headline: Panhandle Animal Welfare Society
short_description: Assist at a shelter, fundraise for animals, and more!
content: The Panhandle Animal Welfare Society cares for more than 7,000 homeless or neglected animals annually. If you want to work directly with some furry friends who need love and care, you can help the Society by assisting at the shelter to help take care of animals. There are many other ways to help as well! You can participate in fundraising and special events, serve on a committee, or work at the Junk Yard Dog Gift n’ Thrift Shop.
organization_description: A veterinary clinic that is dedicated to the welfare of animals, handling more than 7,000 animals annually. PAWS acts as an animal shelter to rehome neglected animals as well.
addresses: ["752 Lovejoy Road Northwest, Fort Walton Beach, FL 32548, USA"]

headline: Austin Pets Alive!
short_description: Care for shelter animals and assist in the adoption process!
content:
Volunteer with Austin Pets Alive for an opportunity to help with a range of tasks. Options include posting adoption profiles, adoption and foster follow-up calls, or hands-on help by caring for and cleaning up after cats and dogs, helping at special events, or even working in the thrift store! 

Austin Pets Alive is a non-profit animal shelter striving to have all cats and dogs adopted or fostered. To volunteer, you must be 12 years or older. Volunteers under 15 must have an adult present, and those under 18 must have a waiver signed.

Register and fill out an online application here using the "Apply to Giveback" button in this listing. There is a training process, which includes one online session and two in-person sessions. Volunteers are encouraged to give time at least once a month. The $30 fee associated with becoming a volunteer covers the cost of onboarding and a volunteer t-shirt.
date_notes: Volunteers can choose any day, and are encouraged to volunteer atleast once a month!
organization_description: A no-kill animal shelter striving to have all cats and dogs adopted or fostered through their unique programs and marketing techniques.
addresses: ["1156 West Cesar Chavez Street, Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: Austin Wildlife Rescue
short_description: Daily tasks around mammal and bird wildlife!
content:
Volunteers are needed to help with the daily tasks around the wildlife rescue, like cleaning cages, feeding animals, tending to animals, doing laundry and dishes, and cleaning and organizing. Working in the center, you will see firsthand the rehabilitation of animals and further educate others on how to coexist with wildlife.

To apply, fill out a volunteer application, and a team member will be in touch soon after. Once you hear from a team member, you can attend an online orientation and join the team to support the facility with tasks and shadow mammal and bird staff. Once you have experience, you can select your preferred volunteer activity! 

Volunteers must be 18 years and older and comfortable handling animals and insects. The center offers morning, afternoon, and evening shifts from March-September, and morning and afternoon shifts from October-February. They ask that volunteers commit to at least two shifts per month March-October, with a shift per week preferred. 

Photo courtesy of Austin Wildlife Rescue
organization_description: A center that takes in and rehabilitates animals from the Austin and Central Texas Region. Through their programs, they hope to educate people on how to coexist with wildlife.
addresses: ["Austin Wildlife Rescue Rehabilitation Center, Elbow Bend, Elgin, TX, USA"]

headline: Lost Dog Rescue
short_description: Volunteer with dogs and cats at adoption events.
content:
Lost Dog Rescue warmly refers to itself as an army of animal lovers on a mission to turn homeless dogs and cats into beloved companion animals. According to their website, the organization has saved over 40,000 lives. They invite new animal lovers to help save even more animals!

With Lost Dog Rescue, you can help out at a cat or dog adoption event, organize a blanket or towel drive, be a pet taxi, and many more opportunities!

Photo courtesy of Lost Dog Rescue
date_notes: Closed daily from 2-5 PM
organization_description: Helps homeless pets find their way to loving homes through rescue and adoption!
addresses: ["6801 Wilson Blvd, Falls Church, VA 22044, USA"]

headline: Dress for Success - Austin
short_description: Advise women's professional skills from interview to attire.
content:
Volunteers can give back to the Austin's professional community by mentoring women about their resume, interviewing skills, and career building advice as well as offering advice on how to "Dress for Success" by putting together optimal business attire. Volunteers can also help by spreading the word as an outreach volunteer.

There are also in office options so volunteers can choose to empower women by professionally styling women personally, assisting in searching for jobs and preparing for interviews in person, working at the front desk or sorting and re-stocking clothing donations.

To volunteer, you must be over 18 with experience in an office based industry. Volunteer efforts primarily take place over the phone or on video, but there is an opportunity to meet at the Austin office if you and your mentee choose to do so.

If you were looking for a group volunteer opportunity, there are additional paid options through Dress for Success' website.
date_notes: Open in person Tues & Thurs from 10am-4pm, but volunteer acitivities are available every day virtually
organization_description: Offers women the resources and mentoring programs to help them achieve financial independence and confidence in the workplace.
addresses: ["701 Tillery St, Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: City Wildlife, Inc.
short_description: Support the migratory animal populations in DC.
content:
Volunteers who are passionate about wildlife and environmental conservation can support City Wildlife, Inc through a variety of opportunities! 

If you want hands-on experience, you can help out as an Animal Care volunteer in the wildlife rehabilitation center by cleaning the center, feeding animals, or assisting in rehabilitation. Or you can assist the Lights Out DC campaign by inspecting building windows to reduce the number of fatal bird collisions. Volunteers are also needed to monitor Mallard duck nests around Washington, DC during the spring nesting season.

All volunteers must be at least 18 years of age. Additional requirements and time commitments vary for each of the three programs. 

Photo courtesy of City Wildlife
organization_description: City Wildlife, Inc is a nonprofit that rehabilitates and supports migratory and orphaned animals in the Washington, DC area.
addresses: ["15 Oglethorpe St NW, Washington, DC 20011, USA"]

headline: Community Tech Network
short_description: Teaching elders internet skills to keep them connected!
content:
Help adults and elder communities grow their confidence and capabilities using the internet so they can stay connected with families and their greater communities! Volunteer from the comfort of your own home to teach the use of the internet and other digital resources via phone calls and video platforms. Digital coaching occurs once a week for 1-2 hours over a 12-week period, and you are able to personally see how your efforts can change the lives of those you are helping as they grow confidence and feel less isolated.

Coaches must be over 18, go through a background check, have high intermediate digital skills and have high levels of patience, and most of all want to make a difference in the lives of adult learners.
date_notes: Must commit to 1-2 hours every week for 12 week course
organization_description: Helping adult and older adult communities to be more confident and capable of using the internet and other digital resources so they may stay connected within their communities or to their families with the goal of reducing the feeling of loneliness and isolation.
addresses: ["Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: Fierce Love Rescue
short_description: A volunteer-run animal rescue.
content:
Fierce Love Rescue relies entirely on the support of volunteers to care for the homeless pets at their shelter.

There are many ways to help! Volunteers are needed to assist at adoption events, perform home visits, and transport animals. If you prefer more flexible activities, the rescue needs volunteers to share information about animals to adopt on social media and to send thank you notes to foster families.

The first step to getting involved is to complete this volunteer application. Once the application is complete, a staff member at Fierce Love will be happy to help you choose an activity that best fits your interests and schedule!

Photo courtesy of @fierceloverescue on Instagram
organization_description: Fierce Love Rescue is a nonprofit run entirely by volunteers that aims to rescue and nurture orphaned companion animals.
addresses: ["Stephens City, VA 22655, USA"]

headline: Explore Austin
short_description: Mentor Austin youth from 6th-12th grade!
content:
Volunteering with Explore Austin is a wonderful opportunity for young adults to mentor younger students while exploring nature in the area!

Mentors gain experience with outdoor activities while getting to explore new places with an inspiring group of teens. Mentees are part of the underserved youth population in Austin from 6th through 12th grade. Mentors can teach outdoor skills and run team-building exercises to get to know the teens, allow them to meet each other and help them gain confidence in themselves.

Volunteers must commit to one Saturday a month throughout the school year and one week during the Summer. They prefer volunteers looking for a multi-year commitment, as you work with the same mentee beginning in 6th grade through their high school experience.

Explore Austin is looking for Austin residents who love the outdoors and want to give back to their community and have experience helping teens.
date_notes: Commit to one Saturday a month in the school year and one week over the summer.
organization_description: Gets underserved youth from 6th to 12th grade outside, teaches them outdoor skills and allows them to participate in team building exercises while exploring Austin.
addresses: ["1111 W 24th St #201, Austin, TX 78705, USA"]

headline: Keep Austin Beautiful
short_description: Plant, pick up trash and improve Austin Parks!
content:
If you are passionate about beautifying Austin's green spaces, there are many ways to help by volunteering with Keep Austin Beautiful.

Keep Austin Beautiful is a vibrant environmental nonprofit that holds events weekly. Volunteers are needed to plant trees, to clean litter and debris from green spaces and waterways, to remove invasive species, and to do landscaping in local parks. Each event ranges from 1 to 4 hours in length. By creating a volunteer account on the website, you can sign up for whatever events fit your schedule. Each event has different age limitations, but there are many great opportnities for business groups and families!

Photo courtesy of https://keepaustinbeautiful.org/kabday/
date_notes: Events held throughout the week, with most occuring on weekends!
organization_description: Keep Austin Beautiful works in partnership with environmental organizations across Austin to beautify local green spaces for the benefit of all residents.
addresses: ["55 N Interstate Hwy 35 ste 215, Austin, Texas 78702, USA"]

headline: Mobile Hope
short_description: Support and an emergency shelter for youths.
content:
Volunteers will help make and deliver clothing bags to local shelters with the Mobile Hope bus and food organization. Inventory & donations are always welcome for food and hygiene supplies.

Before the first volunteer shift, you must attend a short 20-minute virtual orientation, which you can sign up for through this link. 

Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes when volunteering with Mobile Hope!

Photo courtesy of Mobile Hope
organization_description: Mobile Hope provides support and emergency shelter to youth up to age 24 who are at-risk or homeless and empowers them to become self-sufficient.
addresses: ["302 Parker Court Southeast, Leesburg, VA 20175, USA"]

headline: Dakota's Dream
short_description: Volunteer and foster-based animal rescue.
content:
The Dakota's Dream team is always in need of volunteers to clean, foster, fundraise, educate, and more! If you have an hour or more each month to help out, just let them know! Volunteering is very therapeutic and rewarding. It will make a difference in your life and the life of a homeless animal.

Fill out the volunteer application here.

In addition: Donations are always needed and appreciated. Email dakotas.dream@hotmail.com to set up a time to drop off donations including paper towels, old towels in good condition, old blankets in good condition, cat beds, litter, unopened food, cleaning supplies, antibacterial wipes, litter boxes, cat toys, laundry detergent and pooper scoopers.
organization_description: Dakota's Dream is a no-kill animal rescue organization run entirely by caring volunteers. The nonprofit provides community education, animal care, and foster placement for homeless pets.
addresses: ["2310 Legge Blvd, Winchester, VA 22601, USA"]

headline: Blue Ridge Area Food Bank
short_description: Help reduce food insecurity for local residents.
content:
The Blue Ridge Area Food Bank relies on the help of dedicated volunteers to alleviate hunger in the region by acquiring and distributing food to individuals and families facing food insecurity.

Regional produce market volunteers help in many ways. They sort food and conduct quality assessments from food drives and food recovery missions. They also work to organize the food pantry, and pack up food for distribution.

Create an account and sign up for your desired shift here.

Please wear closed-toed shoes.

 

Photo courtesy of Blue Ridge Area Food Bank Instagram
organization_description: Food Bank working to ensure all members across the Blue Ridge community have access to food and do not go hungry.
addresses: ["1802 Roberts Street, Winchester, VA, USA", "501b 12th St, Lynchburg, VA 24504, USA"]

headline: Austin Parks Foundation
short_description: Monthly cleanups at your favorite Austin Parks!
content:
Austin Parks Foundation holds monthly park clean-up days all around Austin! Volunteers help to remove invasive species, clear trash, plant new plants and so much more! This is a great way to give back to the Austin parks that give so many opportunities for families to get outside, and a great way to make outdoor activities more accessible and enjoyable for Austin residents and visitors. 

This is a great full-family volunteer option, and the foundation provides equipment for each volunteer. Right now, the clean-up days are capped at 25 participants and take about 2 hours. There are monthly events to sign up for once you create your profile here: Austin Parks Volunteer Profile.
date_notes: Days of cleanup events change every month
organization_description: Works to make the parks and green spaces of Austin more accessible for all residents and visitors through clean-up and beauitification projects!
addresses: ["Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: Capital Area Food Bank
short_description: Donations of food, non-perishables and simple items.
content:
The Capital Area Food Bank provides donations of food items, non-perishables, and basic items to provide more than 45 million meals each year for communities across Maryland, Virginia and D.C.

Volunteers can donate, or help at the Distribution Center, Community Market or Garden and one of many events hosted by the Capital Area Food Bank throughout the year. 

When volunteering, make sure to dress comfortably and wear appropriate footwear. 

Please also note that volunteers of all ages are welcome, but for anyone under 18 a waiver must be downloaded and signed by a legal parent or guardian. Volunteers must have received all COVID vaccinations prior to volunteering. 

Photo courtesy of Capital Area Food Bank
organization_description: Leads our region’s efforts to provide equitable access to food and opportunity to people struggling with hunger and food insecurity. Each year, we source and distribute the food for over 45 million meals with the help of 450 partners
addresses: ["6833 Hill Park Drive, Lorton, VA 22079, USA"]

headline: Highland Food Pantry
short_description: Food pantry serving the northern Shenandoah Valley.
content:
Volunteers are needed at the Highland Food Pantry for a variety of jobs such as supporting with check-in, childcare, monitoring the main room and coffee area, produce distribution, intake, backroom food distribution, carrying boxes, and helping with sorting, serving, packing and delivering food. You can become a part of the following teams: Intake Team, Backroom Team, Partner Pick-Up Team, Special Delivery Team, and Special Team.

Tour the pantry while in operation on Tuesday morning from 9:30-11:30 am or Tuesday evening from 6:00-7:30 pm and learn about each station on the path to providing food for our clients.

Fill out the volunteer application here.

There are also group volunteering opportunities available. The application for groups can be found here.

After you return a minimum of three times, and a background check has been successfully completed, you will officially be considered a volunteer. You will receive a permanent name tag and be eligible for a shirt. Shirts are available for $10.

Volunteer Shifts: Tuesday AM (9am-12pm) Tuesday PM (6pm-8pm) Friday AM (9am-12pm)
date_notes: Tuesday AM (9am-12pm), Tuesday PM (6pm-8pm), Friday AM (9am-12pm)
organization_name: Highland Food Pantry, United Way Partner
organization_description: Highland Food Pantry serves people in the northern Shenandoah Valley experiencing chronic hunger. Our main activity is the distribution of food to individuals and families in need. We are a United Way partner.
addresses: ["446 Highland Ave, Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: Learning Ally
short_description: Helping students with learning disabilities.
content:
Learning Ally gives students with learning disabilities the tools to overcome challenges in reading and literacy.  

Volunteers are needed to help narrate audiobooks, conduct outreach in school districts, help to create digital marketing materials, conduct quality assurance on pre-recorded books and so much more!

This is an online opportunity so you must have access to a computer and stable internet access.

Fill out this form to hear about volunteer opportunities that pop up throughout the year. You can select and sign up for the opportunities as they come.
organization_description: Giving students with learning disabilities, like dyslexia, the tools to stay proficient and on track with reading levels, leading to fewer students dropping out of school.
addresses: ["Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: TechSoup
short_description: Offers tech-related services to non-profits.
content:
TechSoup is a digital platform that offers advice and tech-related services to non-profit organizations that may not have the funds to hire or implement these services themselves. As a TechSoup Connect volunteer, you will help to guide various non-profits with tech-related questions to make sure they are running efficiently. Over the course of a year, you will be responsible for hosting four meetings to teach non-profits about your skills to help them learn and develop their own skills to support their organization's efforts. You can also write guidance and tip articles for these organizations to use.

Must have some experience with various technology platforms. This is can either be an online or in-person opportunity supporting both local and nationwide non-profits.

Create a profile here and register to become a volunteer.
organization_description: A digital platform that offers advice and tech-related services to non-profit organizations who may not have the funds to hire or implement these services themselves.
addresses: ["Fredericksburg, VA, USA", "Pensacola, FL, USA", "Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: Reading Partners
short_description: Volunteer with a student to act as their reading mentor.
content:
Volunteers are matched with students and provided with a curriculum and other resources to act as reading mentors, helping to ensure that the children learn to enjoy reading and ultimately become lifelong readers through the support of their mentor. 

To volunteer and become a mentor, you must be over 18 years old and first submit an interest form here. The next volunteer steps include completing an orientation program and passing a background check. After this process, you will receive an easy-to-follow curriculum and then be able to set up weekly appointments to mentor a child and teach them a love of reading!

This is a nation wide program with both in-person and virtual opportunties to help children practice and improve their reading skills.
organization_description: Works to ensure children learn to enjoy reading and ultimately become lifelong readers through support and mentorship.
addresses: ["Baltimore, MD, USA", "Los Angeles, CA, USA", "Minneapolis, MN, USA", "New York, NY, USA", "San Francisco, CA, USA", "Washington D.C., DC, USA"]

headline: Wildlife Sanctuary of Northwest Florida
short_description: Help care for native wildlife!
content:
The Sanctuary works to rehab injured or orphaned wildlife indigenous to the Northwest region of Florida. 

Volunteers can assist with household chores around the Sanctuary to keep it in excellent condition for the animals. They can learn to feed baby birds and mammals, help to foster certain types of animals and help out at events and fundraisers to support the mission of the Sanctuary.

Volunteers must be 18 or older and commit to regularly volunteering at least once a week. One person should volunteer at a time. The Sanctuary cannot commit to having groups of volunteers at this time. 

Interested in volunteering? A volunteer application must be filled out here first. The cost for applying is $20 to cover orientation and materials.
organization_description: Working to heal and rehab injured or orphaned wildlife that is indigenous to the Northwest region of Florida.
addresses: ["105 North S Street, Pensacola, FL 32505, USA"]

headline: Hungry Souls
short_description: Sort, pack and deliver meals to Texas students!
content:
Hungry Souls partners with local schools to feed students who are insecure so they can focus on learning. 

Volunteers are needed to do the important work of sorting, packing, and delivering meals to the Central Texas school community. Hungry Souls also offers additional volunteer opportunities to accept donations and hold food drives. 

These volunteer opportunities are available for full family participation, with all ages welcome! After signing up you can choose which opportunity you would like to participate in.  Each volunteer role varies with specific requirements for each.
date_notes: Sign up for 2 hour shifts any time that fits in your schedule!
organization_description: Work to feed all children in the Austin and Central Texas region so they are able to thrive in school!
addresses: ["7100 Brodie Lane, Austin, TX 78745, USA", "Bannockburn Church - Dripping Springs Campus, 264 American Way, Dripping Springs, TX, USA"]

headline: Smithsonian Museum
short_description: Volunteer in many positions to support the Smithsonian.
content:
The Smithsonian benefits from the work of thousands of passionate volunteers who support the organization on-site in the museums, zoo, and other facilities. Today, digital technology makes it possible for people who believe in the Smithsonian mission to make significant contributions online. "Digital Volunteers" can now take on important assignments to expand access to the Smithsonian's massive collections and can participate in a variety of research programs. Some roles require special knowledge or skill, but many do not.

The Smithsonian relies on its volunteers to help support 21 museums, 21 libraries, the National Zoo and numerous education and research centers which are all free to the public.

Photo courtesy of Smithsonian
organization_description: An organization which supports 21 museums, 21 libraries, the National Zoo, numerous education and research centers all free to the public
addresses: ["600 Maryland Ave SW, Washington, DC 20024, USA"]

headline: Prodisee Pantry
short_description: Prepare food donations for hungry community members.
content: Prodisee Pantry is a faith-based community nonprofit that provides emergency food and disaster relief to many different local individuals. Volunteers can assist with preparing and organizing food donations. You can commit less than two hours to help with these tasks and make a real difference in someone's life. The Pantry currently requires that masks are worn by all volunteers and that all volunteers fill out an online waiver before their involvement begins. They welcome volunteers of all ages, as individuals, in families or in other groups.
organization_description: The Pantry provides emergency food and disaster relief. Those that they serve include single parents, homeless persons, retirees, families in transition, under-employed and unemployed households, grandparents raising grandchildren, and others in need.
addresses: ["9315 Spanish Fort Blvd, Spanish Fort, AL 36527, USA"]

headline: Central Texas Foodbank
short_description: Prepare, distribute and grow food for the food insecure!
content: Feed the hungry across Central Texas by preparing, delivering and distributing food through their mobile food pantries. You can even get down to the "root" of it by planting and tending to crops in the community garden! Each volunteer shift ranges from two to three houses and they are available for sign up in the volunteer portal every single day. Volunteers must be 8 years or older for donation sorting and have to be over 15 for every other program. All minors have to volunteer with an adult.
date_notes: Sign up for a 2-3 hour shift any day of the week!
organization_description: Working to feed the hungry across Central Texas. Works with 21 partner organizations to provide meals.
addresses: ["6500 Metropolis Drive, Austin, TX 78744, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering for ages 8 and above with a parent"]

headline: Northern Virginia Family Services
short_description: Provide, prepare and deliver meals for Families
content:
Volunteers provide, prepare and deliver nutritious meals for about 60 guests at the SERVE Family Shelter on weekends and holidays. Volunteers have the option to prepare the meal offsite and do a drive-by drop-off delivery of the meal to the shelter or to prepare and serve onsite in the shelter kitchen.

There are opportunities for volunteers over the age of 12, but the majority of the opportunities require participants to be over the age of 16. 

Many opportunities for group volunteering can be found here. 

Avoid clothing that is too revealing, has text or images that may make others uncomfortable or is too casual (i.e. workout clothes, sweats, etc.).

Parking information can be found on Page 11. 

Photo courtesy of Northern Virginia Family Services
organization_description: Provides the essential building blocks for financial, emotional and physical well-being, serving as leaders and innovators for the Northern Virginia community.
addresses: ["Historic District, 10056 Dean Dr, Manassas, VA 20110, USA"]

headline: Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen
short_description: Serve meals and support local families in need.
content:
Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen works to alleviate hunger and provide basic needs to those struggling to make ends meet. 

Volunteers can serve meals and sort donations at the soup kitchen. Volunteers are also needed to drive families to ministry counseling appointments, assist in the counseling playroom to look after small children, and clean houses and yards within the ministry.

Volunteers should be able to commit to 2 hours per volunteer session. One needs to be at least 18 years old (but children younger than 18 can volunteer in the soup kitchen). Loaves and Fishes welcome groups as well as individual volunteers.
organization_description: Providing food and financial support to underserved and low-income communities around Berkeley County.
addresses: ["257 East Lee Street, Pensacola, FL 32503, USA"]

headline: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center
short_description: Volunteer at this innovative and sustainable farm.
content:
Volunteers help throughout the year on projects like preparing the soil and garden beds, planting seedlings, harvesting, and processing fresh herbs, weeding garden beds, and helping with onsite fundraisers and events.

You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection, and multiple layers if it is cold or water.

To volunteer, just contact Fox Haven through their website. 

Photo courtesy of Fox Haven Farm
organization_name: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center
organization_description: A learning center established to address the environmental challenges threatening life on our planet and to find and develop local solutions to global problems.
addresses: ["Fox Haven Farm and Learning Center, Poffenberger Road, Jefferson, MD, USA"]

headline: Foundation for the Homeless
short_description: Serve hot breakfast to the Austin homeless community.
content:
Volunteer with Foundation for the Homeless at the Feed My People Breakfast. Volunteers help to set up, clean up and serve hot meals to the homeless. There are also options to prepare the meals in the kitchen, work as a greeter or ensure safety during the event. Volunteering is open to 18 and older and there are a lot of different dates to choose from.

Volunteers must be vaccinated and the foundation recommends wearing comfortable and not revealing clothing. Some events take place outside, so be sure to pay attention to the description as you sign up and if so arrive dressed appropriately and with sunscreen!
organization_description: Fighting homelessness, hunger and poverty by providing a hot meal and shelter for people.
addresses: ["1300 Lavaca St, Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: Mosaic Street Ministry
short_description: Pass out Sunday morning breakfast and pack meals forhomeless
content:
Volunteers can help out at the Sunday Morning Care Team event to help pass out coffee and breakfast, talk and connect with members. They can also help pack non-perishable food items to be handed out in the community.

Volunteer with the Sunday Morning Care Team to pass out coffees and hot breakfast to the homeless and hungry. This is also a great way to talk and connect with all community members and is a very welcoming environment. You can also volunteer occasionally throughout the week to pack non-perishable food items to be handed out in the community. Activities are expected to last about 2 hours, and all ages are welcome to help.
organization_description: Serves the homeless and hungry in Austin to make sure they have shelter and a warm meal.
addresses: ["12675 Research Blvd, Austin, TX 78759, USA"]

headline: Make a Vet Sweat
short_description: Work with veterans and gyms to find fitness options!
content:
Help veterans combat PTSD by working with Make a Vet Sweat to offer veterans 3-month free gym memberships, letting them establish healthy habits. Help out in various ways by providing marketing and fundraising support, planning or helping out at a special event, assisting the membership team by speaking with current or potential members, or working on fundraising to keep the nonprofit running. You can also sign up to be a general volunteer and help out where needed! Volunteers help with everything from working directly with veterans and gyms to find the perfect programs, to working on the marketing side to spread awareness.

There are in-person volunteer opportunities and locations vary, but it is mostly virtual-based initially.
date_notes: Work events or do virtual volunteering on your own timeline!
organization_description: Sponsoring vets with a three-month gym membership to help them combat the side effects of PTSD.
addresses: ["Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: Disabled American Veteran's Charity Austin
short_description: Help disabled veterans with care, transportation and errands
content:
Support veterans by signing up to work with the Disabled American Veteran's Charity. You will be matched with a local Veteran's Affairs hospital in Austin and surrounding areas, where you can help out with patients, events, and transportation. Other options are to sign up to help out with grocery runs or other household errands for veterans. The agency works hard to connect disabled veterans to their community and help people contribute personally to the military benefits our veterans have earned.

Photo courtesy of https://www.dav.org/
date_notes: Sign up for an event and time slot that fits in your schedule!
organization_description: Ensuring a high-quality life to disable veterans through programs that connect them within their community, supporting their rights, and ensuring they receive and take advantage of their military benefits.
addresses: ["Austin, TX, USA"]

headline: Gulf Coast Kid’s House
short_description: Shop wish lists for victims of child abuse.
content:
With this virtual volunteer opportunity, you can buy clothing and supplies for child abuse victims from wish lists on Amazon, Target or Walmart. It only takes a few minutes to make a difference, and anyone can do it!

Shop these wish lists to help the children served by Gulf Coast Kid's House:

Amazon Wish List

Target Wish List

Walmart Wish List
organization_description: Gulf Coast Kids House is on a mission to form a more collaborative response to child abuse cases so that we can improve case outcomes and minimize trauma to the children and families we serve.
addresses: ["Pensacola, FL, USA"]

headline: Community Action Program Committee
short_description: Support families in need through a variety of services.
content:
The Community Action Program Committee provides the opportunity for education, financial guidance, and community support for families using a "Whole Family, Whole Child' model. Volunteers can assist teachers in classrooms for both the Head Start and Early Head Start programs or be a guest speaker for parents and families at one of the many events the organization hosts. College students are also invited to act as social services interns and shadow one of the employees for the summer. 

Interested in volunteering? You must be 18 years of age or older. Submit a volunteer inquiry to receive necessary information about becoming involved!
organization_description: Providing resources and the opportunity for education, financial guidance, and community support for families.
addresses: ["2050 W Blount St, Pensacola, Florida 32501, USA"]

headline: Our Corner Escambia
short_description: Help maintain Pensacola's natural beauty!
content:
Volunteer with Our Corner Escambia if you are passionate about protecting and restoring the natural environment!

Each month, Our Corner Escambia hosts various community cleanup and beautification opportunities, and recycling events. You can get involved with GAC by volunteering at events like Clean Your Block in March, Paint Your Heart Out in May, or recycling your plastic bags at bag swap events in April. 

All ages are welcome at these events, which last between two to four hours, depending on the activity. 

Beach clean-ups and beautification projects are outside, so bring sunscreen, other sun protection, water and snacks! Also, remember to wear comfortable clothes and shoes for working outdoors.
organization_description: This environmental nonprofit provides education, resources, and service events to restore and beautify the natural resources of Escambia County.
addresses: ["3500 Barrancas Ave, Pensacola, FL 32507, USA"]

headline: ReadingPals
short_description: Help preschoolers develop their reading skills.
content:
ReadingPals volunteers help children build reading skills by using books, puzzles, and other forms of teaching mediums. They are matched with PreK students at Title 1 schools around the Escambia County School District. They are able to pick the school they are matched with and choose days of the week which best fit their schedule. 

Volunteers should be able to give time once a week, for about an hour each time. Volunteers must be 18 years of age and complete a Level II background screening that will be paid for by ReadyKids Florida.
organization_description: Reading Pals works to ensure students in Pre-K are ready to succeed in school by supporting their reading ability.
addresses: ["Pensacola, FL 32591, USA"]

headline: Pensacola and Perdido Bays Estuary Program
short_description: Protect and beautify local waterways!
content:
The Pensacola and Perdido Bays Estuary Progam needs volunteers to help restore local waters!

Volunteers can help with various projects that beautify, protect, and improve regional waterways. You can clean litter and debris from important wildlife habitats and watersheds by joining beach and stream clean-ups. Pitch in on habitat restoration projects that help to boost oyster populations and seagrass areas, or collect data about keystone species' health. Volunteers also assist with animal surveys with partner organizations. Most events last 2-3 hours. Events are kid-friendly, and the organization welcomes groups and families as volunteers.

Projects are outside, so bring sunscreen, and wear comfortable shoes and clothes for working outdoors. Volunteers also need to bring their own water and snacks.

Photo Credit: Pensacola and Perdido Bays - Estuary Program
organization_name: Pensacola and Perdido Bays Estuary Program
organization_description: This environmental organization restores and protects the waterways surrounding Pensacola to ensure swimmable, fishable, and sustainable habitats for the future.
addresses: ["226 Palafox Place, Pensacola, FL, USA"]

headline: Literacy Volunteers, Winchester Area
short_description: Building and maintaining Winchester's Little Libraries.
content:
Volunteers are needed to help build and maintain Winchester Little Libraries. 

Opportunities include:

1. Construction – The actual building of Little Libraries and participating in the setting up process.

2. Maintenance – The maintaining and preserving of established Winchester Little Libraries.

3. Book collection & delivery – The collection of donated books, stamping and sorting of collected donations, and restocking of Winchetseter Little Libraries.

If you are interested in volunteering, please complete this volunteer application.
organization_description: Provides one-on-one and small group tutoring for adults, as well as building and maintaining Winchester Little Libraries.
addresses: ["301 North Cameron Street suite 102, Winchester, VA 22601, USA"]

headline: Literacy Volunteers, Winchester Area
short_description: Adult literacy tutors in classrooms or one-on-one.
content:
A dedicated team of qualified volunteer tutors assists adults in building their literacy skills to be better prepared for today’s job market, to get a promotion, and to be more engaged in the community. They provide services to residents of the City of Winchester, Frederick County, and Clarke County.

LVWA has several volunteer opportunities available:

One-on-one tutors, small group tutors, and classroom tutors in reading, writing, math, English language, computers, and citizenship. Prior teaching experience is helpful, but not necessary.

Assistant tutors provide support to lead tutors in a classroom setting.

Computer Maintenance - Provide regular computer maintenance and troubleshoot problems.

Special Events/Fundraising - Assist with the coordination, planning, and logistics for various events.

If you are interested in volunteering, please complete this volunteer application.
organization_description: Provides one-on-one and small group tutoring for adults, as well as building and maintaining Winchester Little Libraries.
addresses: ["301 North Cameron Street suite 102, Winchester, VA 22601, USA"]

headline: Fix by Five
short_description: Help spread awareness to spay and neuter cats.
content: This social media and outreach campaign is available for all Happyly users passionate about animals and animal welfare. Through this outreach initiative, you can download materials to either share on your social media platforms, or conduct outreach to veterinary clinics to encourage them to speak to clients about spaying or neutering both stray and domestic cats before five months old, ultimately reducing the risk of mammary cancer developing in cats.
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: A digital campaign to spread the word about spaying cats by 5 months old to reduce stray or roaming cats and wipe out the risk of mammary cancer
addresses: [null]

headline: Walk Your Human - Keep Virginia Beautiful
short_description: Pick up litter while walking your dog!
content:
Walk Your Human is a new litter initiative that teams you and your dog up to build a cleaner, greener Frederick County.

Volunteers are asked to simply pick up any litter that they find while taking their best furry friend on his or her daily walks. Then add a litter "selfie" to an app to help track the initiative's success. Your kids will love doing this! 

Check out the How to Get Started Brochure online!

You can also pick up your “Walk Your Human” kit in the Public Works office, County Administration Building, 2nd floor, 107 N. Kent St. It contains a safety vest, litter grabber, dog waste dispenser, bags and a pedometer.
organization_description: The mission at Keep Virginia Beautiful is to engage and unite Virginians to improve our natural and scenic environment. We believe in a shared responsibility to end littering, improve recycling and beautify communities.
addresses: ["Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: eMammal
short_description: Help to identify animal species from around the world!
content:
Calling all animal lovers and citizen scientists!

For this opportunity, volunteers can pick from a wide variety of projects that involve identifying animals throughout various regions worldwide. Projects vary by location, region, and species! It is so easy to get started! All you need to do is look through photos on the website and select the number of animals you see in each frame. There are also more challenging opportunities available to analyze data. Regardless of your project, you will be helping scientists worldwide!
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: Using citizen science to help identify animals in remote and local regionals of the world.
addresses: [null]

headline: American RedCross
short_description: Launch a social media or fundraising campaign!
content:
Follow and support the Red Cross calls for action on social media platforms and/or launch a fundraising campaign of your choice. You can create a web page through the Red Cross digital platform. These initiatives will bring awareness to the need from blood donation and have people identify their blood type. 

All you need to do to get started is follow the Red Cross social media accounts and begin to post or repost!

Photo Credit: The American Red Cross
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: A nation-wide blood donation organization that saves lives daily with the help of donors and volunteers.
addresses: [null]

headline: Blandy Experimental Farm - State Arboretum of Virginia
short_description: Help with gardening or grounds/tree maintenance.
content:
The purpose of Blandy Experimental Farm is to increase understanding of the natural environment through research and education. Blandy Experimental Farm exists to promote this understanding through education and research on plants, plant biology, ecology, evolution, the environmental sciences, and the manner in which all of these are used and affected by humans. 

Volunteer with the Weekly Garden Crews. Volunteers are the most valuable resource at the State Arboretum. They are currently looking for enthusiastic volunteers for their weekly garden crews, as well as for a number of events that occur periodically throughout the year.

Weekly garden crews are the primary volunteer opportunities for those interested in helping with gardening or grounds/tree maintenance. These groups meet once a week during their respective days throughout the growing season.

According to the website, in addition to weekly crews, there are periodic volunteer events throughout the year. These vary by season and tend to happen on weekends. Typical opportunities involve helping to set up and run annual events, serving as docents and guides during particularly busy weekends, and more. 

Fill out the volunteer application here!

 

Photo courtesy of Blandy Experimental Farm
date_notes: Garden crews work Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday mornings; Events are held on weekends.
organization_name: Blandy Experimental Farm - State Arboretum of Virginia
organization_description: The purpose of Blandy Experimental Farm is to increase understanding of the natural environment through research and education. Volunteer with our Weekly Garden Crews.
addresses: ["400 Blandy Farm Lane, Boyce, VA 22620, USA"]

headline: Helping Hands Food Pantry
short_description: Assist with food donations for the hungry and homeless.
content:
Volunteers with Helping Hands Food Pantry will help sort donations, stock shelves, fill food bags and more. Another way to help is to collect items to donate to their monthly food drives for nonperishable food items. Items are used to service the community by providing bagged groceries for families and those in need. 

Volunteers are needed on Tuesdays and one weekend a month for the Monthly Giveaway; all ages are welcome to volunteer! Make sure to wear comfortable clothes and shoes to volunteer.
organization_description: Provides groceries, lunches, and hot meals to the homeless and hungry throughout the month.
addresses: ["307 South Shelton Beach Road, Eight Mile, Mobile, Alabama 36613, USA"]

headline: Catchafire
short_description: Put your online skills to work and give back!
content:
This opportunity is great for interested volunteers who would like to offer advice or services to non-profits in need or without the resources to pay for these positions. Volunteers are able to select from a wide range of opportunities to put various online skills to work such as online editing of documents and photographs. The projects' timelines depend on the type and organization. They could involve time anywhere from a 1-hour phone call to a few months working on a project.

To get started, select the type of opportunity you would like to help with, create an online profile and apply to the project through a 2-step application, have a phone call with the non-profit, and start giving back!
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: Nonprofits provide critical support to their communities, but limited budgets can block them from hiring the expert talent they need to operate most effectively. Catachafire provides a network of volunteers, nonprofits, and funders working together to solve urgent problems and lift up communities
addresses: [null]

headline: Smithsonian Digital Volunteer
short_description: Calling all history buffs!
content:
This opportunity allows volunteers to be transported back in time or around the world! Volunteers are given the chance to help edit Wikipedia articles and translate historical documents on an online database system. Great fit for someone who enjoys to read and has great attention to detail. This information is free to the public and important to keep up to date and accurate!

Get started by selecting the opportunity you want to be involved in from the list of current projects. There may be some experience required for individual projects.
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: An organization which supports 21 museums, 21 libraries, the National Zoo, numerous education and research centers all free to the public
addresses: [null]

headline: St. Jude's Children's Hospital Online Cards
short_description: Uplift patients with a card!
content:
Create an uplifting card to be sent to a child fighting cancer or other severe diseases at St. Jude’s hospital.

This is an excellent opportunity for kids of all ages or groups looking for a project to complete together that will make the day of a little one who could use an extra smile!
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: One of the top hospitals helping children with cancer and other life-threatening diseases
addresses: [null]

headline: iCould Be - Digital Mentors
short_description: Give advice to high school students!
content:
Volunteers are invited to apply as mentors to high school students across the U.S. Mentors provide feedback and support their mentees’ discussions about academic success, preparing for graduation, gaining work experience, preparing for future education and networking. The goal is to support mentees as they 1) define personal challenges or goals; 2) determine potential solutions and strategies; and 3) identify networks of people who can help and how they can help. The fourth opportunity for support is to engage people in their network in the solution.

All interested volunteers must register online to be added to the waitlist. Mentors will be notified in July or August to begin the coming school year! Mentors should be able to commit at least 1 hour per week to meet with their mentees.
date_notes: Coordinated with mentee
organization_description: Provides high school students with an online community of professional mentors, empowering teens to stay in school, plan for future careers, and achieve in life
addresses: [null]

headline: Table Wisdom
short_description: Teach English to students or adults.
content: Volunteers will be assigned to an international student or adult to help better their English speaking skills. Mentors should be available to meet weekly on one-hour mentoring calls. Volunteers must be fluent in English and 21 years or older and exhibit patience and positivity.
organization_description: Connecting foreign born students with mature adults, we’re able to improve career and academic prospects, English proficiency and increase social connectivity.
addresses: [null]

headline: Project Gutenburg - Distributed Proofreaders
short_description: Help promote literacy!
content:
Through Project Gutenburg's Distributed Proofreaders program, you are able to proofread books, articles and other transcripts so they can be available to the public!

Volunteers are able to help increase literacy and access to literature by donating books to be digitally uploaded, helping to transcribe books into digital format, and assisting in the editing of transcribed work. Volunteers who help with transcribing and editing should be detail-oriented! Teens are welcome to support the initiative as well.

To get started, follow the orientation training steps on the Distributed Proofreaders webpage.
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: One of the largest online and free database of books
addresses: [null]

headline: Cornell Lab of Ornithology
short_description: Get outside and birdwatch!
content:
Volunteers are welcome to create an account, get outside, and record their own videos of bird songs and calls! This information will then help scientists analyze bird migratory patterns, nesting habitats and population density across the US! You can get started by selecting from various projects found by clicking this link!

This is a great motivation to get outside and learn about local and visiting bird species in your region! It is a great activity for groups of families and friends of all ages.

Photo Courtesy of Ian Stewart from Cornell Lab of Ornithology
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: This app and collected data benefits Cornell’s scientists that learn how bird species are affected by environmental changes
addresses: [null]

headline: Get the Filter Out
short_description: Get Outside and Help Clean Up!
content:
Help clean up cigarette butts around your neighborhood or community green space! All you to do is create a profile and start picking up litter today. It's that simple to start making a difference in your community!

This would be a great opportunity for the whole family or a group.
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
universal_notes: This project can take place anywhere! Help clean up your neighborhood.
organization_description: An online community to empower youths to join a campaign that supports causes from environmental issues to human rights.
addresses: [null]

headline: Plant a garden for the hungry!
short_description: Get that garden started and plant an extra row!
content:
Plant an extra row of produce in your seasonal garden (or start one!) and donate the produce to a local food bank.

There are over two hundred locations around the country where you can donate your produce! GardenComm is a nonprofit that promotes the efforts of at-home gardeners to make an impact by donating some of what they grow to those in their community who are struggling with food insecurity.

Questions about getting started or donations can be directed to gardenerjeff@me.com. This is a great spring or summertime activity for the kiddos once they get out of school. You only need space to plant a garden, and you can make a significant impact by providing healthy produce to members of your community!
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
universal_notes: As convenient as your own backyard!
organization_description: Supports community gardening and how people from all economic classes can grow their own produce
addresses: [null]

headline: Hope for Life Rescue
short_description: Care for and walk healing animals at this shelter!.
content:
Help out at the Hope for Life Rescue Center to get hands-on volunteer work with four-legged friends! Opportunities offered here range from walking the dogs and cleaning up after animals to transporting them. There are even fostering opportunities. The animals here are healing from neglect, so the center really values the assistance of caring animal lovers. 

Most volunteer opportunities are for 18 and older, though there are occasional options for volunteers 10 and up.
date_notes: Tues-Fri 12:30-4pm Sat: 1-5pm Sun:1-5pm
organization_description: Animal rescue specializing in special-needs animals, abandoned, neglected and abused street animals. Provides medical treatment, shelter, and the love while working towards finding the right forever home.
addresses: ["610 Jack Rabbit Road suite 3, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23451, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some opportunities for ages 10 and above."]

headline: Pets Are Wonderful Support (PAWS) NY
short_description: Help elderly and homebound New Yorkers care for their pets!
content:
PAWS NY offer a variety of volunteer opportunities, including dog walking, cat care, and administration of food or medicine for pets. Fostering options are also available on occasion.

Housecall volunteers must be vaccinated against COVID-19 and must be able to make a weekly house visit for 6 months. All foster care volunteers must have a pet-friendly home.

Volunteers must be 18 years or older and attend a volunteer orientation prior to volunteering. 

Estimated duration of activity: 1 or more hours
organization_description: PAWS NY is a philanthropic organization with a mission to help New York City’s most vulnerable residents care for their pets.They help elderly and home bound New Yorkers or those with financial obstacles with pets get their animals adequate care and exercise.
addresses: ["134 W 29th St, New York, NY 10001, USA"]

headline: Best Friends - New York
short_description: Help save pets relocated from kill shelters!
content:
Spend some time with pets and make a new best friend. Sign up to foster an animal or help with community outreach on the Borough Engagement Team. You can also volunteer to help out in the Lifesaving Center and be trained to work as a hospitality docent, cleaning assistant, or work in cat care.

Volunteers must be at least 12 years old and those under 18 can sign up under the New York under 18 pathway. Volunteers between the ages of 12 and 15 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times. 

Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that are not too revealing!

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Photo courtesy of Best Friends New York
organization_description: A nation-wide organization to help save and relocate pets from kill shelters and put them in foster care to eventually be adopted into loving homes.
addresses: ["307 West Broadway, New York, NY, USA"]

headline: Little Essentials
short_description: Help at-risk families experiencing poverty or homelessness.
content:
Little Essentials partners with shelters, social-service agencies and community organizations to bring children's supplies and parenting education to at-risk families. Volunteers can help by sorting through donated clothes and other baby essentials or by taking inventory of donations and packing items to be dispersed in the Little Essentials warehouse. They also happily accept diaper and other baby-oriented donations - perfect for an office or community donation opportunity.

This volunteer opportunity is group friendly.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours

Photo courtesy of Little Essentials Facebook
organization_description: Offers at-risk families who are experiencing poverty or homelessness the opportunity to get supplies and parenting education. They focus on children under the age of 5.
addresses: ["63 Flushing Ave bldg 131 suite 205, Brooklyn, NY 11205, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["All ages welcome!", "Must show proof of vaccination"]

headline: City Harvest
short_description: Join in to help reduce hunger and food waste across NYC!
content:
Help make sure all children and their families have enough food in New York City! Volunteers help to deliver weekly supplies of groceries across the boroughs or go and rescue food that will otherwise be wasted at farmers and other markets. 

All volunteer opportunities are suitable for those that are 18 years or older. Select opportunities for those under 18 are available. All those under 18 must be accompanied by an adult (over 21 years) and complete a release and waiver (Available Here). Mobile markets are suitable for those 14 years and older. Greenmarket rescue is suitable for those 11 years or older. Children under 11 years of age can support by coordinating a food drive!

You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection or multiple layers if it is cold and water.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Sites vary.

Photo courtesy of City Harvest
organization_description: Making sure that no food gets wasted when it could go to someone in need across all five boroughs.
addresses: ["6 E 32nd St 5th floor, NY, NY 10016, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering available for children 10 and up with waiver and accompanying adult."]

headline: GO Project NYC
short_description: Help inspire students!
content:
Help benefit under-resourced elementary and middle school students in New York City! Volunteers can sign up to participate in read-aloud sessions with K-4th graders or participate in college and career panels with upper elementary school and middle schoolers. Teachers will select the books to be read at the GO Read Aloud sessions. 

You must have access to a computer and the internet. An online orientation will need to be completed before your first session. In addition, you must be available during the school year!

Photo courtesy of Go Project NYC
organization_description: Provides time and family support for children from under-resourced communities around New York City who are underachieving. Hoping to inspiring these children to enroll in high-achieving high schools and graduate ontime.
addresses: ["50 Cooper Square 3rd floor, New York, NY 10003, USA"]

headline: DOROT
short_description: Help benefit older adults around New York!
content:
Create a meaningful connection with older individuals in your community! Volunteers will be connected with an older adult to make regular phone calls, or video calls to achieve a connection and friendship with these people in isolation. Calls will take place on cell phone or Zoom platform. This is a great opportunity for community groups and clubs.

Volunteers must be available for a minimum of 8 weeks. Must complete an orientation session after submitting a volunteer application.

Click here to complete a Virtual Volunteer Information Form.

Duration of activity: 30 minutes

Photo courtesy of Dorot
organization_description: Working to connect and support older adults to meaningful connections with people in their communities both in-person and virtually.
addresses: ["171 West 85th Street, Manhattan, New York, NY 10024, USA"]

headline: Winchester Rescue Mission
short_description: Help feed and support the homeless.
content:
The Winchester Rescue provides high-quality care to individuals devastated by poverty and homelessness.

Individual, family, and group volunteers are welcome. Join one of six volunteer teams - Hospitality, Maintenance, Transportation, Resident Support, Special Events, or Food Ministry. When you give the gift of your time, you make a massive difference in the lives of those you serve.

All new volunteers must attend a volunteer session!
organization_description: The Winchester Rescue provides high-quality care to individuals devastated by the effects of poverty and homelessness.
addresses: ["434 N Cameron St, Winchester, VA, United States"]

headline: Super Supper Supporter, Winchester Rescue Mission
short_description: Shop, purchase, cook, and serve meals.
content:
Want to volunteer as a Group? Volunteer to prepare & serve a meal with the Super Supper Supporter program.

The Super Supper program provides approximately 80 meals for men, women, and children while providing an enriching volunteer experience for groups. Winchester Rescue Mission partners with volunteer groups of all sizes, including churches, sports teams, restaurants, families, and corporations. Get started by organizing groups of up to 8 volunteers to bring a meal. Trained kitchen staff members are available to help you cook your meal, too!

Shop, purchase, cook, and serve your meal from one of their industrial kitchens to help support your local homeless community.

Complete the volunteer interest form to connect with them!
date_notes: Supper is every 4th Monday and Thursday of the month!
organization_description: The Winchester Rescue provides high-quality care to individuals devastated by the effects of poverty and homelessness.
addresses: ["434 N Cameron St, Winchester, VA, United States"]

headline: Objective Zero
short_description: Text and talk with veterans in crisis.
content:
Objective Zero helps to prevent veteran suicide by pairing those in need with a listening ear on the other end of the line. Through an innovative app, this program pairs civilian volunteers with veterans to support their mental health and wellness.

Volunteers will help veterans in crisis by being able to text and talk to those in need through the innovative app platform. Volunteers must be willing to support veterans going through serious mental health crises.

You must finish the training modules in the app before being able to assist veterans.

Download the app through this page. Once you have the app downloaded, click this link and it will direct you through the training courses.
organization_description: Helping to prevent veteran suicide by pairing those in need with a listening ear on the other end of the line. Through an innovative app, this program pairs civilian volunteers with veterans to support their mental health and wellness
addresses: ["Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: Disabled American Veteran's Charity - Winchester
short_description: Helping disabled veterans with transportation, errands, etc.
content:
DAV ensures a high-quality life to disabled veterans through programs that connect them with their community, support their rights, and ensure they receive and take advantage of their military benefits.

Volunteers will be matched with their local VA hospital to help out with patients, events, and transporting from clinics, nursing homes, or other facilities. Volunteers can also sign up to help out with grocery shopping or other household errands through the Veterans Assistance Program. Finally, there are opportunities to take home-bound veterans to medical or other important appointments.

Fill out this interest form and a team member will match you with your local VA branch.

Please wear comfortable shoes and clothing that is not too revealing.

Photo courtesy of https://www.dav.org/
organization_description: Ensuring a high-quality life for disabled veterans through programs that connect them within their community, supporting their rights, and ensuring they receive and take advantage of their military benefits.
addresses: ["170 Prosperity Drive, Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: United Way Rubbermaid Product Sale
short_description: Help at monthly Rubbermaid sales to support non-profits.
content:
Thanks to a special partnership with Rubbermaid Commercial Products, United Way of Northern Shenandoah Valley offers a monthly sale of returned goods, discontinued products and slightly damaged items.

On the last Saturday of every month they need volunteers to help set up and staff the monthly Rubbermaid sales where they sell donated Rubbermaid goods and all the proceeds go back to supporting local non-profit organizations, including those that benefit the local homeless community.

Find the schedule and sign up to help here.
date_notes: Sales are held the last Saturday of each month.
organization_description: Thanks to a special partnership with Rubbermaid Commercial Products, United Way of Northern Shenandoah Valley offers a monthly sale of returned goods, discontinued products, and slightly damaged items. Proceeds support local non-profits.
addresses: ["Apple Blossom Mall, Apple Blossom Drive, Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: Central Virginia Horse Rescue
short_description: Help out around the stable, cleaning and grooming horses.
content:
CVHR adopts unwanted, neglected, abused or abandoned horses and gives them a safe environment to live him. Through rehabilitation and care, they hope to rehome the horses with a loving family.

Volunteers are able to help out around the stables cleaning stalls or grooming and feeding horses, can help out in the office with administrative work, or even just lend a hand at a special event!

Volunteers should have some experience or feel comfortable around animals if helping out at the barn.

All interested volunteers must fill out the volunteer interest form. A team member will then get in touch about the next steps!

Make sure to wear clothes you won't mind getting dirty! And a sturdy pair of shoes.
organization_description: CVHR adopts unwanted, neglected, abused, or abandoned horses and gives them a safe environment to live him. Through rehabilitation and care, they hope to rehome the horses to a loving family.
addresses: ["31262 Eagle Hill Trail, Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]

headline: Enchanted Makeovers
short_description: Help women and children in homeless shelters!
content:
Calling all creative minds who love to sew! There are so many different kinds of projects to choose from that support women and children in shelters across the US. Projects include sewing pillowcases, capes for kids, dolls, and patches to be distributed at shelters. All designs and directions on how to create the projects can be found online: Travelling Pillowcases, Doll Adoption, and Capes for Kids!

You can select a project from the list HERE. This would be a great activity for a birthday party, sleepover or another reason to get a group or your family together to support people in need! The time for each project varies depending on the item you are preparing,
organization_description: Help to volunteer your creativity to benefit women and children in shelters across the US.
addresses: [null]

headline: Casey Trees
short_description: Plant and care for trees in the DC area.
content:
Transform D.C.’s urban forest this season by joining a team of volunteers. Help with planting and caring for trees all around DC with this family-friendly organization. Trees are essential for DC's climate resiliency, and now you can join Casey Trees' team to help restore, enhance, and protect DC’s tree canopy!

You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection and multiple layers if it is cold or wet out.

Group volunteering is available by filling out this form and setting up a date and time.

Photo courtesy of Casey Trees
organization_description: Trees are essential for DC's climate resiliency. Join Casey Trees' team to help restore, enhance, and protect DC’s tree canopy
addresses: ["3030 12th Street Northeast, Washington, DC 20017, USA"]

headline: Virginia Beach SPCA
short_description: Animal lovers care for healing dogs and cats!
content:
There are so many great volunteer opportunities at the Virginia Beach SPCA. The coolest program is a children's volunteer opportunity called "Tale for Two" for kids 6-13. Kids get to come to the shelter and read books to dogs. Not only does this help socialize the dogs, it also is a great way for animal-loving kids to work on their reading and public speaking! Sign-up for this program here: Tale for Two Children's Volunteer Sign Up.

Other volunteer opportunities are available for volunteers 14 and older. Volunteers can choose between walking dogs, assisting in the cattery, helping with adoption events, clerical and customer service tasks, taking dogs out of the shelter for the day through a "buddies" program, and more. These volunteers are asked to commit to 3 hours a month and must pass a background check. There is also a $45 program registration fee for adults.
organization_description: VBSPCA is an animal shelter that cares for and adopts out abandoned animals. In addition it runs a public clinic, educational programs, wildlife rehabilitation, and numerous animal welfare partnerships and strives to create a more humane and responsible community.
addresses: ["3040 Holland Road, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: WeSpeakNYC
short_description: Help English learners learn and practice the language!
content:
Volunteers will be paired with a group of English learners to participate and conduct facilitator check-ins, class observations, short phone calls and complete a post-cycle survey at the end of your time volunteering. Volunteers will receive all class resources before they begin and must participate in two 2-hour training sessions and a 1-hour sexual harassment training.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours per week for the quarterly period.

Classes will take place online or at a local community organization. Classes run on a quarterly cycle:
Winter Session - January through March/April
Spring Session - April through June
Summer Session - July through September
Fall Session - October through late November/early December

Photo courtesy of WeSpeak NYC
organization_description: A free English-learning program that provides the adequate materials for immigrants to be able to learn and practice English.
addresses: ["New York, NY, USA"]

headline: America Needs You
short_description: Help mentor first generation students!
content:
It can be hard finding jobs once students graduate due to the challenging job market and competition for openings. This can be even harder for first-generation college students. Volunteers will participate in a 2-hour virtual workshop to help give guidance to first-generation college students about internships and career paths and also help with mock interviews. You would be paired with a student in the New York area.

Volunteers must be college graduates with at least 1 year of work experience.

Sign up and create a volunteering profile here: Link You can then sign up for a volunteering spot through the events calendar: Link

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours
organization_description: Identifies young professionals to act as mentors for first generation college students.
addresses: ["America Needs You, 82 Nassau Street, New York, New York 10038, USA"]

headline: Potomac River Keeper Network
short_description: Defend healthy river habitats and promote clean water!
content:
Help Potomac Riverkeeper Network protect and defend healthy river habitats and promote clean water. Whether testing water quality, doing river clean-ups, attending public hearings, doing scientific or legal research, or helping out in the Georgetown office you can make a difference for our local waterways.

This is a family-friendly volunteer initiative and groups are welcome to come volunteer at river cleanup events! You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection, a reusable water bottle and clothes you don't mind getting a little dirty.

The event calendar is located here and has information about special events, as well as the monthly events hosted throughout the year. 

Photo courtesy of Potomac River Keeper Network
date_notes: These hours are for contacting the Headquarters. Volunteer hours vary and specific information can be found on the calendar.
organization_description: Protect the public’s right to clean water in the Potomac and Shenandoah Rivers and their tributaries. We stop pollution to enhance the safety of our drinking water, protect healthy river habitats, and enhance public use and enjoyment.
addresses: ["3070 M Street Northwest, Washington, DC 20007, USA"]

headline: Manna Ministry of Tidewater
short_description: Pack and deliver food to families in need of food assistance
content:
Help provide emergency food assistance to families by packing boxes, grocery shopping and delivering meals to community members. The Manna Ministry of Tidewater helps all families in need in the community, with a focus on single mothers in need. They accept volunteers of all ages, and each shift is about 2 hours.

Photo Courtesy of Manna Ministry of Tidewater
organization_description: Organization that provides emergency food assistance to families in the community, primarily single mothers while they are waiting for their food stamp applications to be processed.
addresses: ["1112 Jensen Drive, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Judeo-Christian Outreach Center
short_description: Food pantry and meal packaging for those in need.
content:
Volunteers are able to help JCOC fulfill its mission of assisting and empowering those who are struggling with food insecurity by completing the many tasks to keep JCOC functioning. Volunteers can do shifts packing food, running errands to grocery stores, sorting donations, working the food pantry, or working reception with client intake. All of these tasks help insure that the dining hall can be open to all who need it daily.

Volunteers must complete an orientation prior to volunteering, which are held on the second Thursday of each month from 2-3 pm. Click here for the Orientation sign-up sheet.
date_notes: Time for volunteering depends on task signed up for
organization_description: JCOC's mission is to empower homeless families, individuals, and veterans to recover from crisis situations and return to being self-supporting, productive, and independent members of our community. Those who are homeless and/or struggling with food insecurity are welcome to come inside the dining hall to sit down and eat every day. They also run several homeless housing programs.
addresses: ["1053 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Thrive DC
short_description: Support people experiencing homelessness and food insecurity
content:
Safety net for people experiencing homelessness, unemployment, housing instability, and food insecurity. With our help, our clients take the first steps toward independence and self-sufficiency.

The Reentry Assistant helps clients by “interviewing” them as they try to reenter the job market. They will also help clients with writing cover letters and resumes for job applications. Other opportunities include serving meals, a winter coat drive, and working a shift at the farmer's market.

Before volunteering, you must attend a virtual orientation which is held over zoom.

Due to COVID-19, Thrive's hours of operation have been modified, including all staff working remotely on Mondays. A full calendar can be found here for more information about specific hours of operation. 

Photo courtesy of Thrive DC
date_notes: No weekend volunteer opportunities. See website for updated COVID hours of operation
organization_description: Safety net for people experiencing homelessness, unemployment, housing instability, and food insecurity. With our help, our clients take the first steps toward independence and self-sufficiency.
addresses: ["1525 Newton Street Northwest suite g1, Washington, DC 20010, USA"]

headline: New York Restoration Project
short_description: Help create green spaces and plant trees!
content:
Help ensure New Yorkers have access to green spaces throughout their communities! Volunteers will help to revamp gardens by removing invasive species and planting in Northern Manhattan neighborhoods. 

Volunteers must wear long pants and a mask. You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection or multiple layers if it is cold and water. 

Sherman Creek crew will work on Saturdays from 10 am to 12 pm. The Highbridge Forest Crew will work Saturdays from 1:30 pm to 3:30 pm.

If your business is interested in corporate group opportunities, email Michael Yerdon at myerdon@nyrp.org

Photo courtesy of NY Restoration Project
organization_description: Working to ensure that New Yorkers have equitable access to green space through community garden clean ups and tree plantings
addresses: ["3703 10th Ave, New York, NY, USA", "Amsterdam Avenue & West 190th Street, New York, NY, USA"]

headline: Sharing and Caring Crestview Center
short_description: Serve meals to homeless individuals.
content:
The Sharing and Caring Center in Crestview provides a host of services that include food, clothing, shelter, transportation assistance, medical and dental help, and much more to the over 20,000 homeless people. They are always looking for volunteers to help serve meals at the center on weekdays. This involves one to three hours of time commitment, each time. 

Interested in serving meals at the center? Please fill out this volunteer application to get started! 

Photo Credit: Sharing & Caring - Crestview Center
organization_description: Sharing and Caring provides a host of services, including food and clothing donations, shelter and transportation assistance, medical and dental help, and much more to the over 20,000 people who come through our facility each month.
addresses: ["298 Martin Luther King Jr Ave, Crestview, FL 32536, USA"]

headline: Miriam's Kitchen
short_description: Help end chronic homelessness and hunger in DC.
content:
Not only does Miriam's kitchen provide healthy, made-from-scratch meals to their customers, they also connect them with personalized social services that assist them with re-building thier lives!
