Volunteers will be able to hand out meals in a designated dining room once a month, either during breakfast or dinner hours.

When volunteering, make sure to wear comfortable clothing. Before your first shift, you must complete an orientation. More information about the orientation and volunteer process can be found here. 

Photo courtesy of Miriam's Kitchen
date_notes: Breakfast hours 6:30 - 8:15 am, Dinner hours 3:30 - 5:15 pm
organization_description: Utilizes a comprehensive approach to eliminating the housing crisis in Washington, D.C. Through engaging our guests with healthy, made-from-scratch meals, we connect them with personalized social services that assist them with re-building their lives.
addresses: ["2401 Virginia Ave NW, Washington, DC 20037, USA"]

headline: Donate to a local homeless shelter
short_description: Donations are always needed at homeless shelters!
content:
Below is a list of the most needed items at homeless shelters nationwide, based on information provided by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development. If you would like to provide a donation, please collect these items, and deliver them to your local homeless shelter: 

1. Socks
2. Shoes
3. Underwear (Men, Women, Children)
4. Blankets
5. General Hygiene Products
6. Feminine Hygiene Products
7. Baby Needs: Diapers, Bottles, Clothes
8. First Aid Kits
9. School Supplies
10. Earbuds
date_notes: Coordinate drop offs with shelters
organization_name: Donate to a local homeless shelter
organization_description: Homeless Shelters provide clothing, food, and resources to those who are facing difficulties in life.
addresses: [null]

headline: The Village Hands
short_description: Multiple projects to care for children in need.
content:
The Village Hands helps to care for children in the community through a number of different programs. With Project Underwear, The Village Hands is pairing with Escambia County School Navigators to provide underwear and socks for those students in most need. The Grandmother’s Program assists grandmothers in raising their grandchildren. The First Time Mom Program provides some basic essentials, and also encourages referrals for early interventions to agencies such as Healthy Start, to get mom and baby started towards a bright future. Expect a time commitment of at least two hours for each project.

To get started making a difference in a local child's life, fill out the interest form!
organization_description: Provides clothing and other items to children in spaces such as homeless shelters, domestic violence shelters, foster care, and under-served day care facilities.
addresses: ["8050 N 9th Ave #127, Pensacola, Florida 32514, USA"]

headline: Junior Achievement of Greater Hampton Roads
short_description: Give insights to K-12 students by teaching life-skills.
content:
Become a mentor to children ages K-12 by teaching engaging and fun programs. The goal of volunteers is to inspire kids to achieve a more fulfilling career and life by contributing professional insights and personal experiences to the programs they teach. 

Volunteers choose the age level they work with, depending on if they are more comfortable with elementary, middle or high school-aged kids. They also choose what school in Hampton Roads they are working in, so it can be kept local. 

Preparation prior to volunteering involves a 60-90 minute orientation and training, 30-60 minutes of self-preparation and some classroom program instruction (whether virtual or in person).
date_notes: Meet with students several times over the school year.
organization_name: Junior Achievement of Greater Hampton Roads
organization_description: Junior Achievement’s mission is to inspire and prepare young people to succeed. The inspiration piece comes from community volunteers who not only deliver our lessons, but share their experience. In the process, these volunteers serve as role models helping to positively impact young people’s perceptions about the importance of education, as well as critical life skills. Preparation involves our proven lessons that promote financial capability, work and career readiness, and business ownership.
addresses: ["Junior Achievement of Greater Hampton Roads, International Parkway, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Martha's Table
short_description: Support the local community dealing with food insecurity.
content:
There are many options to get involved with Martha's Table. Volunteers are needed to make trail mix and/or muffins and other popular items to be dropped off at the Martha's Table Headquarters in Washington D.C. In-person volunteers are greatly needed to  help with food delivery and distribution, clothing and food donation sorting and lend a hand at the Martha's Table market.

Wear comfortable, durable, and non-revealing clothing, including close-toed shoes with no significant heel and minimal jewelry. 

Before volunteering, please read the Volunteer Waiver, Volunteer Code and Volunteer Health Policy on the website. 

While all volunteers must be at least 12 years old, younger children can participate in the snack pack-making process for donations. 

Photo courtesy of Martha's Table
organization_description: Operating nationally accredited education programs, pairing healthy food access with physical and mental health services, and promoting family success by investing in family leaders.
addresses: ["1474 Columbia Rd NW, Washington, DC 20009, USA", "2375 Elvans Rd SE, Washington, DC 20020, USA"]

headline: Hire Heroes USA
short_description: Support veterans as they transition back to civilian life.
content:
Help out veterans who are searching for permanent work by mentoring them through resume building, mock interviews, and guidance on what industry would suit them based on their experiences. All mentors should have experience in the industry in which they wish to provide advice and guidance. 

Once you are paired with your mentee, you will conduct all communications remotely. Mentoring opportunities are one-time volunteering settings and do not require a commitment to a weekly timeframe.
date_notes: Will coordinate with mentee
organization_description: Supporting veterans in their transition from military to civilian life by offering them resources to be recieve job interviews and be hired.
addresses: [null]

headline: American Corporate Partners
short_description: Support military spouses of active duty and veterans.
content:
This opportunity will connect spouses of both active duty military and veteran community members with a volunteer (you!) to act as a mentor to bridge the gap between the military and the private sector. Topics to be discussed are resumes, interviews, career interests, networking and small business development. 

Once you are paired with your mentee, you will conduct all communications remotely. Volunteers must be at least 35 years of age and able to commit 1-hour per month to creating a connection with their assigned mentee.
date_notes: Coordinated with mentee
organization_description: Helping Veterans and their spouses to find careers and provide career advice
addresses: [null]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 35 years or older", "Must be able to commit 1 hour per month"]

headline: Crestview Area Shelter for the Homeless
short_description: Make comfort bags and organize donations.
content:
At the Crestview Area Shelter for the Homeless, there are several ways to care for homeless individuals in the community. Volunteer to make comfort bags for the homeless by filling bags with toothbrushes, toothpaste, socks, blanket, food, and clothing. They are also looking for volunteers to help sort donations and provide meals. Expect a time commitment of two or more hours for each activity.

All ages are welcome to volunteer, but those under 18 must be accompanied by an adult.
organization_name: Crestview Area Shelter for the Homeless
organization_description: Provides street outreach services to homeless individuals and advocates for collaborative, locally driven solutions to end homelessness.
addresses: ["120 Duggan Avenue, Crestview, Florida 32536, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: So Others Might Eat
short_description: Change lives - break the cycle of poverty and homelessness.
content:
This volunteer organization provides material aid and comfort to our neighbors in the District, helping them break the cycle of poverty and homelessness through programs and services that save lives, improve lives, and help transform the lives of individuals and families, their communities, and the systems and structures that affect them. Volunteers can begin by collecting winter coats for men and women at Holy Trinity, additionally, they appreciate snack bags to include fruit, granola bars and trail mix. 

Group volunteering is available through SOME for groups up to 8 people.  Before volunteering, you must attend an orientation session. Information can be found about these sessions on the SOME Webpage. 

Photo courtesy of So Others Might Eat
date_notes: Specific Volunteer hours vary depending on time slots.
organization_description: Provides material aid and comfort to our neighbors in the District, helping them break the cycle of poverty and homelessness through programs and services that save lives, improve lives, and help transform lives of individuals and families, their communities, and the systems and structures that affect them
addresses: ["71 O Street Northwest, Washington, DC 20001, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of Northwest Florida
short_description: Support members of the military at various events!
content:
USO volunteers can help out with special events like military homecomings, training and/or deployment, concerts, holiday parties, booths at festivals, military appreciation day, and many more! There are multiple locations where you can help to support our military service members, including NAS Pensacola, Corry Station, Pensacola International Airport (PNS) and Destin-Ft. Walton Beach Airport (VPS). You can also sign up to help at one of the various USO Centers across Hampton Roads. Expect to commit at least two hours for each activity. 

The USO requires that volunteers be 18 years or older for most activities, but some volunteers 13 and older are welcome at specific events.

Interested volunteers can register here, and a team member will reach out with more information! Volunteers will be expected to complete a background check.
organization_name: United Service Organization of Northwest Florida
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families, and country through programs which strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["153 Ellyson Ave building 625d, Pensacola, FL 32508, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some opportunities for ages 13 and above."]

headline: Disabled American Veteran's Charity - Washington DC
short_description: Help disabled veterans with care, transportation and errands
content:
Support veterans by signing up to work with the Disabled American Veteran's Charity. You will be matched with a local Veteran's Affairs hospital in Washington DC and surrounding areas, where you can help out with patients, events, and transportation. Other options are to sign up to help out with grocery runs or other household errands for veterans.

The agency works hard to connect disabled veterans to their community and help people contribute personally to the military benefits our veterans have earned.

Photo courtesy of https://www.dav.org/
date_notes: Sign up for an event and time slot that fits in your schedule!
organization_name: Disabled American Veteran's Charity - Washington DC
organization_description: Ensuring a high-quality life to disable veterans through programs that connect them within their community, supporting their rights, and ensuring they receive and take advantage of their military benefits
addresses: ["1722 I Street Northwest, Downtown, Washington, DC, USA"]

headline: SCORE Hampton Roads
short_description: Professional advice to help small businesses thrive!
content:
Volunteers can sign up to share their industry experience or knowledge about running a business through online video seminars, leading meetings for your local SCORE chapter, helping people build meaningful relationships within their communities and so many other ways to help small businesses grow! If you have experience owning, running or growing a business, volunteering with SCORE is a great way to give back and share your knowledge to help other small businesses thrive!

Volunteering is done virtually, and volunteers should be able to dedicate 5-15 hours a month to SCORE. To get started, fill out this interest form!
date_notes: Virtual options make volunteering schedule flexible
organization_description: SCORE is a non-profit that is working to ensure the support and success of small business nationwide. They provide expertise and guidance through their platforms and volunteer groups.
addresses: ["Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: City Parks Foundation
short_description: Help transform parks!
content:
City Parks Foundation helps to make parks more vibrant through sports, arts, community building, and environmental education programs across all five boroughs! Help with park beautification around many of New York City's small and large green spaces. Volunteers must be vaccinated.

There is no age restriction and group volunteering opportunities are available! 

Locations will vary around New York City.

You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection or multiple layers if it is cold and/or rainy.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours

Photo courtesy of City Parks Foundation
organization_description: Works to transform parks into vibrant green spaces where New Yorkers can go to play and appreciate being outdoors
addresses: ["830 5th Avenue, New York, NY, USA"]

headline: Food Banks for New York City
short_description: Help those experiencing homelessness with food!
content:
Help distribute groceries to those experiencing homelessness in New York City! Grab-and-Go Pantry volunteers help to sort and pack grocery donations, help distribute grocery bags to community members and help clean up and organize the grocery pantry after the shift. 

Those who wish to volunteer will create an account and review available opportunities on the Volunteer Portal. From the Volunteer Portal calendar, volunteers can self-select shifts that work best for them based on their availability. Once they find a project that works for them, they click on “Sign up” on the date they want to participate in. The volunteer will receive an automatic email from our system that includes the address, directions, and any additional information they need for the project. Our Grab-and-Go Pantry Distribution opportunity has a maximum of 6 volunteers and participants register on a first-come-first-serve basis.

Groups interested in creating a unique volunteer opportunity can email Jessica Presedo, Director of Corporate Service & Engagement, at jpresedo@foodbanknyc.org

Volunteers must sign a waiver, COVID-19 waiver, and photo release waiver.

Estimated duration of activity: 3 hours
organization_name: Food Banks for New York City
organization_description: A food bank which distributes over 700 bags of groceries monthly to the people experiencing homeless around New York
addresses: ["Food Bank for New York City, 39 Broadway, New York, NY 10006, USA"]

headline: Soldiers' Angels
short_description: Bake, write letters, and more to support military members!
content:
As an at-home volunteer for Soldier's Angels, you can help support and comfort deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, or adopting a family around the holidays! There are many other ways to support the troops at home, too. With the flexible time commitment and at-home location, this would be a great activity to do with your family on your own time! You just need to be able to fill a box with homemade goodies, or write a thoughtful letter, to make a difference in someone's life.

Register online to be a "Team Angel" here!
organization_description: Soldier's Angels works to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["3001 N Davis Hwy, Pensacola, FL 32503, USA", "Atlanta, GA, USA", "Denver, CO, USA", "Fredericksburg, VA, USA", "Orlando, FL, USA", "Phoenix, AZ, USA", "Portland, OR, USA", "Seattle, WA, USA", "Tampa, FL, USA", "Washington D.C., DC, USA"]

headline: Virginia Beach GrowSmart
short_description: First Grade READS literacy tutoring program.
content:
Volunteer with GrowSmart to become a tutor and mentor to first graders in the Virginia Beach public schools. As part of the First Grade Reads program, you will be paired with a first grader and work them through books so they become confident, successful readers.

This long-term volunteer opportunity is a weekly commitment from October through May available for adults only.

For an updated application, you can email vbgrowsmart@vbgov.com or find out more on the GrowSmart Website.

 

Photo courtesy of https://www.vbgrowsmart.com/tutoring-program
date_notes: 1 hour tutoring sessions 1-2 days a week after school!
organization_description: Virginia Beach's early childhood education initiative . GrowSmart focuses on helping kids grow up with all they need to be healthy, educated and successful! They collaborate with Virginia Beach schools, communities and more to work towards their goal.
addresses: ["VIRGINIA BEACH GROWSMART, Main Street, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Seeds in the Middle
short_description: Help with food insecurity in Brooklyn!
content:
Help out at the Tastes of Brooklyn and various farm stand events that run on Saturdays. Set up for the event, help with social media outreach and posting, cooking classes, coordinate activities, reading tutors, etc. There are so many opportunities to help with this organization! Look through this document to see which cause you would like to join in on helping.

For group volunteering opportunities please contact volunteer@seedsinthemiddle.org

Please wear comfortable shoes and clothing that is not too revealing.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours.

Photo courtesy of Seeds in the Middle
organization_description: Working to erase the food desert in Brooklyn but teaching the community members how to grow fruits and vegetables and cook more wholesome meals
addresses: ["Brooklyn, New York, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA"]

headline: Dare2B
short_description: Help homeless children of New York!
content:
Help make a positive impact on communities in New York City! Volunteers will help out with community events for the children supported by Dare2Be. Most events will be outside, so bring sun protection or multiple layers if it is cold or damp.

Sign up to volunteer and make sure to fill out the associated forms!

Volunteers must wear a mask and show proof of vaccination.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Please provide 48 hours notice if you are unable to participate.

Photo courtesy of Dare2B
organization_description: Helping the homeless children of New York to support and empower them to thrive.
addresses: ["55 Exchange Place, New York, NY 10005, United States"]

headline: Animal Care and Control Team Philly
short_description: Help to care for neglected and abandoned animals.
content:
Calling all animal lovers! This opportunity to support animals in need has so many different opportunities for involvement. Volunteers are able to volunteer by taking pictures of animals, setting up, breaking down and supporting special events, assisting in socializing cats and dogs for their future owners, and helping in the transport of adopted or foster animals. 

Before you are able to start giving time, you must create an account and register for an online orientation. Once that is complete, you can select your desired project! 

When you arrive for your volunteering time, please park in the back employee parking lot or on Hunting Park Avenue. Volunteers should expect to give 2 hours of their time.
date_notes: Dependent on the project
organization_name: Animal Care and Control Team Philly
organization_description: Working to give care and comfort to all homeless, abandoned, or neglected animals around Philadelphia.
addresses: ["111 West Hunting Park Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19140, USA"]

headline: Lynnhaven River NOW
short_description: Clean up, restore, and advocate for the Lynnhaven River
content:
Help Lynnhaven River NOW accomplish its waterway  improvement  goals by participating in one of its volunteer events.

Monthly waterway cleanups, oyster restoration projects, tree plantings, and water quality testing days are all great ways to get outside and help Lynnhaven River watershed. Descriptions and schedules for each event can be found on the nonprofit's website. 

Volunteers can also get involved with educational outreach programs, working with local students to teach them about the importance of the Lynnhaven River and its surrounding ecosystems. 

 

Photo Courtesy of https://www.lynnhavenrivernow.org/events/volunteer-opportunities/
date_notes: Tiime of day and day of the week varies depending on volunteer opportunities
organization_description: Lynnhaven River NOW is an environmental nonprofit that works to restore and protect Virginia Beach’s waterways and natural resources. Initiatives such as regular cleanup and restoration events, public education, and political advocacy help to improve the health of this vital ecosystem.
addresses: ["Lynnhaven River NOW, Holland Road, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Philadelphia Animal Welfare Society
short_description: Helping homeless dogs and cats around Philly.
content:
A fulfilling opportunties for dog and cat lovers! Volunteers can give time by assisting at adoption events, caring for and feeding animals, helping to clean out crates, assisting with administrative work or applying to be a foster parent. All animals in this shelter were eiter given up, neglected or abandoned. Without the help from volutneers, this shelter would not be able to provide services to support these vulnerable animals.

After you fill out an application a PAWS team member will be in touch within 48 hours to schedule an orientation. Once you've completed your orientation, you can then select the desired opportunity you would like to support.

There are multiple clinic locations that are open 7 days a week and need volunteers for opening shifts (9 AM - 11 AM) and closing shifts (5 PM - 7 PM). The Petsmart Adoption Center needs volunteers M-F (9 AM - 11 AM and 5 PM - 8 PM) and also on weekends from 11 AM - 3 PM.
date_notes: Please see above notes for additional dates and times
organization_description: Offering low cost veterinary care to pet owners and rescue clinics as well as acting as the largest shelter for abandoned, neglected and stranded pets
addresses: ["1000 South Broad Street, Philadelphia, PA, USA", "100 North 2nd Street, Philadelphia, PA, USA", "1810 Grant Avenue, Philadelphia, PA, USA", "2900 Grays Ferry Avenue, Philadelphia, PA, USA"]

headline: Philafound.org
short_description: Put your skills to use for the good of others!
content:
This opportunity is a great match for someone with experience in a specific industry or with online skill expertise! Through Philafound.org's initiative to support non-profit organizations, volunteers will assist non-profits with their expertise to help streamline and support their work when they cannot afford to hire the positions or the technology. Ultimately allowing these smaller organizations to reach more people and thrive.

Once you register online, you can select an opportunity to then submit an application to support. You will have an interview with the organization before helping out with the project. All interviews will be by phone or video-call and about 30 minutes long, just to see if the desired opportunities and skills are a good fit. 

All volunteers must have access to a computer, telephone and reliable internet. Hours and length of commitment vary depending on the organization and project.
date_notes: Coordinated with organization
organization_description: Helps non-profit organizations who do not have the resources to hire staff or invest in technology to help in business, marketing, development and other key areas find volunteers to lend a hand and give their expertise.
addresses: ["Philadelphia, PA, USA"]

headline: Virginia Aquarium
short_description: Creek clean-up, marine animal care and more!
content:
Volunteer with the full family at the monthly creek clean-ups hosted by the Virginia Aquarium! Creek Cleanup Sign Up

There are also opportunities for volunteers ages 13 and older to take care of the marine wildlife, teach about conservation or assist in the aquariums youth program! There is so much you can do to help the aquarium educate and inspire! Positions and events are updated regularly on the aquarium website!

Photo Credit: Virginia Aquarium
date_notes: Creek Cleanups one Saturday a month
organization_description: The mission of the Virginia Aquarium & Marine Science Center is to inspire conservation of the marine environment through education, research, and sustainable practices.
addresses: ["717 General Booth Boulevard, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Spread the Love Campaign
short_description: Send a card to a front line worker.
content:
Looking to support front-line workers who support the greater Philadelphia area? Through the Spread the Love Campaign sponsored by Penn Medicine, volunteers can send messages of gratitude or have their kids draw a picture and upload it for the doctors and nurses working through the Penn Medicine hospital system.

It's super simple to give time through this card campaign. Just have you, your family or friends complete their own card and it will be sent to a member of the hospital staff!

This would be a great opportunity for a rainy day, group gathering or just to spread some joy :)
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_description: A multi-hospital health systems in association with The University of Pennsylvania School of Medecine.
addresses: ["Penn Medicine Princeton Medical Center, Plainsboro Road, Plainsboro Township, NJ, USA"]

headline: Mighty Writers
short_description: Help underserved students in the Philly school system!
content:
Are you looking for an opportunity to support children across Philadelphia? Through the Mighty Writers program, you can help underserved students across the Philadelphia school system with reading, writing, homework and studying after school. All kids in this program are in grades 2 - 12. Volunteers will act as tutors and mentors to students seeking help with various subjects of varying academic abilities. 

Mighty Writers asks that volunteers have some prior experience tutoring or teaching in either a classroom or non-classroom setting. Once you fill out a volunteer application, a team member will be in touch to pair you with an opportunity.

Parking is available on-site for all volunteers.
organization_description: Working to teach children across Philadelphia to better read, write and excel in school.
addresses: ["1501 Christian St, Philadelphia, PA 19146, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Must have received a High School Diploma"]

headline: The Bowery Mission
short_description: Help serve meals to the homeless.
content:
The Bowery Mission is making a citywide impact by providing compassionate care, residential and community programs, transitional housing and alumni programs, and children's programs. Help to serve meals to the homeless around New York City. Volunteers must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination and wear a mask.

Volunteers must sign up for the desired shift through this link. If you cannot make your shift please login into your volunteer profile and cancel your shift. There are 6 Bowery locations. Please specify which one you would like to volunteer at.

Please wear close-toed shoes, hairnets (provided), gloves and aprons (provided) and clothing that covers the chest, shoulders, underarms, torso, and knees. Please don't wear jewelry and clothing must not portray themes related to alcohol, cigarettes, drugs, sex or violence.

Community and Corporate volunteering opportunities are available.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Photo courtesy of The Bowery Mission
organization_description: Serving meals to people who are experiencing homelessness or other crisis and using the community to support and empower these individuals
addresses: ["227 Bowery, New York, NY, USA"]

headline: Philly Reading Coaches
short_description: Help students improve their reading skills!
content:
Students who are exposed to 60 minutes of reading a day have some significant improvement in reading skills. Throughout the Philadelphia school system, 3 out of 4 students below 4th-grade struggle to achieve the desired reading level. (Credit: Philly Reach Coaches) That's where you come in!

Through this initiative sponsored by the Office of Children and Families, volunteers will be paired with students in Kindergarten through 3rd grade to help them practice reading and improve their skills. Volunteers are also encouraged to donate books so that each student can take home 25 books to practice their reading.

Volunteers must fill out an interest form to be considered to volunteer. Once submitted, you will receive an email with the next steps to becoming a volunteer and helping kids gain confidence with their reading skills!

This opportunity is within the Philadelphia school system and locations for work days and volunteering events will be listed on the event page.
date_notes: Hours will be listed on the event page of the opportunity you select.
organization_description: Works to boost reading skills among Philly's youth (under 4th grade) by offering reading practice with a tutor, access to books and support from community members.
addresses: ["Philadelphia, PA, USA"]

headline: Rikki's Refuge
short_description: Help take care of animals or participate in outreach.
content:
Rikki's Refuge is a no-kill animal sanctuary that is home to 1,200 different kinds of animals. They teach about the importance of taking care of your animals.

Volunteers can help out by cleaning up and taking care of animals and their pens, outreach in the community for food donations from farmer's markets and grocery stores, and helping with maintenance projects and general yard work.

Please email volunteers@rikkisrefuge.org if you are interested in becoming involved!

There is plenty of parking available. Older kids are welcome.

Make sure to wear clothes you won't mind getting dirty and a sturdy pair of shoes.

 

Photo Courtesy of Rikki's Refuge
organization_description: This is a no-kill animal sanctuary that is home to 1,200 different kinds of animals. They teach about the importance of taking care of your animals.
addresses: ["21410 Constitution Hwy, Rapidan, VA 22733, USA"]

headline: Pennsylvania Horticultural Society
short_description: Get dirty and beautify Philly's parks and gardens!
content:
Work to help the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society beautify Philadelphia by assisting in maintaining community gardens and green spaces. Volunteers will be involved in assisting with tree planting, invasive species removal, cleaning out and planting gardens and working at the Philadelphia Flower Show!

Before you can get to work, volunteers must create an account in VolunteerHub and fill out a volunteer interest form. These volunteer opportunities take place outdoors and in all different kinds of weather. Please wear comfortable clothes that you do not mind getting dirty, close-toed shoes, bring water, sunscreen and multiple layers of clothes or a rain jacket depending on the weather.

Locations for work days and volunteering events vary and will be listed on the event page for the specific volunteering opportunity. Volunteers must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and upload a picture of your vaccine proof into VolunteerHub.
date_notes: Vary with location
organization_description: Using horticulture to support and both social and environmental change through access to fresh food, green spaces, increasing healthy living habits and economic opportunties.
addresses: ["Philadelphia, PA, USA"]

headline: ENGin
short_description: Help international students increase English skills.
content:
ENGin works to pair fluent English speakers with Ukrainian youth to help them increase their English skills and gain a cross-cultural connection.

Volunteers are paired with younger international students from various countries to serve as speaking "buddies." Programs are now focusing on Ukrainian students.

Must be 14 or older, fluent in English, and able to commit 1 hour per week, 4 hours per month. These weekly 1-hour conversations are meant to be a casual way for your speaking buddy to practice their English.

Volunteers must fill out this application and have a 10-15 minute interview. Once that is finished, you will take an exam to determine the student you will be paired with!
organization_description: ENGin works to pair fluent English speakers with Ukrainian youth to help them increase their English skills as well as gain a cross-cultural connection.
addresses: ["Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of Metropolitan New York
short_description: Help keep military members connected to their communities!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like Fleet Week, Veterans Week, deployments and many more! You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across the New York City metro area. Sites in New York City are at Fort Hamilton Army Garrison, JFK Airport in the JetBlue Terminal and Newark Airport in Terminal B. 

Volunteers must undergo a background check.

Please wear shoes that are comfortable and clothes that are not too revealing.

Volunteers must be 18 years or older; those 13 and older can volunteer at some special events with a parent/guardian.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours
date_notes: Hours vary by event.
organization_name: United Service Organization of Metropolitan New York
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families and country through programs which strenghten those bonds.
addresses: ["JFK Airport (JFK), Queens, NY, USA", "Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR), Brewster Road, Newark, NJ, USA", "United States Army Garrison Fort Hamilton"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some opportunities for ages 13 and above."]

headline: Fairmount Park Conservancy
short_description: Get outside and clean up around Philly!
content:
Help to clean up local parks around Philadelphia in Spring, Summer and Fall to help attract people to visit the parks. This initiative sponsored by Fairmount Park Conservancy is called the Love Your Park Program. Volunteers can help during the Love Your Park Weeks in May and November. There are also bi-monthly clean-up opportunities every second Saturday of the month. You can also pick up a kit and clean up any local green space!

Volunteers will be responsible for picking up trash, cleaning out flower beds and gardens, invasive species removal, planting trees, flowers and other ornamental plants, and generally making the parks an inviting space for all to visit. Select your event TODAY.

Groups are welcome! Individualized company clean-up days can be scheduled by providing information through this link. All ages are welcome as well! Clean-up and plantings will take about 2 hours.
date_notes: Times and additional dates specified on event page.
organization_description: Working to make the park system equitable and high quality for all residents and visitors of Philadelphia.
addresses: ["Philadelphia, PA, USA"]

headline: Fredericksburg Area Museum
short_description: Help plan and implement museum programs.
content:
The museum works to educate the community on the culture, history and importance of the Fredericksburg area through educational programs, art exhibitions and special events.

Volunteers are needed to help out with the planning and implementation of the museum's educational programs! They need help in designing programs and materials which can be interactive.

Please fill out a volunteer interest form and select "Education Programs."

There could potentially be virtual options available as well. 

Photo Courtesy of Fredericksburg Area Museum
organization_description: The museum works to educate about the culture, history, and importance of the Fredericksburg area through educational programs, art exhibitions, and special events.
addresses: ["907 Princess Anne Street, Fredericksburg, VA 22401, USA"]

headline: New York State Division of Veteran Services
short_description: Help support military programs and initiatives!
content:
Help support veterans by informing them of their benefits. Volunteers learn about the military and veteran benefit process, then conduct outreach to groups, conduct administrative tasks for the office, and work to support the Governor's military programs and initiatives.

Volunteers must have access to a computer, telephone, and internet.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours
organization_name: New York State Division of Veterans Services
organization_description: Work to notify veterans and their families about the benefits they've earned for their service and to make sure they are able to redeem and use those benefits
addresses: [null]

headline: MANNA
short_description: Help feed homebound individuals healthy meals.
content:
Many members of the Philadelphia community are homebound due to age or a medical condition. These people often cannot provide healthy, well-balanced meals for themselves and need support. This is where you come in! Volunteers are involved in multiple steps of meal prep to help make daily meals for the homebound community MANNA serves. You will be involved in multiple tasks such as slicing and preparing foods to be cooked, packing meals, and delivering meals to communities around Philadelphia.

Volunteers must register to volunteer and attend a volunteer orientation. Once you are done with the orientation, you can select an opportunity on the VolunteerHub. All volunteers must email a picture of your COVID-19 vaccination card to vaccine@mannapa.org.

Group opportunities are welcome! If interested, send an email to punetic@mannapa.org.

Parking is available at the site and the building is ADA accessible. Please wear closed-toed shoes, comfortable clothing, and nothing too revealing.
date_notes: Monday shifts go until 8PM
organization_description: Helping to serve the medically impaired and homebound nutritious meals to help them heal
addresses: ["420 North 20th Street, Philadelphia, PA 19130, USA"]

headline: Stafford Junction
short_description: Help underprivileged students with homework and reading.
content:
Stafford Junction works to support families living in poverty around Stafford and offers services to help students excel in school.

Volunteers will be paired with a student at one of the seven schools Stafford Junction serves. You will help with homework and encourage students to read to reach their grade reading level.

Must be at least 15 years old. National Junior Honor Society members, high schoolers, college students and retired teachers are welcome.

Please fill out a volunteer application here and a team member will be in contact about a placement!

Stafford Junction serves the following schools: Drew Middle School, Stafford High School, Conway Elementary School, Rocky Run Elementary School, Anne Moncure Elementary School, Kate Waller Barrett Elementary School, and Falmouth Elementary School.

Please check the website for specific times for each school.
date_notes: Days and times will vary depending on the school, check the website for schedule.
organization_description: Stafford Junction works to support families living in poverty around Stafford and offers services to help students excel in school.
addresses: ["Stafford, VA, USA"]

headline: Sunday Breakfast Rescue Mission
short_description: Serve hot meals to those in need.
content:
The Sunday Morning Breakfast Mission provides meals to the homeless 7-days a week and invites the community to help with meal serving! Volunteers will support the mission during meal times by carrying trays to guests, cleaning up trays when they are finished and helping to break down the meals site.

Once you create an account, you can select the desired date that works with your schedule. Meals are served 7-days a week. Lunch: 11:45AM - 1PM and Dinner: 4:30PM - 6:30PM. Please wear comfortable clothes that are not too revealing, closed-toed shoes and bring layers.

Groups are welcome! 4-hour service projects available. Must fill out a group volunteering form if interested.
date_notes: Dinner is served 4:30 - 6:30PM
organization_description: Helping to feed the homeless and underserved populations of Philadelphia 7-days a week.
addresses: ["302 N 13th St, Philadelphia, PA 19107, USA"]

headline: Downtown Greens
short_description: Help with gardening and weeding.
content:
Downtown Greens is a community garden that works to educate the community about the importance of green space and environmental conservation.

Volunteers will be able to help tend to the community garden by planting and removing weeds. Or help to maintain the pantry which provides free food for the community.

All ages and groups are welcome. The only requirement is an interest in gardening or learning about gardening!

Make sure to wear clothes you won't mind getting dirty and a sturdy pair of shoes.

You can send gardens@downtowngreens.org an email to sign up and ask any questions you may have.

Shifts are Thursdays: 3 PM - 6 PM and Saturdays: 9 AM - 12 PM.

Photo Courtesy of Downtown Greens
date_notes: Shifts are Thursdays: 3PM - 6PM and Saturdays: 9AM - 12PM.
organization_description: A community garden that works to educate the community about the importance of green space and environmental conservation.
addresses: ["206 Charles Street, Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]

headline: Broad Street Ministry
short_description: Help provide clothes to those in need.
content:
Volunteers will be part of an organization that works to provide clothes, food, resources and shelter to Philadelphia's homeless and underserved populations. Volunteers will help to sort clothing and food donations, help serve meals or staff the clothing closet, answer any mail or phone calls, and assist in sorting mail for the members of Broad Street Ministry who use it as their permanent address.

Once you create an account, you can select your desired shift through the Broad Street Ministry's event calendar. Volunteer opportunities occur every day throughout the day. Slots to help fill up quickly, so register in advance!

All ages are welcome and families! If you are helping out in the mail room, you must be 18 years or older. Please remember to wear closed-toed shoes, comfortable clothes that are not too revealing and to bring layers. All volunteers must be vaccinated against COVID-19.
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: A shelter for the homeless and hungry to get a hot meal, clothing, and other necessities they are lacking
addresses: ["315 South Broad Street, Philadelphia, PA 19107, USA"]

headline: Care by Community
short_description: Help with homework, snacks and play games after school!
content:
Volunteer at Care by Community's after-school program for children from under-resourced communities around Virginia Beach. It gives them a place to rest, learn and play after the school day. Volunteers get to do hands-on work with the kids, including homework help, reading and playing games. Some kids need rides home, so there is also a driving volunteer opportunity. 

The program also always welcomes snack donations and dinner sponsors.

Volunteers have to pass a background check and take a Safe Sanctuary training course provided by Care by Community.

They are working on creating a website, but in the meantime, email mcutchins@vbumc.org to sign up!
organization_description: Care by Community (CBC) is Virginia Beach United Methodist Church’s after-school program for children from the homeless and working poor community. This outreach focuses on the children of nearby Cooke Elementary School.
addresses: ["212 19th Street, Virginia Beach, Virginia, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of PA and NJ
short_description: Support active duty and veterans today!
content:
Are you looking for an opportunity to support the men and women who fight for our country? If so, the USO of Pennsylvania and New Jersey has many options to fit all schedules and interests! Volunteers can help out with special events like military homecomings, training and/or deployments, concerts, holiday parties, booths at festivals, military appreciation day, and many more! You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across Pennsylvania to become involved in more administrative work. 

Once you have registered online, please watch a short training video to begin volunteering! For more information about locations where you can give your time, please visit the USO Center webpage. You can also use these locations to select a specific opportunity you want to be involved in.

If you are volunteering at the PHL airport, you must be able to commit to at least two 6-hour shifts a month.
date_notes: Hours depending on opportunity.
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families and country through programs which strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["2700 Southampton Rd, Philadelphia, PA 19154, USA"]

headline: Virginia Bluebird Society
short_description: Check bluebird boxes for nests, chicks and eggs.
content:
Virginia Bluebird Society promotes the health of bluebirds native to Virginia. Volunteers will work to monitor bluebird boxes once a month to track for nests, eggs and chicks. All ages are welcome - it's a great way to teach your kids about nature, and they'll love looking for eggs and chicks. Must have an interest in birds and environmental conservation.

This is a low-commitment opportunity since it's only once a month and can be conducted at your own convenience. Interested volunteers will need to email Anne Little at thegate@cox.net for a map of boxes.
organization_description: Virginia Bluebird Society promotes the health of native bluebirds in Virginia.
addresses: ["Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]

headline: Back on My Feet - Philadelphia
short_description: Walk or run to help break the cycle of homelessness
content:
Do you enjoy waking up early to walk or run? In partnership with Back on My Feet, you can help accompany people to break the cycle of homelessness and get some physical activity! There are many ways to help out, either by enjoying a morning walk or run, serving as a Next Steps Mentor, and/or leading a professional development workshop.

To get started, submit a volunteer sign-up form. Once that is complete, watch the Volunteer Orientation video and complete the volunteer skill survey. Your final step would be to review the volunteer handbook and complete a "Circle Up" training. Then you are ready to get involved!

Volunteers for certain events should be at least 18. However, if accompanied by a parent, there is a possibility of someone under 18 participating. Be sure to ask a volunteer team member for details!
date_notes: Usually in the mornings, dependent on opportunity
organization_description: Working to break the cycle of homelessness through a community of supporters who emphasize the importance of physical health, work to mentor members about employment and guide them to land jobs.
addresses: ["111 N 49th St, Philadelphia, PA, USA", "Broad St & Diamond St, Philadelphia, PA, USA", "Morris Street & Point Breeze Avenue, Philadelphia, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some ages are welcome to join, just ask a team member!"]

headline: USO of Hampton Roads
short_description: Work at special USO events and programs!
content:
The USO of Hampton Roads offers two types of volunteer work, the Special Events Volunteer and the Center Representative Volunteer. The Special Events Volunteer is an event-based volunteer who assists in events like military homecomings, training, deployments, concerts, military appreciation days and more. You can check out the events and sign up for one that fits in your schedule here. 

The Center Representative Volunteer is a more full-time volunteer opportunity, and they help with daily operations and programs at the USO center.
date_notes: Date depends on which event you select!
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families and country through programs which strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["USO Hampton Roads and Central Virginia - Naval Station Norfolk USO, Gilbert Street, Norfolk, VA, USA"]

headline: Literacy Council
short_description: Tutor and help teach adults to read and write in English.
content:
Volunteers will act as tutors for adults whose second language is English. Tutors help adults to read and write in English so that they can prosper in the community. 

Tutors must be available to meet for 2 hours once per week for a full year. You will also complete a tutor training session and a two-day workshop to prepare for your role. When filling out your Volunteer Inquiry you will be able to sign up for a training session that fits into your own schedule. 

Photo courtesy of Literacy Council Facebook
organization_description: Works to teach all ESL and other community members to read and write in English so they can prosper within the community
addresses: ["110 E Patrick St, Frederick, MD 21701, USA"]

headline: Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank
short_description: Assist with the food pantry by packing and passing out food.
content:
Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank exists to make sure that underserved communities around the Rappahannock region have access to groceries and meals. 

Volunteers can assist with daily food pantry events where community members can get groceries. They will help with the line, packing groceries and passing out groceries. There are also opportunities for administrative work as well.

Kids 13 and older are welcome; those under 15 must have an accompanying adult.

You must sign up on the website. Walk-ins cannot be accommodated. You can create an account here to select the opportunity you want to attend.

Groups are welcome! You must have all attendees create an account and select the corresponding event to attend.

Make sure you wear comfortable clothing that is not too revealing. Some events occur rain or shine, so bring layers and a raincoat. Events are 2+ hours.

Photo Courtesy of Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank
date_notes: Shifts vary: Monday - Wednesday: 9AM - 4PM or Thursday - Friday: 9AM - 3PM
organization_description: Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank makes sure that underserved communities around the Rappahannock region have access to groceries and meals.
addresses: ["Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank, 3631 Lee Hill Dr, Fredericksburg, VA 22408, USA"]

headline: Helping Ourselves to Transform
short_description: Virtually help those being released from incarceration.
content:
Volunteers can put their skills to work and help out with a variety of projects ranging from legal help, and grant writing to community outreach to help give those recently released from incarceration the resources and support they need to get their lives back on track!

When volunteering, they ask that you only volunteer for a field in which you have prior experience. Once you fill out this volunteer form, a team member will contact you for more information and to get you started.

This opportunity is virtual, so volunteers must have access to a smartphone and the internet. 

Depending on the project, the timeframe can range from weeks to months of involvement.
date_notes: These hours are for the Headquarters. Volunteering hours will vary depending on the tasks assigned.
organization_description: Working to give members of society who are being released from incarceration the resources and support they need to succeed in family life, career and their communities
addresses: ["14625 Baltimore Avenue suite 803, Laurel, MD 20707, USA"]

headline: Who Will Let the Dogs Out
short_description: Virtually work to raise awareness and end animal abuse.
content:
While working to raise awareness about animal abuse and neglect, volunteers will assist with website and graphic design projects, work to manage the social media pages, fundraising, bookkeeping and outreach to partner organizations. This organization raises money and resources to support shelters and help pets in need!

Volunteers must have some experience in the task they sign up for and enough time to help out. Depending on the project, the timeframe could vary from weeks to months. Once they fill out this Volunteer Interest Form a team member will be in touch to set up times. 

This is a virtual opportunity, so volunteers must have access to a smartphone and internet. 

Photo courtesy of Who Will Let the Dogs Out
organization_name: Who Will Let the Dogs Out
organization_description: Working to raise awareness about animal abuse and neglect and raising money and resources to support shelters
addresses: ["Frederick, MD, USA", "Harpers Ferry, WV, USA"]

headline: Veterinary Community Outreach
short_description: Assist with low-cost veterinary clinics for animals in need.
content:
Help out low-income families with their Veterinary costs for their loveable pets! Volunteers help with weekly vaccination clinics by assisting with paperwork, crowd control, answering questions from visitors and supporting the overall flow of the clinic.

Please send an email stating your interest. Potential volunteers will speak with the Lead Veterinarian before starting their first shift. You can also create a VolunteerMatch account and submit a request to help through the "I Want to Help" button on the website. 

Photo courtesy of Veterinary Community Outreach
date_notes: Specific times vary with opportunities, you will be notified when you select your project
organization_description: Provides low-cost veterinary clinics around the state of West Virginia.
addresses: ["310 North Buckmarsh Street, Berryville, Virginia 22611, United States"]

headline: Freedom Hearts Animal Rescue
short_description: Work in all aspects of animal care with adorable rescue pets
content:
Volunteers help in all aspects of animal care and facility maintenance. Volunteers can also help with marketing and outreach of adoptable pets! Freedom Hearts helps care for unwanted and abandoned pets and makes sure they get adopted into a great home!

All volunteers must be over the age of 18 and be comfortable around small animals. Those interested in this opportunity can reach out through this application and a team member will be in contact with you within three business days.

Please wear comfortable clothes you do not mind getting dirty and are weather appropriate. 

Photo courtesy of Freedom Hearts Animal Rescue
date_notes: Specific times vary with opportunities, you will be notified when you select your project.
organization_description: Focuses on caring for unwanted or abandoned pets, caring for them, and making sure they get adopted to a good home
addresses: ["Gerrardstown Rd, Gerrardstown, WV 25420"]

headline: Meals on Wheels - Fredericksburg
short_description: Deliver meals to families, children and elderly in need.
content:
Meals on Wheels works to serve food to people in need across the United States. Local chapters and partner organizations are in almost every state. There are various locations around the central Rappahannock Region. 

Volunteers will help to deliver meals to families, children and the elderly in need around the region. Volunteers can also use the delivery time to visit with the people receiving meals. Shifts are usually around lunchtime but can also coincide with your schedule. Children may accompany adult volunteers.

Fill out your information here so a team member can connect you with your local chapter of Meals on Wheels!

There are also group volunteering options available. Please mention to your local representative if you are interested in giving time as a group.
organization_description: Meals on Wheels works to serve food to people in need across the United States. Local chapters and partner organizations are in almost every state.
addresses: ["Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Books Motivate Foundation
short_description: Help promote literacy for students, individuals and families
content:
Volunteers can assist in the creative development of innovative educational programs, facilitate individual and group participation in Books Motivate programs, help with digital media campaigns, research and reach out to potential donors, speakers and registrants, and help coordinate meetings and special events.

If you wish to volunteer, fill out this Interest Form, and a team member will get in touch with you! All volunteers must pass a background check before they can begin.

High school-aged kids can apply to serve on the Books Motivate Youth Advisory Board. Some events may be virtual.
date_notes: Specific Volunteer hours vary depending on the task you sign up for.
organization_description: Enhancement and achievement of American and international knowledge and culture. We promote the development of literacy, career, and quality of life goal attainments for students, individuals, and families.
addresses: ["101 W Washington St #454, Charles Town, WV 25414, USA"]

headline: Fredericksburg Regional Continuum of Care
short_description: Collect items for community distribution to the homeless.
content:
Fredericksburg Regional Continuum of Care works to supply homeless and underserved populations around Fredericksburg with meals and clothing. 

Volunteers are needed to collect donations from the provided list and drop them off for community distribution. This is an easy way to help on your own time! Get your kids involved by taking them to buy or collect items. 

You can find what to donate here. You can contact info@fredericksburgcoc.org to schedule a contactless drop-off.
organization_description: Working to supply homeless and underserved populations around Fredericksburg with meals and clothing.
addresses: ["406 Princess Anne Street, Fredericksburg, Virginia 22401, USA"]

headline: Habitat for Humanity of Greater Fredericksburg
short_description: Volunteer to work in the ReStore.
content:
Habitat for Humanity works to build homes and spaces for communities to ensure that underserved populations have a safe place to live.

Volunteers are needed in the ReStore. There are many opportunities for individuals and groups to volunteer at the ReStore. Volunteers support the ReStore in various areas such as customer service, minor repairs and maintenance, receiving donations, cleaning and stocking the sales floor, and office support. All proceeds from the store fund the Greater Fredericksburg Habitat for Humanity and its operations.

You must be at least 16 years old and Covid vaccinated. 

You can register through this online platform and then select to volunteer in the ReStore.

Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

Shifts are Monday, Wednesday - Saturday: 12 PM - 5 PM.
organization_name: Habitat for Humanity of Greater Fredericksburg
organization_description: Works to build homes and spaces for communities so that underserved populations have a safe place to live.
addresses: ["2378 Plank Road, Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]

headline: Blueridge Center for Environmental Stewardship
short_description: Volunteer outdoors and keep the Blueridge Environment green!
content:
Volunteers will work to maintain trails, green spaces and other areas of the BRCES property for visitors. Task vary depending on the season!

Once you find a work day that fits your schedule, send an email to express interest in joining! You can also use this email to sign up for group volunteering options. Volunteer workdays are held on the third Saturday of each month.

Please wear comfortable clothes you do not mind getting dirty. Please bring layers or dress weather-appropriate.

Photo courtesy of Blueridge Center for Environmental Stewardship
date_notes: Specific times vary with opportunities, you will be notified when you select your project
organization_description: Protects Potomac River tributaries and the Chesapeake Bay watershed, preserves the Appalachian Trail, and conserves the natural habitat for hundreds of animal species.
addresses: ["11661 Harpers Ferry Road, Purcellville, VA, USA"]

headline: Animal Aid Society
short_description: Help dogs at a no-kill shelter!
content:
If you have a love for and confidence around dogs, the Animal Aid Society is the perfect place to volunteer! There are so many opportunities! The area of greatest need is helping clean out kennels, but volunteers can be a greeter for visitors, help transport newly adopted dogs, conduct maintenance around the property, help with administrative tasks, or help to familiarize dogs with humans.

Register online through this link. Then complete the online training course, download and email your certificate to volunteer@animalaidsociety.org. Once that is done, a staff member will reach out to get you started!

Parking is available onsite. 

Wear comfortable clothing you won't mind getting dirty or covered in pet hair.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Photo courtesy of Animal Aid Society
organization_description: Providing shelter, care and potential adoption for dogs around Hampton Roads. This no-kill shelter keeps all dogs until they are re-homed or fostered.
addresses: ["80 Butler Farm Road, Hampton, VA 23666, USA"]

headline: Ohana Homefront Foundation
short_description: Assist with fundraising, events or outreach.
content:
Ohana Homefront Foundation works to combat active duty and military veteran suicide through programs that support and uplift the military community. 

Volunteers can help out in various ways by either assisting with the fundraising or operations team, helping out at community events or conducting outreach to support OHF programs.

You must fill out this interest form, and a team member will be in contact to schedule an interview.
organization_description: Working to combat active duty and military veteran suicide through programs that support and uplift the military community.
addresses: ["Milford, VA, USA"]

headline: Armed Services YMCA of Hampton Roads
short_description: Work with military and military families at this YMCA.
content:
Volunteers at the Armed Services YMCA can help with everything from daily operations to special family programs. Volunteers can do desk work, help out with youth sports, or be a mentor for a program. One of the programs that they need mentors for is Operation Hero, a free after-school program for military children grades 2-8. Volunteers get to work directly with the kids, helping them with school work, socializing and more, all to assist in their coping with frequent moves and deployment separation. It is a great volunteer program to see the work you put in truly make a difference in a child's life.

 

Photo Courtesy of Armed Services YMCA of Hampton Roads
date_notes: Programs run after school and other opportunities are in the day.
organization_name: Armed Services YMCA of Hampton Roads
organization_description: The goal of ASYMCA is to provide a multitude of educational, recreational, and family programs that support military personnel, their spouses, and their children.
addresses: ["1465 Lakeside Rd, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Virginia Living Museum
short_description: Care for animals and their habitats!
content:
If you have an avid interest in animal welfare and/or environmental education this is a great volunteer opportunity for you! Volunteers can be involved with teaching museum visitors about the animals local to Tidewater Virginia, or work behind the scenes with the care and maintenance of both animals and their habitats.

Those 15 years or older can volunteer alone. Those 11-14 are welcome for family volunteering! Under 18 must have a parent or guardian fill out a waiver.

Volunteers should be available for a weekly shift.

Volunteers must submit a volunteer application depending on age. The organization will conduct an interview and screening, which will cost $12.50, before signing up for a shift.

Parking is available onsite.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 to 4 hours

Photo courtesy of Virginia Living Museum
organization_description: A museum where visitors are able to experience nature, meet animals and learn about the importance of conservation.
addresses: ["524 J Clyde Morris Blvd, Newport News, VA 23601, USA"]

headline: Soldier's Angels - At Home
short_description: Make baked goods and write letters for deployed troops.
content:
The Soldier's Angels organization exists to provide resources to active military, veterans and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.

You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and more. This can all be done from home, so it's a great activity to do with your kids! 

Register online to be a "Team Angel" here, then visit this page to select your baking opportunity!
organization_description: Soldier's Angels works to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["Fredericksburg, VA, USA"]

headline: Frederick Fresh Online
short_description: Sort and distribute goods from local farms to the community
content:
Help to sort and pack the local farm fresh goods that will be handed out to customers at various pickup locations around Frederick. Volunteers can also help with the distribution of food to customers.

Open to all ages. Comfortable shoes and clothes should be worn. Volunteers need every Wednesday from 3 - 7 PM. Shifts and opportunities vary in length of time.
organization_description: Working to create more food access and preserve the local food economy to benefit farmers, community members and the environment
addresses: ["2914 Roderick Road, Frederick, MD, USA", "3726 Clay St, Point of Rocks, MD 21777, USA", "6316 Mount Phillip Road, Frederick, MD 21703, USA", "723 N Market St, Frederick, MD 21701, USA"]

headline: SCORE Hampton Roads
short_description: Help support small businesses!
content:
Volunteers can sign up to share their industry experience or knowledge about running a business through online video seminars, leading meetings for your local SCORE chapter, helping people build meaningful relationships within their communities and so many other ways to help small businesses grow! This can be done from any virtual video platform!

Volunteers must have experience owning, running, or growing a business and be able to give time monthly.

After you submit an application, you will connect with your local chapter to find the best fit for your skills. 

Estimated duration of giveback opportunity: 15-20 hours a month.
organization_description: SCORE is a non-profit that is working to ensure the support and success of small business nationwide. They provide expertise and guidance through their platforms and volunteer groups.
addresses: ["Newport News, VA, USA"]

headline: Kidz Power Pacs
short_description: Pack food bags to feed school-aged children.
content:
Simply show up and help us pack kid-friendly food bags for our KPP kids!

Help pack the food bags once a month (normally 3rd weekend) at Eagle School Intermediate. Friday night, volunteers unload the truck. Saturday, the team gathers at 9 am for refreshments, followed by instructions and announcements at 9:30. Packing the food starts at 10 am and is typically done by noon. Please check the website for actual packing dates as the 3rd weekend may vary due to school breaks or school availability.

We are requesting food donations of soups, tuna fish, and To-Go peanut butter cups. For summer, we collect 16 oz jars of peanut butter and large boxes of cereal. All year we collect single toothbrushes, toothpaste and Christmas gifts.

Photo courtesy of Community Combined
date_notes: Usually the 3rd Saturday of each month, but could vary with school availability
organization_description: Kidz Power Pacs is a weekend, holiday break and summer feeding ministry for school aged children. KPP serves on average 1025+ children / 42 schools in Berkeley and Jefferson Counties, West Virginia.
addresses: ["TSR Inc, 796 Foxcroft Avenue, Martinsburg, WV, USA"]

headline: StandUp for Kids
short_description: Hand out hot meals and counsel homeless youth.
content:
Volunteer to serve hot meals to homeless youth at the StandUp for Kids Drop-In Center. Volunteers also provide games and crafts and snacks with the hope of making this somewhere that kids will look forward to turning to for support. Volunteers can even undergo a training series provided by StandUp for Kids to learn how to counsel and assist the youth. Another program to get involved in is the Street Outreach Program, which meets the youth where they are to make assistance more accessible.

The organization is also always grateful to receive donations of food and clothing.
date_notes: Apply for volunteering to sign up for days and times that work for your schedule!
organization_description: Stand Up for Kids is dedicated to ending the cycle of youth homelessness. They care for homeless and at-risk youth by transitioning them from crisis to connection. They give youth a sense of safety, hope, and belonging through housing support, mentoring, drop-in centers, and street outreach.
addresses: ["576 North Birdneck Road, Virginia Beach, VA, USA"]

headline: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center
short_description: Volunteer at this innovative and sustainable farm.
content:
Volunteers help throughout the year on projects like preparing the soil and garden beds, planting seedlings, harvesting, and processing fresh herbs, weeding garden beds, and helping with onsite fundraisers and events.

You will be working outdoors, so bring sun protection, and multiple layers if it is cold or water.

To volunteer, just contact Fox Haven through their website.
organization_name: Fox Haven Organic Farm & Learning Center
organization_description: A learning center established to address the environmental challenges threatening life on our planet and to find and develop local solutions to global problems.
addresses: ["3630 Poffenberger Road, Jefferson, MD 21755, USA"]

headline: Clean City Commission
short_description: Help benefit the environment around Hampton Roads!
content:
If you are passionate about the environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you! Volunteers are needed to conduct online research about litter and recycling, public awareness campaigns and other environmental issues around Hampton Roads.

Volunteers must have access to a library or computer for research.

Volunteers must fill out an interest form and select Education or General Information projects.

Estimated duration of activity: hours vary by project.

Photo courtesy of Hampton Clean City Commission
organization_description: This commission works to educate the citizens of Hampton and the greater Hampton Roads area about waste management, coastal awareness, and beautification and hopes for their participation.
addresses: ["Hampton Roads, Virginia, USA"]

headline: Jefferson County Community Ministries
short_description: Help this food pantry sort community donations.
content:
Volunteers are needed to help in sorting donations in the food pantry or clothing closet, day programs, and the cold weather shelter. Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes. Clothes cannot be too revealing or flashy. Please bring layers since some shifts may be outdoors.

Before beginning volunteering, you must attend a training session and shadow a volunteer prior to your first shift. 

Photo courtesy of Jefferson County Community Ministries
organization_description: Jefferson County Community Ministries, Inc. (JCCM) is a cooperative ministry of local churches that assists people in need.
addresses: ["238 West Washington Street, Charles Town, WV 25414, USA"]

headline: Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen
short_description: Serve meals and support local families in need.
content:
There are multiple options to help out at Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen. Volunteers can serve meals and sort donations at the soup kitchen. Volunteers can also help to drive families to ministry counseling appointments, assist in the counseling playroom to look after children up to 4 years old, and to clean houses and yards.

Volunteers should be able to commit 2 hours and be at least 18 years old (children younger than 18 years old can volunteer in the soup kitchen). Loaves and Fishes welcome groups as well as individual volunteers. Meal serving happens seven days a week. You can volunteer as much as you want or as little as once a month.
organization_description: Providing food and financial support to underserved and low-income communities around Berkeley County.
addresses: ["336 S Queen St, Martinsburg, WV 25401, USA"]

headline: Virginia Housing and Community Development Corporation
short_description: Help give resources to homeowners and families!
content:
Help educate and empower individuals, families and minority business owners to build wealth, access capital and credit, and achieve home ownership. Volunteers will guide homeowners on how to manage finances, rental home issues, home purchases, and credit management. They also have the opportunity to lead workshops about these various topics with a group. Volunteers must have finance or other industry knowledge. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is retired. 

Volunteers must be available for 4-10 hours a week (hours are negotiable).

Volunteers should be proficient with PC and Microsoft Office apps (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word).

If interested, apply here.
organization_name: Virginia Housing and Community Development Corporation
organization_description: A local organization that helps low-to-middle income families build wealth and provide them with the resources to adequately manage their finances.
addresses: ["445 North Main Street, Suffolk, VA, USA"]

headline: Patriot's Path
short_description: Support veterans and help boost their overall well-being!
content:
Volunteers will work to support veterans and their families with resume-building assistance, mock-interviewing, career path suggestions and advice or working as peer-to-peer mentors for mental, financial and wellness support.

Volunteers must have some career coaching experience. If interested, you can submit an interest application through this link and a team member will be in touch about getting you matched with a veteran and their family!

Coaching will take place through phone or video calls, so you must make sure you have a stable internet and phone connection.
date_notes: This is a virtual volunteer opportunity that vary for each case
organization_description: Veterans enroll in a 5-part course to help guide them both career-wise, education-wise, or financial-wise back into civilian life. The courses include workshops, mentoring, coaching and all other support needed for veterans and their families to thrive
addresses: ["Frederick, MD, USA", "Harpers Ferry, WV, USA"]

headline: ForKids
short_description: Help students from underserved and homeless populations!
content:
This organization is looking for tutors to help out with the Beyond the Bell Tutor Program. Volunteers would be matched with students to help them with studying and homework afternoon. No prior experience is needed, just a passion for helping!

Volunteers must fill out a volunteer application. Once received, they will reach out about completing a mandatory volunteer orientation.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours
organization_description: First opened as a homeless shelter, ForKids has expanded to help students from underserved and homeless populations receive educational support to excel in school.
addresses: ["1001 Poindexter Street, Chesapeake, VA 23324, USA", "119 West Constance Road, Suffolk, VA 23434, USA"]

headline: Madison Fields
short_description: Support this natural sanctuary that helps veterans relax.
content:
Madison Fields is committed to the preservation of its natural sanctuary for the benefit of the community. They believe in making places of healing, respite, and reflection accessible to those in the community struggling to cope with life’s many challenges, specifically socially underserved or isolated communities. Volunteers can support Equine Assistance Service, the Job Readiness Program, and help out around the grounds with maintenance or tending the gardens.

Before applying, read through this volunteer manual. Then, view this calendar and list of opportunities and sign up for one that you want to take part in!

Group volunteering options include sponsoring a therapy horse!

Volunteers must be 14 years or older, and those under 18 must a parent or guardian to be present with them. 

Photo courtesy of Madison Fields
organization_description: Committed to the preservation of the natural sanctuary we call Madison Fields for the benefit of our community. It is important that we make places of healing, respite, and reflection accessible to those in our community who are struggling to cope with life’s many challenges. Specifically socially underserved or isolated communities.
addresses: ["21355 Big Woods Rd, Dickerson, MD 20842, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers must be over 14, and those under 18 need a parent or guardian present"]

headline: Hoffler Creek Wildlife Preserve
short_description: Help preserve the Hoffler Creek Wildlife!
content:
The Hoffler Creek Wildlife Preserve is a privately owned parcel of land open to the public. Volunteers can choose to help with Saturday clean-ups or sign up for additional opportunities around the preserve. Volunteers must be willing to complete manual labor in various weather conditions. 

Volunteers must be 10 years or older; those younger than 16 must be accompanied by an adult. If interested in group volunteering opportunities, email hofflercreek@hofflercreek.org with the number of people and your desired time.

When you arrive at the preserve, you will be directed to the group of volunteers.

Bring bug spray, sunscreen, clothes for all weather conditions, water bottles and sturdy shoes.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

 

Photo courtesy of https://www.hofflercreek.org/volunteer
organization_description: This 145-acre parcel of land is used for education, conservation and research. The preserve also encourages visitors of all ages to explore its many trails!
addresses: ["4510 Twin Pines Road, Portsmouth, VA 23703, USA"]

headline: Williamsburg Community Growers
short_description: Help grow Williamsburg's health community!
content:
