Interested in helping to grow Williamsburg's health community and love to garden? This volunteer opportunity would be great for you! Volunteers will learn about planting and the importance of growing your own food while helping to tend to the gardens around the property. Volunteers must willing to complete manual labor in various weather conditions. 

Please wear close toes shoes and bring water, sunscreen, a sunhat and gloves as needed. 

Check out their Facebook Page for current opportunities!

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours

Photo courtesy of Grow Williamsburg
organization_description: A 10-acre community garden which is used for educational and research purposes. The garden grows food for local high schools and low-income neighborhoods.
addresses: ["5700 Warhill Trail, Williamsburg, VA 23188, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Virginia Peninsula Foodbank
short_description: Help those facing food insecurity!
content:
Help feed those facing food insecurity and sort through donated food to ensure that the food distributed by the Foodbank is safe to share with the community. Volunteers will assist with sorting donations, packing food boxes to be picked up or delivered, helping with some deliveries, inspecting non-perishable food items, and helping at special events.

Make sure you wear comfortable shoes and clothing that is not too revealing. Please note that you cannot bring in any large purses or backpacks. 

Location is determined by the timeslot or activity you choose to help out with.

Volunteers under 18 years must have a signed waiver!

The estimated duration of the event is 2 hours.
organization_description: Offering hunger relief to all citizen across the Hampton Roads area.
addresses: ["2401 Aluminum Ave, Hampton, VA 23661, USA"]

headline: Foodbank of Southeastern Virginia
short_description: Help underserved familes and offer food and other supplies!
content:
Volunteers will help out with sorting and packing groceries for distribution at the Youth and Family Nights. During these events, children are invited to learn about the importance of giving back to their communities through learning about the foodbank's work to feed families around Hampton Roads.

Sign up in advance for the Youth and Family Nights! Spaces fill up quickly.

Volunteers must be able to lift 35 pounds!

Group opportunities are available.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours
organization_description: Offering food and other supplies to underserved families around Hampton Roads and the Eastern Shore.
addresses: ["800 Tidewater Dr, Norfolk, VA 23504, USA"]

headline: Wesley Community Service Center
short_description: Help to clothe and feed those across Portsmouth!
content:
Help clothe and feed those part of underserved populations and experiencing homelessness across Portsmouth! Volunteers assist with picking up and sorting donations to the food pantry and clothing closet. Volunteers also assist in small office-based projects. 

Clothing donation help hours are Monday's 9 AM -1 PM and Food Panty Hours are Tuesdays 8 AM - 1 PM.

If you are interested, you must create a profile.

Wear comfortable clothes! Bring water or layers depending on the weather

The estimated duration of activity is 2 or more hours
organization_description: Works to help feed and cloth people experiencing homelessness or underserved populations across Portsmouth.
addresses: ["1701 Elm Avenue, Portsmouth, VA 23704, USA"]

headline: The Menchville House
short_description: Help homeless mothers and children!
content:
The Menchville House is a non-profit organization that offers shelter to mothers and children. Volunteers are able to assist in many different programs. From serving meals in the dining hall, tutoring children who are residents, helping to chaperone field trips and assisting with repairs and landscaping. 

The estimated duration of activity is 2 or more hours.

Location is given upon shift sign-up.

Please wear comfortable shoes and clothing that is not too revealing.  

Must fill out a volunteer application and a team member will be in contact!

 

Photo courtesy of Menchville House
organization_description: Offering shelter to homeless women and children to allow them to heal. The Menchville House allows mother's to become independent and contributing members of society.
addresses: ["Newport News, VA, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of Hampton Roads and Central VA
short_description: Help give appreciation to the military!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like military homecomings, training and/or deployments, concerts, holiday parties, booths at festivals, military appreciation day, and many more! You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across Hampton Roads.

Special Event Volunteers fill out an application and watch a short training video. USO Center Volunteers must register and fill out this application form and then watch a short training video.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Volunteers must be18 years or older. Some special events with a parent/guardian are available for those 13 and older.
organization_name: United Service Organization of Hampton Roads and Central VA
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families and country through programs which strenghten those bonds.
addresses: ["Hampton, VA, USA"]

headline: Disabled American Veteran's Charity - Newport News
short_description: Help disabled military veterans!
content:
Help and support disabled veterans through the programs at the Disabled American Veteran's Charity. Volunteers will be matched with their local VA hospital to help with patients, events and transportation from clinics, nursing homes or other facilities. Volunteers can also sign up to help out with grocery shopping or other household errands through the Veterans Assistance Program. Finally, there are opportunities to take home-bound veterans to medical or important appointments.

This opportunity will take place across Hampton Roads. The location will be determined when you sign up. Events will usually occur at your local VA hospital or clinic. 

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours.

Photo courtesy of Disabled American Veteran's Charity
organization_name: Disabled American Veteran's Charity - Newport News
organization_description: Ensuring a high-quality life to disable veterans through programs that connect them within their community, supporting their rights, and ensuring they receive and take advantage of their military benefits.
addresses: ["Hampton Roads, Virginia, USA"]

headline: Wildlife Rehab Center
short_description: Help wildlife recuperate!
content:
Volunteers can assist with animal care which encompasses working alongside experienced professionals to help with daily cleaning, diet preparation, and intake exams. There are also opportunities for hotline volunteers, wildlife taxi volunteers, and licensed sub-permittee volunteers (fostering). Using this link, you can find the volunteer applications.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours

Volunteers can volunteer from 8:00 am to 11:00 am or 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm.
organization_description: The Wildlife Rehab Center is a non-profit organization that offers resources for orphaned, abandoned, injured, or incapacitated wildlife. Serving more than 1800 animals a year, they have animal intake services where you can drop off animals for care.
addresses: ["1504 Union Ave NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49505, USA"]

headline: Michele's Rescue
short_description: Help dogs at a no-kill shelter!
content:
Volunteers can assist with adoption events, cleaning their cattery (located at Petsmart in Kentwood), cleaning the cat cafe (located in downtown Grand Rapids), making daily phone calls, and acting as messengers while picking up donations in the community.

Using this link, you can access the volunteer application.

Estimated duration of activity: 1- 3 hours
organization_description: Michele's rescue is a non-profit no-kill animal rescue that ensures the animals that come in are vaccinated, microchipped, treated, and spayed/ neutered. They offer adoptions for the rescued animals.
addresses: ["Grand Rapids, MI 49503, United States"]

headline: Pets on Wheels
short_description: Our volunteers and their pets make an important difference
content:
As described by Pets on Wheels: 

We bring the joy of friendly pet therapy to people all over the state of Maryland.  And we need volunteers to help improve lives and help lick loneliness one visit at a time.

Most people choose to become part of our volunteer therapy teams with their pets. Many others who don’t have an animal companion still volunteer their time and talents. If you don’t currently have a pet suitable for therapy work, we invite you to join us as one of our Volunteers Without Pets. Our VWPs serve as organizational supporters and ambassadors, helping with events, administration, fundraising, screenings and more, and are equally important to our organization. Contact info@petsonwheels.org to become a VWP.

It starts by filling out our volunteer application – we just require a time commitment of one hour each month to be an active volunteer.

A note about minors: Our insurance regulations do not allow anyone under age 18 to be the primary handler for our therapy teams. Individual facilities and events may welcome minors to visit along with an adult handler, however. If you want a younger family member to become involved, you will need to clear that with your chosen facility and fill out a Minor Release Form and send it to your local coordinator first.
organization_description: Pets on Wheels shares the love of friendly therapy pets to help improve life, connecting our pets with people to make a profound positive difference every day.
addresses: ["Nottingham, MD 21236, USA"]

headline: Luna's House
short_description: Any time you could spare to help the homeless animals of our
content:
Any time you could spare to help the homeless animals of our community could really make a difference. Donations of your time by becoming a Luna’s House Volunteer are truly priceless.

The first step in becoming a volunteer is to attend an orientation held on the second Wednesday of each month at 6:30. 

PLEASE NOTE: Preregistration is REQUIRED for Orientation.  

Please call our facility at (410) 671-2954 and select option five from the menu to sign up for New Volunteer Orientation.

Please complete the Volunteer Application and bring it to the New Volunteer Orientation for which you are registered. 

Luna's House is open during these hours:

Monday: 11:00 AM - 7:30 PM

Tuesday: CLOSED

Wednesday:11:00 AM - 7:30 PM

Thursday:11:00 AM - 7:30 PM

Friday:11:00 AM - 7:30 PM

Saturday:11:00 AM - 5:00 PM

Sunday:12:00 PM - 4:00 PM
date_notes: Closed on Tuesday
organization_description: Luna's House envisions a future of respect for and compassionate treatment of all companion animals, a future in which every animal is placed in the happy home he or she deserves.
addresses: ["2801 Pulaski Hwy, Edgewood, MD 21040, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering available for children 10 and up with waiver and accompanying adult."]

headline: End Hunger in Calvert County - Event Volunteers!
short_description: Help out at various events around Calvert County
content:
Are you looking for a great opportunity to give back with a group of people? End Hunger in Calvert County has multiple opportunities for groups to lend a hand at various events around the county!

Events are going on throughout the year! For example, The Dragon Boat Festival (Sunday, August 28th) has volunteer opportunities from August 24th - 28th to help out with event pre-set up, during the event, and break down of the event. Volunteers can assist with check-in, at boat launching at the beach, taking photos, event safety, traffic control and so much more! There is another opportunity for a group to volunteer in October at the Run to End Hunger (Sunday, October 15th) from October 11th - 15th to participate in both pre-event opportunities, such as route marking, or day-of opportunities like check-in, photo or video help and water station assistance.

Shifts are three hours and length and are throughout the day. You can select your preferred shifts as you complete your event registration form. Once that is complete, the volunteer coordinator will be in touch to help you finalize your registration and identify time slots! There is mandatory volunteer training that will occur before the events start.

For events, families are welcome but children should be 12 years or older. If you have any questions about participant ages, please email info@endhungercalvert.org.
organization_description: End Hunger in Calvert County pairs up with food pantries and shelters to provide food and goods to underserved populations around Calvert County. They also offer culinary lessons to offer participants skills to have a meaningful career in the food industry.
addresses: ["14200 Solomons Island Rd S, Solomons, MD 20688, USA", "North Beach Welcome Center, 9023 Bay Ave, North Beach, MD 20714, USA"]

headline: Oregon Humane Society
short_description: Walk, care for and train animals for youth and adults
content:
Oregon Humane Society has almost 3,000 volunteers working in a variety of ways. There is a youth volunteer program for ages 12-17, where kids can gather donations or work on projects from home or participate in long-term volunteering, where kids walk, groom and care for pets. This is a six-month commitment with regularly scheduled shifts.

Adult volunteer options include dog walks and runs, basic training, youth education programs assistance and more. There are also more administrative positions for those 18 and older, including data entry, phone reception work and helping customers at the retail store. OHS asks that volunteers commit to at least 12 hours a month for the first three months, then 8 hours a month afterward. There are costs for supplies for cat and administrative ($47), dog (57.50) and small animal ($47) handling volunteers.
organization_description: Oregon Humane Society is the biggest animal welfare organization in the Northwest with a vision to create "a world where all animals are treated with compassion kindness and respect".
addresses: ["1067 Northeast Columbia Boulevard, Portland, OR, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Costs towards onboarding, training and uniform.", "Volunteering for ages 12 and above!"]

headline: One Tail at a Time PDX
short_description: Pet walking, grooming, transportation and more volunteering
content:
Join the volunteer team that piques your interest! There is a dog walking and running team that focuses on on-leash exercise, a dog-transport team assisting in getting pups to and from the vet and events, event planning and fundraising teams, grooming teams and more. Whether your specialty is photography, cleaning or technology, if you are interested in volunteering, there is a job that fits that criteria. Volunteers must be 21 and older animal lovers looking to do their part! The location of volunteering is spread out all around Portland depending on sign-up.

Fill out the application to get started and get more information!
date_notes: Flexible time and dates based on Volunteer Team and objective!
organization_description: One Tail at a Time is an all-breed, no-kill foster based animal rescue that aims to care for, educate on and advocate for the humane treatment of companion animals.
addresses: ["Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: Soldier's Angels Portland
short_description: Send baked goods and letters to warm a soldier's day!
content: The Soldier's Angels organization exists to provide resources to active military, veterans and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all. You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and more. This can all be done from home, so it's a great activity to do with your kids! Register online to be a "Team Angel" here, and from there, select your baking opportunity!
date_notes: Virtual and remote activities can fit your schedule!
organization_description: Soldier's Angels works to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: [null]

headline: Compassion Clinic
short_description: Health clinic giving basic healthcare to those in need.
content:
The compassion clinic is looking for volunteers with experience in medical, dental, chiropractic, vision, foot care, physical therapy, social services and more. Volunteers work directly with patients in the Portland area who don't have access to basic healthcare. Clinics run between 6 and 12 hours on Fridays and Saturdays and occur up to 10 times a year. If you don't have the experience in patient care but are still looking to make a difference, there are teams available for outreach recruitment, to build connections with healthcare organizations and find volunteers, as well as supply management and sterilization volunteering.

Compassion Connected also has a few volunteer opportunities unrelated to health care, including the Bridal Shop Sales Associate, who works to help brides find dresses, and the money goes towards trafficking prevention, awareness and survivor support. There are also opportunities for youth mentoring, administrative volunteering and resource delivery.

A full breakdown of each team's job description, experience and time requirements are listed on the application page!

Photo Courtesy of Compassion Clinic
date_notes: Clinics run on Fridays/Saturdays, but volunteers are needed daily for other tasks
organization_description: Church led free community health clinic serving neighbors who lack basic health care access. The clinic also works towards supporting the communities youth, anti-trafficking movements and more.
addresses: ["12135 Southeast Lincoln Street, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: SCORE Portland
short_description: Professional advice to help local small businesses thrive!
content: Volunteers can sign up to share their industry experience or knowledge about running a business through online video seminars, leading meetings for your local SCORE chapter, helping people build meaningful relationships within their communities and so many other ways to help small businesses grow! If you have experience owning, running or growing a business, volunteering with SCORE is a great way to give back and share your knowledge to help other small businesses thrive! Volunteering is done virtually, and volunteers should be able to dedicate 5-15 hours a month to SCORE. To get started, fill out this interest form.
organization_description: SCORE is a non-profit that is working to ensure the support and success of small business nationwide. They provide expertise and guidance through their platforms and volunteer groups.
addresses: ["Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: The Children's Book Bank
short_description: Repair and donate books to help get kids involved in reading
content: The Children's Book Bank offers individual and group opportunities for volunteers to help advocate for their mission of getting families involved in reading! There are shifts for individuals to participate in book cleaning and repairs. Whether it is a ripped page that needs some tape or a scribble to erase, volunteers know they are doing their part to get the best quality books in the hands of kids in Portland. Sing up for your shift here. You can also bring along book donations for your shift. Read-aloud books in any language are appreciated! Waivers are required to bring with you and volunteers must be 10 years or older with an adult and 15 or older unaccompanied. The book bank is always looking for drivers (21+) who can deliver the books to local elementary schools and community organizations! All skills and special talents are welcome for volunteering, whether web help or mural designs, so email brittany@childrensbookbank.org if you have any unique ideas to help the book bank! Here is the total list of volunteer opportunities and contacts.
date_notes: Sign up for 2 hour shifts when it fits in your schedule!
organization_description: The Children's Book Bank focuses on improving child literacy by getting books in children's hands that are inclusive, curious and encouraging. Last year, they helped every preschooler in the county receive a bag of 15 books to bring home - in both Spanish and English!
addresses: ["The Children's Book Bank, Northeast 7th Avenue, Portland, OR, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering available for children 10 and up with waiver and accompanying adult."]

headline: The Shadow Project
short_description: Package learning tools and tutor to empower students!
content:
There are many ways to work with kids through the Shadow Project to help them grow confidence to excel in the classroom.

Individuals and groups of up to 15 enjoy volunteering on weekdays in the warehouse to package fun and educational tools for kids! These shifts run for 2-4 hours.

You can also volunteer as a reading mentor who meets with students K-8 in the Portland Metro public skills. Work one-on-one with students virtually or in person for up to two hours weekly. Programs are generally during the school day, and reading mentors are encouraged to commit to 3 months at a time. There is an interview, training and orientation process before each 3-month cycle beginning for new tutors. References and background checks are required.

Additional volunteer options include sitting on the Community Advisory Board or working with data entry and fundraising support virtually.
date_notes: Most volunteering occurs on weekdays during school hours
organization_description: The Shadow Project works towards making schools accessible and engaging for kids with learning challenges because they believe that school should be a place that every kid can thrive and grow.
addresses: ["2154 NE Broadway, Portland, OR, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Age Requirement - Reading mentors must be over 18"]

headline: Forest Park Conservancy
short_description: Lend a hand in forest cleanups and stewardship hikes
content:
Forest Park Conservancy has many opportunities for those who want to spend time in Forest Park. The events calendar is always filled with volunteer work parties, free public events, guided hikes, and more; all meant to maintain the park and inspire stewardship. If you are able to offer more commitment, look into their Volunteer Leadership Opportunities, which include joining the Rapid Response Team to survey trails after storms, Forest Park Ambassadors who welcome folks at trailheads, and more! 

All participants are expected to wear close-toed shoes, dress appropriately for the weather, and bring any medications they believe they might need. To see all scheduled events, check here. To learn more about their leadership opportunities, read more here. 

Other Helpful Info: Approx. shift time is 2+ hours. Volunteer and public event schedules change every month. Refer to their Event Calendar for the most up-to-date schedule. To sign up for events, you need to make an account through FPC’s volunteer system, which can also be accessed using the Get Connected app on mobile devices.

Language Provided by Mikey Brooks, Forest Park Conservancy Communications Coordinator
date_notes: Time and days of cleanup events change every month
organization_description: Works towards maintaining trails, restoring native habitats and protecting Nashville greenspace to inspire community appreciation and stewardship!
addresses: ["833 Southwest 11th Avenue, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: Friends of Tryon Creek
short_description: Maintain trails, teach about wildlife and greet visitors
content: Work with nature by volunteering with Friends of Tryon Creek. Positions include the Summer Trail Crew that meets every third Thursday of the month to help maintain trails through labor, becoming a Nature Center Ambassador who welcomes visitors and answers questions from the Nature Store and working at the Saturday Interpretive Program, where you can answer visitors questions about interpretive tables filled with wildlife, plants and artifacts. Park Rangers teach you all you need to know for each volunteer opportunity, so no background knowledge is required. Sign up here.
organization_description: Friends of Tyron Creek aims to connect this urban forest with the surrounding community through educational and inclusive programs and events and offer an outdoor oasis for all visitors to create a relationship with nature.
addresses: ["11321 South Terwilliger Boulevard, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: Friends of Trees
short_description: Grow a tree to improve your environment and community
content: Friends of Trees holds great community volunteering events in the Portland metro area and two other locations. Volunteer to be a tree planter from October through June, which are the best planting months. It is a great way to get outside, do something for the community and have fun as you see the physical result of your volunteering! Volunteers are guided on how to plant trees and tools are provided. Volunteering is available for ages 6 and up, and you must sign up for the events prior by looking at the events calendar which has RSVP links attached. Groups and individuals are encouraged to join in on the fun!
date_notes: Planting days are held most Saturdays October-April
organization_description: Friends of Trees is inspired to improve the world and community by planting trees together! Their inclusive and equitable program inspires large groups of communities to get outside, contribute positively to their native ecosystem and enjoy nature and each other while doing so.
addresses: ["3117 NE Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: The Oregon Food Bank
short_description: Pack food, distribute meals, plant in the garden and more!
content: There are plenty of events to sign up for to work with the Oregon Food Bank almost every day of the week. Volunteer to pack food at one of the central locations, distribute meals, work in the garden, advocate for local government or partake in administrative work. When signing up you can select events that fit in your schedule and decide which location is best for you- or even complete a volunteer activity from your own home! There are so many great ways to get involved with this positive and driven community, Begin your efforts by filling out the New Volunteer Application for yourself and any others who are volunteering with you, then check out the events calendar to sign up for any that interest you! If there is an age restriction, it says so on the event sign-up. Many of the events are 12+ or 16+, so note that if you are looking for a full family volunteer activity.
organization_description: The Oregon Food Bank works towards eliminating hunger in their communities by not only providing food to anyone in need, but also starting at the root of the problem by working across systems with social and racial justice in mind with every decision made. The bank works hard because they believe that food is a basic human right and that they can take action together to end hunger.
addresses: ["7900 Northeast 33rd Drive, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: Meals on Wheels People
short_description: Provide food and social connections to the lives of seniors
content: Volunteer opportunities include driving for meal deliveries to seniors, kitchen support, remote-friendly chats online for socialization, wellness check calls, and even assisting in projects such as home repairs and safety improvements. Volunteering options can be in-person, remote or contactless, so it is a great way to be as involved and time flexible as you need. New volunteers create an account and then watch a brief training video. Then, there is a portal for scheduling shifts.
organization_description: Meals on Wheels People has a mission of improving the lives of seniors by providing food and human connections with a goal of eliminating hunger or feelings of social isolation.
addresses: ["7710 Southwest 31st Avenue, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: Refugee Care Collective
short_description: Create a care kit to help a family adjust to Portland life
content: Get involved in Refugee Care Collective through restart kit creation, family mentorship and youth mentorship programs. The best way to help is by making a restart kit for the next collection day. Here is the information for what type of restart kit it needed, how to build a restart kit, and when to drop one off at a warehouse. Restart kits consist of gently used or new products relating to one of the eight essential household item categories. There are kists of everything you need and you can RSVP with what you are bringing! If you have over 10 restart kits, you can schedule a separate drop-off time, but the warehouse is not regularly staffed so this must be in advance. There is no age or number limit on this volunteer activity, so get your family, friends or office involved! Mentor programs take volunteers who know Oregon well and are looking to commit to meeting weekly with a refugee or refugee family to help them adjust.
date_notes: Drop off dates occur every few months and are specified on website!
organization_description: Refugee Collective supports and serves refugees that are resettled in the Portland Metro area to assist and empower them in rebuilding their lives through a sustainable process involving restart kits and resettlement programs and mentorship.
addresses: ["7710 Southwest 31st Avenue, Portland, OR, USA"]

headline: With Love Oregon
short_description: Wash, organize and package donations for foster families
content:
Volunteer for With Love to encourage and support foster families. Volunteers wash, inspect and sort donations to get the care packages ready to send! Volunteers can help on their own time by washing the clothes from home. Sign up from the event calendar and pick up the bins on Wednesday between 11:30 am - 1 pm and then drop them back off the following week at the same time. WithLove asks that you inspect the clothes and then fold and sort them before returning to the bins. Laundry volunteer shifts fill up quickly, but you can also volunteer as a team volunteer, where you will sort the donations based on the needs of the foster families and create the care packages. Team volunteers must be over 10 and must be accompanied by an adult. Shifts run for 2 hours and sign-ups are available here on the website after you create a volunteer account. New opportunities and days are always being added, so keep checking the live calendar for opportunities!

There is also always a need for donations, such as bedding, clothes and toys.
date_notes: Laundry volunteer pickup/drop off is on Wednesdays
organization_description: With Love Oregon is a non profit organization that supports foster families with clothing and supplies for ages 0-6 to offer hope and ease their stresses, so they can focus on the children.
addresses: ["14555 SW 74th Ave, Tigard, OR 97224, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering available for children 10 and up with waiver and accompanying adult."]

headline: Craft + Boogie Collective
short_description: Hand make craft kits to ship to kids in need!
content: Craft + Boogie Collective is run 100% by volunteers who want to give back to children through giving access to fun activities. Volunteers make all of the craft kits by hand. They are packaged and then shipped directly to foster children and families in need. If you are interested in joining in on one of the craft packing party days, fill out the volunteer form. Volunteers of all ages can participate and parties are held all throughout the year.
organization_description: Craft + Boogie Collective makes children feel loved by shipping craft kits to foster families, students in under-resourced communities, and families in need of relief. The crafts hope to make kids feel special and accomplished.
addresses: ["8295 Southwest Cirrus Drive, Beaverton, OR, USA"]

headline: Nashville Humane Association
short_description: Work with dogs and cats in the shelter!
content: Pet lovers can volunteer at NHA for hands-on animal or administrative work! There are five teams within the volunteer program: Dog Care Team, Cat Care Team, Community Outreach Team, Pet Services Team and Shelter Operations Team. There are so many great options, from walking dogs to assisting with pet adoptions! Volunteers are asked to commit to 6 hours a month for at least 6 months. There is a training course with both online and in-person components. Volunteers must be 16 for independent volunteering or 13 for volunteering with a parent or adult. Apply for individual volunteering here or read more information on each volunteer team. There is also a 2-hour group and corporate volunteering option for up to 20 people with a minimum donation requirement.
organization_description: Nashville Humane Association works to house shelter pets into loving homes, while educating about humane treatment and caring for each homeless animal.
addresses: ["213 Oceola Avenue, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Agape Animal Rescue
short_description: Support foster dogs with walks, drives and adoption events
content: Volunteer opportunities are available for all skill sets. Agape Animal Rescue and Training Center needs people who can drive pets to local events and appointments, go on dog walks, volunteer at events, and facilitate adoptions. They are also looking for volunteers with skillsets in design/illustration or writing! There are events annually that need volunteers prior and during, so there is always an option to offer up even just an hour of your time. There is no central location for the rescue since it uses a system of foster homes in Nashville to place and care for the dogs, so many volunteer opportunities are at adoption events. Events will have sign-ups and guidelines are available ahead of time, so you know what you are doing before you arrive.
organization_description: Improving the lives of homeless animals through a caring and educational environment on humane and responsible pet ownership.
addresses: ["Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Humane Society of Charlotte
short_description: Help dogs and cats at a no-kill shelter!
content:
Volunteers can help with animal care, spend one on one time with cats, help with customer service, help with back-office work such as fundraising, help with the spay/neuter clinic and special events.

They also offer volunteer opportunities for little kids.

Estimated duration of activity: 3-4 hours
organization_description: A no-kill shelter that provides resources and services including behavior & training, lost & found pets, pet loss, pet welness clinics, and rehoming services. They keep their cats and dogs until foster or adoption.
addresses: ["The Humane Society of Charlotte, Parker Drive, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA"]

headline: North Mecklenburg Animal Rescue
short_description: Help animals at a no-kill shelter!
content:
Those who would like to work with shelter help (dog walking, kennel support, and shelter enrichment) can walk dogs from Monday- Sunday between 8:30 and 11:30. For those interested in doggy dates, you can meet the dogs and find the best match to take out for hikes, breweries, etc.

For those under 18 and interested in volunteering, the organization has a junior volunteer program for teenagers. Some activities might include holding a shelter donation drive/fundraiser, holding an animal rescue party, or sponsoring a dog.

Doggy Dates are available only in the summer. Shelter help can be 8:30-11:30 Monday through Sunday.
organization_description: North Mecklenburg Animal Rescue is a "no-kill animal rescue in Charlotte NC. Helping to end pet abandonment, abuse, and neglect". They have various opportunities to help walk dogs, help in the shelter or even fundraising opportunities for junior volunteers!
addresses: ["St Andrew's United Methodist, Archdale Drive, Charlotte, NC, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Comfortable Around Animals", "Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Volunteering for ages 12 and above!"]

headline: Lutheran Social Services - Delaware Food Pantry
short_description: Support underserved populations across Delaware County
content:
Lend a hand and help to distribute groceries to Delaware County residents facing food insecurity struggles.

Lutheran Social Services serves Central Ohio and its population of underserved communities to help address food insecurity issues and work to support communities through providing shelf stable meals, medical care and shelter to those who are homeless. Volunteers are needed to help pack and distribute shelf-stable groceries at the Delaware LSS Food Pantry Site.

To sign up, all you need to do is click the "Join" button on the desired date and time located on the volunteering webpage here. You will be prompted to create an account before you can confirm your spot. Once you've selected your desired time to volunteer, the food pantry organizer will be in touch with day-of details!

Time slots are either Tuesdays from 3:30 - 6:30 pm or Thursdays from 9:30 - 1 pm.
organization_description: Helping to address food security across Central OH by providing meals, health care, shelter and resources to underserved communities or people experiencing personal crisis.
addresses: ["50 Ross St, Delaware, OH 43015, USA"]

headline: Digital Page
short_description: Help women in the digital technology and design space!
content:
Volunteers can help mentor young women by sharing their leadership skills and professional experience. Volunteers will work with students and the Core Leadership Team to provide expertise, guide, and help develop training programs.

Volunteers should be business professionals with experience.
organization_description: Digital Page works to close the gender gap in the digital technology and design space. They help empower and educate women through different programs. They provide education and training courses, pair them with different companies that need creative digital solutions, and support the startups of aspiring female entrepreneurs.
addresses: ["Charlotte, NC, USA"]

headline: Apparo
short_description: Help non-profits with business and technology solutions!
content: Volunteers can serve in five different capacities. Volunteers can spend their time as project volunteers to help deliver solutions to nonprofits in need, as project managers to facilitate technology projects, provide advice and guidance to nonprofits, provide education and training on technology topics, and help with their auction committee.
organization_description: Apparo partners with corporations to provide technology and business solutions to nonprofits to allow them to work more efficiently. They also provide IT education and training courses to nonprofits.
addresses: ["Charlotte, NC, USA"]

headline: Learners Help Center of Charlotte
short_description: Support refugees and immigrants.
content:
Volunteers can help serve in various opportunities, including reading and math assistance, tutoring and mentoring, marketing and social media, and more.

Estimated duration of activity: 1-3 hours

Volunteers should fill out an application and child protection policy.
organization_description: LHCC is an organization that provides scholastic, spiritual social support to underserved refugees and immigrants. They provide programs for the community which include after-school literacy enrichment, homework and reading support, Summer reading, literacy and enrichment camps, family stabilization, community events and weekend sports, spiritual and family enrichment.
addresses: ["St Andrew's United Methodist, Archdale Drive, Charlotte, NC, USA"]

headline: Trees Charlotte
short_description: Help plant trees in Charlotte!
content:
Volunteers can help plant trees, pack and distribute seedlings, and more! No prior experience is needed. After opening remarks during your volunteer session, TreeMasters/lead volunteers will show you how to plant a tree. Shovels and rakes will be provided. Tree plantings will continue regardless of rain or sunshine. Bring work gloves, and wear long pants and close-toed shoes. You are working outdoors, so wear sun protection or layers when necessary!

Estimated duration of activity: 1-3 hours
organization_description: TreeCharlotte helps to build Charlotte's urban forest by educating on how to plant and preserve trees. Focusing on underserved communities, they help build Charlotte's tree canopy.
addresses: ["701 Tuckaseegee Rd, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA"]

headline: Catawba Riverkeeper
short_description: Help keep the river clean!
content:
Volunteers can help with cleanups, the trash trap program, collecting water samples for testing, helping with recycling fishing lines, or special events. Bring work gloves, and wear long pants and close-toed shoes. Working outdoors so sun protection or layers if cold!

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours

For group volunteering, email Lauren.h@catawbariverkeeper.org

For a corporate clean up, email Vanessa.c@catawbariverkeeper.org
organization_description: The Catawba Riverkeeper helps to preserve, protect and restore the water of the Catawba- Wateree River Basin through education, advocacy, and more.
addresses: ["115 Willow Dr, McAdenville, NC 28101, USA"]

headline: Feeding the Carolinas
short_description: Help feed your neighbours!
content:
Volunteers will help gather and sort food from donations and pack them for distribution to different regions. Volunteers can also help with special events and projects. Volunteering opportunities are available in different locations. All volunteers must wear gloves. They are provided, but if you have some, please bring your own.

Estimated duration of activity: 3-4 hours

If interested in group volunteering, follow this link.
organization_description: Feeding the Carolinas has 10 Food Banks in North and South Carolina. They tie up with local charitable agencies to help provide healthy, adequate, and consistent food supply to their communities.
addresses: ["6255 Towncenter Dr, Clemmons, NC 27012, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Second Harvest Food Bank of Metrolina
short_description: Help feed your neighbours!
content:
Volunteers can help sort food and non-food products in their Charlotte warehouse. They might need help with certain special events as well.

Volunteers between the ages of 13-16 must be accompanied by an adult who is 21+. There must be one adult per 4 youths. 

For group volunteering, email Betsy Van Dyne at bvandyne@secondharvest.org or call 704-376-1785.

There is a training session before volunteering.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours
organization_name: Second Harvest Food Bank of Metrolina
organization_description: Second Harvest Food Bank is an organization that provides services to help feed children, seniors, families, and pets and offers school-based programs as well as disaster relief.
addresses: ["500 Spratt Street b, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA"]

headline: Samaritan House
short_description: Help homeless men and women!
content:
Samaritan House is a not-for-profit organization. Volunteers can help with landscaping, meal prep, and service of meals.

There are volunteer opportunities for those under 18, but an adult must chaperone them. One adult must be present per 8 youth.

Application for General Volunteering: Link (thesamaritanhouse.org/general-volunteer-policy)
Application to Meal Prep and Service: Link (thesamaritanhouse.org/meal-prep-%26-serve)

Estimated duration of activity: 1-2 hours
organization_description: Samaritan House is a short-term recuperation center in a home-like setting for men and women experiencing homelessness. They provide guests with clean bedrooms. bath facilities, nutritious meals, and transportation.
addresses: ["611 Fortune St, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Roof Above Inc.
short_description: Help the homeless in Charlotte!
content:
Volunteers can help assist with services such as helping as a shower attendant, laundry attendant, on the front desk/ phone desk, in the resource center, or as a mail sorter. Volunteers can also help serve shelter meals, hold collection drives and bring and serve drinks.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-4 hours
organization_description: Roof Above serves the homeless population by providing services and housing programs. They believe every individual should have a home that provides safety, stability, and dignity.
addresses: ["1210 N Tryon St, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA", "945 North College Street, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA"]

headline: Veterans Bridge Home
short_description: Help veterans and their families!
content:
Volunteers can help veterans with various programs such as the Battle Buddy Program or the Crisis Assistance Ministry. Volunteers can also help at the front desk to make veterans and their families feel more comfortable and assist with check-in guests, center activities and other programs.

Virtual opportunities are available.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-4 hours
organization_description: Veterans Bridge Home is an organization that serves veterans and their families transition home at any stage by providing resources to veterans to help them navigate employment, create social connections and settle their families.
addresses: ["5260 Parkway Plaza Blvd suite 110, Charlotte, NC 28217, USA"]

headline: Patriot's Path
short_description: Help veterans in Charlotte!
content: Volunteers can help with different opportunities such as being a resume facilitator, mock interview coach, job shadowing mentor, or military to civilian mentor (peer-to-peer support.)
organization_description: Veterans enroll in a 5-part course to help guide them both career-wise, education-wise, or financial-wise back into civilian life. The courses include workshops, mentoring, coaching and all other support needed for veterans and their families to thrive
addresses: ["Charlotte, NC 28247, USA"]

headline: Richmond SPCA
short_description: Help animals at a no-kill shelter!
content:
Volunteers can spend time at the Robins-Starr Humane Center, the Susan M. Markel Veterinary Hospital, or on community assignments. Opportunities at these locations might include dog walking, doing the dishes, kennel cleaning, and more Volunteers must commit to giving four hours of service each month for four months.

All volunteers must submit an online application. If they are well suited, they can set up a virtual meet and greet.

Estimated duration of activity: 1-7 hours

Below are the different hours of different offices/ locations.

Adoption Center: Mon (12:00pm- 5:00 pm) Tue-Fri (12:00pm- 7:00 pm) Sat (11:00pm- 6:00 pm) Sun (12:00pm- 5:00 pm)

Donation Drop Off: Mon (8:00am- 5:00 pm) Tue-Fri (8:00am- 7:00 pm) Sat (11:00am- 6:00 pm) Sun (12:00pm- 5:00 pm)

Vet Hospital: Mon-Fri (8:00am- 6:00 pm)

Admin Hours: Mon-Fri (8:00am- 5:00 pm)

Gift Shop: Mon (12:00pm- 5:00 pm) Tue-Fri (12:00pm- 7:00 pm) Sat (11:00pm- 6:00 pm) Sun (12:00pm- 5:00 pm)
organization_description: A no-kill shelter dedicated to saving the lives of dogs and cats and advocating for animals. They provide many services for animals including medical treatment, behavior rehabilitation, and more!
addresses: ["2519 Hermitage Road, Richmond, VA 23220, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers must be 14 years or older to work with cats", "Volunteers must be 16 years or older to work with dogs", "Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: SOAR 365
short_description: Help young disabled children and adults.
content: Volunteers can help in many different opportunity areas, including event support, beautification, admin support, program support, and joining the Next-Generation Council. The Next Generation Council is for professionals between the ages of 21-45 years and meets every other month to lead initiatives benefitting SOAR365.
organization_description: SOAR365 offers programs for disabled individuals offering services including pediatric therapy services, adult and youth day services, SOAR365 business solutions, and respite and summer camp.
addresses: ["3600 Saunders Ave, Richmond, VA 23227, USA"]

headline: Love of Learning
short_description: Serve low income children!
content:
Volunteers can help by holding book drives, handing out flyers, reading aloud to children, and more!

See if being a read-aloud volunteer is good for you by following this link. Check out details on how to hold a book drive guide here.

Estimated duration of activity: 1-2 hours
organization_description: Love of Learning is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering children from low-income families through literacy initiatives. They provided children from low-income, at-risk families books as well as low-income housing, shelters, and feeding programs.
addresses: ["Richmond, VA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Varies by event.", "Volunteering for ages 16 and above!"]

headline: Richmond Peace Education Center
short_description: Help promote social justice through peace!
content: Volunteers can help in different areas of interest, including advocacy and activism, fundraising, tabling at local events, youth programs, special events, helping at the office, and writing and editing.
organization_description: Richmond Peace Education Center promotes nonviolence and social justice by offering a different path to individuals through different programs.
addresses: ["Richmond Peace Education Center, 4500 Kensington Avenue, Richmond, VA 23221, USA"]

headline: Capital Trees
short_description: Help make Richmond greener!
content: Volunteers can help on volunteer work days with activities such as gardening and planting trees. No prior expertise is needed to plant trees. Tools, expertise and gloves are provided. Please note that there will be physical activity involved, such as bending, lifting, pulling, and kneeling. If needed, tasks can be modified. There are more opportunities available in different areas of expertise, including landscape design, urban planning, fundraising, social media, and more!
organization_description: Capital Trees works with private and public entities to make Richmond a greener city by creating public landscapes that help with community building, environmental stability, economic investment and build healthier lifestyles.
addresses: ["South 3rd Street, Richmond, VA, USA"]

headline: The Nature Conservancy - Virginia
short_description: Help the environment in Virginia.
content:
Volunteers can choose different volunteer work categories, including office work, outdoor work, and specific skills. 

Locations vary around Virginia, Maryland, and other surrounding areas. These include the Piedmont Area, Charlottesville, the Tidewater Area, Richmond Southeast, Norfolk-Chesapeake, Northern Virginia, Arlington, Bethesda Southwest, Abingdon, Eastern Shore, Nassawadox, Western Mountains, and Hot Springs.

Volunteers that help with office work need to be available from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm from Monday to Friday; some work can be done remotely.
organization_description: The Nature Conservancy is a global organization working to conserve land and water.
addresses: ["530 E Main St #800, Richmond, VA 23219, USA"]

headline: Feed More
short_description: Help the hungry in Central Virginia!
content:
Volunteers can help to deliver meals, sort, and package food in their warehouse, prepare and pack meals in their kitchen, and assist with their hunger hotline.

Estimated duration of activity: 20 minutes - 3 hours

The days and timings of volunteer opportunities are dependent on the types of opportunities. 

Warehouse: Tuesdays and Thursdays 9:00 am to 11:30 am and Fridays 9:00 am to 12:00 pm

Kitchen Opportunities: Monday-Friday 7:30 am to 4:00 pm

Children's Program Opportunities: Tuesdays from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm and Wednesdays from 1:00 om to 3:30 pm
organization_description: Feed More is an organization that provides hunger relief throughout Central Virginia by preparing and distributing foods. Together with Meals on Wheels and the Central Virginia Food Bank, they built a joint kitchen to create cooked-from-scratch meals for neighbors in need.
addresses: ["1415 Rhoadmiller St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA"]

headline: Chesterfield Food Bank
short_description: Help the hungry in your community!
content:
Volunteers can help with short-term and long-term work and choose to be a part of four different programs, including the general volunteer program, skilled volunteer program, community service program, and client plus program. Opportunities in these areas include warehouse work, food distribution, driving trucks, food drives, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 2 - 6 hours

Locations will change depending on the volunteer shift you choose.
organization_description: Chesterfield Food Bank fights hunger by providing their community with basic needs and through food outreach programs, community outreach programs, resource programs, and volunteer programs.
addresses: ["12211 Iron Bridge Road, Chester, VA 23831, USA"]

headline: Home Again
short_description: Help the homeless in Richmond!
content:
Volunteers can choose to volunteer in one of the three emergency housing shelters, The Espigh Family Shelter, Men's Shelter, and the Veterans Shelter, or help with the offsite projects. Volunteers can help as skills-based instructors, technology instructors, landscaping/ maintenance, photographer, organizational support, front desk support, children's activities, and hold donation drives.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours
organization_description: HomeAgain provides safe, decent, and affordable housing to the homeless men, women, children, and veterans in the Richmond area.
addresses: ["5 E Franklin St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA"]

headline: Caritas
short_description: Help the homeless in Richmond!
content:
For more than 30 years, CARITAS has provided effective, permanent solutions to community members dealing with the crisis of homelessness and/or substance use disorder in the Richmond area. 

Its five programs include The Healing Place, The Emergency Shelter, The Furniture Bank, CARITAS Works, and the CARITAS Recovery Residences. Through these programs, CARITAS provides men and women with the tools to make a successful transition to dignity and self-sufficiency. You can learn about all of the organization’s services at www.caritasva.org. 

There are many ways to support CARITAS's work. Help collect needed items (such as furniture, housewares, bedding, and more), provide meals (for The Shelter, Works, and The Healing Place), and more. View all of their volunteer opportunities here: https://www.caritasva.org/give-help/volunteer/. 

Other Helpful Info: New on-site volunteers must complete the application and orientation before volunteering. Orientations are held every Wednesday at 1:00 pm. In addition, all onsite volunteers must provide proof of vaccination. Follow CARITAS on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter for updates and urgent needs. For specific volunteer needs and questions, please contact volunteer@caritasva.org.

Language provided by CARITAS Volunteer Coordinator
organization_description: Caritas provides effective, permanent solutions to individuals and families dealing with the crisis of homelessness and- or addiction in Richmond.
addresses: ["Embrace Richmond - Food Distribution Center, 1125 Commerce Rd, Richmond, VA 23224, USA"]

headline: Tech for Troops
short_description: Help give veterans access to technology!
content: Volunteers will get a tour of the facility and details from staff about daily operations and will learn how to break down computers, filter computer parts, clean laptops, and more! Volunteers must sign a waiver and photo release form.
organization_description: Tech for Troops refurbishes laptops and other devices to provide veterans and those serving active duty in the military at low or no cost. They also provide training to veterans to teach them how to use the device.
addresses: ["Tech For Troops, 4840 Waller Rd, Richmond, VA 23230, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Signed Photo Release"]

headline: Operation Enduring Warrior
short_description: Help veterans and their families!
content: Volunteers can assist with being honoree support team members, coordinate travel programs, run booths at events, and edit videos. Volunteer opportunities change depending on the needs of the organization.
organization_description: Operation Enduring Warrior honors, empowers, and motivates, wounded military and law enforcement veterans through physical, mental, and emotional rehabilitation.
addresses: ["14241 Midlothian Turnpike #209, Midlothian, Virginia, United States"]

headline: Dismas House
short_description: Mentor, tutor or serve dinner to recently released prisoners
content:
Volunteers at Dismas House can participate in mentorship or event volunteering. The mentorship program is a weekly time commitment. Volunteers are asked to use their experiences for life coaching, goal setting, and career support while also building more personal connections with the residents. There is also a tutoring mentorship position to help with college assignments. Mentors have to go through training before volunteering, which is held monthly.

If you are looking for a more flexible volunteer opportunity, they are always looking for volunteers for community dinners. Dinners are Monday through Thursday at 6 pm, and volunteers plan the menu, shop for the groceries and arrive at least a half hour early to prepare the meal. The meal is then shared by community members and returning citizens. Here is the sign-up link.

All new volunteers must fill out this volunteer interest form before signing up or training for either opportunity.
date_notes: Time is flexible based on position chosen
organization_description: Dismas House assists people released from prison in re-entering the community, with mentorship and housing programs to support their basic needs, physical and mental health, life skills and legal support.
addresses: ["2424 Charlotte Ave, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Mending Hearts Nashville
short_description: Use your life skills to serve women in addiction recovery
content:
Volunteer opportunities that assist women in addiction recovery include mentoring, education and tutoring, recreational support, and reception work. Other volunteer options require specific work experience, like dentists, dental hygienists, and healthcare providers. Volunteers are embraced for any life skills and experience they may have to help benefit the women they are serving.

Photo courtesy of Mending Hearts Nashville.
date_notes: Flexible hours
organization_description: Mending Hearts is a liscenced and accredited treatment program that assists women through the process of substance abuse recovery through their 6 thoughtful care programs.
addresses: ["Mending Hearts Inc, 44th Avenue North, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Turnip Green Creative Reuse
short_description: Save materials from the trash to make crafts!
content:
Volunteer in the reuse center or at home! Volunteers work with the Reuse Specialists at the center to detangle and gather materials, create fun scrap packs to send out to students and artists, stock the shelves, or process donations. All volunteer workers get to learn about how they are keeping usable materials out of landfills. Any particular artistic skill is great to have while you're volunteering but not necessary. If you have a green thumb, you can also volunteer in the community garden! If you are looking for at-home volunteering, email volunteer@turnipgreencreativereuse.org to schedule take-home kit pickup and drop-off so you can sort and package the materials from home! Those over 21 can participate in a Pick Up for a Pint activity, where you spend an hour picking up trash and receive a beer token to use at Jackalope! All volunteer activities, art classes and more are listed on the event calendar.

Photo courtesy of Turnip Green Creative Reuse
organization_description: A nonprofit that diverts usable materials from landfills for creative use in art and education by connecting the supplies to teachers, students and artists! They aim to inspire and educate the correct usage of reduce, reuse then recycle and give everyone the opportunity to do so.
addresses: ["407 Houston Street, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: PENCIL
short_description: Tutor students or work at free school supply shop!
content:
PENCIL offers volunteer opportunities to work with students and supply them with the necessary resources to succeed. Work directly with students on math and reading through their Accelerating Scholars Tutoring program, a three-time-a-week 30-minute session for a total of 10 weeks. It is currently online, requires a free background check, and requires two two-hour training sessions prior. The tutor application is available at https://brightpath.goschoolbox.com/apply. You can also volunteer at DG PENCIL Box, the free school supply store for Metro Nashville Public School Teachers. Volunteers sort and package donated supplies or help out while the teachers shop. Here is the link for more information on upcoming events https://pencilforschools.org/free-teacher-supply-store/ . Finally, a great virtual opportunity is through the Proudly PENCIL Virtual Learning Series, where volunteers create a 5-20 minute video presentation on an educational topic to help grow the Metro School online resource access.

Photo courtesy of PENCIL.
date_notes: Options for opportunities whenever they fit in your schedule!
organization_description: Pencil is a nonprofit organization assisting Metro Nashville Public Schools through supplying resouurces and educational tools.
addresses: ["PENCIL (DG PENCIL Box), Cockrill Bend Boulevard, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Root Nashville
short_description: Join a planting event around Nashville!
content: Planting events are held from mid-October through the end of March every year for volunteers to dig holes, deliver and plant the big trees. Volunteers of all ages and abilities can contribute since no one plants alone. These events take about 3 hours, so bring a water bottle and snacks. Work gloves can be provided if you don't have them, and wear clothes you don't mind getting dirty. If you want trees in your neighborhood, apply to get free trees for your neighborhood to stay involved close to home. Root Nashville is a part of the Cumberland River Compacts projects.
date_notes: Events October-April
organization_description: Root Nashville's effort go to building a tree canopy to help Nashville become more "equitable, healthy and climate resilient".
addresses: ["35 Peabody Street, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Mission Animal Hospital
short_description: Help animals receive veterinarian attention at low cost!
content:
Volunteers can help in a variety of ways, including being a spay/neuter community volunteer, veterinary treatment volunteer, community ambassador volunteer, spay/neuter surgical preparation volunteer (for vet/vet tech students with experience), and spay/neuter surgical recovery volunteer (for vet/vet tech students with experience).

Estimated duration of activity: 2-4 hours
organization_description: Mission Animal Hospital provides affordable animal care and veterinary options. They provide pet exams, general surgery, and advanced surgery and have an urgent care that is open 7 days a week.
addresses: ["Mission Animal Hospital, 10100 Viking Drive #150, Eden Prairie, MN 55344, USA"]

headline: Pet Project Rescue
short_description: Help homeless animals from Minnesota to Mexico!
content:
Volunteers can help with research, fundraising, eBay sales, events, administrative support, and the trap-neuter-return program. Volunteers should commit for 6 months and hours vary per week. 

Virtual opportunities are available.
organization_description: Pet Project Rescue works to end animal homelessness and suffering by providing spay/ neuter programs from Minnesota to Mexico. They also provide hospice care for terminally ill Minnesota dogs and cats rescued from high-kill shelters.
addresses: ["Minneapolis, MN 55458, USA"]

headline: Literacy Minnesota
short_description: Help adult learners in Minnesota!
content:
Volunteers can become tutors to help adult learners with ESL/ELL, GED, reading, writing, math, basic computer skills, citizenship, conversation circles, and admin help.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours
organization_description: Literacy Minnesota provides programs to increase literacy through education, community building, and advocacy. They believe literacy will advance equity and justice.
addresses: ["700 Raymond Ave #180, St Paul, MN 55114, USA"]

headline: Minnesota Tech for Success
short_description: Help give access to technology to those in need!
content:
Volunteers can assist with sorting, processing, and recycling computers, laptops, and other electronic devices. For group, volunteering use the contact us part on the website to inquire.

Estimated duration of activity: 3 or more hours!
organization_description: Minnesota Tech for Success partners with schools and other education organizations to provide technology access, STEM programming and IT workforce development in underserved communities.
addresses: ["504 Malcolm Ave SE suite 100, Minneapolis, MN 55414, USA"]

headline: Science Museum of Minnesota
short_description: Help the science museum!
content:
Volunteers can help with a range of activities, including offering directions, facilitating hands-on science activities, or even preparing fossil specimens! Volunteers require mandatory training, which takes up to 15 hours.

Volunteers receive benefits including free parking, tickets, a 20% discount at the museum store, and more!
organization_description: The Science Museum of Minnesota offers many different permanent and temporary exhibitions. Permanent exhibitions include the human body gallery, light gallery, Mississippi River gallery, and more! The museum also has different initiatives to help spread the word on issues such as climate change.
addresses: ["120 W Kellogg Blvd, St Paul, MN 55102, USA"]

headline: Open Arms
short_description: Help feed your neighbours!
content:
Volunteers can help with a range of duties, including working in the kitchen, working on the farm, delivery, and event set-up.

Those 16 years and older can volunteer without an adult. Those 8-15 years with an adult at a 2:1 ratio.
organization_description: Open Arms of Minnesota prepares and delivers meals to the critically ill of Minnesota and their families. They use fresh and organic produce whenever available and work with their dietitians and in-house chefs to make made-from-scratch meals.
addresses: ["2500 Bloomington Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55404, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering for ages 16 and above!", "Volunteering for ages 8 and above with a parent"]

headline: Sharing and Caring Hands
short_description: Help the homeless in Minneapolis!
content:
Volunteers can help serve meals, host speakers, and help review resumes and cover letters. Volunteers can also tour the facility to see which they might be able to help. The organization is also in need of tutors, dentists, doctors, and nurses.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours
organization_description: Sharing and Caring Hands provides food, clothing, shelter, transportation assistance, and medical and dental help to those who cannot obtain help from the welfare system.
addresses: ["525 N 7th St, Minneapolis, MN 55405, USA"]

headline: Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen
short_description: Help cool and serve meal to those in need in Minnesota!
content:
There are multiple options to help out at Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen. Volunteers can serve meals and sort donations at the soup kitchen. Volunteers can also help to drive families to ministry counseling appointments, assist in the counseling playroom to look after children up to 4 years old, and to clean houses and yards.

Volunteers should be able to commit to 2 hours and be at least 18 years old (children younger than 18 years old can volunteer in the soup kitchen). Loaves and Fishes welcome groups as well as individual volunteers. Meal serving happens seven days a week. You can volunteer as much as you want or as little as once a month.
organization_description: Loaves and Fishes work to serve healthy and free meals to Missesotans in need through a variety of meal programs.
addresses: ["721 Kasota Ave SE, Minneapolis, MN 55414, USA"]

headline: People Serving People
short_description: Help the homeless in Minneapolis!
content:
Volunteers can help deliver meals and with other programs assisting wherever help is needed. Volunteers should commit to two shifts per month for at least three months.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours
organization_description: People Serving People provides emergency shelter to children and families experiencing homelessness. They provide various programs including an early childhood development program and family activities. financial fitness, supportive housing, and more!
addresses: ["614 S 3rd St, Minneapolis, MN 55415, USA"]

headline: Minnesota Veterans Home
short_description: Help veterans in need!
content: Volunteers can help by volunteering with the chapel, choir, recreation therapy activities, rehabilitation therapy escort, one on one visits with residents, and as pet visitors.
organization_description: Minnesota Veterans Home provides individualized care (rehabilitation, medical services, 24-hour nursing care, and more) and specialized services (work therapy, mental health services, barber and beautification services, and transportation) to veterans. They also offer various programs such as a family council, spouse support group, and more!
addresses: ["5101 Minnehaha Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55417, USA"]

headline: Minneapolis VA Health Care System
short_description: Help veterans get the care they need!
content:
Volunteers can help with patient transportation, housekeeping, setting patients up on the MyHealtheVet portal, and more!

Volunteers are asked to serve four hours per week and are asked to complete an application to allow for background checks.
organization_description: The Minneapolis VA Health Care System helps veterans, their families, and caregivers through various services.
addresses: ["Veterans Drive, Minneapolis, MN 55417, United States"]

headline: Cumberland River Compact
short_description: Park and stream cleanups and more to help the river basin
content: Hands-on volunteer opportunities for individuals and groups to work towards improving the Cumberland River Basin. Volunteer events have individual sign-ups and include stream cleanups, rain garden builds, species removal, park cleanups and more. Bring along your boat for a kayak cleanup, where you remove trash as you paddle. Each volunteer activity lasts for between 2 and 6 hours, and age requirements depend on the activity - most of them kids are welcome with adults! This calendar has a full list with event information and sign-ups.
date_notes: Varies based on event
organization_description: Works to educate and restore the Cumberland RIver Basin by starting at the root problems of water pollution and giving individuals resources to do the same.
addresses: ["Cumberland River Compact, Peabody Street, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Second Harvest Food Bank of Middle Tennessee
short_description: Sort and package food donations to feed the hungry
content:
Sign up for a shift sorting and packaging food donations at the Second Harvest Food Bank of Middle Tennessee warehouse. Volunteer shifts are around two hours, with a brief orientation and training at the beginning. Volunteers may work with frozen food, so dress in a sweatshirt and long pants for the 40-degree cooler if you are doing so. Volunteers must be 12 years or older and must have an adult with them if they are under 16. Thursday nights are family nights, where you can volunteer with kids six and older as a family. Groups of up to 25 are welcome to volunteer.

Photo Courtesy of Second Harvest Food Bank of Middle Tennessee
organization_name: Second Harvest Food Bank of Middle Tennessee
organization_description: Second Harvest Food Bank provides food for the hungry while working to advance long term solutions to hunger.
addresses: ["313 Great Circle Road, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: Elijah's Heart
short_description: Food distribution to underserved children and families
content: Elijah's heart looks for dozens of volunteers every week for seasonal events. All of these events involve packaging and unloading food, distributing meals, and setting up the space. The Fresh Market Walk of Love happens every Saturday of the summer and distributes fresh fruit and vegetables to the community. The event calendar updates monthly and includes links to RSVP for volunteer activities!
date_notes: Weekend events are updated on calendar
organization_description: Supports underserved children and their families through hunger relief, education and support projects.
addresses: ["648 Claiborne St, Nashville, TN 37210, USA"]

headline: Nashville Rescue Mission
short_description: Serve meals, tutor and more for the underserved
content: Volunteer opportunities for different skills and interests. Options include serving meals, HiSET Exam tutoring, teaching computer and exercise classes, and more. There are also faith-based volunteer activities, such as leading bible studies and serving as a Guest Chaplain. Volunteer event details and sign-ups are listed here. Details on age limit, attire and time requirements are included on each specific opportunity since it varies.
organization_description: Christian based organization assisting hungry, homeless and hurting communities.
addresses: ["639 Lafayette Street, Nashville, TN, USA"]

headline: People Loving Nashville
short_description: Outreach program working directly with homeless population
content: PLN runs four types of outreach programs for volunteers. The most known is the Monday Street Outreach program, where volunteers can serve food, clothing and resources at War Memorial Plaza. Click here for more information and sign-ups. Other outreach projects also occur weekly, serving apartment complexes for those who have just found stable housing. Monthly projects include clothing sorting and deep cleaning of the kitchen. This page details the other projects and emails to reach out to with interest in volunteering.
date_notes: Monday outreach program accepts the most volunteers
organization_description: PLN supplies food and resources to the homeless community in Nashville based on the goals of creating relief, community, connection and restoration.
addresses: ["People Loving Nashville, Gallatin Pike, Nashville, TN, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Women Elevated
short_description: Give women veterans professional, financial and life advice
content:
Use your skill sets to help improve the lives of women veterans in crisis. Counseling for professional, financial and life advice is the best way for community members to lend a hand to further Women Elevated's mission. There are also occasional events such as food and toy drives, so check out the event calendar. To volunteer, email executivedirector@womenelevated.org.

Photo Courtest of Women Elevated.
organization_description: Nonprofit assisting veteran women in need with housing, counseling, professional help financial advice and more.
addresses: ["3404 Bradfield Drive, Clarksville, TN, USA"]

headline: BARCS
short_description: Take pups on walks and play with cats at BARCS
content: Work directly with furry friends in need of love and care. Volunteers walk dogs, socialize with cats, and even prepare and distribute treats and toys. Volunteers also clean kennels, transport animals, and train them. If you are a tech or vet, medical support volunteers are always appreciated by BARC. There are non-handling support positions as well, including adoption counselors, graphic designers, pet locators and more. Group and corporate projects are available to make a difference in a pup's life.
organization_description: Largest animal shelter and adoption center in Maryland that accepts every animal in need, including dogs, cats, and even wildlife and exotic animals. BARCS is committed to creating a loving temporary environment as they help them find their home.
addresses: ["2490 Giles Road, Baltimore, MD, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to work with dogs", "Volunteers 13-15 must have a parent or guardian with them"]

headline: Baltimore Humane Society
short_description: Animal-handling and adoption work at BHS
content: Animal-handling opportunities to work with cats, dogs, and small animals. Volunteers do anything from playing with animals, feeding them treats, walking them and cleaning their cages. There are also operational support options to work on the adoption side of the shelter as a counselor, photographer, social media assistant and more. Whatever your skill sets or interests, there is a position to get involved. BHS asks that volunteers commit 4-6 hours a month to volunteer in addition to the initial hour of orientation. Volunteers under 13 must have a parent or guardian with them at all times, and those under 18 must have a parent or guardian with them at orientation. The volunteer page has a full description of each opportunity.
organization_description: BHS is an animal shelter and adoption center for all animals. It also has a low cost clinic with quality care and a 340 acre protected wildlife sanctuary.
addresses: ["Baltimore Humane Society, Nicodemus Road, Reisterstown, MD, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["13 and younger must have accompanying adult"]

headline: VOLO Kids - Baltimore
short_description: Coach and mentor kids with Volo
content:
Volunteers with Volo Kids work directly through the kids as not only sports coaches, but also life mentors for kids who come from all different backgrounds. There are 8 sports to choose between coaching, with opportunities changing seasonally. Volunteers can also serve on the admin side with a need for networking, social media work, field managers, photographers and most importantly help at big events.

Photo Courtesy of Volo Kids Foundation
date_notes: Dates, times and commitment varies based on event
organization_description: Volo Kids works to make youth sports free and accessible to all kids to raise physical activity with a goal of combatting obesity, drug usage and mental health issues in children. They want to introduce children to an "active, resilient and confident" lifestyle.
addresses: ["Baltimore, MD, USA"]

headline: Baltimore Curriculum Project
short_description: Work with directly with students as mentors, readers & more
content: BCP offers one-time and recurring volunteer opportunities to complete many activities, including reading to kids, classroom mentorship, after-school clubs and events and more. There is also administrative and clerical work in schools and for BCP. When you fill out an application, they will make sure to find an opportunity that fits your goals and needs!
