BCP also pairs with businesses to combine their skill sets with a project to give back to schools and the community.
date_notes: Flexible time and dates
organization_description: BCP works towards improving and transforming Baltimore's education system through employing research based learning, teacher training and offering support for schools.
addresses: ["Baltimore Curriculum Project, East Fayette Street, Baltimore, MD, USA"]

headline: Blue Water Baltimore
short_description: Planting, cleanups and more for the clean water initiative
content: Year-round volunteer activities and events for the whole community to help in the clean water initiative of Blue Water Baltimore. Opportunities include planting trees, trash cleanups, planting native plants at Herring Run Nursery, and making storm drain art. There is always something new to do and a mixture of one-time and recurring activities, so you can be as involved as your schedule allows.
organization_description: Restoring Baltimore waterways to make them safe, healthy and enjoyable by planting trees and plants, educating and advocating for stewardship and monitoring water quality. Solving the polluted water crisis will help the Baltimore environment and community well being.
addresses: ["Blue Water Baltimore, Sisson Street, Baltimore, MD, USA"]

headline: Friends of Great Kids Farms
short_description: Care for educational farm in Baltimore MD!
content:
Participate in a day of service through seasonal cleaning and planting volunteer days. These opportunities last between 2 and 3 hours and are great for all ages! There are also recurring volunteer roles with a more significant time commitment, including farm guides, chef assistants, landscape artists and farm assistance. These volunteer positions work directly with the plants and students through educational programs on agriculture and farm-to-table lifestyles. Volunteers can sign up as individuals by emailing lnmenyuk@bcps.k12.md.us or for groups by emailing nancy@friendsgkf.org. 

Photo Courtesy of Friends to Great Kids Farms
date_notes: Varies depending on needs of farm and volunteer's schedule
organization_description: Non profit supporting Baltimore City Public Schools' Great Kids Farm educational programming to bring city students opportunities to connect with nature and agriculture. The program reinforces healthy habits and eating with their Farm to School program.
addresses: ["Great Kids Farm/Baltimore City Public Schools, Baltimore National Pike, Catonsville, MD, USA"]

headline: Moveable Feast
short_description: Prep, package and deliver meals to food insecure and sick
content: Volunteers prep, package and deliver meals based on the dietary needs of those who experience food insecurity and/or chronic illness. Volunteers in the kitchen must wear shirts with sleeves, pants, and closed-toed shoes. They are given a hairnet, gloves and apron for their shift. Volunteers must be 14 and up to age 17 and must be accompanied by an adult. There are group volunteering options for up to 15 people. Each shift runs from 8-11:30 am, with a brief orientation in the beginning. There are special events and virtual volunteering options for those who can't commit to volunteering during the week.
organization_description: Mission of improving health by providing meals to Marylanders struggling with food insecurity and chronic illness, while providing nutritional education to improve lifestyles.
addresses: ["Moveable Feast, North Milton Avenue, Baltimore, MD, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers must be over 14, and those under 18 need a parent or guardian present"]

headline: Paul's Place
short_description: Serve the Baltimore homeless community with food & clothing
content: Paul's Place has volunteer opportunities daily for single volunteers or groups. Individuals can serve meals, help guests shop, organize clothing, assist in career workshops, sort food donations or mentor a student. There is a wide variety of options that require a 1-3 hour time commitment. There is a sign-up calendar to find an event that fits in your schedule. Group opportunity sign-ups are here, with similar opportunities with a 3-hour time commitment.
organization_description: Dozens of services for low income individuals and families to have access to food, clothing, job training, family workshops and more. Paul's Place was founded as a soup kitchen, but has since grown to support the communities needs with over 2 dozen services and programs.
addresses: ["Paul's Place - Food Distribution Center, Ward Street, Baltimore, MD, USA"]

headline: Seattle Humane
short_description: Help pet owners take care of their pets!
content:
Volunteers can help with animal care, administrative support, veterinary clinics, events, and more! Volunteer opportunities change depending on the need of the organization and new opportunities are posted every month. Other ways to get involved can be holding a fundraiser, holding a pet food drive, or making blankets and snuffle mats to drop off at the shelter.

For corporate volunteering opportunities, email events@seattlehumane.org. If you are looking for opportunities for children and teenagers, contact the education department at educationservices@seattlehumane.org.
organization_description: Seattle Humane is a shelter that provides services and resources to pet owners such as adoption services, a pet food bank, support for pet owners, low-cost surgeries and wellness exams, and more!
addresses: ["13212 Southeast Eastgate Way, Bellevue, WA 98005, USA"]

headline: Seattle Animal Shelter
short_description: Help animals receive the care they need!
content:
Volunteers can help in the shelter with services such as working on the critter team, dog walking, and other shelter help. Volunteers must commit to a weekly two-hour shift for six months and must attend required training classes.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours
organization_description: Operated by the city of Seattle this animal shelter is dedicated to helping pets including dogs and cats avoid being euthanized. They work to spay and neuter animals and send them to a loving home for fostering or adoption.
addresses: ["Seattle Animal Shelter, 2061 15th Ave W, Seattle, WA 98119, USA"]

headline: Minds Matter Seattle
short_description: Help students from underserved populations!
content:
Volunteers work as mentors with a 2:1 mentor-mentee model. Two mentors work with one student to meet and go through the Mind Matters curriculum that provides students with skills to succeed in college. Mentors must have graduated from a 4-year college/university and be available on Saturdays. Volunteers can also work as test prep instructors for SAT and ACT tutoring, as well as writing and critical thinking advisors.

Volunteers working as mentors must commit to three years as volunteers and be free of 80% of Saturday sessions.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours
organization_description: Mind Matter provides students from low-income families with connections to people and prepares them to succeed in college.
addresses: ["1420 5th Ave #2200, Seattle, WA 98101, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have graduated from college/ university with 4 year degree."]

headline: Atlantic Street Center
short_description: Help support children and families!
content: Volunteers can help with chaperoning, activity planning, child care/ development, tutoring, and more! Volunteers can also work as ESL assistants, van drivers, and staff assistants. Virtual opportunities are available.
organization_description: Atlantic Street Center works to support children and families by providing them educational support, family support, and behavioral health counseling.
addresses: ["2103 South Atlantic Street, Seattle, WA 98144, USA", "5150 South Cloverdale Place, Seattle, WA 98118, USA", "610 W Meeker St suite 201, Kent, WA 98032, USA"]

headline: Whale Scout
short_description: Help improve the habitat for whales!
content:
Volunteers can help during events held by Whale Scout to help clean up and improve the habitat for whales in the surrounding areas.

Photo Credit: Whale Scout, Jami Cantrell
organization_description: Whale Scout works to improve the habitat surrounding where whales reside. They work on the land to clean up and plant trees.
addresses: ["Woodinville, WA, USA"]

headline: Delridge Neighbourhoods Development Association
short_description: Help the environment in Seattle!
content:
Volunteer opportunities change depending on the event registered for. Volunteers can help remove invasive plants, plant native species, and more!

Please wear close-toed shoes and long pants to volunteer. All other tools are provided.
organization_description: DNDA works to create a vibrant community by enhancing the natural environment and providing individuals with arts and cultural resources. They also work to provide affordable housing to those in need.
addresses: ["4408 Delridge Way Southwest, Seattle, WA 98106, USA"]

headline: Northwest Food Harvest
short_description: Help feed your neighbours!
content:
Volunteers can help in their locations in Kent, Seattle, Spokane, or Yakima. They also hold special events at various locations in which volunteers can work. Volunteers in Seattle will assist in the SODO community market with opportunities to sort donations, repack donations, distribute foods, make sandwiches, and more!

For group volunteer opportunities, fill out this form.
organization_description: Northwest Food Harvest is on a mission to improve equity in the food system. Partnering with food banks, meal programs, and high-need schools they redistribute foods to families across Washington State.
addresses: ["1915 4th Ave S, Seattle, WA 98134, USA"]

headline: Food Lifeline
short_description: Help feed your neighbours!
content:
Volunteers can help in the warehouse and opportunities change daily depending on the needs of the organization. Volunteers help sort and repack foods from bulk-size donations to redistribute to families. There are other special volunteer opportunities available as well.

Volunteers are asked to show up 15 minutes before their shift.

For group/ corporate volunteer opportunities fill out this form.
organization_description: Food Lifeline is a member of Feeding America and is on a mission to end hunger in Washington. They distribute meals through their food banks, shelters, and meal programs.
addresses: ["815 S 96th St, Seattle, WA 98108, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering available for children 10 and up with waiver and accompanying adult."]

headline: Mary's Place
short_description: Help the homeless in Seattle!
content:
Volunteers can help in the shelter sites to assist with administrative tasks, sort through donations, help with homework, help families with housing and employment.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-4 hours
organization_description: Mary's Place helps homeless children, women, and families by providing them with resources to move out of homelessness. They have five emergency shelters that keep families safe and provide them with resources such as housing and employment services. They ensure children are connected with school and provide activities for them.
addresses: ["10621 NE 12th St, Bellevue, WA 98004, USA", "113 Dexter Avenue North, Seattle, WA 98109, USA", "9 South Nevada Street, Seattle, WA 98134, USA"]

headline: Roots
short_description: Help the homeless in Seattle!
content:
Volunteers help with preparing and serving food, setting up and cleaning shelter spaces, and handing out supplies. There are different shift timing in which volunteer duties might change.

Volunteers must go through volunteer training prior to the first shift.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-12 hours
organization_description: Roots provide young adult aged 18-25 years experiencing homelessness with essential services and a place to sleep.
addresses: ["4541 19th Ave NE, Seattle, WA 98105, USA"]

headline: Soldier's Angels - Seattle
short_description: Make baked goods and write letters for deployed troops.
content:
The Soldier's Angels organization exists to provide resources to active military, veterans and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.

You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and more. This can all be done from home, so it's a great activity to do with your kids! 

Register online to be a "Team Angel" here, then visit this page to select your baking opportunity!
organization_description: Soldier's Angels works to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["Seattle, WA, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of the Northwest
short_description: Support members of the military at various events!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like Fleet Week, Veterans Week, deployments and many more! You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across the Northwest. Sites are located at the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, and Portland International Airport and there are two mobile sits.

The USO requires that volunteers be 18 years or older for most activities, but some volunteers 13 and older are welcome at specific events.

Interested volunteers can register here, and a team member will reach out with more information! Volunteers will be expected to complete a background check.
organization_name: United Service Organization of the Northwest
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families, and country through programs that strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["Portland International Airport (PDX), Northeast Airport Way, Portland, OR, USA", "Seattle-Tacoma International Airport (SEA) (SEA), International Boulevard, Seattle, WA, USA"]

headline: Back on My Feet - Baltimore
short_description: Walk or run to help break the cycle of homelessness
content:
Do you enjoy waking up early to walk or run? In partnership with Back on My Feet, you can help accompany people to break the cycle of homelessness and get some physical activity! There are many ways to help out, either by enjoying a morning walk or run, serving as a Next Steps Mentor, and/or leading a professional development workshop.

To get started, submit a volunteer sign-up form. Once that is complete, watch the Volunteer Orientation video and complete the volunteer skill survey. Your final step would be to review the volunteer handbook and complete a "Circle Up" training. Then you are ready to get involved!

Volunteers for certain events should be at least 18, however, if accompanied by a parent, there is a possibility of someone under 18 to participate. Be sure to ask a volunteer team member for details!
date_notes: Usually in the mornings, dependent on opportunity
organization_description: Working to break the cycle of homelessness through a community of supporters who emphasize the importance of physical health, work to mentor members about employment and guide them to land jobs.
addresses: ["Back on My Feet Baltimore, East Baltimore Street, Baltimore, MD, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some ages are welcome to join, just ask a team member!"]

headline: Happy Helpers for the Homeless
short_description: Food and clothing distributions every Saturday and Sunday
content: Volunteer opportunity every Saturday and Sunday of the year to serve the homeless community. Saturdays from 11:30 to 2:15, volunteers are busy preparing sandwiches and food baskets and distributing them. Sundays, volunteers meet at the Harundale Presbyterian Church at Noon to distribute food and clothing to families in Glen Burnie and Baltimore. Additionally, Happy Helpers for the Homeless runs seasonal and holiday events that are all on their calendar. Some projects and donations can be collected on your own time so that volunteers can participate with a more flexible schedule.
organization_description: Provides food, toiletries and clothing to homeless Maryland community every weekend with the end vision of solving the issue.
addresses: ["1550 Caton Center Drive, Baltimore, MD, USA", "Harundale Presbyterian Church, Eastway, Glen Burnie, MD, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Blue Star Families
short_description: Work with military families at events, counseling, and more
content:
Volunteer opportunities of all different commitment levels are offered throughout the year. If you are looking for a short-term opportunity, Blue Star Families needs volunteers for holiday celebrations, organizational projects, social media content and more. More involved volunteers share their skills with veteran families, whether that is through professional counseling, a fitness class, fun crafts, or so many more possibilities. It is a great way to be flexible and share what you love! Here is the link directly to the Baltimore Chapter to see special events and activities in your area.

Photo Courtesy of Blue Star Families
organization_description: Educating and empowering military families through meaningful programming, community relationships and supportive events.
addresses: ["Baltimore, MD, USA"]

headline: Colorado Saint Bernard Rescue
short_description: Help rescue and rehome unwanted dogs!
content:
Volunteers can help with home checks, transporting dogs, marketing, fundraising, volunteer training, and more! You will be working with big dogs so you must be comfortable around them.

Volunteers have to fill out a release form prior to volunteering.
organization_description: Colorado Saint Bernard Rescue works to rescue and rehome unwanted, abandoned and abused Saint Bernards and Saint Bernard mixes.
addresses: ["Denver, CO, USA"]

headline: The Wild Animal Sanctuary
short_description: Help take care of rescued exotic animals!
content:
Volunteers can assist with office work, educational duties, fence building, habitat construction, fundraising, managing cross-country rescue schedules, and working with animals. 

Volunteers must and volunteer for at least 6 months and volunteer for 16 hours a month. The 16 hours can add up to 2 full days or 4 half days.

You will be working outdoors so make sure to wear sun protection and bring layers if cold.
organization_description: Located on 794 acres of natural habitats the Wild Animal Sanctuary has over 600 exotic animal rescues at its facilities. They work to ensure these animals are well taken care of while continuously rescuing more animals.
addresses: ["The Wild Animal Sanctuary, 2999 County Road 53, Keenesburg, CO 80643, USA"]

headline: Erie Uplink
short_description: Help students and their families with basic need!
content:
While volunteer opportunities are paused during covid, volunteers can work from home to assemble Tiger Packs which are food-filled backpacks sent home with students from Erie schools. The backpacks are filled with non-perishable, kid-friendly, and help the students over long weekends and holidays. Volunteers can also help create personal care kits and collect new socks, hats, gloves, and pajamas in all sizes.

For group volunteering options, you can organize a packing event and contact erieuplink@gmail.com to let them know when you will drop off the items.

How to create Tiger Packs.
organization_description: Eerie Uplink works to provide families with basic needs and connect families to one another with opportunities that might be of service to one another.
addresses: ["77 Village Square #280, Erie, CO 80516, USA"]

headline: KidsTek
short_description: Help provide students with access to technology!
content:
Volunteers can with programs offered by KidsTek. KidsTek is always looking for individuals to speak to one of their high school classes, provide an internship or summer program, or just help out with homework on Saturday afternoons.

For group and corporate volunteering, use the same application to sign up.
organization_description: KidsTek provides students with tech literacy to help improve their academic, career and personal success. They have programs for elementary, middle, and high-schoolers that will impact what they would need to use the internet for.
addresses: ["PCs for People, East 38th Avenue, Denver, CO, USA"]

headline: Volunteers for Outdoor Colorado
short_description: Help the environment in Colorado!
content:
Volunteers can help in a variety of ways. All volunteer projects are based on protecting, enhancing, restoring, and preserving Colorado's natural places. Volunteers can help with maintenance, gardening, planting, wildfire and flood restoration, and more!

For group opportunities, email outreach@voc.org

For corporate opportunities, visit this link. 

Volunteer opportunities are held for different amounts of time. A list of what to bring can be found here for Single Day Projects and Weekend/ Multi-Day Projects.
organization_description: Volunteers of Outdoor Colorado bring thousands of people together to work as a volunteer workforce for recreation and habitat improvement projects.
addresses: ["Colorado, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Varies by event.", "Volunteering for ages 12 and above!"]

headline: Groundwork Denver
short_description: Help the environment in Denver!
content:
Volunteers can help plant trees, restore habitats, conduct community outreach, work in the office, and more!

Group volunteering for up to 200 people are available.
organization_description: Groundwork Denver works to improve the physical environment and promote health and well-being for lower-income communities. They help improve parks, clean up rivers and the air, insulate houses, promote biking, grow food, and more!
addresses: ["3280 North Downing Street unit e, Denver, Colorado 80205, USA"]

headline: We Don't Waste
short_description: Help reduce food wastage in Denver!
content:
Volunteers can help at the mobile food market while filling up families' cars with bags of produce, dairy, and nonperishable. They can help pack groceries at a distribution center and use their voice to support We Don't Waste by joining the Speakers Bureau.

For group volunteering opportunities, fill out this form.
organization_description: We Don't Waste helps reduce hunger and food waste in Denver by recovering quality, unused foods from the food industry and delivering it to non-profits such as food pantries, soup kitchens, shelters, schools, daycare programs, and more!
addresses: ["5971 Broadway, Denver, CO 80216, USA"]

headline: Denver Food Rescue
short_description: Help your neighbours access food!
content:
Volunteers can help in many ways that include rescue shifts via car, volunteering at a No Cost Grocery Program, and working on the Bike and Garage Maintenance Team.

Estimated duration of activity: 1-3 hours
organization_description: Denver Food Rescue takes high-quality, fresh produce and perishable foods from grocery stores, farmer markets, and produce distributors that would have otherwise been thrown away. They then redistribute the food to No Cost grocery Programs (NCGP) and members of the NCGPs help lead the distribution and help with food rescue shifts. They rescue a majority of their food via bicycles.
addresses: ["Denver Food Rescue, 3840 York St, Denver, CO 80205, USA"]

headline: The Gathering Place
short_description: Help the Homeless in Denver!
content:
Volunteers can assist in many different ways such as operating the welcome desk, kitchen, family programs, education and job readiness programs, computer lab, and more!

Volunteers are asked to commit to a weekly routine for three months. Volunteer welcome tours take place on the first Tuesday of the month at 8:00 am and the third Thursday of the month at 4:00 pm.
organization_description: The Gathering Place provides women, children, and transgender individuals living in poverty with services to combat it and a place with stability and security.
addresses: ["1535 High Street, Denver, CO 80218, USA"]

headline: Denver Rescue Mission
short_description: Help the homeless in Denver!
content:
Both short-term and long-term volunteer opportunities are available. Volunteers can help serve meals, sort clothes, warehouse support, mentoring, and more!

Group opportunities are available; 2-8 people groups can help with in meals and 2-5 people groups can work in the warehouse.
organization_description: Denver Rescue Mission provides those experiencing homelessness and poverty with emergency services, rehabilitation programs, and more!
addresses: ["6100 Smith Road, Denver, CO 80216, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Some opportunities for ages 10 and above.", "Varies by event."]

headline: Colorado Veterans Project
short_description: Help veterans and their families!
content: Volunteers are needed to help support events and will assist as photographers, videographers, digital marketers and with stuffing race bags, social media, set-up/clean-up, registration, and more for the events.
organization_description: The Colorado Veterans Project supports Colorado veterans and their families as they raise funds and appreciation at various events held by the organization.
addresses: ["1120 Washington Ave suite 200, Golden, CO 80401, USA"]

headline: Soldier's Angels - Denver
short_description: Send baked goods and letters to warm a soldier's day!
content: The Soldier's Angels organization exists to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all. You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and more. This can all be done from home, so it's a great activity to do with your kids! Register online to be a "Team Angel" here, and from there, select your baking opportunity!
date_notes: Virtual and remote activities can fit your schedule!
organization_description: To provide resources to active military, veterans and their families through programs which office comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["Denver, CO, USA"]

headline: San Francisco Animal Care and Control
short_description: Help animals receive the care they need!
content:
Volunteers can work in different positions such as being a cat volunteer, dog volunteer, fetch volunteer, small animal volunteer, foster volunteer, outreach volunteer, veterinary volunteer, corporate and school groups volunteers, and transport volunteers.

Group volunteering does not include working with the animals. In addition, these positions are first come, first serve.

Orientation sessions are required prior to volunteering and last approximately 90 minutes.
organization_name: San Francisco Animal Care and Control
organization_description: The San Francisco Department of Animal Care and Contol provides housing, care, and medical treatment to wild, exotic and domestic stray, lost, abandoned, sick, injured, and surrendered animals. They accept all animals no matter their species or medical/behavioral condition.
addresses: ["1419 Bryant Street, San Francisco, CA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some opportunities for ages 13 and above."]

headline: San Francisco SCPA
short_description: Help animals receive the care they need!
content:
Volunteers can help in many different ways by working as shelter volunteers, animal-assisted therapy volunteers, foster volunteers, community medicine volunteers, community cat teams, mobile vaccination clinic volunteers, and more! Volunteers can also help with front desk greeting and hospitality, laundry, and more!

Half-day projects are provided to groups (12 or fewer) on the Mission campus from Tuesday- Friday. Group volunteer sessions are usually from 9:00 am- 1:00 pm and volunteers help with gardening, painting and beautifying their Mission Campus.

Volunteer positions require a commitment of at least 6 months. Volunteers are in need on weekdays from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Volunteers must sign up and attend an information session prior to volunteering. After attending the information session, volunteers will then receive a link to the application by email. (different for groups)

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours
organization_description: The San Francisco SPCA works to provide dogs and cats with access to high-quality veterinary. They are a cageless animal shelter ensuring pets and those who take care of them have access to care for the animals.
addresses: ["San Francisco SPCA Adoption Center, Florida Street, San Francisco, CA, USA", "San Francisco SPCA, Alabama Street, SF, CA, USA"]

headline: San Francisco Public Library - Project Read
short_description: Help adults improve their basic reading and writing skills!
content:
Volunteer tutors will help the learner with specific reading and writing goals. Volunteers are required to attend interactive and comprehensive tutor training several times a year.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours a week, at a regularly scheduled time for a minimum of one year.
organization_name: San Francisco Public Library- Project Read
organization_description: The San Francisco Public Library offers an adult literacy program called Project Read which provides free one-one tutoring to English-speaking adults. Trained volunteer tutors help to improve the basic reading and writing skills of these adults.
addresses: ["100 Larkin Street, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have received a High School Diploma"]

headline: 826 Valencia - San Francisco
short_description: Help under-resourced students!
content:
Volunteers can help tutor students, help students with writing projects, assist the organization's Young Author's Book Project, and more! Volunteers do not need to be expert writers and training is provided during orientation as well as there are ongoing training opportunities available.

Group volunteering opportunities are available using this form.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours
organization_description: 826 Valencia works to help under-resourced students aged 6-18 years with their writing skills.
addresses: ["826 Valencia Street, San Francisco, California 94110, USA"]

headline: Golden Gate Audubon Society
short_description: Help the bird habitat!
content:
Volunteers can help with habitat restoration, docent training, conservation committees, children's education, and as photographers and event volunteers.

For group work days (with a maximum of 10 volunteers) email jcarpinelli@goldengateaudubon.org a month in advance.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-3 hours
organization_description: The Golden Gate Audubon Society works to preserve and protect native bird populations and habitats by engaging people to experience the wonder of the birds and take action.
addresses: ["Golden Gate Audubon Society, 2530 San Pablo Avenue, Berkeley, California 94702, USA"]

headline: Friends of the Urban Forest
short_description: Help plant trees in San Francisco!
content:
Volunteers can help with planting trees, tree care, outreach for upcoming planting, advocacy for a greener San Francisco, office help, and more! Volunteers usually help with the planting of 5-7 trees at each planting.

For group volunteer opportunities (less than 5 individuals) use this form. For coporate groups/ partnerships visit this website.

Estimated duration of activity: 5 hours
organization_description: Friends of the Urban Forst help plant trees to build San Francisco's street tree canopy. Since 1981, they have planted 60,000 trees and they water 500 plants weekly. Through tree plantation, the organization fights climate change, improves air quality, adds beauty, and more!
addresses: ["1007 General Kennedy Ave, San Francisco, CA 94129, U.S."]

headline: Food Runners
short_description: Help deliver food to those in need!
content: Volunteers can work as regular runners (picking up food from the same donor and taking it to the same recipient). On-call runners will be called, emailed, or texted to see if they can make a pickup and delivery that day.
organization_description: Food Runners help the hungry in San Francisco by delivering foods that would otherwise be thrown out to them. These foods are perishable and prepared food items and come from restaurants, caterers, bakeries, hospitals, cafeterias, and more!
addresses: ["2579 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA"]

headline: SF Marin Food Bank
short_description: Help feed your neighbors!
content:
Volunteers can assist in many ways, including helping out at the pop-up or partner pantries, packing senior boxes and groceries bag from home delivery while volunteering in the warehouse, delivering fresh groceries to homebound recipients, helping on the shop floor, and helping reach everyone in need through the provision of bilingual support.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours
organization_description: This foodbank works to end hunger in San Francisco and Marin. They help feed their neighbors through the distribution and delivery of groceries, and more!
addresses: ["San Francisco-Marin Food Bank"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering for ages 8 and above with a parent"]

headline: St Anthony's
short_description: Help support those in need!
content:
Volunteers can assist with preparing and serving meals in the dining room, sort clothes and assist shoppers in the free clothing program, and help answer basic computer questions in the tech lab.

To volunteer as a group, fill out this form.

Estimated duration of activity: 2-4 hours
organization_description: St Anthony's provides services such as a dining room, free clothing program, resource center, community safety services, medical clinic, addiction recovery, workforce development training, and more to those in need.
addresses: ["150 Golden Gate Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["13 years and older", "Varies by event.", "Volunteers 13-15 must have a parent or guardian with them"]

headline: Urban Angel SF
short_description: Help those in suffering from homelessness!
content: Volunteers can help in various ways, including handing out donations, water, meals, and more – weekly.
organization_description: Urban Angels SF helps and supports neighbors suffering from homelessness and income instability by providing them with basic necessities and other comforts.
addresses: ["5228 Diamond Heights Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA"]

headline: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine - Dallas
short_description: Pick up and deliver recovered leftover food donations
content:
Volunteers pick up and deliver the food donations at their convenience. There are two types of volunteers: the crew volunteers, who bring food donations from the donor to the nonprofit partner, and the lead rescuer, who plan the food rescue events. Rescuing Leftover Cuisine runs in Atlanta, Columbus, Dallas, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, New Orleans and Rhode Island.

Photo Courtesy of Rescuing Leftover Cuisine
organization_description: Nationwide nonprofit organization that redistributes leftover food to feed those struggling with food insecurity. RLC works directly with restaurants and businesses to save food from going in the trash and giving it to those in need
addresses: ["Dallas, TX, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have volunteer old enough to drive"]

headline: Bayanihan Equity Center
short_description: Help those in need in San Francisco!
content: Volunteers can help with administrative support, arts and crafts, food distribution, and more!
organization_description: The Bayanihan Equity Center first opened its doors to Filipino World War II veterans and provided them with direct services. Since, they extended their services to low-income immigrant seniors, people with disabilities, and families in San Francisco.
addresses: ["1010 Mission St suite c, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA"]

headline: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine - Atlanta
short_description: Distributing rescued leftovers to the food insecure
content:
Volunteers pick up and deliver the food donations at their own time convenience. There are two types of volunteers: the crew volunteers, who bring food donations from the donor to the nonprofit partner, and the lead rescuer, who plan the food rescue events. Rescuing Leftover Cuisine runs in Atlanta, Columbus, Dallas, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, New Orleans and Rhode Island.

Volunteers pick up and deliver the food donations at their own time convenience. headline: Arizona Humane Society
short_description: Help the neglected cats and dogs around Phoenix!
content:
Calling all animal lovers! Give some time and lend a hand to help the stray, neglected and abused cats and dogs around Phoenix find their forever homes!

Volunteers can assist in all aspects of animal welfare and assist with guest services during adoption visits. Volunteers can work with just cats or dogs, or both! There are opportunities to socialize with cats, take dogs on walks, help work with shy animals, clean up enclosures and even bottle feed baby kittens! If you are interested in working with people, volunteers can accompany visitors on adoption visits to make them feel comfortable and answer any questions about the animals. Volunteers are also able to help take photos of animals to pair with adoption postings or in the pet thrift store!

It only takes three steps to start volunteering! First, please register and fill out a volunteer application and complete the online orientation class. Second, you will be asked to submit payment for your $25 volunteering fee, which covers your application, t-shirt and supplies. Finally, once your application has been received, a team member will be in touch to get you set up to select your first shift! Please allow 3-5 for all of these steps to be completed.

Groups of up to 100 people are able to volunteer. These volunteer experiences also require a donation to allow the team to provide adequate materials for the groups. If you are interested in getting your group involved, fill out an interest form.
date_notes: Volunteering opportunties every day of the week!
organization_description: The Arizona Humane Society offers a no-kill, supportive and nurturing environment for Phoenix's most at-risk pets. The shelter takes in abandoned, neglected and abused animals, gives them proper medical care and a loving place to heal and one day, find their forever home.
addresses: ["1110 W Southern Ave ste 20, Mesa, AZ 85210, USA", "13401 N Cave Creek Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85022, USA", "1521 W Dobbins Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85041, USA", "9226 N 13th Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85021, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Volunteering for ages 16 and above!"]

headline: Phoenix Rescue Mission
short_description: Better your community and offer support to those in need.
content:
Are you looking for a way to help those who may be experiencing homelessness or personal crisis around Phoenix? The Phoenix Rescue Mission is a great opportunity to give back.

Volunteers are needed to help in the Food Bank by helping to prepare meals, hand out meals, sort and organize donations and also help to pack groceries for community members. Volunteers can also sign up to assist in the Hope Coach program, which travels around to different communities in Phoenix to offer meals and services to community members in need.

In order to start volunteering, all you need to do is create an account and then select the opportunity you wish to participate in through the volunteer calendar. Volunteers under 18 must fill out a waiver before their first shift. Groups can participate in community drives to support areas of need at the shelter. Please fill out an interest form.

Food Bank shifts are usually 2 - 2.5 hours and occur between 6 am and 12 pm. Hope Coach shifts are full-day events and take place from 8 am to 2 pm.
date_notes: Shifts are available every day of the week!
organization_description: Helping the men, women and children around Phoenix who are experiencing homeless, poverty, addiction or trauma and providing support and resources to help them find a path to a new beginning. The Arizona Rescue Mission provides meals, childcare and parenting classes and resources to help community members get back into the workforce.
addresses: ["1540 W Van Buren St, Phoenix, AZ, USA", "5605 North 55th Avenue, Glendale, AZ 85301, USA"]

headline: San Diego Audubon Society
short_description: Spread the word about conservation and get your hands dirty!
content:
If you are a lover of birds or conserving our natural spaces to promote healthy habitats for species native to California, the San Diego Audubon Society is a great way to give back!

There are so many ways to become involved and support wildlife around San Diego! Volunteers can assist with various projects like weeding, invasive species removal, habitat improvement and assisting visitors around San Diego and in the Anstine-Audubon Nature Preserve or the Silverwood Wildlife Sanctuary Volunteers are also able to help out in the office by conducting administrative work or help plan events. And even participate in a bird count in your neighborhood or local area around the Christmas holiday!

Please submit a volunteer application with your various project interests. Once you have completed the application, Chelsea, the Audubon Volunteer Coordinator, will be in touch to provide information about orientation and training before you select your first shift! Locations for volunteering projects change depending on what you select. You will always be notified of the location before the work day! Check out the events calendar to find more information about locations. 

All children under 18 must have a parent or gaurdian supervise. Most projects will be outside and include bending, lifting, walking and exposure to the elements.

Photo Courtesy of San Diego Audubon Society.
date_notes: Times may vary!
organization_description: San Diego Audubon is a grassroots organization that works to support bird populations, other wildlife species and their habitats. They support these important wildlife species and environments but conducting community education and outreach, restoration projects and advocate for laws and regulations which support birds and their habitats.
addresses: ["4010 Morena Blvd ste 100, San Diego, CA 92117, USA"]

headline: Feeding San Diego
short_description: Support underserved communities and help prepare meals!
content:
Help to combate the food insecurity crisis across San Diego by giving time and helping to support Feeding San Diego's efforts to provide resources to all communities facing hunger.

Volunteers are able to support Feeding San Diego's missions to address the Food Insecurity crisis by lending a hand at food distribution centers, meal delivery services, mobile pick-up locations and so many more options! Volunteers will be tasked with sorting and organizating donations at centers across San Diego, packing and delivering meals and goods to clients across all neighborhoods, and working to support partnerships across San Diego to help provide meals and groceries to all underserved communities.

Please visit Feeding San Diego's Volunteer Hub and read through the opportunities in more detail to select which you would like to become involved in. You can then click "Register Today" to then start an application and a team member will be in contact to help you sign up and start volutneering! Volunteering events will take place at various community stores and locations across San Diego. Once you have your desired opportunity selected, you will be notified of the location! Please wear appropriate clothing that is not too tight or revealing. Close-toed shoes are encouraged and layers depending on the weather.

Groups of up to 40 participants and may take a few months to find time to participate. If you are interested, please fill out this application.

Age Requirments: Food Distribution Center allows for 6 years old and up, and under 15 must be accompanied by an adult. Together Tour Distribution allows for 16 years and older who do not have to be supervised. Shifts are usually 2+ hours.
date_notes: Day of the week depends on the opportunity you select!
organization_description: Feeding San Diego is a branch of Feeding America which works to address the food insecurity crisis that affects our nations underserved populations. Feeding San Diego works with partner organizations and volunteers to ensure that all communities around San Diego have healthy, fresh and affordable food in their local areas.
addresses: ["San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of the Northern California
short_description: Help veterans connect to their family, home and country!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like Fleet Week, Veterans Week, deployments, and many more! You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across Northern California. Currently, there are two sites in the Bay area - San Francisco International Airport and the Travis Airforce Base.

Volunteers must undergo a background check.

Please wear shoes that are comfortable and clothes that are not too revealing.

Volunteers must be 18 years or older; those 13 and older can volunteer at some special events with a parent/guardian.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours
organization_name: United Service Organization of Northern California
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families, and country through programs that strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["San Francisco Intl, South Airport Boulevard, San Francisco, CA, USA"]

headline: San Antonio Humane Society
short_description: Help rescue and rehome animals!
content:
Volunteers can assist on a variety of teams including the adoption team, animal behavior and enrichment team, animal care team, and animal health team. The community outreach team, development and donor relations team, humane education team, and public relations team are also options.

Duration of activity: 1-4 hours

Those 18 years and older will be required to have a background check. There is a $15.50 fee associated with the background check.
organization_description: San Antonio Humane Society works to rescue the lives of dogs and cats by providing services such as shelter, care, adoption, rescue, spay/ neutering programs, and community programs.
addresses: ["Brooks Spay & Neuter Clinic, 8034 City Base Landing, San Antonio, TX 78235, USA", "San Antonio Humane Society, 4804 Fredericksburg Rd, San Antonio, TX 78229, USA"]

headline: San Antonio Pets Alive
short_description: Help save at-risk dogs and cats!
content: Volunteers can help in the adoption center, rescue center, medical care center, administrative office, or even volunteer remotely. Those under 18 may participate through online volunteering opportunities.
organization_description: San Antonio Pets Alive works to save at-risk dogs and cats from euthanasia through the provision of various programs and services.
addresses: ["4710 TX-151, San Antonio, TX 78227, USA"]

headline: Each One Teach One
short_description: Help adults reach their educational goals!
content:
Volunteers can work as literacy tutors to help with one-on-one and small group tutoring in subjects such as math, reading, writing, social studies, science, digital literacy, and English as a second language. Volunteers can also work for special events to plan special events, strategize on marketing tactics, assist with fundraising, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours per week for 6 months
organization_description: Denver Rescue Mission provides those experiencing homelessness and poverty with emergency services, rehabilitation programs, and more!
addresses: ["815 El Monte Blvd, San Antonio, Texas 78201, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have received a High School Diploma"]

headline: San Antonio Youth Literacy
short_description: Help San Antonio students!
content:
Volunteers primarily help with SAYL's 2nd grade Reading Buddy program in elementary schools around the area. They also offer summer opportunities to join the San Antonio Youth Literacy's Camp Read-Aloud, which helps students in the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd grades. The organization is also in need of office volunteers to help prepare training materials, create program activities, and more!

Volunteers are expected to work 1 hour per week for a full school year (only for the reading buddy position).
organization_description: SAYL provides San Antonio students with skills needed to read and learn through one-on-one support while nurturing self-confidence and enjoyment of reading.
addresses: ["2527 Rim Oak, San Antonio, TX 78232, U.S."]

headline: San Antonio River Authority
short_description: Help keep the river clean!
content: Volunteers work as River Warriors to help the River authority with ecosystem restoration activities such as planting native grasses, removing invasive species, mulching trees, and more! Volunteers are not only on foot but can volunteer on kayaks as well! You can organize your own river and park clean-ups for your group.
organization_description: The San Antonio River Authority works to keep the river and parks clean while taking feedback from the San Antonio public into hand.
addresses: ["201 W Sheridan, San Antonio, Texas 78204, USA"]

headline: Keep San Antonio Beautiful
short_description: Help keep San Antonio clean and beautiful!
content: Volunteers can help with different events throughout the year. During the events, volunteers might help with cleanups, monitoring recycling, and more! Volunteers are encouraged by the Department of Interior and Michelle Obama to get outside and play, learn, serve and work.
organization_description: This organization works to encourage members of San Antonio to keep the city clean through community clean-ups, environmental education, volunteerism, and more! They offer solutions to create beautiful public places, reduce waste and increase recycling.
addresses: ["San Antonio, TX, USA"]

headline: Snack Pak 4 Kids
short_description: Help feed students over the weekends!
content:
Volunteers can help pack the Snack Paks at the warehouse. Volunteers can also help deliver loaded Snack Pak totes to schools once a month. Volunteering occurs during the school year.

Estimated duration of activity: 1 hour
organization_description: This organization works to provide food supplements to chronically hungry children over weekends. Teachers help identify students who might be in need of this service and Snack Packs are discretely distributed into their backpacks every Friday (by the teacher).
addresses: ["3559 Belgium Lane, San Antonio, TX 78219, USA"]

headline: San Antonio Food Bank
short_description: Help feed your neighbours!
content:
Volunteers can help in the warehouse, sorting room, curbside, community garden and farm, and mobile distribution, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 2- 4 hours

Dress codes might be recommended depending on the opportunity. When registering for the event, the requirements will come up, so please be mindful of them!
organization_description: The San Antonio Food Bank works to feed those in need in San Antonio and Southwest Texas.
addresses: ["San Antonio Food Bank, 5200 Enrique M. Barrera Pkwy, San Antonio, TX 78227, USA"]

headline: Haven For Hope
short_description: Help the homeless in San Antonio!
content: Haven for Hope offers a variety of volunteer opportunities for individuals and groups. Activities can include administrative support, donation sorting, painting, Bingo with clients, assisting with special events, and more.
organization_description: The Haven for Hope mission is to offer a place of hope and new beginnings. We do this by providing, coordinating, and delivering an efficient system of care for people experiencing homelessness in San Antonio. Haven serves individual men, women, and families with children with a variety of services.
addresses: ["1 Haven for Hope Way, San Antonio, Texas 78207, USA"]

headline: St. Vinnys Bistro
short_description: Help the homeless in San Antonio!
content:
Volunteers can help serve meals, support the chefs and kitchen staff with meal prep and clean-up, as videographers, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

A map to find the kitchen is available here.
organization_description: St. Vinny's Bistro works to serve San Antonio's Homeless. They run a soup kitchen that provides three hot meals every day to anyone in need.
addresses: ["1 Haven for Hope Way, San Antonio, Texas 78207, USA"]

headline: Operation Homefront
short_description: Help military families!
content: Volunteers can help in many different capacities including as fundraisers, collecting donations, working as office support, and more! A full list of volunteer opportunities can be found under volunteer FAQs on the website.
organization_description: Operation Homefront provides military families with short-term critical financial assistance, long-term stability, and recurring family. Some of the work that goes into the three categories includes financial assistance for food/home repairs, veteran caregiver support program, backpacks filled with school supplies for military kids, and more!
addresses: ["1355 Central Parkway South ste 100, San Antonio, TX 78232, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering for ages 15 and above!", "Volunteering for ages 6 and up!"]

headline: Wish for Our Heroes
short_description: Help military members and their families!
content:
Volunteers can help work an event, grant wishes, with fundraising, do administrative work, host an event, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 2-15 hours
organization_description: Wish for Our Heroes works to support and provide resources to active-duty members of the military and their families to make life during deployment easier. They grant basic needs/ emergencies such as food on the table, baby supplies, and more! If basic needs are met they are able to send troops to fun activities such as athletic events, vacation after deployment, and more!
addresses: ["Huebner Rd, San Antonio, TX 78230, USA"]

headline: ZSL Instant Wild
short_description: Tag animals on app for widlife research contributions!
content: Use the website or phone app to watch live stream footage of animals worldwide and help ZSL Instant Wild by tagging species as you view the footage. Even if you don't feel confident in your animal identification field, the program has interactive guides and identification is based on the consensus of everyone that is helping, so there is no pressure in taking your best guess! This is a great way to volunteer in your own time while helping in the research, conservation and education of wildlife in its natural habitat.
date_notes: Use app on your own time!
organization_description: ZSL Instant Wild has motion triggered cameras across the world used for animal monitoring. Information from this research is used for conservation method development.
addresses: [null]

headline: Zooniverse
short_description: Community-based research projects for animal welfare.
content: Choose from over a hundred research projects on animals, nature, history, medicine and more. These projects can be completed on your own time, with little to no experience needed. They are typically research projects with too much data for one person to analyze. For example, the Killer Whale Count Project has over 1 million images to analyze for killer whales or sea lions. All of these projects rely on the work of large numbers of people to ensure efficiency and accuracy. https://www.zooniverse.org/projects?page=1&sort=completeness&status=live
date_notes: Log onto the website whenever is convenient!
organization_description: People-powered research project platform where anyone can help professional researchers accelerate their research through community analysis with a goal of understanding the world and animals quicker than ever before.
addresses: [null]

headline: Smithsonian Transcription Center
short_description: Transcribe historical documents to add to resource library
content: Almost 70,000 volunteers work to make historical documents more easily accessible through the transcription of field notes, diaries, ledgers, biodiversity specimen labels and more. Volunteer to transcribe on your own time after you learn how to transcribe from the website. This is a super cool opportunity for those who love history and are looking to join a community network of volunteers working towards a common goal. Here are tips, more information and how to get started.
date_notes: Log onto the website whenever is convenient!
organization_description: Network of volunteers working to transcribe field notes, diaries, ledgers, manuscripts and more. The "volunpeer" network has over 70,000 people working to further historical education through this Smithsonian project.
addresses: [null]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have some knowledge and skill in mathematics", "Training"]

headline: MicroMentor
short_description: Business experts can mentor young entrepreneurs.
content: Those with prior business experience can volunteer their knowledge and skills to help new entrepreneurs navigate their businesses as mentors. Volunteering is easy with a flexible schedule. Just create a profile to match with an entrepreneur who you believe in, then make a plan to meet with them as often as you would like over the course of weeks, months or even years. This is a great way to pass on your skills and guidance while building a relationship with your mentee. Sign up here!
date_notes: Flexible hours choosing your meeting times
organization_description: Business mentors work with entrepreneurs to give free advice and support based on their previous work experience and interests. Micro Mentors makes recommendations for mentors that will be the best fit for your business, and each party agrees on how long and often they will meet.
addresses: [null]

headline: Project Glimmer
short_description: Volunteer at home making confidence kits for young girls!
content: Remote volunteers can participate in the "Boxing Joy" project, where you are sent a kit with products, wrapping supplies and shipping labels to send gifts to young women needing a confidence boost. Volunteers can also use their previous experiences of success in the workforce and school to run a virtual Empower Hour meant to inspire girls. After each Empower Hour, everyone is matched one-on-one for a career coaching session. Mentors and fundraisers help Glimmer Project run and continue inspiring young girls, volunteer for the program that suits you best here.
date_notes: Package at home any day!
organization_description: Project Glimmer aims to build self confidence in young women and adolescents, especially for the community living in impoverished environments. Project Glimmer
addresses: [null]

headline: Translators without Borders
short_description: Volunteering for those fluent in two languages!
content: Most volunteers work as translators for Translators without Borders. They must be fluent in at least one language other than their native language. Translators help with everything from medical texts to crisis response messages. Professionals are encouraged to apply, but volunteers need no experience other than being fluent. Register here to become a translator. If you want to be more involved, other volunteer roles for graphic designers, project managers, fundraising, and more need support are also available.
organization_description: Translators without Borders has a mission to help give people information and a means of communication no matter what language they speak. They help in important conversations in medical situations, crisis relief, resources for victims of violence and more.
addresses: [null]

headline: UPchieve
short_description: Be an Academic Coach to inspire youth!
content:
Become an Academic Coach for UPchieve! Help inspire and support students from low-income backgrounds to help them excel in school and continue on a path to college. 

Volunteers can work one-on-one with students to offer tutoring and college counseling. The volunteer program was created with flexible scheduling and no minimum time commitment. All you need to do to get started is input your available times. You will get a text if a student needs your help.

You can help students from anywhere with an internet connection, whether from your desk at work or the comfort of your couch! There is no video or audio. All interaction is through a chat box and interactive whiteboard!

Academic Coaches can participate in training courses and have an interactive coaching community for support and advice.

Other Helpful Info: Volunteers can be 13 and older and must pass the certification quiz to be eligible to teach that subject.

Photo and language courtesy of Maurissa Buster, UPchieve.
date_notes: Flexible scheduling
organization_description: Non profit giving academic support access to low-income students through free online tutoring and college counseling.
addresses: [null]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["13 years and older", "Must pass at least 1 subject course and quiz to tutor"]

headline: Dallas Pets Alive!
short_description: Hands on pet care and helping in the pet adoption process!
content:
Volunteer with Dallas Pets Alive for an opportunity to help with a range of tasks. Options include posting adoption profiles, adoption, and foster follow-up calls, hands-on help by caring for and cleaning up after cats and dogs, helping at special events, or even working in the thrift store! Volunteers under 15 must have an adult present and under 18 must have a waiver signed.

Register and fill out an online application here: Dallas Pets Alive Volunteer Application. There is then a training process, which includes one online session and two in person. Volunteers are encouraged to give time at least once a month. The $30 fee associated with becoming a volunteer covers the cost of onboarding and a volunteer t-shirt.
date_notes: Volunteers can choose any day, and are encouraged to volunteer atleast once a month!
organization_description: A no-kill animal shelter striving to have all cats and dogs adopted or fostered through their unique programs and marketing techniques.
addresses: ["Dallas, TX, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers 13-15 must have a parent or guardian with them", "Volunteers under 18 must have signed waiver"]

headline: DFW Humane Society
short_description: Care for shelter animals and assist in the adoption process!
content: There are various ways to volunteer with the DFW Humane Society, including walking, socializing and bathing dogs and cats, assisting in the adoption process and events, or working in administration. The shifts are flexible and there are opportunities to utilize special skills, like art and computer work. They ask that volunteers commit to a minimum of 40 hours a year, and registration and orientation is all online.
organization_description: DFW Humane Society is a no-kill animal shelter that cares for over 900 animals yearly until they find their home. They provide injured and sick pets with necessary medical treatment as well.
addresses: ["4140 Valley View Lane, Irving, TX, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Commit to 40 hours a year minimum", "Volunteers under 18 must have signed waiver"]

headline: The Love Pit Rescue

content: Volunteers at The Love Pit Rescue can work directly with the pit bulls in person or on other projects! Serve on the foster team, training team, or medical team based on your skill sets. There are also options to work on events, social media, transportation, design, adoption and more. After applying online, you will be contacted shortly to discuss your time commitment and interests.
date_notes: Days and hours change based on activity
organization_description: Non-profit dog rescue focused on saving pit bulls through rescue, training and eventually adoption.
addresses: ["2029 East Levee Street, Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: Books Between Kids

For group/corporate volunteer opportunities with Books Between Kids, use this form.
organization_description: This organization provides Houston's at-risk children with books to build their own home libraries.

organization_description: This organization provides under-resourced youth and their communities with technology access to help facilitate their growth and digital literacy.
addresses: ["1602 Airline Drive, Houston, TX 77009, USA"]

headline: Houston Arboretum & Nature Center
short_description: Help provide nature education!
content:
Volunteers can assist in four categories: administrative/clerical, conservation programs, education programs, and groups (corporate, school, service, etc.).

Estimated duration of activity: 4 hours

Group volunteering opportunities are available and resources to find out more can be accessed here. All group members should be at least 16 years old and the maximum group size is 30.

There is a $25 charge for all new volunteers. Volunteers receive a free 1-year membership, free parking, discounts at the Nature shop, and more!
organization_description: The Houston Arboretum & Nature Center is a nature sanctuary located on 155 acres of land and provides nature education facilities to children in the state of Texas.

headline: Target Hunger

Volunteers can help in the community garden, which grows 9,000 pounds of produce, with the education food fairs (repackaging produce, client intake, and more), in the warehouse, in the food pantry, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 3-6 hours

Group volunteering opportunities are available for groups with five or more individuals. The form is available here.
organization_description: Target Hunger works to provide food and other social service navigation programs to those in need. Some of their initiatives include the Food Fair Schedule (free+ fresh food at different locations throughout the month), monthly groceries (for families in need), and navigation services (connecting to community resources).

Volunteers can help with preparing food in the kitchen, help pack and sort foods in the warehouse, as well as develop enriching activities for children.

Corporate volunteering opportunities are available and sign up here.
organization_description: A member of Feeding America, the Houston Foodbank helps to distribute fresh foods, and prepare hot meals for individuals in Houston.

organization_description: The Coalition for the Homeless of Houston works to provide supportive resources to people experiencing homelessness to help them move into permanent housing.

headline: Homemade Hope

content:
Volunteers can help in a multitude of ways by volunteering to tutor, assisting with after-school cooking, chaperoning a field trip, creating an hour-long class/workshop on a hobby/skill (photography, art, etc.), and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 30 minutes - 3 hours
organization_description: Homemade Hope provides homeless and underserved children and families with cooking and nutrition education to help with self-confidence, encourage wellness, and allow them to experience the joy of family meals.
addresses: ["Southwest Houston, Houston, TX, USA"]

headline: United Service Organization of Houston
short_description: Help veterans and their families!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like Fleet Week, Veterans Week, deployments, and many more! You can also sign up to help at one of the various USO Centers across Houston. Sites in Houston are located at the Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH), Hobby Airport (HOU), Ellington Field Joint Reserve Base (EFJRB), and Military Entrance Processing Station (MEPS) USO Center.

organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families, and country through programs that strengthen those bonds.

headline: Dress for Success - Houston
short_description: Advise women's professional skills from interview to attire.
content:
Volunteers can give back to Houston's professional community by mentoring women about their resumes, interviewing skills, and career-building advice, as well as offering advice on how to "Dress for Success" by putting together optimal business attire. Volunteers can also help by spreading the word as outreach volunteers. There are also in-office options so volunteers can choose to empower women by professionally styling women personally, assisting in searching for jobs and preparing for interviews in person, working at the front desk or sorting and re-stocking clothing donations.

To volunteer, you must be over 18 with experience in an office-based industry. Volunteer efforts primarily take place over the phone or on video, but there is an opportunity to meet at the Austin office if you and your mentee choose to do so.

Photo Credit: Christine Torres
organization_description: Offers women the resources and mentoring programs to help them achieve financial independence and confidence in the workplace.
addresses: ["Dress for Success Houston, Eastside Street, Houston, TX, USA"]

headline: Dress for Success - Dallas
short_description: Advise women's professional skills from interview to attire.
content:
Volunteers can give back to the Dallas professional community by mentoring women about their resumes, interviewing skills, and career-building advice, as well as offering advice on how to "Dress for Success" by putting together optimal business attire. Volunteers can also help by spreading the word as outreach volunteers.

There are also in-office options so volunteers can choose to empower women by professionally styling women personally, assisting in searching for jobs and preparing for interviews in person, working at the front desk, or sorting and re-stocking clothing donations.

To volunteer, you must be over 18 with experience in an office-based industry. Volunteer efforts primarily take place over the phone or on video, but there is an opportunity to meet in person if you and your mentee choose.

If you were looking for a group volunteer opportunity, there are additional paid options through Dress for Success website.
date_notes: Flexible scheduling
organization_description: Offers women the resources and mentoring programs to help them achieve financial independence and confidence in the workplace.
addresses: ["Dress for Success Dallas, Peterson Lane, Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: SCPA of Wake County
short_description: Help animals find their forever homes!
content:
There are both short-term and long-term opportunities available to volunteers. Volunteers can help at the Admission (Holding) Center and the Pet Adoption Center and can help with various activities.

Volunteers must commit to at least 25 hours a year which is one shift a month.

Volunteers must attend an orientation and sign a waiver before volunteering.
organization_description: SCPA of Wake County is an animal welfare organization that help transform the lives of pets and people through protection, care, education, and adoption.

headline: Second Chance Pet Adoptions
short_description: Help pets find their forever homes!
content:
Volunteers can help clean cat rooms, wash dogs, with administrative needs, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 1-5 hours

Volunteers must attend volunteer orientation training prior to volunteering.
organization_description: Second Chance Pet Adoptions works to find healthy/ treatable homeless dogs and cats their forever home. They are on a mission to reduce the rates of homeless animals.
addresses: ["6003 Chapel Hill Road suite 133, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA"]

headline: Read and Feed
short_description: Help underserved elementary school students!
content:
Volunteers can work in many different capacities. They can work as tutors, and mobile classroom drivers, help pick up/deliver food, help with office/administration, help prepare the mobile classroom, deliver materials, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 1-3 hours

Volunteers must attend a training session prior to the first shift.
organization_description: Read and Feed works to strengthen the literacy skills of underserved elementary school children. They also provide meals in their after-school programs.
addresses: ["171-10 High House Road, Cary, NC 27511, USA"]

headline: Durham Literacy Center
short_description: Help adult learners in Durham!
content:
Volunteers can help with different programs in the organizations, which are the ESOL Program, Adult Literacy Program, and YAP Program.

Estimated duration of activity: 30 minutes - 5 hours

Volunteers must attend a training session prior to the first shift.
organization_description: The Durham Literacy Center helps adults and teens achieve their learning-centered goals. They teach adults how to read and write, prepare out-of-school youth and adult learners to pass high school, and more!
addresses: ["1905 Chapel Hill Rd, Durham, NC 27707, USA"]

headline: NC Green Power
short_description: Help with the environment around North Carolina!
content:
Volunteers can help reach out to the public at various events and provide education about initiatives by NC Greenpower and ways to improve the environment.

Volunteers should have good public speaking skills!
organization_description: NC Green Power works to improve the environment in North Carolina by supporting renewable energy, providing grants for solar installation, and more!
addresses: ["Raleigh Office, 909 Capability Drive, Raleigh, NC 27606, USA"]

headline: Girls Empowerment Network - Dallas
short_description: Work directly with positive programming for young girls.
content:
Use your experience, knowledge and advice to help empower young girls.

Volunteering with the Girls Empowerment Network's Girl Connect Program lets volunteers work directly with girls to guide them with positive programming. Volunteers commit to weekly meetings for a full semester of school. This program is held in Houston, Austin, Central Texas, Dallas and San Antonio. If you are looking to make a difference but can't make that commitment, volunteers can also write Relatable Role Model Letters. These are page-long letters to connect girls all over the place to inspiring and uplifting volunteers. Volunteers are asked to hand write at least five different letters and decorate them as they wish. Other volunteer tasks include administrative work, community outreach, big events, and fundraising events.

Photo Courtesy of Girls Empowerment Network
date_notes: Opportunities on school days or on own time
organization_description: Works with Texas girls grades 3rd-12th to help them discover they are powerful and become confident in their ability to succeed as individuals. The organization was founded in Austin TX by mothers who wanted to address the decline in self esteem they saw in young girls, and wanted to combat that before seeing its effects.
addresses: ["Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: Friends of State Parks - North Carolina
short_description: Help maintain the State Parks of North Carolina!
content: Volunteers can help in many different positions, including ground workers (mowing grass, etc.), park attendants, bird specialists, natural resource interpreters, and more!
organization_name: Friends of State Parks- North Carolina
organization_description: Friends of State Parks helps support the North Carolina park system and helps build programs and other initiatives that governments cannot put into action.
addresses: ["North Carolina, USA"]

headline: Girls Empowerment Network - Austin
short_description: Work directly with young girls with positive programming.
content:
Use your experience, knowledge and advice to help empower young girls.

Volunteering with the Girls Empowerment Network's Girl Connect Program lets volunteers work directly with girls to guide them with positive programming. Volunteers commit to weekly meetings for a full semester of school. This program is held in Houston, Austin, Central Texas, Dallas and San Antonio. If you are looking to make a difference but can't make that commitment, volunteers can also write Relatable Role Model Letters. These are page-long letters to connect girls all over the place to inspiring and uplifting volunteers. Volunteers are asked to hand write at least five different letters and decorate them as they wish. Other volunteer tasks include administrative work, community outreach, big events, and fundraising events.

Photo Courtesy of Girls Empowerment Network
date_notes: Opportunities on school days or on own time
organization_description: Works with Texas girls grades 3rd-12th to help them discover they are powerful and become confident in their ability to succeed as individuals. The organization was founded in Austin TX by mothers who wanted to address the decline in self esteem they saw in young girls, and wanted to combat that before seeing its effects.
addresses: ["Girls Empowerment Network, South Interstate 35 Frontage Road, Austin, TX, USA"]

content:
Use your experience, knowledge and advice to help empower young girls.

addresses: ["Girls Empowerment Network, Beechnut Street, Houston, TX, USA"]

headline: Inter-Faith Food Shuttle
short_description: Help teach those in need how to make nutritious meals!
content:
Volunteers can assist in different areas of interest, including agriculture, community health education, hunger relief, food recovery and distribution, agriculture education, and administration.

Estimated duration of activity: 1-4 hours

Group volunteering is available and can be accessed here.
organization_description: Inter-Faith Food Shuttle works to feed, teach, and grow. They feed children, families, and seniors in need. They teach individuals skills on how to cook, garden, and cook healthy on a budget. They grow fresh produce on their farms and help others grow their own produce.
addresses: ["1001 Blair Drive suite 120, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA"]

headline: Food Bank of Central and Eastern North Carolina
short_description: Help provide food to those in need!
content: Volunteers can choose to help in different branches, including the Raleigh branch, Durham branch, Greenville branch, New Bern branch, Sandhills branch, and Wilmington branch. Volunteers can help with food drives, in the warehouse, in the community gardens, and more!
organization_name: Food Bank of Central and Eastern North Carolina
organization_description: The Food Bank of Central and Eastern North Carolina works to feed those facing hunger in 34 counties. They feed those in need through their various food distribution programs and child nutrition programs.
addresses: ["1924 Capital Blvd", "2700 Angier Ave suite a"]

headline: Raleigh Rescue Mission
short_description: Help those suffering from homelessness!
content: Volunteers can provide assistance as administrative assistants, mentors, help with children's ministry support, and more!
organization_description: Raleigh Rescue Mission works to provide homeless men, women, and children with shelter and more! This organization works to help others through their faith and belief in Jesus Christ.
addresses: ["314 E Hargett St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA"]

headline: Durham Rescue Mission
short_description: Help the homeless in Durham!
content:
Volunteers can help serve meals, help with special events, become daycare volunteers, volunteer at a thrift store, and more!

Daycare volunteers must undergo a background check and are responsible for the cost.
