organization_description: The Durham Rescue Mission works to provide men, women, and children a safe shelter and other services and programs such as food, addiction recovery programs, job placement programs, and more!
addresses: ["1201 East Main Street, Durham, NC, USA"]

headline: Vets To Vets United, Inc.
short_description: Help connect veterans to service animals!
content: Volunteers can help by assisting with office tasks, fostering and training dogs, building/repairing training equipment, and more! View the volunteer handbook to see which positions might be right for you and the volunteer requirements.
organization_description: This organization works to connect veterans with service dogs to give them a campanionship and help with any mental/physical disabilities. Service dogs can help veterans suffering from depression, PTSD, and more.
addresses: ["2510 Glendale Ave, Durham, NC 27704, U.S."]

headline: Fortress Fort Worth
short_description: Mentoring and tutoring for kids in need.
content:
There are so many great volunteer options for both ongoing and one-time needs. Commit to volunteering on a regular basis as a mentor to 4th graders for up to two years, tutoring, preschool assistant teaching, photographers, and more. A great opportunity for all ages is the reading program, where kids or adults can read to younger students! Check out the website for special events volunteering, which changes seasonally. There is always some kind of donation drive, auction, carnival, or more for the community to participate in.

Photo Courtesy of Fortress FW
date_notes: Most opportunities fall on school days, but not all
organization_description: Provides resources in education, social and emotional skills for kids and families in poverty through various assistance programs.
addresses: ["Fortress, East Terrell Avenue, Fort Worth, TX, USA"]

headline: Tarrant Literacy Coalition
short_description: Adult literacy volunteers work in tutoring and mentoring.
content:
Volunteers can work directly with adults in literacy programs through tutoring and mentorship programs. Volunteers lead a class following a designated curriculum. There is training before teaching, and prior experience with teaching/tutoring is helpful but not needed. There are also options with fewer time constraints, including childcare help, serving snacks or meals to students, registering students, marketing and outreach and more.

Photo Courtesy of Tarrant Literacy Coalition
date_notes: Schedule times that work for you
organization_description: Advocates and educates on adult literacy through programming to improve the lives of Adult Texans with insufficient math and reading skills.
addresses: ["Tarrant Literacy Coalition, Southwest Boulevard, Fort Worth, TX, USA"]

headline: Veterans Life Center North Carolina
short_description: Help at-risk veterans!
content: Volunteers can help with special projects, share their skills, provide veterans service for a period of time, work as mentors, and more!
organization_description: Veterans Life Center North Carolina works to provide at-risk veterans with services and programs to avoid them from falling into crisis (homelessness, incarceration, suicide, etc.)
addresses: ["1005 9th St, Butner, NC 27509, USA"]

headline: Nest Academy RVA
short_description: Help young adult learners with disabilities!
content:
There is a range of remote volunteering opportunities available. Help sew upcycled tote bags (materials can be picked up), be a guest speaker, help with virtual office support, provide classroom support, and more!

Estimated duration of activity: 1-6 hours
organization_description: Nest Academiny RVA is a day program that provides an inclusive learning environment for young adults with special needs.
addresses: ["2101 Maywill Street, Richmond, VA, USA"]

headline: Hunger Busters
short_description: Packaging and distributing food to food insecure students.
content: Hunger Busters holds Food Box Distribution events outside of their kitchens from Monday-Saturday for volunteers looking to assist in the donation process. At these drives, families come for fresh food boxes to take home. Volunteers help with vehicle traffic control, registration, loading vehicles with food, and cleanup at the site. Events run rain or shine from 10 am-3 pm. Before Covid, there were also volunteer shifts in the kitchen, preparing and packaging food for students, and Hunger Busters hopes to return to that point soon. To volunteer, email LPHILLIPS@HUNGERBUSTERS.COM.
organization_description: Hunger Busters provides a third meal to food insecure students in the Dallas area through after school programming and direct work with schools. Meals served are healthy, fresh and made daily to help fuel and recharge students.
addresses: ["Food Foundation DBA- Hunger Busters, Sylvan Avenue, Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: 24 Hour Club
short_description: Help with clothing donations and mentorship programs.
content: Volunteers work directly with the members of the 24-Hour Club through mentorship and service. They need help with the Clothing Closet, so volunteers sort through donations and label and organize items. They are also in need of a Front Desk Volunteer to greet guests and residents and assist with questions. These opportunities run daily in 3-hour shifts from 8 am-5:30 pm. Volunteers fill out the application and have a brief interview and orientation process. As you get more involved with the Dallas 24-Hour Club, mentorship opportunities may present themselves.
organization_description: Provides services on transitional living and essential life skills for alcoholics and addicts experiencing homelessness, with the goal of long-term sobriety and integration into the community as a self supporting member.
addresses: ["Dallas 24 Hour Club, Ross Avenue, Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: Families to Freedom
short_description: Saving victims of abuse using your time or expertise.
content:
Volunteers assist in all ways to help the victims get to a safe space. The most high-demand position is a volunteer driver, who picks up survivors from a safe pickup location to a new home or city with a shelter. This can include multi-state trips, drives ranging from an hour to a day, and driving at night. Vehicle and travel expenses are taken care of and volunteers choose their days and range of travel. Positions that don't involve travel include car seat cleaners, who make donated car seats like new again, vehicle mechanics if you have professional skills in this field, or fleet management, who clean and manage vehicles owned by Families to Freedom. Volunteers must be over 21, and you can email volunteer@FamiliestoFreedom.org to get involved.

Photo Courtesy of Families to Freedom
date_notes: Completely flexible scheduling
organization_description: Families to Freedom supports and transports victims of domestic abuse to safety to get them away from their abusers and off of the streets. They also work to counsel and support the families and children to break the cycle of abuse.
addresses: ["Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: Soldier's Angels - Dallas
short_description: Send baked goods and letters to warm a soldier's day!
content: The Soldier's Angels organization exists to provide resources to active military, veterans and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all. You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and more. This can all be done from home, so it's a great activity to do with your kids! Register online to be a "Team Angel" here, and from there, select your baking opportunity!
date_notes: Virtual and remote activities can fit your schedule!
organization_description: Soldier's Angels works to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: Veteran Women's Enterprise Center
short_description: Help women veterans grow professionally and personally.
content: Volunteers work with military women to help them grow with professional and personal workshops. Areas of volunteering include helping with pro bono professional services, mentoring, leading meditation, guidance on finding inexpensive meals and more. Volunteers also work on the administration side with clerical work, technology, marketing, public relations and community outreach. There are opportunities for volunteers of all skill sets to help in the goal of the Veteran Women's Enterprise Center.
date_notes: Plan meetings with mentees to fit your schedule!
organization_description: Empowers women who are veterans, current military, and military spouses to work in the entrepreneur field by giving professional and personal resources to succeed.
addresses: ["4900 S Lancaster Rd, Dallas, TX, USA"]

headline: Dress for Success - Phoenix
short_description: Advise women's professional skills from interview to attire.
content:
Volunteers can give back to the Phoenix professional community by mentoring women about their resumes, interviewing skills, and career-building advice, as well as offering advice on how to "Dress for Success" by putting together optimal business attire. Volunteers can also help by spreading the word as outreach volunteers.

There are also in-office options so volunteers can choose to empower women by professionally styling women personally, assisting in searching for jobs and preparing for interviews in person, working at the front desk or sorting and re-stocking clothing donations.

To volunteer, you must be over 18 with experience in an office-based industry. Volunteer efforts primarily take place over the phone or on video, but there is an opportunity to meet at the Phoenix office if you and your mentee choose to do so.

If you were looking for a group volunteer opportunity, there are additional paid options through Dress for Success website.
organization_description: Offers women the resources and mentoring programs to help them achieve financial independence and confidence in the workplace.
addresses: ["1024 East Buckeye Road, Phoenix, AZ, USA"]

headline: Soldier's Angels Phoenix
short_description: Send baked goods and letters to warm a soldier's day!
content: The Soldier's Angels organization exists to provide resources to active military, veterans and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all. You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and more. This can all be done from home, so it's a great activity to do with your kids! Register online to be a "Team Angel" here, and from there select your baking opportunity!
date_notes: Virtual and remote activities can fit your schedule!
organization_description: Soldier's Angels works to provide resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["Phoenix, AZ, USA"]

headline: UMOM
short_description: Aid, tutor and mentor families at the UMOM shelter.
content: Volunteers with UMOM work primarily on their missions of improving education through their Read To Me and Mentorship programs. Volunteers can read to children aged 4-12 at the UMOM family shelter to promote literacy through one-on-one interactions. Sign-ups are on the website's volunteer page https://umom.org/volunteer/. The mentor program allows volunteers to work with small groups for organized activities and less structured hangouts, so they have a Big Brother or Sister to talk to. Those interested in the Mentorship Program should email volunteer@umom.org. Other ways to get involved are advocating for UMOM and attending events and drives.
date_notes: Reading program is from 6-8pm on select days, other opportunities are more flexible for scheduling
organization_description: Volunteer based organization with a mission to end homelessness at the root of the problem through improving education, offering healthcare, professional training workshops and more.
addresses: ["UMOM NEW DAY CENTERS, East Van Buren Street, Phoenix, AZ, USA"]

headline: Children's Reading Foundation of Phoenix
short_description: Donate, deliver and read books to Phoenix kids!
content: Those interested in supporting the foundation's mission of encouraging kids to read early can volunteer to read to kids, deliver books, support events, or help in the office. There is something for everyone to do for flexible schedules and different levels of commitment. Fill out the contact page to express your interest in volunteering.
organization_description: Promotes reading early by educating and encouraging families, schools and communities to be involved in young students success.
addresses: ["3104 E Camelback Rd, Phoenix, AZ, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering available for children 10 and up with waiver and accompanying adult."]

headline: AZ Sustainable Alliance
short_description: Community-based research and conservation projects.
content: Volunteers all across Arizona work on community-based projects focusing on sustainability practices. Whether you have your own projects to start based on conservation, renewable energy, food systems, or education, or want to join a project that has already begun, all volunteers can make a difference doing so. Choose your priority areas of interest from that list, and select which organizational skills you have to be paired with the right project.
date_notes: Work on projects when it is convenient!
organization_description: Non profit advocacy alliance with a mission to create and support sustainability solutions in Arizona through community projects.
addresses: ["Phoenix, AZ, USA"]

headline: Keep PHX Beautiful
short_description: Phoenix park and neighborhood cleanups!
content: Keep Phoenix Beautiful volunteers can work towards cleaning, greening, and beautifying parks in their backyard to make it a more enjoyable and healthy place to live. Most volunteer activities are big park clean-ups, where you can join your community for a couple of hours to work to give back to your environment. Recently, they have begun a #MyBeautifulPHx campaign for volunteers to gather in small, Covid safe groups. Sign up at the information page to get your cleanup kit to get started! All volunteer activities are listed on the volunteer match website.
date_notes: Cleanup kits can be used anytime!
organization_description: Keep Phoenix Beautiful is a non profit affiliate of Keep America Beautiful. The organization promotes preservation and protection of the Phoenix environment through the help of volunteers to make it a healthy, safe and pretty place to live, and improving the resident's quality of life.
addresses: ["Phoenix, AZ, USA"]

headline: United Food Bank
short_description: Sort, package and serve food donations to Arizona families.
content: Volunteers provide food for Arizona families by sorting donations, packaging emergency food bags, serving at food distributions and more. There are options for kids 5 to 15 to volunteer with an adult accompanying and 16 and older to volunteer independently. There are also group options for up to 15 people. Most volunteer activities occur at the food bank and volunteer center in Mesa, AZ, but events can be mobile for groups and companies.
date_notes: Time varies by day, check sign ups!
organization_description: United Food Bank provides 300,000 pounds of food a week to food insecure families in Arizona through food drives, community donations and packaged meals.
addresses: ["United Food Bank Volunteer Center, East Javelina Avenue, Mesa, AZ, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["5-15 years old must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: US VETS Phoenix
short_description: Serve vets with meals, mentorship, events and more.
content: Volunteer opportunities for individuals, small groups and corporations can choose between meal serving and delivery, working in the donation drive, mentorship, or special holiday events. While applying, choose your preferred activity and list in the box the time commitment you are looking for, as well as the ages of each volunteer. After applying, you will hear back with opportunities shortly.
date_notes: Opportunities for any time of the day!
organization_description: US VETS Phoenix has provided housing, workforce development and case management services to over 10,000 veterans over the past 20 years.
addresses: ["3507 North Central Avenue, Phoenix, AZ, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Reading Connections
short_description: Weekly tutoring online and more!
content: The primary way to get involved in Reading Connection is through online tutoring. Tutors meet with students of all ages on Zoom for two to four hours a week, with a one-year commitment. There is no prior teaching experience required, and lessons and programming are provided. Other virtual volunteer opportunities include student intake assistants, who work with incoming students, career coaches, who support adult students looking for employment, and family literacy volunteers who give elementary-aged kids resources and help.
date_notes: Schedule times that work for you
organization_description: Reading connection advocates for education and works towards improved literacy, with a specific focus on volunteers working with adults on reading and career advancement.
addresses: [null]

headline: Color A Smile
short_description: All ages can color a drawing to make those in need smile!
content: Volunteers of any age can work with Color a Smile by printing a coloring page from the website and coloring it in, or drawing your own unique piece! Sign the drawing with your name and age, and mail it to Color A Smile PO Box 1516 Morristown, NJ 07962-1516. Volunteers can receive a letter of validation for their volunteer work for 10 minutes for each drawing sent.
date_notes: Draw any day and anytime!
organization_description: Color a Smile builds a positive community through sending cheerful drawings to senior citizens, overseas troops, and anyone else needing an uplifting letter in the mail.
addresses: [null]

headline: Operation Gratitude
short_description: Letter writing, survival bracelets and care package making!
content: Volunteer with Operation Gratitude from anywhere. There are multiple options to make a difference, from letter writing, making paracord survival bracelets, donating beanie babies (a signature addition in all Operation Gratitude's packages) or even holding a collection drive. The care packages sent out wouldn't be possible without the help of volunteers nationwide. To get involved in any of these opportunities, check here for specific instructions and addresses to send your work.
date_notes: Remote activities can be completed whenever!
organization_description: Express gratitude to military and first responders through sending care packages created by a community of volunteers.
addresses: [null]

headline: PAWS Chicago
short_description: Help homeless and abused pets find forever homes!
content:
PAWS Chicago helps to house unwanted, stray or abused animals around the Chicago area, gives them necessary medical care and works to find them forever homes!

Volunteers are welcome at all of the pet centers run by PAWS. You can help out with daily tasks around the shelters like cleaning cages, helping out on the administrative side, walking dogs, socializing with shy cats and dogs, conducting outreach around the community and so many other things to help support PAWS' mission!

All you need to do is select the PAWS location you would like to volunteer at and then fill out a volunteer interest form and a member of the PAWS volunteer team will be in touch to give you more information about completing your volunteer orientation! Kids who are 12 - 17 are able to volunteer at the Medical Center with a parent or guidance chaperone. Junior volunteers can apply through a separate volunteer application. 

Hours and days of the week vary depending on what opportunity you select. All information on days and times will be provided on the event page. Groups are also welcome! Please email volunteer1@pawschicago.org to schedule a date and time for your group to volunteer.
date_notes: Times and days of the week will be provided
organization_description: A no-kill shelter serving the dog and cat population around Chicago. They work to help limit the stray population by implementing community wide care practices and education about spaying and neutering animals.
addresses: ["1997 North Clybourn Avenue, Chicago, IL, USA", "3516 W 26th St, Chicago, IL, USA"]

headline: Tree House Humane Society
short_description: Providing homes to cats around Chicago.
content:
Calling all cat lovers and people wanting to help homeless and unwanted cats! Tree House Humane Society works to provide homes, care and medical attention to cats across Chicago.

Volunteers can participate in so many different facets of Tree House! Volunteer positions are always being updated or added to their volunteer portal, so make sure to check back regularly to see new positions! Volunteers can help with guest relations, adoption events, and as adoption counselors to help inform potential adopters, educate the community about veterinary resources and help guests have an overall enjoyable experience. Volunteers are also able to help around the facility to care for cats, clean up enclosures or play spaces or help to socialize shy or frightened cats. Volunteers can also help out at community events and take photos of outdoor cats to help with population assessment. 

Please fill out a volunteer application and indicate which opportunity you would like to participate in. More information about positions, roles, times and responsibilities can be found through this link. Most volunteering opportunities are for ages 18+, but children ages 7 - 17 are able to with adults who volunteer as a Caregiver. 

Other helpful info: Groups of 20 or less are welcome! Please fill out a group interest form at least four weeks in advance of desired volunteering date. Some events will take place around the community. If you wish to become involved with one of those opportunities, information will be available before the volunteering date. Please wear comfortable clothing that you do not mind getting dirty. Depending on the role, please bring layers and dress according to the anticipated weather conditions.
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: Tree House Humane Society is a cat-focused animal shelter that works to provide homes, care and potential adoption opportunties for cats around Chicago.
addresses: ["7225 N Western Ave, Chicago, IL 60645, USA"]

headline: Chicago Youth Centers - College and Career Workshops
short_description: Help students prepare for life after high school!
content:
Are you looking for a way to help underserved students have an equitable chance to succeed in college and find a career? If so, Chicago Youth Centers College and Career Workshops are a great chance to inspire youth to continue towards their goals.

Volunteers are welcome to help teach students through the College and Career Readiness Workshops! These virtual learning opportunities are meant to expose students and young adults to various careers and places of work and allow volunteers of any career or educational background help students as they move into the future.

Interested volunteers, please fill out this Volunteer Interest Application and indicate your area of expertise and how frequently you would like to volunteer. Once this is completed, you will be contacted by a volunteer team member with orientation information about creating presentations and when your opportunity to volunteer will be. Group opportunities are available to present with a small group from your community or workplace!

Other helpful info: Most sessions are one hour long. Volunteer opportunities are available on both weekdays and weekends. You can volunteer on a one-time basis or on a regular schedule.
date_notes: Coordinated with mentee
organization_description: Chicago Youth Centers uses their resources to support youth in underserved communities so that they may have an equitable chance to thrive in school and a career. Programs focus on educational support and college and career readiness!
addresses: ["Chicago, IL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have graduated from college/ university with 4 year degree.", "Required", "Volunteers must be business professionals"]

headline: Chicago HOPES for Kids
short_description: School year and summertime tudors needed!
content:
Volunteers are needed after school and during the summer to help underserved Chicago youth stay in school and excel in their classes. Chicago HOPES for Kids inspires its students by placing them with tutors and mentors.

Volunteers can assist in a variety of programs that support the continued education of children in homeless shelters. The After School Program works with children in grades K - 5 after school to help them with homework, curriculum support and just to be a friend. The Literacy Leaders Program focuses on supporting reading and improving reading levels for children in homeless shelters. Working to help build reading skills and a love of reading through weekly tutoring sessions. 

If you are interested in getting involved, you must first attend an information session. Once you sign up and attend an information session, you can submit an application, mandatory paperwork and background check. Once you finish those required steps, you will attend a virtual orientation and be able to start volunteering!

Other Helpful Info: Once you have completed your onboarding, you will have access to the shelter locations. All volunteers must be able to commit to weekly 2-hour sessions during the school year.
date_notes: Mostly Afterschool
organization_description: Chicago Hopes for Kids provides educational programs throughout the school year and summer for children experiencing homelessness, or living in homeless shelters. So that they may continue their education and offer themselves an equitable future in school.
addresses: ["Chicago, IL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["2 hours weekly during school year", "Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Required"]

headline: Midtown Educational Foundation
short_description: Tutors needed for Chicago youth!
content:
Offering tutoring, career advice and other enriching services, Midtown Educational Foundation works to support both youth and adult community members around Chicago.

Volunteers can help out regularly in schools around Chicago. They will be paired with a student and meet weekly to help with homework, tutor on specific subjects and help prepare for quizzes and tests. They are also responsible for calling the student's parents or guardians so families can also work to support their child's educational development.

Please complete and submit and volunteer interest application and a volunteer team member will reach out to schedule your volunteer orientation training. If regular tutoring is not for you, you might be interested in putting together a group for a volunteer opportunity. Volunteer groups can help out at the facility by conducting maintenance projects or being career speakers for the foundation's students. Please submit a group interest application.

Other Helpful Information: Individual volunteers must be available to meet and tutor students throughout an academic semester. Tutors will be matched with a student of the same gender. Male tutor opportunities are only for grades 4th - 6th on Mondays and Wednesdays from 6 pm - 8 pm and Saturdays from 10 am - 12 pm. Female opportunities are available for grades 4th - 6th on Mondays from 6 pm - 8 pm, 7th - 9th on Wednesdays from 6 pm - 8 pm, and 10th - 12th on Tuesdays from 6 pm - 8 pm.
date_notes: Times vary depending on age and gender of students
organization_description: Midtown Educational Foundations provides educational and life-enriching services to the low-income urban neighbors around Chicago. Offering tutoring services, mentors, career advice and other enrichment opportunties, students are supported to succeed in school and be prepared for college or a career after high school.
addresses: ["718 South Loomis Street, Chicago, IL 60607, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["2 hours weekly during school year", "Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Required"]

headline: Alliance for the Great Lakes - Adopt-a-Beach
short_description: Get outside and clean up Chicago's shoreline!
content:
Alliance for the Great Lakes - Adopt-a-Beach volunteer opportunity is a great opportunity to recruit your friends or family to clean up trash on Chicago's beautiful shorelines!

Volunteers can get involved by signing up to participate in an Adopt-A-Beach beach clean-up along the shoreline of Lake Michigan! Bring yourself, your family or your colleagues to collect litter and help scientists by recording the types of litter collected. You will improve the habitat for wildlife and preserve the local natural beauty. All you have to do is visit the Find An Event portal and select a clean-up event near you. You will be able to register and receive location and time information all on the specific event page.

Other Helpful Info: Groups of all shapes and sizes are welcome to join! All locations, mostly on Lake Michigan, and meet-up information will be listed on the event registration page. Please remember that these events are outside in varying weather conditions.
date_notes: Varies with event!
organization_description: The Alliance for the Great Lakes works across the Great Lakes region to protect and restore the crucial habitat in and around the lakes, advocates for legislative support of the lakes, and educates the public about why the Great Lakes are so important to take care of.
addresses: ["South Chicago Beach Drive, Chicago, IL, USA"]

headline: Citizens for Conservation
short_description: Help preserve natural landscapes!
content:
If you want an excuse to get out and give back to your community, join Citizens for Conservation on their twice-weekly workdays throughout the year.

Volunteers can help to restore natural habitats around the Barrington area by helping to remove invasive species, plant native plants, clean up streams and other natural areas, and collect seeds for native plant propagation. Please visit the CFC events calendar to select a date and event that interests you. In the fall, Thursdays and Saturdays are days to collect seeds and are great opportunities to get the entire family involved!

Other Helpful Info: Volunteers and groups no longer have to pre-register, but they ask that you email Kevin, kevin.scheiwiller@citizensforconservation.org in advance to let him know how many people will be joining. Specific worksite information will be available on the specific event you wish to participate in. Please bring a pair of gloves and dress appropriately for the weather.
organization_description: Working with volunteers and donors, Citizens for Conservation, strives to restore and conserve the natural landscapes around Illinois. They also conduct educational outreach to teach children and adults how to be good environmental stewards, and protect natural areas for future generations.
addresses: ["Barrington, IL, USA"]

headline: Greater Chicago Food Depository
short_description: Help feed the hungry around Chicago!
content:
Help to address the food insecurity crisis across Chicago neighborhoods and support underserved community members.

By helping to provide groceries and teach classes about cooking and growing vegetables with the Greater Chicago Food Depository, you can make a substantial impact in your community.

Volunteer opportunities are available for families, groups and individuals, ranging from sorting and repacking food donations, helping to distribute food around underserved communities on the Fresh truck, driving packs of food to various delivery locations, and helping out at one of the many events around the Chicago area. One Saturday a month is Kids Day when children ages 5 - 11 are invited to help in the Repack Warehouse.

Create an account through their volunteer portal, and you can select the opportunity you want to participate in. Once you select your opportunity, the project lead will reach out with day-of information for your volunteering opportunity!

The exact time and day of the week will be available when you sign up for your opportunity. You must be vaccinated against COVID-19 and complete a brief volunteer training the day you are volunteering.
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: Greater Chicago Food Depository works to feed the hungry around Chicago as well as partner with organizations to teach about healthy eating, provide healthy food options and offer training opportunties for careers in hospitality and industry to all of the greater Chicago community
addresses: ["Chicago, IL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["11 - 15 years old must have a parent or guardian", "Must show proof of vaccination"]

headline: Nourishing HOPE
short_description: Offering support to at-risk and underserved communities.
content:
Nourishing Hope works to help our Chicago neighbors overcome hunger, improve mental wellness, and build for the future.

Formerly known as Lakeview Pantry, it is a dynamic social services organization providing food, mental wellness counseling and other social services, such as job and housing assistance. Nourishing Hope strives to serve the needs of the whole person — with respect and dignity, always.

This is a great opportunity for a group or family to be able to give back within your community! Volunteers are able to help to feed people facing food insecurity around the greater Chicago area. As a Nourishing Hope volunteer, you are able to help to sort donations, prep and distribute food, and so much more!

Registering to volunteer is fast and easy. Visit nourishinghopechi.org/volunteer to sign up and review the virtual orientation.

Other Helpful Info: A variety of volunteering opportunities take place at each site location. Children who are 9 - 12 years old are welcome to volunteer with Online Market Packing, Home Delivery Prep and Packing, Saturday Hub Restock and Glean as long as they have a parent or as their guardian with them. Children who are 12 - 15 are able to volunteer with any program with a guardian's supervision. Once you register, you will have more information on locations and opportunities. Must be vaccinated against COVID-19 and wear a face mask during volunteering. For groups, please email aliya.prescott@nourishinghopechi.org for more information.
date_notes: Time and Date are dependent on activity
organization_description: Nourishing Hope works to support the underserved and needy populations of Chicago by offering meals and general food distribution services as well as social service to support mental wellness and family health across all neighborhoods in Chicago
addresses: ["1716 West Hubbard Street, Chicago, IL, USA", "3533 West North Avenue, Chicago, IL, USA", "3945 North Sheridan Road, Chicago, IL, USA", "5151 N Ravenswood Ave, Chicago, IL 60640, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must show proof of vaccination", "Volunteering for ages 9 and older."]

headline: The Honeycomb Project
short_description: Give back with your whole family!
content:
The Honeycomb Project is a great way to get out in the community with your loved ones and inspire your kids (or yourself!) to continue to support and give back to those in need.

Families can be involved in many volunteer opportunities supporting various projects around the greater Chicago area! Kids of all ages can work in food banks by sorting and preparing meals, managing community fridges through the Love Fridge program, helping to sort school supplies, cleaning up a beach or nature preserve, and putting crafting skills to work by sewing blankets and other comfort items!

Create a My Hive account for yourself or your entire family. Then select the opportunity that you are most interested in! Once you sign up for an event, a Honeycomb Project event leader will reach out with event day details!

Other Helpful Info: All volunteering opportunities are suitable for kids of all ages. That said, kids ages five and up are most suitable for service days. These giveback opportunities take place in various locations around Chicago. You will find location information on the specific event page!

Photo courtesy of The Honeycomb Project
date_notes: Dates and Time vary depending on activity!
organization_description: The Honeycomb Project works to inspire children to continue to giveback in their communities by offering opportunties for them to assist in a variety of social causes. From food banks to beach clean-ups, kids and their families are able to give time through helping their community and community members
addresses: ["Chicago, IL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["All ages welcome!", "Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: JOURNEYS: The Road Home
short_description: Help offer support to those experiencing homelessness!
content:
JOURNEYS: The Road Home allows all individuals to take shelter, grab a hot meal and access medical and mental health services.

Are you looking for a way to help people experiencing homelessness or personal crisis across Chicago? Volunteers can help with various volunteer opportunities that support the members of the shelter. Volunteers can work at the shelter's front desk, answering emails and phone calls and helping with meals. You can also work in either the Food Pantry or the Clothing Closet to help sort donations and put together packs to be delivered by the Mobile Delivery volunteers. For bike lovers, Journeys has a bike repair shop for all shelter members where you can give back time to help repair bikes used by community members.

All you need to do to start helping register for a volunteer orientation. Once that has been completed, you can sign up for a shift to help! Kids can help in the Food Pantry and Clothing Closet, sorting and packing donations - as long as a parent or guardian accompanies minors.

Other Helpful Info: Groups can help at special events by contacting volunteer@journeystheroadhome.org with group numbers and interests at least one month in advance. Once you create an account and complete your orientation, more information will be available!
date_notes: Dates and times vary depending on activity
organization_description: JOURNEYS: The Road Home provides both shelter and social serves to those experiencing homeless or at high risk of becoming homeless in the neighborhoods North of Chicago. They offer shelter and support so that all community members can get the help the deserve.
addresses: ["1140 East Northwest Highway, Palatine, Illinois 60074, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Pritzker Military Museum - Oral History Project
short_description: Help interview veterans!
content:
If you are a history buff or know one, the Pritzker Military Museum Oral History Project is a chance to learn about history directly from veterans.

Volunteers can help with the Holt Oral History Program by identifying candidates to share their stories, interviews with veterans, research about particular wars, and help with transcribing interviews for visitors to the museum. To volunteer, you must submit your resume and cover letter about why you want to help with the Oral History Program to khiltwein@pritzkermilitary.org. They will be in touch if they feel it is a good fit!

Once you are in touch with the volunteer coordinator, they will give you more information about the timeframe and dates for you to help with the oral history program.
organization_description: The Pritzker Military Museum works to educate the public of Chicago and nationally about the history of wars, who fought in them and the importance of nation security. Through innovate and hands-on programs, the Museum is able to teach people of all ages about our nation's history and the heroes who keep our country safe.
addresses: ["104 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60603, USA"]

headline: Kids Above All
short_description: Help to support military spouses and kids!
content:
Lend a hand and act as a mentor to either active duty or veteran spouses or children through Kids Above All.

Volunteers can educate or act as a mentor to military families who are members of the Kids Above All communities. These participants would either be currently active duty military or veterans spouses and their children. Volunteers would be responsible for teaching the paired mentee about financial literacy, career paths, resume building, how to search for a job effectively, and many other topics to ensure these military affiliates can have an equitable opportunity to thrive in their community.

Please complete the interest form at the bottom of this page. Once you do that, Zulma will be in touch within a few days with the volunteer application you can complete. Groups can participate with partner organizations by participating in a beautification project or preparing kits for community members ranging from baby supplies to everyday supplies. Please email zcolon@kidsaboveall.org with interest.

Other Helpful Info:  If you have any questions, reach out to Zulma at zcolon@kidsaboveall.org. Sessions can be coordinated around your schedule.
date_notes: Coordinated with mentee
organization_description: Kids Above All works to give children and their families equitable opportunties and future regardless of their background. Through community programs, mentoring programs and resources, Kids Above All allows their community members to learn, grow and thrive.
addresses: ["8765 W Higgins Rd suite 450, Chicago, IL 60631, USA"]

headline: FurKids
short_description: Care for shelter animals, help at adoption events, and more!
content:
A wonderful opportunity for cat lovers who want to give back to their communities!

Volunteers can assist in many aspects of the daily care and adoption of cats and kittens. Volunteers help with various cleaning tasks around the shelter (cleaning out pens, medical areas and the free-roaming room), help to socialize shy or fearful cats to increase their chances of adoption, foster cats and help out at adoption days at Petco and Petsmart adoption centers! Click here for a full list of opportunities.

To begin volunteering, fill out an application here and a member of the FurKids Volunteer team will be in touch once your volunteer questionnaire has been reviewed.

The dog shelter accepts groups of up to 10 volunteers and headquarters and cat shelters up to 50. Find more information here.

Most volunteer opportunities are open to all ages! Check here for more information on age limitations.

Please wear comfortable clothes that are not too revealing and closed-toe shoes. Some tasks require lifting, cleaning, and moving items. Clothes that can get dirty are recommended.
date_notes: Options available
organization_description: FurKids is the largest no-kill shelter in the Southeast for cats and kittens. They rely on volunteers to help them support the cats who live in the shelter, adoption events and fostering opportunties.
addresses: ["5235 Union Hill Road, Cumming, GA 30040, USA"]

headline: AWARE Wildlife Center
short_description: Care for rehabilitating animals!
content:
Volunteers at AWARE Wildlife Center are known as Animal Caregivers. They are responsible for the overall care of the 200+ species that are in the rehabilitation center. Volunteers are responsible for feeding, distributing medication, cleaning enclosures, other cleaning tasks around the center, and also can support with administrative work like email and data entry.

Please fill out this volunteer interest form. Once you complete the form, you can sign up for an orientation occurring once a month.

Generally, volunteers must be 18 or older, but some opportunities for 16 - 17-year-olds exist. Volunteers must be able to commit to a weekly volunteer shift and must be vaccinated against tetanus and COVID-19.

Please wear comfortable clothes that are not too revealing and closed-toe shoes. Some tasks require lifting, cleaning, and moving items. Clothes that can get dirty are recommended. No jewelry is allowed. Volunteer hours: Everyday - 10:30 a, - 2:30 pm, 2 pm - 6 pm, or 6 pm - close.
date_notes: Volunteer hours: Everyday - 10:30a-2:30p, 2p-6p, or 6p-close
organization_description: AWARE Wildlife Center is responsible for rehabbing 2,000 injured wildlife species a year who are native to Georgia. They also work to educate the public about the importance of native wildlife and ways to coexist with wildlife through schools, fairs, and other media outlets.
addresses: ["4158 Klondike Road, Stonecrest, GA 30038, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older, some opportunities exist for 16-17"]

headline: Soldiers' Angels - Atlanta
short_description: Send baked goods and letters to warm a soldier's day!
content:
You can help to support deployed military troops by baking goodies, writing letters, adopting a family around the holidays, and so many other ways to support from home.

Register online to be a "Team Angel" here then visit Volunteer to select your baking opportunity!
organization_description: Soldier's' Angels provides resources to active military, veterans, and their families through programs that offer comfort and aid to all.
addresses: ["Atlanta, GA, USA"]

headline: USO - Atlanta
short_description: Work at special USO events and programs!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like military homecomings, trainings and/or deployments, concerts, holiday parties, booths at festivals, military appreciation day, and more!

You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across the Atlanta metro area.

USO Volunteers can register here and a team member will reach out with more information

Generally, volunteers must be 18 years or older but can be 13 and older at some special events with a parent/guardian. Must undergo a background check. Wear comfortable shoes and clothing that is not too revealing.
date_notes: Depends on event schedule!
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families and country through programs which strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), North Terminal Parkway, Atlanta, GA, USA"]

headline: Partners in Change
short_description: Train to be a Virtual Life Coach!
content:
Partners in Change (PIC) takes coaching's track record of success for executives and brings that to adults with big dreams but too little support.

As a trained PIC life coach, you and your partner develop an honest and trusting relationship focused on their long-term, transformational growth.

WHAT DOES PIC VIRTUAL VOLUNTEERING LOOK LIKE? 

  • Attend (virtual) training in PIC's non-directive, asset-based life coaching model (two 3-hour sessions).
  • Be paired with an under-resourced adult pursuing personal and/or professional goals.
  • Support your partner via one-to-one 30-45 minute weekly phone/video conversations.
  • Receive ongoing guidance from PIC staff.
  • Remain connected with your partner for one year. 
BENEFITS OF BEING A PIC COACH 
  • An authentic and long-lasting relationship with your coaching partner
  • Valuable training on how to be an effective coach to others
  • Growth in understanding the impacts of poverty on some Atlanta residents & communities
  • An opportunity to take personal action in support of social justice and racial equity 
PIC's vision is to support self-empowerment as individuals build skills, pursue goals, gain increased confidence and resilience, become lifelong learners, and contribute their assets to their communities. 
 
To get involved, fill out PIC's short volunteer application (must complete a $19 background check), or email info@picusa.org to attend a weekly Q&A to learn more about the program.
 
Language courtesy of Kathleen Bryant, Partners in Change
organization_description: Partners in Change uses coaching and mentorship to improve outcomes for adult community members in poverty and lacking access to essential resources. Volunteer coaches are trained in coaching and mentorship and develop powerful skills to become positive forces in their community.
addresses: ["Atlanta, GA, USA"]

headline: Atlanta Habitat for Humanity
short_description: Support new homebuyers, learn a construction skill, and more
content:
Virtual/remote volunteers can assist Atlanta's Habitat for Humanity in multiple ways, including the following three examples: 1) Be paired with a new homebuyer and write a letter of support or sign a virtual beam; 2) Work as a stewardship volunteer and assist in communicating with donors; 3) Learn a construction skill virtually and complete your own repairs. Check out all your options here.

Browse your volunteer options and complete a volunteer preference form here.

All ages are welcome to send letters of support to new homeowners! Stewardship volunteering is generally 18 or older. Group volunteering is possible - be sure to note your group on the volunteer preference form.
organization_description: Atlanta Habitat for Humanity works to build, maintain, and foster affordable housing and safe, dynamic neighborhoods. They help under-served families and individuals buy, build, and repair homes, while providing financial, educational, and social resources that help neighborhoods to thrive.
addresses: ["Atlanta, GA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Some ages are welcome to join, just ask a team member!"]

headline: La Amistad
short_description: Mentor and assist young students with their homework!
content:
Volunteers have the option to participate in two vital programs at La Amistad. The afterschool program connects the volunteer with an elementary-age student to provide homework help and mentorship. Volunteers also can complete training and orientation to work as ESL teachers in the English For Successful Living program. ESL teachers equip students with language skills that help them to flourish in their schools and careers.

Fill out a registration form for your preferred volunteer opportunity and be prepared to submit a background check. After completing the form, you can schedule a virtual or in-person orientation and begin volunteering!

Afterschool programs occur at a number of schools and churches in the Atlanta area. Locations are listed here.

All volunteers must complete a background check. One-time group volunteering opportunities (including with school and corporate groups) are available. More information here.

Afterschool volunteers attend two 1-hour sessions a week between 3:00 pm and 5:30 pm, Monday-Thursday. ESL teachers commit to 1-2 classes per week for a 10-week period.
organization_description: La Amistad serves the Latin community in Atlanta by providing educational support and enrichment activities that improve quality of life. Connecting volunteers and students, La Amistad (meaning friendship) fosters relationships that have lasting impacts.
addresses: ["Atlanta, GA, USA"]

headline: Everybody Wins!
short_description: Read with a student during lunch to improve literacy!
content:
Volunteer with Everybody Wins!

Meet a paired student each week during lunch and read aloud for 30 minutes. Students in the Power Lunch program have been identified as reading below their grade level and benefit tremendously from weekly reading sessions. Volunteers fill a void in schools with limited resources and can have a lifelong impact on their paired students.

Fill out a volunteer application. You'll choose when and at which school you'll be able to volunteer and get connected to a student in need!

Power Lunch is currently in ten schools in the Atlanta Metro area. Locations can be found here.

Volunteers work with a paired student for the duration of the school year (once a week for a 30-minute session). It is possible to alternate with another volunteer if you cannot participate every week. Although working one-on-one with students, workplace groups are encouraged to volunteer together.
organization_description: Everybody Wins! pairs volunteers and students for weekly reading sessions so kids can keep up, excel, and gain valuable mentorships. Their reading sessions have been shown to significantly increase literacy, and their school programs provide educational resources to children who otherwise might be left behind.
addresses: ["Atlanta, GA, USA"]

headline: Trees Atlanta
short_description: Help preserve and grow Atlanta's forests!
content:
There are many ways to volunteer with Trees Atlanta! You can get your hands in the dirt with tree planting, tree and plant care, or forest restoration. Volunteers learn basic forestry skills and have the opportunity to train and become educated in more advanced skills. If you prefer to stay clean or limit physical effort, you can work as a program ambassador and facilitate projects and events, assist in office work, or serve as event support. Check out the Trees Atlanta volunteer pathways to learn more about all the ways you can contribute.

Fill out a new volunteer application here. Once your form is submitted, you will be able to sign up for volunteer opportunities and get involved! There are opportunities for groups of 5-20.

Tree plantings are open to all ages! 12 and up is suggested for some conservation work. Children under 16 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. 16 or 17-year-old volunteers must have a parent or guardian sign a liability waiver. Some activities may require a background check.  

Please wear closed-toed shoes and clothes that can get dirty. Most outdoor activities require moderate physical effort.
organization_description: Atlanta is unique among major cities for its significant tree canopy, and Trees Atlanta and their volunteers are unflagging stewards of the forests that play a vital ecological role in the city. Since 1985, Trees Atlanta has planted over 150,000 trees, conserved existing forests and ecosystems, and educated the public on the importance of maintaining Atlanta's forests.
addresses: ["Atlanta Kendeda Center, 225 Chester Avenue Southeast, Atlanta, GA 30316, USA"]

headline: Chattahoochee Riverkeeper
short_description: Clean up the Chattahoochee and protect Atlanta's ecology!
content:
Chattahoochee Riverkeeper volunteers have the opportunity to explore Atlanta's most important waterway by foot and by boat. River cleanups rely on volunteers to help restore the beauty and health of Chattahoochee. In 2021, volunteers removed over 63 tons of litter from the river and accomplished much of the work underfunded environmental agencies were unable to. If you wish to contribute in another way, volunteers are always needed to assist with events and in the office.

To volunteer at a cleanup, check out the available dates and complete registration. To volunteer in another way (at events or in the office), complete the volunteer form here.

River cleanups are a great volunteer option for groups. Volunteers 10 and up are welcome with the supervision of a parent or guardian.

River cleanups on foot are around 3 hours. Paddle cleanups around 6 hours. Boats for paddle cleanups are self-supplied unless borrowing a boat from Chattahoochee Riverkeepers is arranged beforehand. Please wear clothes and footwear appropriate for wading in mud and water if participating in a cleanup.
organization_description: Chattahoochee Riverkeeper monitors, protects, and advocates for the health of the Chattahoochee River. The river provides a sustainable water source to Atlanta and much of Georgie and is threatened by human activity and climate changes. Chattahoochee Riverkeeper works to preserve this essential water source for the future.
addresses: ["The Foundry at Puritan Mill, 916 Joseph E. Lowery Blvd NW, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["10 and up with the supervision of a parent or guardian"]

headline: Second Helpings Atlanta
short_description: Rescue food and combat hunger!
content:
Volunteers with Second Helpings Atlanta have the opportunity to sustainably rescue foods and turn waste into nourishment in their community. Volunteers can provide essential support in two ways. They can drive food rescue routes transporting rescued food from donors to SHA centers, or they can assemble meal kits with rescued food. These kits will be distributed to food-insecure families and individuals free of charge. Drivers can complete pickups and deliveries in just 90 minutes and are needed throughout the week (flexible option). Meal kit assembly occurs every Wednesday morning from 9 am - 1 pm and is a fun, social environment great for groups.

To learn more about both volunteer options and register, visit the volunteer page.

Meal kit assembly is a great activity for groups, and children ten and up are welcome - every Wednesday, 9 am - 1 pm!  No experience is needed. Closed-toed shoes are required for food packaging, and the facility is not temperature controlled. Food packaging requires a significant amount of time on your feet.

Food rescue routes take roughly 90 minutes; meal kit assembly is 4 hours.
organization_description: Second Helpings Atlanta uses rescued food to combat hunger in Atlanta by providing free nutritious meals to those in need. Volunteers divert food destined to become waste in landfills and put it to good use feeding Metro Atlanta.
addresses: ["970 Jefferson Street Northwest, Atlanta, GA 30318, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["10 and up with the supervision of a parent or guardian"]

headline: Atlanta Mission
short_description: Feed and shelter the unhoused in Atlanta!
content:
Join the Atlanta Mission to give back time and support the homeless and hungry around Atlanta. Volunteers can become involved in a wide range of activities, from helping to prepare and provide food at a shelter, offering family support through childcare and vocational services, working in the thrift shop, or helping to beautify the campus by gardening, cleaning, and performing other maintenance work. For people who may not have as much free time, there is an opportunity called "Volunteer in Place," where you can write letters to community members or select a time to drop off a meal.

All you have to do is create an account on the volunteer portal and select the event you would like to sign up for!

Groups of 5 or more can volunteer at special events, help with food prep and distribution, maintenance projects and so much more! Check out opportunities here.

Some of the opportunities are kid-friendly! Please ensure that you indicate if you are bringing a child to an opportunity. Donation sorting, letter writing, and other activities are suitable for children to help out.

Hours: Shifts are usually 2 hours in length and exact timing will be indicated on the event page

Please wear comfortable clothes that are not too revealing and closed-toed shoes. Some tasks require lifting, cleaning, and moving of items. Clothes that are able to get dirty are recommended.
organization_description: The Atlanta Mission is a faith-based organization that works to support the homeless population around Atlanta. Through offering shelter, guidance, learning opportunities and other resources the Atlanta Mission strives to get the homeless of Atlanta as a supporting member of society.
addresses: ["Atlanta, GA, USA"]

headline: Back on My Feet - Atlanta
short_description: Morning walks and runs to break the cycle of homelessness.
content:
Do you enjoy waking up early to walk or run? In partnership with Back on My Feet, you can help people break the cycle of homelessness and get some physical activity! There are many ways to help out - either by enjoying a morning walk or run, serving as a Next Steps Mentor, and/or leading a professional development workshop.

To get started, submit a volunteer sign-up form. Once that is complete, watch the Volunteer Orientation video and complete the volunteer skill survey. Your final step would be to review the volunteer handbook and complete a "Circle Up" training. Then you are ready to get involved!

Volunteers for certain events should be at least 18. However, if accompanied by a parent, there are opportunities for someone under 18 to participate. Be sure to ask a volunteer team member for details!
organization_description: Working to break the cycle of homelessness through a community of supporters who emphasize the importance of physical health, work to mentor members about employment and guide them to land jobs.
addresses: ["400 Luckie St NW, Atlanta, GA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Some ages are welcome to join, just ask a team member!"]

headline: Animal Rescue League of Boston
short_description: Help care for shelter animals!
content:
The Animal Rescue League of Boston is searching for volunteers committed to animal welfare to support its various programs. There are opportunities to work directly with animals (training, exercising and feeding shelter animals ), in addition to roles in the ARL offices and at ARL events. Check this page to see current volunteer opportunities at the location most convenient to you.

To begin volunteering at the ARL of Boston, apply here. If your application is accepted, the volunteer department will reach out to you within 10 days. Groups of up to 15 are encouraged to apply.

Volunteers are expected to make a six-month commitment to their role. There is a variety of options throughout the week with varied shift lengths. Check with your volunteer contact for a suggested dress code according to your role.
organization_description: The Animal Rescue League of Boston provides essential veterinary and rescue services to animals in need and advocates for their safety and care. The ARL extricates thousands of animals from abusive and unsafe environments every year and supports families and communities to furnish animals with a healthy and loving home.
addresses: ["10 Chandler Street, Boston, MA 02116, USA"]

headline: MSPCA - Angell
short_description: Advocate and care for animals in need!
content:
If you love animals, MSPCA - Angell has a volunteer opportunity for you. Volunteers can work on advocacy and legislative policy, as animal caregivers, or in several administrative and communications positions. Visit this page to browse all of the available opportunities.

Select and apply for a volunteer role you're interested in here.

Must be 16 or older for the majority of in-person volunteering. Check out these programs for children of all ages.

There are a variety of options throughout the week with varied shift lengths. Some roles require a six-month commitment. Check with your volunteer contact for a suggested dress code for your role.
organization_description: MSPCA - Angell operates a network of state-of-the-art medical centers throughout Massachusetts that provide a complete array of veterinary services. MSPCA - Angell also offers animal adoption, enforces humane laws, and advocates for animals in legislature and communities.
addresses: ["350 S Huntington Ave, Boston, MA 02130, USA"]

headline: 826 Boston
short_description: Tutor K-12 students and help them succeed and flourish!
content:
Volunteers can serve as after-school tutors in 826 Boston's writing center or at their College Essay Boot Camp. Remote and in-person opportunities are available, and volunteers can connect one-on-one with students and support their learning. Whether you help edit a college essay, tutor geometry or assist a student in publishing their poetry, you will have a powerful impact on a student's future.

Complete an application, submit a background check, and begin volunteering. Groups of 3-10 should fill out this application.

Must be 16 or older. Prospective volunteers 16-18 should fill out this interest form. A criminal background check is required, and new volunteers complete a tutor training session.

Experience with tutoring, teaching, or a particular subject is a plus! If you don't have any experience, 826 Boston will provide guidance and teaching materials.

There are a variety of options throughout the week with varied shift lengths (generally 1-2 hours). Check with your volunteer contact for a suggested dress code according to your role.
organization_description: 826 Boston provides free tutoring to K-12 students in the Boston public school system. Writing support, subject tutoring, and college essay assistance are just some of the ways 826 Boston seeks to nurture under-served students and amplify their voices.
addresses: ["3035 Washington Street, Washington Park, Boston, MA 02119, USA"]

headline: FriendshipWorks
short_description: Connect with isolated older adults and build a relationship!
content:
Remote volunteers call older adults to talk and share stories, build relationships, and support each other. These "Friendly Visits" are a great opportunity to gain a wise friend and brighten an elder's week! In-person volunteers can also assist with transportation, medical visits, errands, and the PetPals program.

To get started, complete an application and connect with a volunteer coordinator.

A criminal background check is required, and new volunteers complete an interview and training session.

No experience needed and largely flexible hours!
organization_description: Friendship Works connects volunteers with older adults to foster engaging relationships and reduce loneliness and isolation. Social interaction improves the mental health of volunteers and older adults alike, and pet visitation and musical performances bring joy and warmth.
addresses: ["105 Chauncy St 8th floor, Boston, Massachusetts 02111, USA"]

headline: Literations
short_description: Tutor under-served youth to improve reading level!
content:
Volunteers with Literations are matched with K-3 students and provide structured coaching proven to improve literacy. As a volunteer, you have an opportunity to mentor under-served youth and complete training as a tutor and teacher.

Complete your application, and a staff member will reach out to schedule an interview. Please have two references prepared.

A criminal background check is required, and new volunteers complete an interview and training session. Volunteers coach 2-3 hours, two days a week.

No experience is needed! Comprehensive training included.
organization_description: Literations matches volunteers with K-3 students to provide free tutoring and improve literacy outcomes for students in their foundational years. Students reading behind their grade level are given the attention they need to gain confidence and flourish into their futures.
addresses: ["1 Federal Street 5th floor, Boston, MA 02110, USA"]

headline: Literacy Volunteers of Massachusetts
short_description: Become an adult literacy tutor and change lives!
content:
Volunteer tutors are matched with an adult for a 9-12 month period over which they develop a meaningful relationship and play an instrumental role in improving literacy and overall lives. LVM provides rigorous training and comprehensive support to assure the efficacy of tutoring for volunteers and adults. There are also opportunities to work as an administrative volunteer and assist with events, fundraising, and more.

Reach out to your area contact or call 888-466-1313 to learn more about volunteering at LVM. Volunteers complete a 2-hour orientation and 18 hours of training before beginning to tutor and must have a high school diploma. They must also commit to a 9-12 month tutorship (2 hours a week).

No experience is needed! Comprehensive training included.
organization_description: Literacy Volunteers of Massachusetts provides free and confidential literacy tutoring and English language lessons to adults across Massachusetts. LVM focuses on individual needs and everyday materials to ensure adults benefit in their careers and communities.
addresses: ["10 Post Office Square, Post Office Square, Boston, MA 02109, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Must have received a High School Diploma"]

headline: Charles River Watershed Association
short_description: Protect and advocate for the watershed and your ecosystem!
content:
Volunteers at CRWA actively protect and champion the vital Charles River Watershed. They monitor the watershed's health, clean trash and remove invasive species, and advocate for their communities. Check this page to browse all available opportunities.

Browse volunteer roles and register here. Group volunteering and corporate sponsorship options are available for several volunteer opportunities. 

Age requirements vary across roles and events. Most volunteer opportunities require a training session.

No experience needed! Check with your volunteer coordinator for a suggested dress code - especially for outdoor roles.
organization_description: The Charles River Watershed Association monitors, protects, and advocates for the watershed. Their various programs conduct cleanup efforts on the Charles, coordinate advocacy efforts with nonprofits and legislative bodies, and take scientific measures of watershed health with an eye toward the future and the ecological impacts of climate change.
addresses: ["41 West Street floor 8, Boston, MA 02111, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Some ages are welcome to join, just ask a team member!"]

headline: Groundwork Somerville
short_description: Learn urban farming and give back to your community!
content:
Volunteers at Groundwork Somerville have the unique opportunity to participate in farming and gardening within a major city, earning a respite from your built environment. You can maintain the South St. farm or one of nine school gardens by weeding, planting, watering, and harvesting. You can also transport crops to donation sites for distribution in the community.

Complete the sign-up form to be contacted with volunteer opportunities. No experience is needed!

Minimum commitment of one hour per week. Please wear closed-toed shoes and clothes that can get dirty!
organization_description: Groundwork Somerville cultivates an equitable and sustainable community by empowering youth to participate in urban farming and increasing access to healthy foods. Working at the intersections of racial, economic, and social injustice that dictate access to sustainable foods and green space, Groundwork Somerville engages the Somerville community with their environment and each other.
addresses: ["337 Somerville Ave #2b, Somerville, MA 02143, USA"]

headline: Greater Boston Food Bank
short_description: Package nutritious meals and combat hunger!
content:
Volunteers at GBFB combat hunger in Eastern Massachusetts. As a volunteer, you will pack food into boxes for delivery to seniors in need and help sort incoming food donations.

To begin volunteering at GBFB, complete the application. Groups of up to 15 are encouraged to register.

Shifts are available: Monday – Friday: 9 am – 12 pm and 1 pm – 4 pm, Saturday: 9 am – 12 pm and 1 pm – 3:30 pm.

Please wear closed-toed shoes and clothes that can get dirty!

Accommodations are available - to discuss, contact volunteer@gbfb.org
organization_description: The Greater Boston Food Bank alleviates food insecurity in Easter Massachusetts by working to provide three nutritious meals a day to anyone in need. In 2021, they distributed over 117 million pounds of food and continue to expand their programs.
addresses: ["70 South Bay Avenue, Boston, MA 02118, USA"]

headline: Boston Area Gleaners
short_description: Harvest, pack, and sort food for the food insecure!
content:
As a volunteer at Boston Area Gleaners, you will harvest, pack, and sort food distributed to the food insecure. You can get outside at local farms and actively contribute to a more sustainable and just food system.

To begin volunteering at Boston Area Gleaners, create an account and register for available volunteer opportunities. Groups can apply for a service workday.

No experience needed! Check out the detailed dress code.
organization_description: Boston Area Gleaners interrupts the cycle of food waste by redistributing surplus foods to the food-insecure. The Gleaners facilitate a more equitable and sustainable food system that connects food producers with those in need.
addresses: ["91 Martin Street, Acton, MA 01720, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["13 or older. Under 18 must be accompanied by parent or guardian"]

headline: Boston Rescue Mission
short_description: Support the unhoused on their journeys to success!
content:
Volunteers at Boston Rescue Mission have the opportunity to support unhoused people as they overcome serious challenges. You can feed folks in the kitchen or on the streets, assist with job readiness and counseling programs, join or lead bible study groups, and much more!

Browse the many volunteer opportunities and complete this application. A volunteer coordinator will reach out to confirm your shift registration. Groups of up to five are welcome and should submit this form.

Must be 18 years or older unless accompanied by parent or guardian. Must be fully vaccinated.

Please wear comfortable clothes that are not too revealing and closed-toed shoes. Shifts schedules are available here.
organization_description: Boston Rescue Mission feeds, shelters, and supports 1,500 unhoused people every year. They assist men and women on their journeys back from addiction and incarceration and provide resources and programs for holistic growth and recovery.
addresses: ["39 Kingston St, Boston, MA 02111, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must show proof of vaccination", "Youth opportunties for 9+"]

headline: Mutt Scouts
short_description: Help dogs get the care they need!
content:
Volunteers can help at community events to encourage people to meet the dogs in the shelter, transport dogs from homes to veterinary appointments, help with social media and fundraising, and conduct home checks for potential adoptive families.

A member of the Mutt Scouts team will be in touch after filling out the application. They will help you finish your orientation and get you scheduled for your first shift! Please be sure you are comfortable working with stray or medically unfit dogs before you submit an application!

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours
organization_description: Mutt Scouts is a dog shelter and adoption facility for all dogs regardless of medical or health issues. Majority of the dogs come from rough beginnings, but are giving medical care, love and eventually find a new home.
addresses: ["Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: New England Center and Home for Veterans
short_description: Serve food to veterans and give back to those who served us!
content:
Volunteers at NECHV work directly with veterans and have the opportunity to give back and serve those who have served us! You can assist NECHV in serving meals throughout the week and get to know sheltered veterans.

To begin volunteering, create an account and sign up for a meal service shift. Part of a group? Indicate that you are a group leader on the affiliations tab of the sign-in page, and a volunteer coordinator will reach out by email and help schedule group volunteering. Meal service shifts are 75 minutes.

Wear comfortable clothing and closed-toe, non-slip shoes. Please bring an ID to verify you are at least 18 years old. All visitors are required to wear masks.
organization_name: New England Center and Home for Veterans
organization_description: The New England Center and Home for Veterans shelters, feeds, and offers a comprehensive range of resources to unhoused veterans, supporting brave men and women to find employment and live the lives they deserve.
addresses: ["17 Court Street, Boston, MA 02108, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", null]

headline: Big Heart Ranch
short_description: Help animals at a ranch!
content:
Volunteers can help with both the animal care and upkeep around the ranch.

Each volunteer will spend an hour each volunteering session helping around the animal spaces, cleaning, feeding, and nurturing the resident farm animals at the sanctuary. Volunteers will then be able to spend the final hour of the volunteering shift working and connecting with their favorite animal or space around the ranch.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 hours

In order to volunteer at Big Heart Ranch, you need to reach out to howdy@bigheartranch.org to schedule the date and time for your in-person orientation. Volunteer orientation takes 2 hours and you will have the opportunity to see the ranch and learn about the various animals! Once you complete your orientation, you are ready to start giving time!
organization_description: Big Heart Ranch is an animal sanctuary that takes in unwanted or neglected farm animals and used them to help rehabilitate and reconnect family members to themselves, especially those facing crisis or financial difficulties.
addresses: ["31409 Pacific Coast Hwy, Malibu, CA 90265, USA"]

headline: The Animal Pad
short_description: Care for shelter animals, help at adoption events, and more!
content:
The Animal Pad is always looking for volunteers to foster dogs, but if you cannot foster, there are lots of options to stay involved and support the dogs in the shelters!

Volunteers can help at adoption and fundraising events, work on the TAP Care Team to look after dogs in the La Mesa shelter by cleaning pens, feeding, organizing donations and socializing with the animals, or be a transporter and make sure foster animals get to appointments.

Please submit an application and a member of the TAP team will be in touch to schedule orientation and your first shift! Please ensure you fill out your experience with animals as accurately as possible. Volunteers under 18 must have a parent sign a waiver as part of the application.

If you are working at an adoption or fundraising event, the location will be provided before your shift!
organization_description: The Animal Pad is a no-kill shelter for all breeds of dogs, working to take in dogs from the streets and Mexico, give them proper veterinary care and eventually a loving home.
addresses: ["4620 Avocado Blvd, La Mesa, CA 91941, USA"]

headline: Homeboy Industries
short_description: Help those previously incarcerated!
content:
Homeboy Industries is looking for current doctors, nurses, and psychologists to help in the Tattoo Removal, Mental Health, and tutoring programs offered to clients.

Individuals helping with the mental health program who live within 10 miles of the Homeboy headquarters will be able to meet with individuals in their offices or if you are located further away, in one of the Homeboy outposts. Tutors will be offering guidance on studying and taking the GED test.

Must be a qualified doctor, nurse, or psychologist to help with tattoo removal or mental health programs.

Estimated duration of activity: 1 or more hours

Photo Credit: Homeboy Industries
organization_description: Homeboy Industries works with past incarcerated individuals or people involved in gangs and give them resources to get jobs, manage finances and help rebuild their lives. Homeboy Industries provides workshops about career development, medical care like tattoo removal and mental health services and a supportive community to lean on.
addresses: ["130 Bruno Street, Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: 2Hands 2Employ
