short_description: Help those who want to work in the hospitality industry!
content:
Volunteers who have experience working in or are currently working in the hospitality industry and want to give back to their community can apply to be a 2Hands 2Employ mentor. Mentors work with individuals interested in the hospitality industry but may not have the means to finish their degree or participate in professional development activities to make them competitive candidates. Mentors offer guidance, education, and support so that all community members have an equitable chance to succeed.

Must have some experience in the hospitality industry and a passion for helping people succeed. Once you've completed your application, you will be prompted to complete a 4-week training program and get a background check. After that is all complete, you will be paired with your mentee!

Estimated duration of activity: 1 hour per week
organization_description: 2Hands 2Employ works with people from underserved communities across LA to education and train them for careers in the hospitality industry.
addresses: ["Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: Wee Companions Small Animal Adoption
short_description: Care for animals, assist with adoption events and more!.
content:
Volunteers are welcome to help out in the Wee Companions store by stocking and organizing shelves, helping customers and keeping the store professional looking, as well as assisting in the adoption center to clean and maintain enclosures, talk with guests and feed animals and help with community adoption or fundraising conducting set up, break down and general oversight. Finally, volunteers can help transport animals to shelters and veterinary appointments.

Please first download and read the volunteer manual, register for a MyImpact account and complete the online volunteer application and interest form. Once you have completed these steps, a volunteer team member will be in touch to help get you set up to start volunteering!

Volunteers should have some level of comfort working around small animals. Please wear clothes you would not mind getting dirty and that are comfortable. Shifts are usually during regular business hours and on weekends.
organization_name: Wee Companions Small Animal Adoption, Inc
organization_description: Wee Companions Small Animal Adoption is an organization that takes in unwanted pets like rabbits, hamsters, guinea pigs and other small animals. Mostly run by volunteers, this organization works to care for, socialize and hopefully find a loving home for the pets in their adoption center.
addresses: ["3368 Governor Dr suite f, San Diego, CA 92122, USA"]

headline: Reading to Kids
short_description: Help underserved students read!
content:
Volunteers are needed to help out with reading clubs that are located in elementary schools downtown. Volunteers are paired with children to introduce themselves and the book they will be reading, help with the read-aloud session, and talk about the book and the child's interest or other education-related topics. Once the reading session is done, children and volunteers then work on reading-centered crafts together until the session is over.

Reading Clubs take place at seven schools are LA. Please take a look at this list to see which schools participate. The school where you will be volunteering will differ depending on the month.

Estimated duration of activity: 3 hours
organization_description: Reading to Kids is a grassroots organization dedicated to inspiring underserved children with a love of reading, thereby enriching their lives and opportunities for future success.
addresses: ["Alta Loma Elementary School, Vineyard Avenue, Los Angeles, CA, USA", "Charles White Elementary School, Wilshire Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA, USA", "Esperanza Elementary School, Little Street, Los Angeles, CA, USA", "Gratts Elementary School, Lucas Avenue, Los Angeles, CA, USA", "Leo Politi Elementary School, 2481 W 11th St, Los Angeles, CA 90006, USA", "Los Angeles Elementary School, South Hobart Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA, USA", "MacArthur Park Visual and Performing Arts Elementary, 7th Street, Los Angeles, CA, USA", "Magnolia Avenue Elementary School, 1626 S, Orchard Avenue, Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: School on Wheels
short_description: Help students with homework, studying for tests, and more!
content:
Volunteers will be matched with a student in one of the Southern California school districts and help them with homeworking, studying for tests, improving reading skills, and encouraging them to continue their education. Virtual opportunities will be for students in grades K - 12 and in-person opportunities will be with kids in grades K - 4.

Estimated duration of activity: 1 hour. Must be able to commit to 1-hour weekly tutoring sessions for a full year.

After you complete the application, you will be sent a 45-minute orientation video to watch. Once that is complete, you will be invited to attend online training and have a background check completed. You will then be matched with a student either online or virtually. Most placements will be online.
organization_description: School on Wheels works to provide homeless and at-risk kids the opportunity to have equitable access to educational resources to help them stay and school and succeed. They do this by offering one-on-one tutoring session, access to school supplies, digital learning opportunties and scholarships.
addresses: ["Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: San Diego Future Foundations - Tech Ambassador
short_description: Improve digital literacy by teaching online skills remotely!
content:
Volunteer Tech Ambassadors work to lead training in online skills such as Microsoft Office, computer software and hardware, coding, emailing etiquette, using the internet safely and understanding online platforms. Volunteers are responsible for leading classroom discussions on various topics to help students understand, learn and excel in online programs.

All you need to do to get started is complete the volunteer application at the bottom of this page. Once you have submitted your application with your preferred days of the week and time of day, a team member will be in touch to get you onboarded! Must complete a background check before interacting with students.

Volunteers will undergo a brief training phase where they will shadow other Ambassadors. Please note that you will be helping to teach students in teams. Volunteer opportunities are generally 2+ hours.
organization_description: San Diego Futures Foundation works to promote environmental sustainability and community welfare by supporting digital literacy across all San Diego communities. They have a goal to inspire and train San Diego future work force in technology driven careers and solutions.
addresses: ["San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: Traveling Stories
short_description: Mentor young students and instill a love of reading!
content:
StoryTent is a mentoring and tutoring program for school-aged children in grades 1 - 3 to be paired with a mentor to help increase their reading skills and interest in reading.

All StoryTent opportunities are now virtual but benefit children across the San Diego area. Traveling Stories is looking for volunteers with experience in virtual learning and video platforms to help oversee and support the StoryTent mentoring sessions and students enrolled in the program.

Please create an account and then submit an application to help with one of the StoryTent Help Desk opportunities. This would be a great opportunity for college students, teachers in the summer or other individuals interested in virtual education.

Volunteers should be able to commit 1 - 3 hours a week to help with the StoryTent program. Must have experience with online applications like email, video calls and basic customer service. You should have access to a computer and be able to download the various technologies needed to help out readers.
organization_description: Traveling Stories serves underserved and low-income children across San Diego to provide them with reading support and encouragement through a one-on-one mentoring program. Ultimately providing children of San Diego an equity chance to thrive in the public school system.
addresses: ["San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: Reading Legacies
short_description: Encourage a culture of reading that improves literacy!
content:
Volunteers can help manage multiple programs at Reading Legacies. They include Book Bridges, a program for incarcerated adults to help them read and record a storybook video for their children, emphasizing the importance of reading aloud. Volunteers work to encourage parents to read to their children from the time they are born, emphasizing a constant role of consistency in their child's life. Volunteers can be involved in registration, sign-up, check-in, as well as volunteer for sessions. Finally, Storybood Legacies connects elderly adults and grandparents with children around San Diego county. You will help older adults record a video at one of the public libraries across San Diego for children to listen to.

Please fill out the form at the bottom of this page. Once you've submitted an application, a team member will be in touch to get you set up and provide any orientation materials for the program you've selected! Volunteers are encouraged to sign up for at least one shift a month.

Volunteer opportunities occur at various libraries around San Diego - location information will be provided before your shift!
organization_description: Reading Legacies works to create meaningful relationships between children and people of all ages, while teaching a passion for reading and learning through multiple programs that involved people from all ages to read, learn and connect.
addresses: ["San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: Blue Heart Foundation
short_description: Mentor black teens in underserved communities!
content:
Volunteers become involved in many aspects of the H.E.A.R.T. Academy students and events. Volunteers can lead workshops, help at annual events, act as chaperones for trips or events, help out on the administrative side or act as mentors for the students.

Please fill out a pre-application with your interests. Once this has been received and you are a good match for open opportunities, a member of the HEART Academy team will be in touch! Location is dependent on your involvement.

Volunteers should be interested in supporting the Black and African American communities around San Diego. Only male applicants should submit an application for direct mentorship.
organization_description: Reading Legacies works to create meaningful relationships between children and people of all ages, while teaching a passion for reading and learning through multiple programs that involved people from all ages to read, learn and connect.
addresses: ["San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: Friends of the Los Angeles River
short_description: Protect and restore the Los Angeles River!
content:
There are many ways to support the vital work of the Friends of the Los Angeles River. 

Volunteers are needed for events that occur throughout the year to improve and restore various locations along the watershed. Individuals and groups are welcome at riverbank cleanups, habitat restoration projects, and days where trash is collected for data assessment.  

FOLAR hosts "The Great LA River Cleanup" during Earth Week in April to engage local corporations, universities, and individuals with the nonprofit's environmental mission.  

Tools and a water station will be provided for all activities. Please remember to bring sunscreen and dress appropriately! 

If you would prefer to volunteer as an advocate for concrete removal and ecological restoration along the LA River, there are also opportunities to get involved in the nonprofit's policy and advocacy activities.
organization_name: Friends of the Los Angeles River
organization_description: Friends of the Los Angeles River is an environmental nonprofit that restores the river's estuaries and habitats to provide a vibrant ecosystem for the people and wildlife of LA County to enjoy.
addresses: ["LA River, California, USA"]

headline: Solana Center for Environmental Innovation
short_description: Educate your community about sustainable living!
content:
Volunteers help spread the word and show people the power of living sustainably! From helping out with school programs giving students hands-on opportunities to recycle, compost, and learn about the importance of sustainable practices, both in school and at the education center, to conducting community outreach by assisting at an Outreach Booth across San Diego County, assisting at composting workshops or assisting with the many programs that are conducted at the Solana Center!

All you need to do is submit a volunteer application and select which program(s) you are interested in becoming involved in on this page. If interested in group volunteering, please reach out to volunteer@solanacenter.org for more information! No experience is needed, just an interest in living more sustainably and teaching others how to do so!

The location will be dependent on the project you want to participate in! Most projects will be outside and include bending, lifting, walking and exposure to the elements.
organization_description: The Solana Center for Environmental Innovation is the leading expert in sustainable living around San Diego. Providing innovative services, community outreach and educational events to communities members, The Solana Center works to educate the public about the importance of a sustainable life and offers services so that businesses can move towards being Zero Waste!
addresses: ["San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: Zer0 Debris
short_description: Clean and beautify beaches around Los Angeles.
content:
Join the Shoreline Team with Zer0 Debris to clean litter from LA's beautiful beaches. 

Shoreline volunteers are responsible for setting up and overseeing various beach day clean-up events throughout the year. As a Shoreline Team member, you can help greet other volunteers, collect data about debris, accept donations, sell merchandise, or oversee an entire event!
organization_description: Zer0 Debris works to reduce the amount of plastic and other waste in Los Angeles waterways and green spaces. The nonprofit organizes groups to help clean up spaces, conducts community outreach to educate the community about reducing plastic and other waste, and provides programs that highlight racial and cultural environmental equity.
addresses: ["Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: The Jacobs & Cushman San Diego Foodbank
short_description: Help supply food to underserved communities!
content:
Foodbank volunteers can help out with a variety of projects to supply food to communities across San Diego.

Volunteers will be responsible for assisting with inspection and packing food for distribution in communities. First sorting donations and making sure the food can be passed along to those in need, volunteers then assemble food packages for specific programs geared towards the elderly, women and children.

Please create an account and then select and register for the desired shift! Groups of 5 or more must fill out a large group volunteer request under the "Group Volunteer Request" button on this page.

Closed-toed shoes are required! Please arrive at least 5 - 10 minutes before your shift starts. Shifts are available every day of the week between 8 am - 8 pm. Must be 11 years or older at the Miramar location and 16 years or older at the Vista location.
organization_name: The Jacobs & Cushman San Diego Foodbank
organization_description: Working to feed community members across San Diego, The Jacobs & Cushman San Diego Foodbank provides groceries and meals to underserved communities.
addresses: ["3030 Enterprise Court ste a, Vista, CA 92081, USA", "9850 Distribution Ave, San Diego, CA 92121, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["11 years or older at Miramar location and 16 years or older at Vista location"]

headline: Father Joe's Village
short_description: Serve meals and support shelter programs for the unhoused!
content:
Volunteers assist on projects ranging from serving meals to shelter visitors to helping with childcare and educational programs or maintenance projects around the shelter.

Volunteers are welcome to volunteer regularly or just for one time!

All you need to do to volunteer is fill out a volunteer interest form, and a volunteer coordinator will be in touch to help you schedule your first shift! Interested groups should have a group leader fill out the interest form with the number of team members and desired time and date. All volunteer shifts must be signed up for in advance; no walk-in volunteers are allowed. Ask about kid-specific activities once you are connected to a volunteer team member!

Most of the volunteering opportunities will be located at the St. Vincent de Paul campus! Please wear appropriate clothing that is not too tight or revealing. Close-toed shoes are encouraged and layers depending on the weather.
organization_description: By offering shelter, child support, meals and skill building programs, Father Joe's Villages invests its resources in the underserved populations across San Diego to try and break the cycle of homelessness.
addresses: ["1501 Imperial Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["10 - 17 must be accompanied by parent or guardian"]

headline: Jewish Family Services LA
short_description: Help give food to those in need!
content:
Volunteers help out the JFSLA food pantry by organizing and sorting donations, packing food to be delivered to homebound community members, answering emails and phones at the front desk, and delivering food to the community members.

Estimated duration of activity: 2 or more hours

Group volunteering opportunities are available with no more than 15 members in a group. If interested, call 323-556-2928 to discuss a time to volunteer in the food pantry.

Volunteers must have a completed background check before their first shift.

Locations vary depending on the opportunity selected. There are various food banks and pop-ups around LA county.
organization_description: Jewish Family Services LA supports the homeless, aging and underserved Jewish communities around LA and works to provide all community members with food, both delivered to homes and served, and counseling services for mental health, family health and aging.
addresses: ["330 North Fairfax Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90036, USA"]

headline: Streets of Hope
short_description: Serve meals and assist at special events for unhoused folks!
content:
Join the Streets of Hope volunteer team and community members to help serve hot meals, and help out at other special events Monday nights in downtown San Diego. Volunteers are also welcome to walk around and greet community members, have a conversation and make them feel known and important to the community. Other opportunities are available during the event on Monday, like hair cutting, church services and resume building.

Please fill out the contact form under one of the many opportunities on this webpage. A team member will be in touch to talk with you about volunteering and get you started!

There are events every Monday from 6 pm - 8 pm. Events are outside in all types of weather. Please dress accordingly in comfortable clothing that is not too revealing.

All ages are welcome!
organization_description: Streets of Hope works to connect the homeless community of San Diego with meals, shelter and support, so that they feel important and like they have a place in society. Offering services to help end the cycle of homelessness and make sure everyone has a place to sleep and meal to eat.
addresses: ["720 15th Street, San Diego, CA 92101, USA"]

headline: U.S.S. Midway Museum
short_description: Volunteer on an aircraft carrier and share naval history!
content:
Volunteers help in a wide range of tasks that relate to the museum guests or working around the aircraft carrier! Volunteers who want to be involved with museum guests can give time to help with guest services, be museum docents, and teach about history on the "Knot Team." Volunteers can also help with the general upkeep of the museum exhibits, help with various restoration tasks and educate the public!

Please fill out and submit a volunteer application and a member of the volunteer team will be in touch about your preferred opportunities. Once accepted as a volunteer, you will be invited to join an Open House. Most volunteer training will happen when you arrive for your first shift. Groups of 10 - 20 are welcome! Please visit this page to learn about group opportunities. 

The museum is open 7 days a week! Volunteer times and days will range depending on the activity selected.

Volunteers should be available for regular monthly shifts. Uniforms are required and will be given out when you sign up for your first shift.

If you are signing up to be involved in the restoration of the ship or aircraft, you must be physically fit and able to lift, stand, and have some maintenance experience.
organization_description: The USS Midway Museum is a educational experience for all visitors to learn about the military, history of battles and operations all on board the USS Midway which was an active aircraft carrier! Exhibits are designed to be educational to all visitors to the museum.
addresses: ["910 North Harbor Drive, San Diego, CA 92101, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Individual volunteers 18 and up, Group volunteers 12 and up"]

headline: PATH: Making it Home
short_description: Prepare meals, care kits, and more for unhoused veterans!
content:
Volunteers help with many opportunities that support the clients at PATH. Volunteers help prepare and serve meals, "welcome home" kits, bagged lunches provided daily to all clients, and care kits. Volunteers can also help on the administrative side by spending time in the volunteer center helping with inquiries, volunteer management, or general administrative work in the office.

If you are interested in volunteering, please register and fill out a volunteer interest form. Once you've completed your volunteer interest form, Sigrid will be in touch to get you registered for your first shift! If interested in group volunteering, please visit this page. If you would just like to sign-up for a one-time dinner shift (every day from 5 pm - 7 pm), please select a shift that works best through this link.

General volunteering shifts occur every day of the week at varied times.

Metered parking is available on the street for $1.25/hour.
organization_description: PATH supports the homeless population across California by providing building affordable housing, providing clothing and meals and support services to all people who have lost homes and are experiencing homelessness, especially veterans.
addresses: ["1250 6th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["16 and up with waiver signed by parent or guardian"]

headline: Los Angeles Regional Food Bank
short_description: Help distribute food to those in need!
content:
The Los Angeles Regional Food Bank provides food to over 900,000 community members monthly with the help of dedicated volunteers.

Volunteers are needed at multiple locations to assist with food distribution at drive-throughs, unload, inspect, and sort donations in the pantry, and pack donations for distribution. Individuals and groups are welcome to volunteer! Please be willing to commit to two hours per volunteering shift, and arrive 15-20 minutes before your shift. 

Before volunteering, you will need to fill out an image release waiver and a liability release waiver.
organization_description: Los Angeles Regional Food Bank aims to ensure that no one across Los Angeles goes hungry, no matter their circumstances. They provide meals to kids, the elderly, and the homeless, groceries, and healthy food options to families.
addresses: ["1734 East 41st Street, Vernon, Los Angeles, CA 90058, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Forms required", "Must be 18 or older to volunteer"]

headline: Midnight Mission
short_description: Provide food, resources, and support to the homeless!
content:
The Midnight Mission helps homeless people turn their lives around and thrive.

There are many ways that volunteers can help homeless community members at the Midnight Mission. The Mission serves three meals daily, and volunteers are needed to prepare and serve food. Behind the scenes, help is needed sorting food and hygiene packs provided to help the homeless.  

Suppose you want to use your education or professional experience to help homeless individuals. In that case, you can provide resume-building and tax preparation training to those who need help in those areas.

Shifts are every day and occur in the morning, afternoon, and evening. You work with the volunteer team coordinator to select the best time for your schedule. Please dress appropriately!
organization_description: Since 1914, The Midnight Mission has been offering paths to self-sufficiency to homeless individuals and families in need. Their extensive range of essential services, including 12-step recovery, education, job training, and work programs, are designed to get people off the streets and into productive lives.
addresses: ["601 South San Pedro Street, Los Angeles, CA 90014, USA"]

headline: Bridge of Faith
short_description: Help women gain independence and life skills!
content:
Volunteers work hands-on with women who have aged out of the foster care support system, and who need additional help becoming independent. 

There are many ways to help with the Bridge of Faith's H.O.M.E. (Home Opportunity Meets Emancipation) programs.

Volunteers help ensure the center is a quality place to visit and live. They are invited to help garden, complete yard work and other maintenance projects, prepare meals, or host workshops for the women. Workshops encompass many values like physical fitness, job support, and life skills. Volunteers are always needed to help set up and manage events like the annual fashion show or help out in the Up*Scale shop.
organization_description: Bridge of Faith provides resources and shelter to girls and women who age out of the foster care system. To provide them with a fair chance to succeed, Bridge of Faith also provides career and emotional support so that women can thrive.
addresses: ["7702 Greenleaf Ave, Whittier, CA 90602, USA"]

headline: Los Angeles Mission
short_description: Help homeless and underserved communities in LA!
content:
The Los Angeles Mission provides food, resources, and other essential support to homeless members of the community. 

Volunteers can serve meals, prepare food, and sort donations in the clothing closet and the pantry. Volunteers can also work to greet guests at the shelter and make them feel important and loved in the community.

Group volunteering opportunities are available for groups of ten or more. Please send ccastro@lamission.net an email with your group details to get started!
organization_description: The Los Angeles Mission provides shelter, clothes, and meals for the homeless and underserved communities around LA County. The nonprofit provides additional support to military veterans who need assistance transitioning to civilian life.
addresses: ["303 East 5th Street, Los Angeles, CA 90013, USA"]

headline: Foundation for Women Warriors
short_description: Help support women veterans and their families!
content:
The Foundation for Women Warriors provides many meaningful ways to support women military veterans as they return to civilian life.

By volunteering, you help to empower these veterans to succeed in their next chapters in life. Volunteers are needed to sort donations at the Essential Goods Warehouse operated by the Foundation. Veterans receive donated items from the warehouse, including food, toiletries, and other household supplies, to help meet their basic needs.

Volunteers are also needed to mentor veterans and provide encouragement as veterans transition to civilian life and seek job opportunities.
organization_description: Foundation for Women Warriors supports women veterans and their families, offering them opportunities to better their economic and emotional well-being.
addresses: ["5062 Lankershim Blvd #3013, North Hollywood, CA 91601, USA"]

headline: Virginia Beach Community Development Corporation
short_description: Help underserved community members around Virginia Beach!
content:
Lend a hand to help support community revitalization efforts with the Virginia Beach Community Development Corporation!

Volunteers help with recurring volunteer opportunities like administrative tasks (answering emails, sitting at the front desk, etc.), sorting Pantry donations that come in for meals and helping community members shop for food or pack meals. Volunteers can also join the Community Action Team, which works directly with community members at special events, conducting community outreach and other special assignments in underserved neighborhoods.

Interested volunteers are asked to fill out a volunteer application and select the days of the week you are available, your interests, skills and other information that will be helpful to place you with the correct opportunity!

Other Helpful Info: This opportunity is non-committal and volunteers can select one that fits their schedule and interests. Volunteer shifts take place 7-days a week at varying times during the day and time ranges depending on the activity but are usually between 2 and 4 hours. You can select your day of the week and time preference in your application. Please wear comfortable and respectable clothing.
date_notes: Depends on your shift!
organization_description: The VBCDC is responsible for providing affordable housing and resources to homeless, low-income and middle-income families around the Tidewater Region of Virginia. Through their programs, they help families to support themselves and the community around them through community based outreach and neighborhood revitalization efforts.
addresses: ["2400 Potters Road, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23454, USA"]

headline: Pet Alliance of Greater Orlando
short_description: Help neglected pets across Orlando find a forever home!
content:
A perfect opportunity for pet and animal lovers to make a difference for stray, abused and neglected animals of Greater Orlando!

Volunteers help out in many ways! Volunteers can work with both cats and dogs to help them become more socialized around people and other animals, take them on regular walks or help with exercising. There are opportunities to foster underaged puppies and kittens before they are available for adoption and also to conduct outreach and support at adoption and other special events!

If you are ready to sign up, please fill out a volunteer application and select a time to complete your orientation. Please use your login to log into the scheduling calendar and select an opportunity that suits you. You can read more about the different programs and ways to help on the Pet Alliance's volunteer page.

Do you have a group? If so, groups of 5 or more must fill out a group volunteer interest form. Groups are asked to bring their own supplies or make a donation to cover supplies.

Other Helpful Info: Must be able to commit to 6 hours per month for six months and pay $25 to cover the cost of uniform, name tag and insurance. Kids ages 13 - 15 can help with the Cat Condo Team, while all other opportunities are available for 16 years and older! All orientations take place at the Sanford Shelter. You must wear your uniform to your shifts.
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: The Pet Alliance of Greater Orlando works to care for and home the neglected, abandoned and sick cats and dogs around Orlando. Programs which place animals in foster care help to decrease the number of stray cats and dogs, trained vets which provide top-notch care for shelter pets and two shelters ensure that all dogs and cats have a chance to find care and a forever home.
addresses: ["12050 East Colonial Drive, Orlando, FL 32826, USA", "2800 County Home Road, Sanford, FL 32773, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Costs towards onboarding, training and uniform.", "Some opportunities for ages 13 and above.", "Uniform must be worn"]

headline: Central Zoo & Botanical Garden
short_description: Help with visitor experience and education at the Zoo!
content:
The Zoo and Botanical Garden is looking for volunteers to act as zoo interpreters for visitors in the Giraffe, Black Bear and Barnyard enclosures!

Volunteers will be responsible for teaching visitors about the animal species and their habitats, conservation of animals, and other general education that coincides with the Zoos mission. Volunteers will assist guests with educational exhibits, hands-on visual displays and animal contact. If you are interested in becoming even more involved at the Zoo, please read the other volunteer opportunities available through the volunteer webpage.

If you are interested in becoming a volunteer, please fill out a volunteer application and sign up for a volunteer orientation. Once that is complete, you will then be assigned for your introductory training period before your first official trip!

Have a group? If so, groups of 10 - 30 people can help with general maintenance and beautification around the zoo. To inquire about your company being interested, please email volunteers@centralfloridazoo.org.

Other Helpful Info: Must be able to commit to one shift per month for six months. You must also pay $25 to cover your uniform and onboarding expenses. Volunteer parking is available! The zoo is open weekly from 9 AM to 4 PM and shifts occur in the morning or afternoon.

Photo Courtesy of the Central Zoo & Botanical Garden.
date_notes: Depends on your shift!
organization_description: The Central Florida Zoo & Botanical Garden is home to native and exotic species of animals and plants. The Zoo and Botanical Garden is meant to be an educational tool for visitors as well as a way to raise money for conservation efforts of the species in the zoo and internationally.
addresses: ["3755 W Seminole Blvd, Sanford, FL 32771, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Costs towards onboarding, training and uniform.", "Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Training", "Uniform must be worn"]

headline: One Heart for Women and Children
short_description: Help support homeless women & children across Orlando.
content:
Giveback time and help support women and children who are experiencing homelessness by providing shelter and resources with One Heart for Women and Children.

Volunteers are needed to assist in various opportunities and are asked to have skills and experience in those areas of need. Volunteers can assist with digital media needs like social media posting, marketing and emails, fundraising and networking, as well as office administrative duties. Other specialized opportunities available help with maintenance and handy work like painting and carpentry around the facility.

All volunteers need to do is express their interests and skills either by filling out the form at the bottom of this page or calling 321-299-4594. Once you discuss your interests with a team member, they will get you set up to complete any required paperwork and schedule for your first shift! You will discuss the desired day of the week and time with a team member once you've connected about your interest.

Other Helpful Info:  Some digital-based projects can be completed remotely. For most, one must have experience in one of the needed skill sets for the requested projects. 

Photo Courtesy of One Heart for Women and Children
date_notes: Depends on your shift!
organization_name: One Heart for Women and Children
organization_description: One Heart for Women and Children specialized in the intake and support of homeless women and children across Orlando. By taking in these vulnerable groups, One Heart strives to give them hope by providing shelter, clothes, food, hygiene products and support through parenting, educational and life skills classes. Ultimately giving their members experience and confidence to support themselves and their children.
addresses: ["2040 N Rio Grande Ave, Orlando, FL 32804, USA"]

headline: SCORE Orlando
short_description: Use your knowledge and skills to help others!
content:
Volunteers can sign up to share their industry experience or knowledge about running a business through online video seminars, leading meetings for your local SCORE chapter, helping people build meaningful relationships within their communities and so many other ways to help small businesses grow! This can be done from any virtual video platform!

After you submit an application, you will connect with your local chapter to find the best fit for your skills. 

Other Helpful Info: Volunteers must have experience owning, running, or growing a business and be able to give time monthly. Estimated duration of activity: 15-20 hours a month.
date_notes: Can coordinate with your schedule
organization_description: SCORE is a non-profit that is working to ensure the support and success of small business nationwide. They provide expertise and guidance through their platforms and volunteer groups.
addresses: ["Orlando, FL, USA"]

headline: Orlando Math Circle
short_description: Help inspire students to excel in math classes!
content:
Are you a math wiz? Have teaching experience? Or just want to inspire students to excel in school? If so, Orlando Math Circle is a great opportunity to help students across Orlando learn math skills and get tutoring help to continue their educational path.

Volunteers are needed to teach mathematics through one-time pop-up events or regularly, to help create entertaining videos that explain the most searched math topics online, to write press releases, video scripts, blog posts, marketing and Social media posts, or for website design and maintenance, data entry and more.

All you need to do to get started is register to volunteer by filling out a volunteer application!

Other Helpful Info: Volunteers must commit to at least 2 hours per week. You will be placed with classes, students or other opportunities based on your skills. Pop-up events happen around Orlando and location will be provided prior to the event!
date_notes: Coordinated around your schedule
organization_description: Orlando Math Circle creates opportunities for all children across Central Florida to develop a passion for mathematics. OMC achieves its mission by providing affordable or free math enrichment programs for 3rd–12th grade students of diverse backgrounds.
addresses: ["Orlando, FL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have some knowledge and skill in mathematics", "Training", "Volunteering for ages 15 and above!"]

headline: House of Hope
short_description: Support and inspire hurting and homeless teens.
content:
House of Hope provides support through relationships, tutoring and opportunities to reconnect with family members. Members of the House of Hope community are usually under 25 years old.

Volunteers are needed to tutor high school students in math, English and science. There are also other opportunities, such as mentoring as a "Big Brother/Sister."

Other Helpful Info: Tutoring sessions occur Monday - Friday from 9 AM to 2 PM. Sessions usually last about 2 hours.
organization_description: House of Hope offers hurting teens, ages 13-17, a place to find hope and healing in a loving, supportive environment and be reconciled to their families.
addresses: ["2036 36th Street, Orlando, FL 32839, USA"]

headline: Adopt-A-Park
short_description: Help clean up parks around Orange County!
content:
Do you want to spend some time outside and help to make public green spaces clean and inviting for all visitors? Well, then join the Orange County Parks and Recreation Department's Adopt-a-Park initiative today!

Volunteers may be asked to perform duties such as removing litter or graffiti, completing light landscaping work, trail maintenance and other park-related projects to enhance park locations. All you need to do to "adopt" a park is schedule a time to meet with the site supervisor at your favorite park to discuss details of what needs to be done!

Other Helpful Info: Both individuals and groups must commit to a minimum number of volunteer hours. For individuals, please plan on commiting four hours per month. For school or other groups, commit a minimum of 120 hours of volunteer service per semester during the school year or other monthly timeframe.
date_notes: Can be done at your leisure!
organization_name: Orange County Parks and Recreation - Adopt-A-Park
organization_description: The Adopt-A-Park program was created to help clean up, beautify and maintain Orange County's parks for the community's enjoyment.
addresses: ["Orlando, FL, USA"]

headline: Oakland Nature Preserve
short_description: Help beautify the entire preserve for all visitors to enjoy!
content:
Oakland Nature Preserve is looking for motivated volunteers to help with beautification projects around the preserve! Grab your work boots and a pair of gloves and join the volunteer team for a morning or afternoon in the great outdoors!

Volunteers are needed for maintenance and restoration (removing invasive plants on trails, assisting in plantings, trimming plants, leaf-blowing the parking lot, boardwalk, and pavilion, etc.), as museum docents, and at special events such as NatureFest. Visit the event calendar and register for the opportunity in which you want to participate.

Have a group? If so, groups must email the Volunteer Coordinator at Outreach@OaklandNaturePreserve.org.

Other Helpful Info: Most opportunities are 18 years and older, but there are Youth Volunteer opportunities for ages 9+. Make sure you wear clothes you can move easily in and don't mind getting dirty. Close-toed shoes are required.
organization_description: Oakland Nature Preserve's Mission is to promote an understanding of the fragile balance between mankind and the environment by educating visitors about Lake Apopka basin's ecosystems and cultural history, and by restoring and conserving the lands within the Preserve.
addresses: ["747 Machete Trail, Oakland, FL 34787, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Youth opportunties for 9+"]

headline: United Against Poverty
short_description: Help support underserved and homeless communities!
content:
United Against Poverty is looking for volunteers to help feed community members who are hungry, homeless and experiencing personal crises around Orlando!

Volunteers can assist in several areas, including cleaning, organizing, and stocking shelves, sorting donated household items in our Member Marketplace and taking inventory in our Emergency Food Pantry. In addition to helping out in the Member Share Grocery Program, individual volunteers are needed to help with administrative tasks, special events, and educational programs.

Getting involved is super easy! All you need to do is register through United Against Poverty's volunteer portal. 

Other Helpful Info: Shifts occur throughout the weeks and average about 2 - 3 hours. Kids aged 10+ can volunteer. Kids aged 10-15 need a parent volunteer present with them.
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: United Against Poverty runs a Member Share Grocery Program which is a dignified food and household assistance program where those who are living in the 200% or below Federal Poverty Level can apply for membership and personally select the nutritious food items their family needs. This provides the basic needs, the variety and the nutritious food needed for them and their families. Program Members contribute a nominal handling fee per item, to cover costs of picking up donations. This contribution gives them dignity and empowerment to engage in the life changing transformational programs we offer at UP. Any proceeds from those contributions are directed back into the support of facilitating our life changing programs.
addresses: ["150 W Michigan St, Orlando, FL 32806, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["10 and up with the supervision of a parent or guardian"]

headline: Second Harvest Foodbank of Central Florida
short_description: Help feed those in need around Central Florida!
content:
Time to help those in need around Central Florida with Second Harvest Foodbank!

Volunteers assist in a wide range of tasks to help feed the people of Orlando. Donations are received daily and volunteers are needed to help unpack, inspect, sort and organize goods in the various pantries and storage areas. As well as help to prepare meals and bags of groceries to be handed out and delivered around the community. Help is also needed to organize and clean the warehouses after daily shifts.

Volunteers need to visit the volunteer webpage and create an account. Once you've created an account, you can register for your desired position!

Have a group? If so, groups must reach out to volunteers@feedhopenow.org to make a group reservation.

Other Helpful Info: Locations may vary depending on the opportunity you select! The location will always be listed on the event page when your register. Kids ages ten and older can volunteer with a parent or guardian. Shifts are usually between 2 - 3 hours in length.
date_notes: Shifts occur throughout the week!
organization_name: Second Harvest Foodbank of Central Florida
organization_description: Second Harvest Foodbank of Central Florida is working to bridge the food divide across Orlando by providing nutritious food, food education and cooking courses to those in need or from underserved communties while also teaching community members about the ways to grow their own food.
addresses: ["3702 Mercy Star Ct building 3 suite 130, Orlando, FL 32808, USA", "411 Mercy Drive, Orlando, FL 32805, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["10 - 17 must be accompanied by parent or guardian"]

headline: Covenant House Florida
short_description: Spread love and support to homeless children & young adults.
content:
Do you want to give back and support underserved communities across Florida? Covenant House Florida is looking for volunteers to help support their efforts to house, feed, clothe and provide love to homeless youths.

Volunteers can work either directly with the children and young adults in the shelter by providing help with homework, arts and crafts, hair care and styling, parents' education and support, or help with weekly meetings to help members curb addiction or avoid it altogether. Volunteers should have a passion or experience teaching life skills and assisting people from underrepresented or troubled backgrounds. There are also behind-the-scenes opportunities for volunteers to lend a hand in preparing and serving meals and overseeing the clothing donation room.

You are able to register to volunteer by filling out the form at the bottom of the volunteer page and selecting your desired volunteer opportunities. Once you've completed your questionnaire, a team member will be in touch to either set up your interview and background check or get you started to finalize your volunteering paperwork.

Other Helpful Info: Volunteers must be over 21 and usually require a Level II background check. Covenant House asks all volunteers for a time commitment of three months. The shelter is open seven days a week. Volunteer shifts will occur each day during regular working hours. Days of the week and times for shifts vary depending on the opportunity.

Photo Courtesy of Covenant House Florida
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: Covenant House Florida works to provide shelter and resources to homeless youth around Orlando. Focusing on individuals 21 and under, Covenant House gives its community members love, support and inspiration to be a contributing member of society.
addresses: ["5931 East Colonial Drive, Orlando, FL 32807, USA"]

headline: Coalition for the Homeless of Central Florida
short_description: Serve meals or sort donations to help the homeless!
content:
Helping hands are needed to support homeless communities around the greater Orlando area. Coalition for the Homeless of Central Florida is looking for one-time and recurring volunteers to help support its mission of providing resources to people experiencing homelessness. This opportunity is great for families with older kids as well!

Volunteers can help with a wide range of tasks around the shelter. From sorting and organizing donations of clothing and food, helping to prepare and serve meals, and working on maintenance and beautification projects around the building, there is something for everyone! Volunteers are also needed to help guests of the shelter retrieve clothing, hygiene products and other needs. Volunteers are integral to serving the community successfully.

All volunteers must register and complete a volunteer application and have a background check completed. Once the volunteer application and your background check have been completed, you will be able to register for your desired opportunity.

Other Helpful Info: There are opportunities available every day of the week. But the individual opportunities vary during the week. Most shifts are 2 -3 hours, with one occurring in the morning and one in the afternoon. Ages 13+
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_name: Coalition for the Homeless of Central Florida
organization_description: The Coalition for the Homeless of Central Florida is a homeless shelter working to improve the lives of men, women and children experiencing homeless. They work to provide individuals and families with resources to support their journey to end their own homelessness.
addresses: ["18 North Terry Avenue, Orlando, FL 32801, USA"]

headline: VA Orlando Healthcare System
short_description: Give back to those who've served our country.
content:
Give back time to those who served our country! 

Volunteers provide many important functions throughout the health care system and make patient experiences more enjoyable. Volunteers perform various services in both clinical and non-clinical areas. Volunteers' talents and interests are used to match them to one or more of the available assignments where they would be able to provide the most impact.

To start volunteering, you must submit a request to volunteer. Once you've submitted your request, the full onboarding process may take 2-3 weeks to complete.

Other Helpful Info: Health and background check are required. You will also need to complete a required orientation. Ages 18+ and opportunities occur at various locations around the Orlando Healthcare system. Length of shifts vary depending on actvity.

Photo Courtesy of VA Orlando Healthcare System
date_notes: Dependent on opportunity
organization_description: The VA Orlando Health Care System helps veterans, their families and caregivers through various services.
addresses: ["Orlando, FL, USA"]

headline: New England USO
short_description: Work at special USO events and programs!
content:
Volunteers can help out with special events like military homecomings, trainings and/or deployments, concerts, holiday parties, booths at festivals, military appreciation day, and more! You can also sign up to help out at one of the various USO Centers across Eastern Massachusetts.

USO Volunteers can register here and a team member will reach out with more information.

Volunteers must be 18 years or older; 13 and older at some special events with a parent/guardian. They must undergo a background check. Wear comfortable shoes and clothing that is not too revealing.
date_notes: Depends on event schedule!
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families, and country through programs which strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["1 Harborside Drive, Boston, MA, USA", "427 Commercial Street, Boston, Massachusetts, USA", "495 Summer Street, Boston, MA 02210, USA"]

headline: Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program
short_description: Help the homeless receive vital health care!
content:
Volunteers with BHCHP have the opportunity to work directly with the unhoused and support clinical care.

You can volunteer as a patient navigator and accompany patients to appointments and throughout their care process. You can also serve as an assistant case manager and assist patients in accessing various resources.

To begin volunteering, submit an application, and a coordinator will reach out shortly. Group volunteering opportunities are available - contact volunteer@bhchp.org for more information.

Volunteers attend an orientation and commit to a weekly shift for six months. Before beginning to volunteer, you must complete a background check, be vaccinated for Covid-19, and provide a record of the immunizations listed here.

Please wear comfortable clothes that are not too revealing and closed-toed shoes.
organization_name: Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program
organization_description: The Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program provides vital care to the homeless in Boston, accessing the resources of the conventional health care system and offering specialized health centers and street medicine.
addresses: ["Barbara Mc Innis House, Albany Street, Boston, MA, USA", "Stacy Kirkpatrick House, Walnut Avenue, Jamaica Plain, MA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Must show proof of vaccination", "Required"]

headline: Swords to Plowshares
short_description: Help veterans in San Francisco!
content: Swords to Plowshares is looking for lawyers to volunteer pro-bono and help veterans access their VA benefits. The organization is also in need of group volunteers to help with monthly breakfast services, beautification/rehabilitation projects, hygiene kit assembly, and event assistance.
organization_description: Swords to Plowshares provides veterans services such as counseling, support groups, and emergency housing. rental assistance, free attorney support, job development, paid training opportunities, and more!
addresses: ["Swords to Plowshares, 1060 Howard St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA"]

headline: Raphael House
short_description: Help those in need in San Francisco!
content: Volunteers can help by offering remote pro bono services to families apart of Raphael House or the organization directly. Volunteers can also create pre-recorded videos on various topics such as interview tips, resume-building skills, how to use Gmail on your phone, step-by-step art projects, and more!
organization_description: Raphael House works to help families experiencing homelessness and low-income families reach financial independence and acquire stable housing through different programs. They offer programs such as a residential shelter program, bridge program, academic enrichment program, and more!
addresses: ["Raphael House, 1065 Sutter Street, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA"]

headline: Humane Society for Greater Savannah
short_description: Helping animals across Savannah find forever homes!
content:
Calling all animal lovers! Give some time and lend a hand to help the stray, neglected and abused cats and dogs around coastal Georgia find their forever homes!

Volunteers can assist in all aspects of animal welfare and guest services during adoption visits. There are opportunities to socialize with cats, take dogs on walks, help work with shy animals, clean up enclosures and even bottle feed baby kittens! If you are interested in working with people, volunteers can accompany visitors on adoption visits to make them feel comfortable and answer any questions about the animals. Volunteers can also help take photos of animals to pair with adoption postings.

To volunteer, you will have to fill out a volunteer application and select a time when you can complete your in-house orientation. During your orientation, you will be able to learn more about the available volunteer opportunities, get to know the shelter and be able to purchase a volunteer t-shirt. Once this is done, you are ready to participate in training and start volunteering!

Other Helpful Info: Days and times of volunteer shifts will be available once you complete your onboarding!
organization_description: Helping to help the abandoned, unwanted and neglected animals around Savannah find a forever home!
addresses: ["7215 Sallie Mood Drive, Savannah, GA 31406, USA"]

headline: Children's Hospital of the King's Daughters
short_description: Give warmth and support to children with serious illnesses.
content:
There are so many ways to support the patients at the hospital! Do you have a certified therapy dog? Do you play an instrument? Or do you just want to lend a comforting hand and warm hug to kids undergoing treatments or in extended stays at the hospital? Volunteers visit with therapy dogs, play instruments in the main lobby, help out in the hospital gift shop, and help to support medical staff with oversight of playrooms and communication with families.

You can submit an application here. Once you have completed the application, reach out to volunteer services ((757) 668-7195) to schedule an interview (Monday - Thursday). After completing your interview, you must have a background check completed and then follow along with and complete the volunteer orientation. 

All opportunities other than musical and pet therapy volunteering require commitments of 4 hours weekly. Must be vaccinated against COVID-19, Measles, Mumps, Chicken Pox, and Tuberculosis.
organization_name: Children's Hospital of the King's Daughters
organization_description: The Children's Hospital of the King's Daughters provides medical care to children with chronic and life-threatening conditions.
addresses: ["Children's Hospital of The King's Daughters, Children's Lane, Norfolk, VA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Must show proof of vaccination"]

headline: Soccer Without Borders - Seattle
short_description: Provide kids positive development through soccer!
content:
Volunteers help Soccer without Borders youth in many ways. Opportunities include coaching soccer, academic tutoring, and driving players when needed.

To begin volunteering, submit an application and a volunteer coordinator will reach out to you shortly.

Must be over 18 to volunteer and vaccinated for Covid-19. If you are under 18 and want to get involved, check out the ambassador program! Volunteers commit to a minimum of one event per week for at least six months.
organization_description: Soccer without Borders believes in positive change for individuals through the sport. They offer youth development programs for underserved youth communities from over 75 countries of origin.
addresses: ["Seattle, WA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Must show proof of vaccination"]

headline: VOLO Kids - San Francisco
short_description: Coach kids and mentor them in a positive lifestyle!
content:
Volunteers with Volo Kids work not only as sports coaches but also as life mentors for kids who come from all different backgrounds. There are eight sports you can coach, with opportunities changing seasonally. Volunteers can also serve on the admin side with a need for assistance in networking, social media work, field management, photography and event support.

To begin volunteering, visit this page and select an activity you're interested in volunteering for. Click the blue "register" button, create an account, and select your preferred volunteer role (e.g., "coach").

Activities are hosted at various locations across San Francisco. Must be 18 or older to volunteer.
organization_description: Volo Kids works to make youth sports free and accessible, increasing physical activity and combatting obesity, drug usage and mental health issues in children. They introduce children to an "active, resilient and confident" lifestyle.

Volunteers with Volo Kids work not only as sports coaches but also as life mentors for kids who come from all different backgrounds. There are eight sports you can coach, with opportunities changing seasonally. Volunteers can also serve on the admin side with a need for assistance in networking, social media work, field management, photography and event support.

Activities are hosted at various locations across San Diego. Must be 18 or older to volunteer.

headline: Soccer Without Borders - Boston
short_description: Provide kids positive development through soccer!
content:
Volunteers help Soccer without Borders youth in many ways. Opportunities include coaching soccer, academic tutoring, and driving players when needed.

To begin volunteering, submit an application and a volunteer coordinator will reach out to you shortly.

Must be over 18 to volunteer and vaccinated for Covid-19. If you are under 18 and want to get involved, check out the ambassador program! Volunteers commit to a minimum of one event per week for at least six months.
organization_description: Soccer without Borders believes in positive change for individuals through the sport. They offer youth development programs for underserved youth communities from over 75 countries of origin.

headline: Connor's Heroes
short_description: Support children battling cancer and their families!
content:
There are many ways to care for Heroes (children battling cancer) and their families: Work one on one with children and create crafts together, clean the yards of children's families, brighten the hospital rooms of heroes by decorating, or assist at one of many events for Heroes and their families.

To begin volunteering, fill out the registration form and a staff member will connect you to a volunteer opportunity in Richmond.

Age and vaccination requirements vary according to activity. Ask your volunteer coordinator for more information!
organization_description: Connor's Heroes is dedicated to supporting the families of children with cancer and funds research to improve treatment. Connor's Heroes helps families to cope by providing resources that ease financial burdens, a community that is a source of strength and comfort, and access to events and joyful experiences.
addresses: ["Richmond, VA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Varies according to activity, ask your volunteer coordinator!"]

headline: Active Children Portland
short_description: Coach and mentor under-served kids in formative experiences!
content:
Active Children Portland welcomes anyone looking to engage positively with the Portland community and will identify and make accessible roles that fit your skills!

Established volunteer opportunities include coaching soccer, serving as a writing/learning mentor, and assisting with tournaments, field clean-up, and events. Groups are encouraged to volunteer and be sure to mention if you have any special talents (web design, photography, etc.).

To begin volunteering, complete this signup form, and ACP will reach out with the next steps. Groups are encouraged to sign up and are needed for tournaments, events, field cleanups and more!

Soccer coaches and writing/learning mentors commit to one afternoon a week for 8-10 weeks. Volunteer opportunities occur at locations all over the Portland metro area!
organization_description: Active Children Portland provides access to sports, mentorship, and education to help kids circumvent financial and societal barriers that create inequities in accessing formative experiences. ACP's range of programs continues to expand to address the health, safety, and development of under-served kids in the Portland metro area.
addresses: ["2405 Southeast 11th Avenue, Portland, Oregon 97214, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Varies according to activity, ask your volunteer coordinator!"]

headline: Gilda's Club Middle Tennessee
short_description: Provide support to those affected by cancer.
content:
Contribute to the social and emotional support of individuals and families affected by cancer.

Bring your skills and passions to volunteering at Gilda’s Club Middle Tennessee and select the volunteer role that best suits your abilities from the many available (volunteer opportunities list)! You can support those impacted by cancer by leading workshops (yoga, sewing, journal writing, cooking, accounting, or anything applicable in your area of expertise!), caring for children, assisting at events, helping out at the office, and so much more!

To begin volunteering, fill out the volunteer application, and Gilda's club will reach out to schedule a tour and information session to get you oriented.

Activity duration and age requirements are dependent on chosen volunteer opportunities. Some activities require background checks and vaccinations - learn more at your volunteer information session!
organization_description: Gilda's Club holistically supports those impacted by cancer, including families, by providing social and emotional support that complements medical treatment. Gilda’s Club Middle Tennessee offers a network of support groups, healthy lifestyle workshops, mind-body classes, social activities, and educational lectures to foster community and connect that community to free resources.
addresses: ["1707 Division Street, Nashville, TN 37203, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Vaccinations may be required dependent on activity", "Varies according to activity, ask your volunteer coordinator!"]

headline: Gilda's Club Twin Cities
short_description: Provide support to those affected by cancer.
content:
There are many ways to provide social and emotional support for those affected by cancer at Gilda's Club.

Bring your skills and passions to volunteering at Gilda’s Club Twin Cities and select the volunteer role that best suits your abilities from the many available (volunteer opportunities list)! You can support those impacted by cancer by leading workshops (yoga, sewing, journal writing, cooking accounting, or anything applicable in your area of expertise!), serving as a clinic ambassador or greeter, assisting at events, helping out at the office, and so much more! Many virtual opportunities are currently available.

To begin volunteering, fill out the volunteer interest form, and Gilda's club will reach out to schedule an orientation and a brief interview to get you situated. Gilda's Club Twin Cities welcomes volunteer groups - check out their group volunteering page to learn more! Some roles require a regular commitment. One-time opportunities are also available.

Activity duration and age requirements are dependent on chosen volunteer opportunities. Some activities require background checks and vaccinations - learn more at your orientation!
organization_description: Gilda's Club holistically supports those impacted by cancer, including families, by providing social and emotional support that complements medical treatment. Gilda’s Club Twin Cities offers a network of support groups, healthy lifestyle workshops, mind-body classes, social activities, and educational lectures to foster community and connect that community to free resources.

headline: B.I.G. Love Cancer Care - San Antonio
short_description: Support and care for pediatric cancer patients.
content:
Deliver meals, assist with events, arrange care packages, and much more to support patients and families and show appreciation for hospital staff. Check out all the available opportunities at hospitals in your area and pitch in where you can.

To begin volunteering, submit an application and look out for an email from B.I.G. Love Cancer Care. Groups are encouraged to volunteer and can assemble care packages and assist with events.

There are opportunities for all ages to get involved with B.I.G. Love Cancer Care. However, you must be 18 or older to volunteer in hospitals. Vaccinations are also required for hospital entry. Email biglovevolunteer@gmail.com for more information on required vaccinations.
organization_name: B.I.G. Love Cancer Care - San Antonio
organization_description: B.I.G. Love Cancer Care works to meet the needs of pediatric oncology and hematology patients and their families. Their many programs in Texas hospitals provide resources, support, and community.

things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Opportunities for all ages. 18 or older in hospitals.", "Vaccinations are required for volunteer activities in hospitals."]

Deliver meals, assist with events, arrange care packages, and much more to support patients and families and show appreciation for hospital staff. Check out all the available opportunities at hospitals in your area and pitch in where you can.

headline: BASE Camp
short_description: Support families affected by cancer at camps and more!
content:
There are many ways to help BASE Camp support and encourage families affected by cancer, including chaperoning at an overnight camp, crafting and sending cards, assisting in the office, delivering groceries, and more! No matter your schedule or interests, there is a role for you.

Fill out a volunteer application and BASE Camp will reach out to schedule a volunteer orientation. Age and vaccination requirements vary according to activity, ask your volunteer coordinator for more information!

Please dress appropriately for activities and follow hospital dress codes.
organization_description: BASE Camp supports families and patients affected by oncological and hematological illnesses. Their programs provide respite, enrichment, and nourishment.

things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Opportunities for all ages. 18 or older in hospitals.", "Vaccinations may be required dependent on activity"]

headline: LA84 Foundation
short_description: Promote positive youth development through sports!
content:
Help kids gain confidence and participate in healthy athletic activities by volunteering with the LA84 Foundation!

 Are you an avid sports fan? Would you like to support children's healthy development and stay active? You can help out at one of the many sports programs in the LA area that the LA84 Foundation funds. The foundation provides financial support, coach training, and sports advocacy to help youth sports programs reach as many children as possible. 

The foundation is always looking for volunteers to act as tour guides at LA84's renowned Olympics and sports library. There are many ways to support the foundation's mission!
organization_description: LA84 promotes youth sports as a positive force for children's development. This nonprofit supports coaches and local organizations that provide access to constructive athletic activities for kids.
addresses: ["2141 W Adams Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90018, USA"]

headline: Isabella Santos Foundation
short_description: Help at events to raise funds for pediatric cancer research!
content:
Help the Isabella Santos Foundation in its mission to beat cancer and fund vital research!

Assist at one of its many annual events or contribute your skills and time to daily operations. Fundrasing events include 5k/10k runs, Golf for a Cure, the Black & White Bowtie Ball, and many more!

To begin volunteering, email info@isabellasantosfoundation.org to added to the volunter database and join the ISF volunteer group on facebook to stay up to date with volunteer opportunities. ISF welcomes group volunteers - email info@isabellasantosfoundation.org to learn more about group opportunities.
organization_description: The Isabella Santos Foundation has contributed over $6 million in funding to pediatric cancer research and research that improves cancer treatments. Recently, the foundation has expanded its effort to support families affected by pediatric cancer and funded counseling, scholarships, and more.
addresses: ["9935 Rea Rd unit 275, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Some ages are welcome to join, just ask a team member!"]

headline: The Miracle League of the Triangle
short_description: Help make baseball accessible to those with special needs!
content:
Help out on Fridays and Saturdays at youth league games as a buddy (work one-on-one and facilitate a player's participation), coach, or as a part of the support staff and get involved in exciting baseball and work closely with players.

To begin volunteering, complete a registration form and a volunteer coordinator will reach out! Groups are welcome to volunteer and should email volunteer@mltriangle.com to sign up. 

Volunteers must be 12 or older, wear a mask, and attend a training session. Coaches must be 16 or older and complete a background check if 18 or older. Volunteers shifts are generally 3 hours long.
organization_name: The Miracle League of the Triangle
organization_description: The Miracle League of the Triangle is a fully inclusive baseball program for youth and adults with diagnosed disabilities, ensuring all community members have access to the sport and enriching outdoor activity.
addresses: ["3011 Queensland Rd, Raleigh, NC 27614, USA", "473 Morehead Avenue, Durham, NC 27701, USA", "Adams Elementary School, 805 Cary Towne Boulevard, Cary, NC 27511, USA"]

headline: Ability360
short_description: Empower people with disabilities to live independently!
content:
Help folks with disabilities achieve independent living by volunteering as a peer mentor or in the sports & fitness center.

Peer mentors work one-on-one and help overcome barriers to independent living. Sports volunteers assist with gym machines or run sports programs for kids!

To volunteer as a peer mentor, complete this application. Sports volunteers should apply here. After applying, a volunteer coordinator will reach out about next steps!

Peer mentors must be 18 or older. Volunteers 16-18 can apply to be junior sports volunteers! Must complete a background check, provide three references, and interview. Volunteers then attend orientation and training.
organization_description: Ability360 empowers people with disabilities to live independently and address societal barriers. Ability360 is the largest independent living facility in Arizona, run by people with disabilities for people with disabilities.
addresses: ["5031 E Washington St, Phoenix, AZ 85034, USA"]

headline: Wipe Out Kids' Cancer
short_description: Provide hope to families affected by pediatric cancer!
content:
As a volunteer with WOKC you can help pack and deliver Buddy Bags - care packages full of comfort items for child cancer patients that make overnight hospital stays easier (each bag includes an Ipad!). You can also brighten the day of families and kids by assisting at WOKC events and programs.

To begin volunteering, submit an interest form and look out for an email from WOKC.
organization_description: Wipe Out Kids' Cancer combats pediatric cancer and provides hope to kids and families by funding research, hosting events, and supplying comfort items to kids during overnight hospital stays.
addresses: ["1349 Empire Central ste 100, Dallas, TX 75247, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Vaccinations are required for volunteer activities in hospitals.", "Varies by event."]

headline: Out Youth
short_description: Provide sanctuary and support to LGBTQIA+ youth!
content:
There are many opportunities to support the vital work of Out Youth and work for the well-being of LGBTQIA+ youth. You are able to assist at annual events like Youth Prom and the PRIDE Parade or support a Drop-In program that helps youth find community and access resources.

To begin volunteering, add your contact information to the volunteer list and browse current volunteer opportunities.

Drop-In volunteers must be over the age of 22. Other volunteer opportunities are generally 18 and older. Volunteers that work directly with youth must complete a background check. Orientation/training may be required. Drop-In sessions are generally 2-3 hours.
organization_description: Out Youth's mission is to "promote the physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well-being of sexual and gender minority youth so that they can openly and safely explore and affirm their identities." Out Youth provides affirming counseling and offers various programs that foster community, acceptance, and empowerment and afford sanctuary.
addresses: ["909 East 49th 1/2 Street, Austin, TX 78751, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Drop-In volunteers must be over the age of 22. Other opportunities are generally 18 and older.", "Required for volunteers."]

headline: Lasagna Love - At Home!
short_description: Bake a lasagna and feed a family in need.
content:
Lasagna Love started in one kitchen and has blossomed into an international movement to help address the food insecurity crisis and help to feed those in need. By baking a lasagna (or two, or three!), you can help to support a person or family who is going through a crisis or a time of need. It really is so simple, just sign up and select the options for type of lasagna, where you will deliver, how frequently you want to contribute and the number of lasagnas you can provide. Once you submit the form, you'll receive a confirmation email (check spam) with all additional details, then you can get to baking!

This is a great option for kids of all ages and families of all sizes. Only delivered in your local area, you can really help make an impact, one lasanga at a time. Participants must provide all materials to prepare and bake lasangas.
universal_notes: You can do this at home, no matter where you live!
organization_description:
Lasagna Love is a global nonprofit and grassroots movement that aims to positively impact communities by connecting neighbors with neighbors through homemade meal delivery. We also seek to eliminate stigmas associated with asking for help when it is needed most. Our mission is simple: feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities.

Mission provided by LasagnaLove.com
addresses: [null]

headline: Donation Drop Offs Needed!
short_description: Donate to feed the hungry around San Diego
content:
The Jacobs & Cushman San Deigo Foodbank is always looking for donations to be distributed within the community.

Donations that are most needed are: Canned Chicken, Tuna Dry, Canned Beans, Cereal Rice, Nuts & Seeds, Peanut Butter, Canned Soup, Canned & Dried Fruit, Canned Vegetables, Powdered Milk, Infant Formula, Canned Vegetables Low & Nonfat Powdered Milk

Other Needed Items: Tuna in Water, Low-Sodium Canned Beans, Low-Sugar Whole Grain Cereal, Brown & Wild Rice, Unsalted Almonds, Low-Sodium & Low-Fat Canned Soup, Flax Seeds, No Sugar Added Peanut Butter, Canned Fruit in Water or Juice Low-Sodium & No Salt Added

Homemade food products or glass jars cannot be accepted. When you arrive at the locations, please follow the signs to "Shipping and Receiving" to drop off your donations. Please have all items packed in either bags or boxes.

Miramar Location: Open Monday - Friday from 8am - 12pm and 1pm - 3pm

Vista Location: Open Monday - Friday from 7am - 11am and 12pm - 2pm
date_notes: Closed 12pm - 1pm
organization_name: The Jacobs & Cushman San Diego Foodbank
organization_description: Working to feed community members across San Diego, The Jacobs & Cushman San Diego Foodbank provides groceries and meals to underserved communities.
addresses: ["3030 Enterprise Court suite a, Vista, CA 92081, USA", "9850 Distribution Avenue, San Diego, CA 92121, USA"]

headline: Side by Side
short_description: Create a supportive community for LGBTQ+ youth.
content:
