Volunteers with Side by Side can provide support and community to LGBTQ+ youth as support group facilitators, by helping to maintain the youth center, or by assisting at one of many events like Alternative Prom.

To begin volunteering, submit a volunteer application and Side by Side will be in touch shortly. If interested in group volunteering opportunities, reach out to delton.harris@sidebysideva.org.

Younger volunteers are encouraged to support events and help maintain the center. Must be 25 or older to volunteer as a support group facilitator. Support group volunteers must complete a background check and facilitation training.
organization_description: Side by Side "is dedicated to creating supportive communities where Virginia’s LGBTQ+ youth can define themselves, belong, and flourish." Side by Side offers peer support groups to affirm and connect LGBTQ+ youth, open Drop-In hours that provide a safe space and access to resources, and training for youth and adults to become advocates for the LGBTQ+ community
addresses: ["2311 Westwood Ave, Richmond, VA 23230, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: Reading Partners - Seattle
short_description: Tutor students struggling with reading in Seattle schools
content:
Volunteers are matched with students and provided with a curriculum and other resources to act as reading mentors, helping to ensure that the children learn to enjoy reading and ultimately become lifelong readers through the support of their mentor. 

To begin volunteering, complete the volunteer sign up form and you will hear from Reading Partners shortly! Volunteers complete a background check and orientation and then commit to at least 1 hour a week on a recurring schedule. Tutoring generally occurs 8am-4pm Mon-Fri.

Reading partners is in 8 schools in the Seattle area. Check out the list of locations here.
organization_description: Reading Partners works to ensure children learn to enjoy reading and ultimately become lifelong readers through support and mentorship.
addresses: ["Seattle, WA, USA"]

headline: SAGE NYC
short_description: Form meaningful relationships with LGBTQ+ elders!
content:
LGBTQ+ elders experience isolation at a greater rate than their non-LGBTQ+ peers. To combat isolation, Volunteers with SAGE are matched with an older person and make visits to form a meaningful and engaging relationship and build community. Volunteers are trained and supported and have the opportunity positively affect an elder's life. 

To begin volunteering, submit a volunteer application and SAGE will reach out with next steps. Volunteers attend training and commit to one year with the program. Visits are generally 1-2 hours a week.
organization_description: SAGE is the world's oldest organization dedicated to providing care for LGBTQ+ elders: "Founded in New York City in 1978, SAGE offers innovative services and programs to LGBTQ+ older people throughout New York City and the nation. In New York, our SAGE Centers offer a number of social activities and programs for LGBTQ+ older people. In addition, SAGE New York provides holistic coordinated care to LGBTQ+ older people and the people who support them via our care management services."
addresses: ["New York, NY, USA"]

headline: Philadelphia FIGHT
short_description: Contribute your skills to the fight against HIV!
content:
Volunteers with Philadelphia FIGHT are encouraged to bring their own skills and expertise to the fight against HIV and can contribute in marketing, data entry, at special events, accounting, and much more!

To begin volunteering, submit a contact form and FIGHT will reach out with next steps!

FIGHT operates in many locations across philadelphia. Locations are listed here.
organization_description: "Philadelphia FIGHT Community Health Centers provide culturally competent comprehensive primary care, and state of the art HIV primary care to low-income members of the community, along with research, consumer education, advocacy, social services and outreach to people living with HIV and those who are at high risk, including family members, communities with high rates of HIV, formerly incarcerated persons, and young people at risk; and access to the most advanced clinical research in HIV treatment and prevention."
addresses: ["Philadelphia, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: LGBT Life Center
short_description: Support local LGBT and HIV communities!
content:
Volunteers at the LGBTQ Life Center have the opportunity to help host events for the LGBTQ and HIV communities or support the Center's work in the office.

To begin volunteering, submit an interest form and the Center will reach out with next steps shortly!
organization_description: "LGBT Life Center is a trusted leader that empowers the LGBTQ communities and all people affected by HIV through improving health and wellness, strengthening families and communities, and providing transformative education and advocacy."
addresses: ["222 West 21st Street f308, Norfolk, VA 23517, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: Book Give
short_description: Collect, sort, box and deliver books in Denver!
content:
Volunteers with Book Give promote literacy in a variety of roles. You can collect, sort, and pack donated books, assist with community outreach, help to coordinate volunteers, and more! Check out all the available roles on the volunteer page.

To begin volunteering, submit a volunteer application and Book Give will reach out to set up next steps!

Volunteers supply references, interview, train, and complete four trial shifts. Some volunteer roles may require the ability to lift and move boxes of books weighing 20-40lbs.
organization_description: Book give believes "literacy is a basic human right. Everyone deserves books. We curate every book request that we deliver. Boulder Bridge House serves people transitioning to permanent housing, so we include cookbooks with recipes for busy working folks. Urban Peak serves diverse youth experiencing homelessness, so we include books with characters of color and queer characters. Crossroads at Lakewood has a memory care unit, so we include coffee table books with fabulous images. Our mission is to deliver free books, the right books that truly inspire readers."
addresses: ["4890 Lowell Blvd, Denver, CO 80221, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: The Veterans Group
short_description: Support and empower Philadelphia's veterans!
content:
The Veterans Group welcomes volunteer to support their community of veterans in many ways. You can mentor veterans in life and workplace skills, help fundraise to expand The Veterans Group's capacity to assist veterans, maintain the shelter, and more!

To begin volunteering, submit your contact information, indicate how you would like to volunteer, and look out for an email from The Veterans Group.
organization_description: The Veterans Group's mission is "to empower Veterans in need to achieve success in civilian society. We accomplish this mission by developing individualized plans for each resident while providing a family-like community of support and care."
addresses: ["3209-11 Baring Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: National Military Park Virginia - National Park Service
short_description: Help maintain and share Virginia's historic battlefields!
content:
Volunteers at the National Military Park help maintain the historic sites, educate visitors, and provide interpretive services. Check out all the current volunteer opportunities here.

To begin volunteering, browse the volunteer opportunities and submit an application. Maintenance work generally requires moderate physical exertion.
organization_name: National Military Park Virginia - National Park Service
organization_description: The National Park Service maintains and curates the historical battlegrounds of Virginia's National Military Park: "Fredericksburg, Chancellorsville, Wilderness, and Spotsylvania, this is America's battleground, where the Civil War roared to its bloody climax. No place more vividly reflects the War's tragic cost in all its forms. A town bombarded and looted. Farms large and small ruined. Refugees by the thousands forced into the countryside. More than 85,000 men wounded; 15,000 killed--most in graves unknown."
addresses: ["1013 Lafayette Blvd, Fredericksburg, VA 22401, USA"]

headline: LGBTQ History Museum of Central Florida
short_description: Help preserve and present Orlando's LGBTQ history!
content:
Volunteers at the museum have a unique opportunity to work firsthand with historical documents/archives and contribute to their preservation and presentation. You are able to participate in archiving histroic artifacts, assist with specific exhibits and events, write local histories, and more!

To begin volunteering, email a completed copy of the volunteer application to floridalgbtqmuseum@gmail.com and look out for an email about next steps!
organization_name: LGBTQ History Museum of Central Florida
organization_description: "The mission of the LGBTQ History Museum of Central Florida, Inc. is to collect, preserve and exhibit the history of the Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual and Transgender community in Central Florida. We are dedicated to collecting and preserving memorabilia, providing a documentary record for research, and displaying with pride that community's social and historical contributions, so our legacy will always be remembered."
addresses: ["Orlando, FL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: A HOPE
short_description: Care for shelter animals and assist in the adoption process!
content:
Volunteer with A HOPE for an opportunity to help with a range of tasks. Options include helping with animal intake, taking care of shelter cats, helping in the Pet Food Pantry which takes place every other Sunday, helping with vaccine clinics, educating youth, fostering animals, and more! 

Volunteers must sign a waiver. Volunteers under 18 must have a parent/guardian present with them and must have a parent/guardian sign their waiver.

Register and fill out an online application here: A HOPE Volunteer Application. Please feel free to contact volunteer@ahope4src.com if you have any questions!
organization_description: A HOPE educates the community on responsible ownership of companion animals and proper care for community cats by providing access to affordable sterilization/vaccine services, rescue support, and community outreach programs, leading to the prevention of unnecessary euthanasia.
addresses: ["5755 Washington St, Milton, FL 32570, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Feeding the Gulf Coast
short_description: Support underserved communities and help prepare meals!
content:
Help to combat  the food insecurity crisis  across the Gulf Coast  by supporting Feeding the Gulf Coast's efforts to provide resources to all communities facing hunger.

Volunteers are needed for sorting and packing. You can get food ready for distribution. Volunteers inspect and sort food donations, which includes checking expiration dates and cans for rust or missing labels and boxing similar items together for our partner organizations. You can also volunteer from home by helping to fundraise or spread awareness.

Minors may participate in some events. An adult must accompany children under 16.

Groups are welcome and should email the Volunteer Team to get started.

Open-toed shoes are prohibited in all warehouses.
date_notes: Day of the week depends on the opportunity you select!
organization_description: Feeding the Gulf Coast is a branch of Feeding America that works to address the food insecurity crisis that affects our nation's underserved populations. Feeding the Gulf Coast works with partner organizations and volunteers to ensure that all communities around the Gulf Coast have healthy, fresh, and affordable food in their local areas.
addresses: ["5709 Industrial Blvd, Milton, FL 32583, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 16 must be accompanied by an adult."]

headline: Feeding America
short_description: Collect essential food items for your local foods bank!
content:
Let Feeding America connect you with your local food bank and join the fight against hunger in your community! Volunteers can host food drives, donate unused food, and help spread the word about food inequity.

To get involved, find your local food bank and discover how you can best contribute! Virtual and in-person opportunities are available, and volunteers of all ages can participate.
organization_description: "Feeding America is the largest hunger-relief organization in the United States. Our mission is to advance change in America by ensuring equitable access to nutritious food for all in partnership with food banks, policymakers, supporters, and the communities we serve."
addresses: [null]

headline: Stone Soup PDX
short_description: Provide workforce training and opportunities to the homeless
content:
Volunteers with Stone Soup PDX provide essential support to the organization and the unhoused people it collaborates with. As a volunteer, you can deliver meals, get outside and help out in the garden, promote Stone Soup at the farmer's market, and more!

To begin volunteering, fill out a volunteer interest form and Stone Soup will be in touch shortly!

When volunteering at the restaurant, close-toed shoes and long pants are recommended.
organization_description: "Stone Soup PDX is a non-profit foodservice training enterprise based in Portland, OR, providing workforce development & hands-on culinary expertise to people at risk of homelessness."
addresses: ["306 Northwest Broadway, Portland, OR 97209, USA"]

headline: Keep Tahoe Blue
short_description: Help protect and maintain the natural beauty of Lake Tahoe!
content:
Volunteers are instrumental to protecting the health and beauty of Lake Tahoe. As a volunteer with Keep Lake Tahoe Blue, you can monitor pollution levels, identify invasive species, clear litter, and/or maintain the infrastructure that protects the lake. The organization offers training and community events (like lake cleanups) or the ability to report litter/environmental concerns through their app. 

To get started, check out all of the available volunteer opportunities and reach out to tahoebluecrew@keeptahoeblue.org. Volunteers of all ages and abilities are welcome!
organization_description: "The League to Save Lake Tahoe protects and restores the environmental health, sustainability and scenic beauty of the Lake Tahoe Basin. We focus on water quality and its clarity for the preservation of a pristine Lake for future generations."
addresses: ["Lake Tahoe, United States"]

headline: Slow Food Lake Tahoe
short_description: Promote healthy and sustainable farming and fight hunger!
content:
Get your hands dirty in the garden and support sustainable and equitable growing practices in your community! Volunteers can help with harvesting, planting, pruning, watering, and packaging fruits and veggies delivered to local hunger relief organizations or join Saturday Dig-ins to help complete larger garden projects. You can also assist in the daily functioning of the organization and bring your talents and enthusiasm to fundraising, photography, grant research, and more!

To get started, fill out a volunteer interest form and Slow Food will reach out shortly. All ages and abilities are welcome! Be sure to dress appropriately for outdoor oppotunities (hat and sunscreen!).
organization_description: "Slow Food Lake Tahoe's mission is to connect our community to the enjoyment of good, clean and fair food by inspiring a self-reliant food culture. We educate the community about growing, preparing and accessing local and sustainable food. Good, clean and fair food for all."
addresses: ["Truckee, CA, USA"]

headline: Achieve Tahoe
short_description: Make outdoor sports accessible for people with disabilities!
content:
Share your passion for an outdoor sport, provide an accessible experience, and enjoy a rewarding journey as an instructor, guide, or enthusiastic supporter! Volunteers with Achieve Tahoe ensure people with a variety of abilities have access to engaging experiences in the sport of their choice and gain confidence and independence. Summer sports include climbing, equestrian, hiking, and a range of watersports at Lake Tahoe. Winter volunteers provide various opportunities to revel in the joy of sliding on snow.

To get involved, fill out a volunteer application and be prepared to provide proof of vaccination and a background check. Volunteers complete training and commit to at least ten days a season.
organization_description: "Achieve Tahoe is dedicated to building health, confidence, and independence in people with disabilities through outdoor recreation. We can serve just about anyone with any disability through our teaching techniques and specialized equipment."
addresses: ["Alpine Meadows, Alpine Meadows Road, Alpine Meadows, CA 96146, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 16 or older", "Must show proof of vaccination", "Required"]

headline: SCORE Twin Cities
short_description: Professional advice to help local small businesses thrive!
content:
Volunteers can sign up to share their industry experience or knowledge about running a business through online video seminars, leading meetings for your local SCORE chapter, helping people build meaningful relationships within their communities and so many other ways to help small businesses grow! If you have experience owning, running or growing a business, volunteering with SCORE is a great way to give back and share your knowledge to help other small businesses thrive!

To get involved, fill out a volunteer application. Volunteering is done virtually, and volunteers should be able to dedicate 5-15 hours a month to SCORE.
organization_description: SCORE is a non-profit that is working to ensure the support and success of small business nationwide. They provide expertise and guidance through their platforms and volunteer groups.
addresses: ["Minneapolis, MN, USA"]

headline: International Cooking Day
short_description: Join Sierra House every 4th Friday of the month!
content:
Every 4th Friday of the month, the Sierra House invites community members to gather with their members to cook a meal! The meals usually rotate different internatioanl backgrounds and offer educational opportunties on how to cook, healthy eating and other life and social skills. 

Volunteers are able to come to the Sierra House, meet the residents and partner to cook a meal. No expereince required. Volunteers will help to collect ingredients, work to prepare the meal and eat together. If you are interested, please email tanya.taylor@sierrahouse.org.
organization_description: Sierra House works to improve the lives of children and adults from low income or disadvantaged communities through housing, education, and community projects.
addresses: ["134 Evergreen Place suite 103, East Orange, NJ 07018, USA"]

headline: Human Needs Food Pantry
short_description: Help to feed those in need around Essex County!
content:
Human Needs Food Pantry is always looking for volunteers to help with sorting, preparing and bagging groceries to be distributed within the community, helping to drive and pick up food for the bagged grocery program from local suppliers, working to sort and orangize clothing donations to be distributed to community members. 

There are also opportunties to help distribute food for walk or drive up community members and drive to deliver food and groceries to homebound community members. 

All you need to do to sign up is fill out this volunteer form and select which event you are interested in helping! Once you register, a team member will be in touch to schedule your training and first shift!
organization_description: Human Needs Food Pantry works to provide food, clothing and shelter to those in need around the greater Montclair and Essex County communities.
addresses: ["9 Label Street, Montclair, NJ 07042, USA"]

headline: The Trevor Project
short_description: Provide life-affirming support to LGBTQ youth!
content:
Seize the chance to support young members of the LGBTQ+ community through this incredible organization.

Volunteers with the Trevor Project have the opportunity to support LGBTQ youth in crisis and provide life-affirming acceptance and counseling. Trevor Volunteer Crisis Counselors are trained to respond to calls or texts and guide youth through their most challenging moments.

To begin volunteering, apply here. Volunteer Crisis Counselors are passionate and committed supporters of LGTBQ youth and are prepared to take on powerful conversations in moments of crisis. Volunteers recieve 40 hours of training and commit to one 3-hour shift per week for a year.
universal_notes: You can volunteer from all 50 states!
organization_description: The Trevor Project's mission is "to end suicide among lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and questioning young people by providing lifesaving and life-affirming services."
addresses: [null]

headline: Holbrook VA Clinic
short_description: Support the health and wellness of American Veterans!
content:
Give back to those who served and ensure they access the health care they deserve! Volunteers have the opportunity to facilitate clinic services and assist disabled veterans by driving them to and from appointments.

To begin volunteering, complete this form and be sure to select the Holbrook VA Clinic (649QB) in the facilities search. A volunteer coordinator will reach out with next steps in 1-2 days through your preferred method of contact.
organization_description: The Holbrook VA Clinic provides primary care and specialty health services, including treatment for diabetes, mental health care, laboratory and pathology services, telehealth, women’s health services, and more to American veterans.
addresses: ["33 West Vista, Holbrook, AZ, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Vaccinations may be required dependent on activity"]

headline: HOCRN Thrift
short_description: Cashiers and store helpers needed!
content:
The Heber-Overgaard area has a community thrift store which is in need of volunteers! The store is a crucial part of providing goods to the area and works to invest all its earning back into the community. Volunteers are needed to help organize and clean shelves as well as help run the cashiers.

Volunteers should be able to help out for atleast 2 hours.
organization_description: A thrift store that helps to connect communities and donate back all revenue for the betterment of the Heber-Overgaard community.
addresses: ["1846 Arizona 260, Heber, Arizona 85928, USA"]

headline: OUR Center (Outreach United Resource Center)
short_description: Support Longmont residents on the path to self-sufficiency
content:
Volunteers with OUR Center advocate for and support neighbors and community members as they transform their lives, fostering a community based in empathy and compassion. As a volunteer, you can play a vital role in one of the many programs and services the center offers and work directly with individuals and families in need. As OUR center works to tackle food insecurity and hunger in Longmont, volunteers are needed in the kitchen, as grocery drivers, and at the community market. Volunteers are also able to contribute at the community closet (clothing bank), in the garden, during special events, and more!

To begin volunteering, complete this application form, and a volunteer coordinator will reach out shortly with next steps!
organization_description: "The Outreach United Resource Center, Inc. (OUR Center) has provided critical services such as food, housing, and utilities to help families achieve self-reliance since 1986.  We offer “a hand up, not a hand out” to residents of the St. Vrain Valley School District of Colorado."
addresses: ["220 Collyer St, Longmont, CO 80501, USA"]

headline: Adult Education Center
short_description: Tutor adult learners to improve literacy and outcomes!
content:
Volunteers at the Adult Education Center are afforded a unique opportunity to form impactful relationships as they tutor and cheer on adult learners who harness improved literacy skills and English language ability to access better employment opportunities and an improved quality of life. Share your passion and knowledge for a subject of choice as a tutor - tutors are needed in literacy, ESL, and basic education can (math, history, science) - or support the center's mission as an administrative assistant or community outreach volunteer.

To begin volunteering, submit an application and be prepared to consent to a background check and provide references. After your application is recieved, a volunteer coordinator will reach out shortly to schedule an orientation and get you involved!
organization_description: The Adult Education Center's mission is "to Engage, Educate, and Empower communities of adult learners by advancing literacy skills and employment opportunities to achieve a better quality of life."
addresses: ["2246 North Washington Avenue, Pearland, TX 77581, USA"]

headline: Help the hungry in your hometown!
short_description: Items are always needed at local foodbanks!
content:
Below is a list of general items that are most needed at local foodbanks nationwide. If you would like to provide a donation, please collect these items, and deliver them to your local foodbank: 

Needs may be increased during the holiday season, make sure to check with your foodbank to make the most impact.

Peanut butter
Canned soup
Canned fruit
Canned vegetables
Canned stew
Canned fish
Canned beans
Pasta (most prefer whole grain)
Rice (most prefer brown rice)
universal_notes: You are able to enter your zip code and find your local food bank on Feeding America's website.
organization_name: Donate to your local food bank
organization_description: Foodbanks provide shelter, food, and resources to those who are facing difficulties in life.
addresses: [null]

headline: Toys for Tots
short_description: Donate toys to be given to children in your community!
content:
Toys for Tots is a nationwide program that collects new and unwrapped toys to be distributed to children in local communities. To become involved, or just to donate a toy, you can visit the "Apply to Giveback" button and search for your local donation bin or buy a toy from the virtual toy drive. 

There are also opportunities to host your own toy collection drive until Dec. 16th. All you have to do is request to be a drop off location and Toys for Tots will provide the boxes! This is a wonderful way to gather as a team of colleagues, family or friends.
date_notes: Donations accepted until Dec. 16th
universal_notes: Find your local donation drop off online
organization_description: The Marine Toys for Tots programs works to spread joy during the holiday season but distributing new, unwrapped toys to children across the U.S. All toys are donated by community members to be given to children who may be less fortunate.
addresses: [null]

headline: Volunteers of America Los Angeles
short_description: Donate clothing, food, or supplies to those in need!
content:
Donations through Volunteers of America Los Angeles support underserved communities, families, and individuals on their journeys to stability and self-sufficiency.

In-kind donations, from  clothing to  non-perishable foods to school supplies, help meet basic needs and allow recipients to pursue positive development through education and employment. As winter brings colder nights, clothing donations (socks, hats, gloves) help homeless veterans, individuals, and families stay warm and healthy. Monetary donations support VOALA's programs providing housing/shelter, drug and alcohol counseling, educational support, and much more!

In-kind donations can be dropped off at VOALA's 3600 Wilshire Blvd location. Monetary donations can also be made online.
organization_description: Volunteers of America was founded in 1896 on a core belief in the potential of every person, no matter the circumstance. Since then, we have been transforming the lives of America’s most vulnerable, including children and families from underserved communities, at–risk youth, veterans, individuals and families struggling with homelessness, men and women returning from prison, victims of human trafficking, and people challenged with addictions and substance use.
addresses: ["Volunteers of America Los Angeles, 3600 Wilshire Blvd suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Used items are not currently accepted due to COVID-19"]

headline: Volunteers of America
short_description: Donate items or money to support those in need!
content:
Serving 1.5 million people annually across the United States, Volunteers of America's network of programs provides housing/shelter, drug and alcohol counseling, educational support, and more to at-risk and underserved communities, meeting basic needs and empowering recipients to achieve stability and self-sufficiency through education and employment. You can donate monetarily to support the VOA's array of programs or be connected to one of the VOA's many local affiliates and donate items like non-perishable food, clothing, and school supplies directly to those in need in your community

To make in-kind donations, search for your local VOA affiliate here - items needed and accepted will be listed. As winter brings colder nights, clothing donations (socks, hats, gloves) are an urgent need and help homeless veterans, individuals, and families keep warm and stay healthy.

Monetary donations can be made online here! Xometry employees looking to donate monetarily should use this page.
organization_description: "Volunteers of America was founded in 1896 on a core belief in the potential of every person no matter the circumstance. Since then, we have been transforming the lives of America’s most vulnerable, including children and families from under–served communities, at–risk youth, veterans, individuals and families struggling with homelessness, men and women returning from prison, victims of human trafficking, and people challenged with addictions and substance use."
addresses: [null]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Used items are not currently accepted due to COVID-19"]

headline: Volunteers of America Greater New York
short_description: Donate clothing, food, or supplies to those in need!
content:
Donations through Volunteers of America Greater New York support underserved communities, families, and individuals on their journeys to stability and self-sufficiency.

In-kind donations, from clothing to non-perishable foods to school supplies, help meet basic needs and allow recipients to pursue positive development through education and employment. Donate items individually or spread the word to family, friends, and/or coworkers and start a drive for the most in-demand items. In particular, as winter sets in, clothing donations (socks, hats, gloves) help homeless veterans, individuals, and families keep warm and stay healthy. Monetary donations support VOA-GNY's array of programs that provide housing/shelter, drug and alcohol counseling, educational support, and much more!

If you are interested in starting a drive or donating items, please email volunteers@voa-gny.org for more information. There are many opportunities for companies and organizations to sponsor, host, or participate in VOA initiatives and events. To learn more, visit this page or email info@voa-gny.org.

 

Volunteer opportunities with VOA-GNY are currently on pause due to COVID-19 concerns.
organization_name: Volunteers of America Greater New York
organization_description: "Volunteers of America was founded in 1896 on a core belief in the potential of every person no matter the circumstance. Since then, we have been transforming the lives of America’s most vulnerable, including children and families from under–served communities, at–risk youth, veterans, individuals and families struggling with homelessness, men and women returning from prison, victims of human trafficking, and people challenged with addictions and substance use."
addresses: ["135 West 50th Street 9th floor, New York, NY 10020, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Used items are not currently accepted due to COVID-19"]

headline: Volunteers of America Mid-States - Lexington
short_description: Volunteer with or donate to at-risk youth and adults!
content:
Volunteers of America's network of programs provides housing/shelter, drug and alcohol counseling, educational support, and more to at-risk and underserved communities, meeting basic needs and empowering recipients to achieve stability and self-sufficiency through education and employment.
 

As a volunteer with VOA Mid-States, you have the opportunity to work directly with at-risk youth and adults and form impactful relationships while tutoring, sharing life skills, or leading games and fun during family night. You can also make an impact donating in-demand items like non-perishable foods, school supplies, and clothing or leading a drive with friends, family, or coworkers.

To begin volunteering, sign up for an introductory session here to learn more about volunteer roles and then complete an application.

In-kind donations can be dropped at VOA's Malabu Drive location Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. or at any of the affiliates throughout Kentucky and Tennessee listed here. During the holiday season, participate in Hope for the Holidays and donate items from this wishlist. 

To donate monetarily, visit this page. Xometry employees should donate through this link!
organization_description: "Volunteers of America was founded in 1896 on a core belief in the potential of every person no matter the circumstance. Since then, we have been transforming the lives of America’s most vulnerable, including children and families from under–served communities, at–risk youth, veterans, individuals and families struggling with homelessness, men and women returning from prison, victims of human trafficking, and people challenged with addictions and substance use."
addresses: ["210 Malabu Drive suite 220, Lexington, KY 40502, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must show proof of vaccination", "Required for volunteers.", "Used items are not currently accepted due to COVID-19", "Volunteers under 18 require adult supervision"]

headline: Mint Project, Inc.
short_description: Help those in need around the DMV
content:
Help to feed the hungry with Mint Project, Inc! Throughout the year, Mint Project has opportunities with local food banks and homeless shelters for individuals and groups of people to come help out. Volunteers will work to prepare lunch for the next days service and bring it to the shelter in need. This organization also hosts events throughout the month like a coat drive and fashion show, meal drives and many more!

This opportunity is a great way to give back to the DC community and they have many opportunties throughout DC proper and the National Harbor area.

Please fill out a volunteer form and a team member will be in touch asap. If you would like more immediate service, please email join@mintproject.org. Once you hear back from a team member, they can give you more information about location, days of the week and timing for your shift.
organization_description: The Mint Project, Inc works to support monthly service projects that work to feed the hungry, provide warm clothing, especially in the winter months, and lend a helping hand to those in need. Through their partnerships with local food banks and homeless shelters, they are able to create bonds between volunteers and the community.
addresses: ["Washington D.C., DC, USA"]

headline: March of Dimes
short_description: Support the health of mothers and infants!
content: Be part of the fight to end preventable maternal health risks, deaths, preterm births, and infant deaths, and close the health equity gap. As a volunteer with March of Dimes, you can lead and support campaigns and events in your community or remotely nationwide that drive new research and catalyze policy changes. Volunteers can send a note to a mom, dad, or family with a baby currently in the NICU or take on longer-term volunteer roles and lead fundraising and advocacy events in their region.
organization_description: March of Dimes mission "is to lead the fight for the health of all moms and babies. Our goals are to end the preventable maternal health risks and deaths, end preventable preterm birth and infant death, and close the health equity gap."
addresses: [null]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Dependent on role. Opportunities for younger volunteers are available."]

headline: Junior Achievement
short_description: Mentor students to financial literacy and career success!
content:
Help give students the tools to succeed in their lives and future careers. As mentors, volunteers with Junior Achievement promote financial literacy, encourage students to get the most out of their education, pass on their entrepenurial spirit to inspire the next innovative idea, and build impactful relationships with their mentees. Volunteers recieve training and have the opportunity to teach one of the JA's many programs from creative problem solving to business ethics with lessons tailored towards students in elementary school, middle school, and high school. Businesses and employers can also partner with Junior Achievement to host students in their workplace or connect employees with longer-term mentorship opportunities.

To learn more or begin volunteering, reach out to the Junior Achievement center near you!
organization_description: Junior Achievement’s mission "is to inspire and prepare young people to succeed. The inspiration piece comes from community volunteers who not only deliver our lessons, but share their experience. In the process, these volunteers serve as role models helping to positively impact young people’s perceptions about the importance of education, as well as critical life skills. Preparation involves our proven lessons that promote financial capability, work and career readiness, and business ownership."
addresses: ["United States"]

headline: GIVE BACKpacks - Montgomery County Public Schools
short_description: Donations provide students backpacks full of school supplies
content:
Your support is needed to ensure that ALL students have the materials to thrive academically! For just $15, you can provide a student in need with a backpack filled with supplies which could include paper, pencils/pens, crayons, highlighters, a glue stick, a binder, and more. Your donation will help provide students with the necessary supplies to engage successfully in their lessons. 

To donate, visit this page or text Backpack to 301-329-2238 and follow the prompts!
organization_description: The Montgomery County Public School system is Maryland's largest school district, serving a diverse body of over 150,000 students across 210 schools.
addresses: ["Montgomery County, MD, USA"]

headline: Greater Lynchburg Habitat for Humanity
short_description: Support new homebuyers, learn a construction skill, and more
content:
Greater Lynchburg Habitat for Humanity has varied volunteer opportunities for all. You can join on the construction site to work side-by-side with future homebuyers to build safe, affordable, energy-efficient homes. You can help organize donations and sell used furniture, cabinets, appliances, building materials, and household items in the ReStore. You can assist with front desk hospitality, greet future homeowners and visitors, enter data, sort mail, and more! Check out all your options here.

To sign up, visit this link. Groups are welcome!
organization_description: Greater Lynchburg Habitat for Humanity works to build, maintain, and foster affordable housing and safe, dynamic neighborhoods. They help under-served families and individuals buy, build, and repair homes, while providing financial, educational, and social resources that help neighborhoods to thrive.
addresses: ["360 Alleghany Avenue, Lynchburg, VA 24501, USA"]

headline: Roanoke Valley SPCA
short_description: Animal lovers care for healing dogs and cats!
content:
There are many ways to help the animals at the Roanoke Valley SPCA, both in the shelter and in the community! From walking dogs and socialization to assisting staff and helping at special events, there is something for everyone!

To volunteer individually, you must be 16 years of age or older. Click here to fill out the volunteer application online.

Volunteers 15 years and younger must apply with a parent or legal guardian. If you are volunteering with someone who is 15 years old or younger, please complete the Family Volunteer application. Click here to fill out the Family Volunteer Application online.

The Roanoke Valley SPCA welcomes groups who want to donate their time to help animals! If your group is interested in volunteering as a group, please contact Erin Dams at edams@rvspca.org or 540-339-9503.
organization_description:
Roanoke Valley SPCA provides a safe environment for lost, abandoned, and homeless animals and strives to set a standard of excellence and leadership in animal care, humane education, and progressive animal welfare programs. 

The shelter provides food, shelter, rehabilitation, and medical treatment for homeless animals.  Prior to adoption, all animals are spayed/neutered, microchipped, receive medical care and behavioral training, and all vaccinations, including rabies, are brought up-to-date.
addresses: ["1340 Baldwin Ave NE, Roanoke, VA 24012, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 16 must be accompanied by an adult."]

headline: Roanoke Adopt-a-Street Program
short_description: Help pick up litter to keep the city clean.
content:
“Adopt-A-Street” participants tangibly demonstrate civic pride for their communities by contributing to a cleaner and healthier environment and also contribute to the city's overall economic development. The activity of volunteers picking up litter also serves as an impressive reminder to the public not to litter the roadways or ignore the environment.

The “Adopt-A-Street” Program allows participants to make a 2-year commitment to collect litter along selected streets 4 times a year. The City of Roanoke recognizes the participants’ commitment and concern for the environment with professional signage at each end of their designated area which identifies the group responsible for the clean-up of that particular roadway. The City provides 33-gallon orange trash bags and the use of High-Visibility Safety Vests.

This is a great group activity for an organization. If you have questions or would like to apply, please email mvp@roanokeva.gov or call (540) 853-1801.
organization_name: City of Roanoke Municipal Volunteer Program
organization_description: The city of Roanoke encourages citizens to get involved and participate in the development and enhancement of the city and the community in which they live and work. Participation as a volunteer will not only enhance your knowledge about the city but also enrich your life and greatly benefit the community.
addresses: ["Roanoke, VA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must commit to 2 years, 4 times per year."]

headline: Humane Society of Bay County
short_description: Work at the thrift store raising money for animal rights.
content:
Volunteers are needed to work in the thrift store, which raises money for the Humane Society. Thrift store volunteer work can range from helping on the sales floor arranging products to merchandising, cleaning, helping customers, cashiering, and working with products. Warehouse help includes sorting/processing donations, cleaning, and going on donation pickups.

All new volunteers must be able to commit to volunteering once a week, for a minimum of 4 weeks. There is a volunteer fee of $15 you must pay at orientation. This includes a volunteer t-shirt and helps defray HSBC volunteer program expenses. Fill out the application to apply here.
organization_description: The Humane Society of Bay County believes that through humane education and responsible pet ownership, we will one day end the needless destruction of companion animals in the community, and envisions a world where every companion animal has a safe and loving home.
addresses: ["1352 West 15th Street, Panama City, FL 32401, USA"]

headline: Central Florida USO
short_description: Help support US troops and families at the airport USO.
content:
Volunteers are needed to work in the USO Centers at Tampa International Airport to provide a touch of home for troops and military family members who visit. Volunteers are also needed to assist troops and their families at a myriad of morale-boosting programs throughout the area, including military homecomings, training, deployments, concerts, military appreciation days, and more.

Fill out an application to help here.
organization_description: The USO works to keep military members connected to their homes, families, and country through programs that strengthen those bonds.
addresses: ["4100 George J Bean Pkwy #2441, Tampa, FL 33607, USA"]

headline: Meals on Wheels of Tampa
short_description: Provide food and social connections to the lives of seniors.
content:
Volunteers are needed to deliver meals 5 days a week. When you are a Meals On Wheels volunteer, you are delivering much more than a hot meal – you are providing human connection. A typical volunteer route takes about one hour to complete. This one hour affects the lives of so many neighbors in need throughout Tampa. For many homebound neighbors, you will be the only person they will see or speak with all day. This special delivery gives them a reason to get up in the morning, something to look forward to, and a reminder to take care of themselves.

Drivers must be 18+ but you can bring your kids with you to share the experience. Drivers must have an automobile and a valid driver’s license, proof of auto insurance, and agree to a simple background screening.

To get started, sign up for a volunteer orientation here. Groups are welcome!
date_notes: Typical routes are Mon-Fri, but there are some special deliveries on Saturdays.
organization_description: Meals on Wheels nourishes and enriches the lives of Tampa seniors and homebound adults by providing hot meals delivered daily by caring volunteers.
addresses: ["5320 N Blvd, Tampa, FL 33603, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: Metropolitan Ministries
short_description: Help support the food insecure in the Tampa area.
content:
There are a variety of volunteer opportunities available with Metropolitan Ministries. Help is needed to prepare 3,000 meals daily for residents and 26 partner meal sites in Hillsborough, Polk, Pasco, and Pinellas Counties! In the kitchen, you could find yourself doing meal preparation, serving our residents in our dining facility, stocking shelves, washing dishes, mopping, or emptying the trash. You can also help with outreach, in the thrift store, at events, and more!

The minimum age to volunteer is 8. Groups are greatly welcomed! 

To get started, view the volunteer orientation schedule and sign up here. Or if you have a group interested in volunteering, fill out the group interest form here.
organization_description: Metropolitan Ministries offers comprehensive services for at-risk and homeless families in underserved and impoverished communities including food, housing, family support, education, and more.
addresses: ["2002 North Florida Avenue, Tampa, FL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteering for ages 8 and above with a parent"]

headline: New Beginnings of Tampa
short_description: Serve meals, mentor youth, connect with guests.
content:
Come speak, help serve food, or simply be there for someone in need. Many patients come in without anyone to connect with at first. Volunteers are also needed for the Youth Mentoring Program.

Fill out the contact form here with interest. Groups are welcome!
organization_description: New Beginnings of Tampa operates a large Transitional Housing and Homeless Recovery Program that provides unaccompanied men and women over the age of 18 with a safe place to live. They serve as a safety net, help residents complete their education, and enhance employment and independent living skills. Their goal is to provide people with a place to live while moving toward a more permanent housing situation.
addresses: ["1402 E Chilkoot Ave, Tampa, FL 33612, USA"]

headline: Junior Achievement of Tampa Bay
short_description: Mentor students to financial literacy and career success!
content:
Give students the tools to succeed in their lives and future careers! As mentors, volunteers with Junior Achievement promote financial literacy, encourage students to get the most out of their education, pass on their entrepenurial spirit to inspire the next innovative idea, and build impactful relationships with their mentees. Volunteers recieve training and have the opportunity to teach one of the JA's many programs from creative problem solving to business ethics with lessons tailored towards students in elementary school, middle school, and high school. Businesses and employers can also partner with Junior Achievement to host students in their workplace or connect employees with longer-term mentorship opportunities.

To begin volunteering, submit a volunteer application and connect with Deviney Hailey (813.631.1410 ext 245 or deviney.haley@ja.org). Companies frequently partner with Junior Achievement to sponsor programs or volunteer in groups. If you are an interested company or corporate group, visit this page https://jatampabay.org/get-involved/companies/ or reach out to Deviney Haley for more information.
organization_description: Junior Achievement of Tampa Bay's mission "is to inspire and prepare young people to succeed in a global economy by providing relevant, hands-on learning experiences that teach young people to manage their money, plan for their economic future, own their own businesses, and develop readiness for careers or college."
addresses: ["13707 North 22nd Street, Tampa, FL 33613, USA"]

headline: Hillsborough Literacy Council
short_description: Tutor Hillsborough residents in reading and English language
content:
Give fellow Hillsborough County residents the reading and English language skills to thrive in their careers and communities and form meaningful relationships as you tutor them to success! As a Hillsborough Literacy Council volunteer, you can tutor reading through Adult Basic Education (ABE) or English speaking and reading through English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL). You will work one-on-one with tutees and have the opportunity directly impact their lives. ESOL tutors do not need to speak their student’s native language!

To begin volunteering, complete the registration form. Volunteer tutors then complete online training and in-person orientation before their first session.

Any adult (18 years or older) with a high school diploma or GED certificate, a valid Hillsborough County Public Library card and transportation can become a tutor. Sessions occur in public libraries across Hillsborough County. Volunteers meet with their tutee weekly for an hour and are asked to make a 48-hour commitment.
organization_description: The Hillsborough Literacy Council is a volunteer-based nonprofit organization committed to helping adults achieve basic reading and writing skills as well as English comprehension and communication skills. It is affiliated with the Tampa-Hillsborough County Public Library System.
addresses: ["Hillsborough County, FL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["1 hour weekly", "Must be 18 or older to volunteer"]

headline: Tampa Bay Estuary Program
short_description: Protect and restore the waters and ecosystems of Tampa Bay!
content:
Protect and restore the waters and ecosystems central to the communities and economy of Tampa Bay! As a volunteer with TBEP, you are able to participate in and lead the Give-A-Day For the Bay program. At Give-A-Day events, the Tampa Bay Estuary Program staff, local partners, and community volunteers put in “sweat equity” to clean and restore bay area parks and preserves. From removing exotic vegetation to creating living shorelines, these interactive events encourage volunteers to get dirty, give back, and have fun!

To begin volunteering, browse the calendar and sign up for a volunteer opportunity. Volunteers of all ages are welcome! Give-A-Day volunteering events are generally 3 hours. 

Be sure to check event information for a suggested dress code - you may get muddy! Lunch will be provided.
organization_description: The Tampa Bay Estuary Program's (TBEP) mission "is to build partnerships to restore and protect Tampa Bay through implementation of a scientifically sound, community-based management plan. TBEP is a national leader in applying robust, reproducible science and compelling storytelling to drive community decisions and individual behaviors for the benefit of cleaner waters, thriving habitats and abundant wildlife—all of which sustain our economy and way of life in the Tampa Bay region."
addresses: ["Tampa Bay, Florida, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["All volunteers must sign a waiver of liability.", "Volunteers under 16 must be accompanied by an adult."]

headline: Keep Tampa Bay Beautiful
short_description: Get outdoors and beautify your community!
content:
Make an impact in your community, get outdoors with friends, and keep Tampa Bay beautiful! As a volunteer with Keep Tampa Bay Beautiful, you have the opportunity to participate in a variety of beautification, conservation, and waste reduction projects: annual clean ups, Adopt-A-Road groups, a variety of community projects, and more!

To begin volunteering, visit this page and register for an event. There are opportunities for all ages! Groups are particularly encouraged to volunteer with the Adopt-A-Road and Community Projects initiatives.
organization_description: Keep Tampa Bay Beautiful's mission "is to promote a culture of environmental stewardship through volunteer and educational opportunities. Since 1989, Keep Tampa Bay Beautiful has provided bay-area residents with opportunities for meaningful environmental service. Our focus areas are conservation, waste reduction and beautification. Keep Tampa Bay Beautiful provides a unique experience for individuals to make an impact in our community. We offer a variety of service projects to work with groups of all ages. We combine education with service projects to create a cohesive community effort for change."
addresses: ["Tampa Bay, Florida, USA"]

headline: Humane Society Tampa Bay
short_description: Help to end animal homelessness!
content:
The Humane Society of Tampa Bay provides shelter, adoption, and veterinary services to homeless animals in the Tampa area. They partner with animal-loving individuals and community organizations to achieve their goal of ending animal homelessness. Thousands of animals need care every year. There are long-term, short-term, and group opportunities available. Volunteer responsibilities include socializing animals, preparing them for adoption, assisting with veterinary services, cleaning the shelter, fundraising, and more.

Long-term volunteers should be willing to commit to 1 hour per week for at least six months. Short-term and group volunteers can work in shifts of up to four hours. 

To begin volunteering, register on the website.
organization_description: Tampa Bay animal shelter aimed at ending animal homelessness.
addresses: ["3607 North Armenia Avenue, Tampa, FL, USA"]

headline: SPCA Tampa Bay
short_description: A "For-All" animal shelter
content:
The Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (SPCA) Tampa Bay is a "For-All" animal shelter that admits ALL pets, regardless of species, breed, age, or situation. They aim to "create a community where every animal matters" through "passionate collaboration" with the community. They care for dogs, cats, livestock, exotic animals, and injured wildlife at their shelter and veterinary center. 

There are a large number of volunteer opportunities with SPCA! Interact directly with animals who need love and attention as a dog walker, cat cuddler, or animal care volunteer. Volunteers are also needed to collect and distribute donated pet food, provide adoption counseling, and represent the SPCA at community events.

Visit their website to see a list of open volunteer opportunities and register.
organization_description: A "For-All" animal shelter that provides care and adoption services to cats, dogs, exotic animals, livestock, and injured wildlife.
addresses: ["9099 130th Avenue North, Largo, FL, USA"]

headline: St. Vincent de Paul CARES
short_description: Help the homeless in a variety of ways.
content:
There are many different volunteer opportunities available with SvDP CARES. Volunteers are often needed at the administrative office in St. Petersburg, as well as at field offices in Central and Southwest Florida. Tasks include filing, data entry, answering and placing phone calls, and stuffing envelopes.

Individual volunteers are needed to assist in preparing and serving breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Individuals must make a weekly commitment. Group volunteers are needed to sponsor and serve meals on evenings and weekends and must make a monthly commitment. Volunteers are also needed for maintenance and landscaping, as well as in the thrift store.

Individuals must be 18 or older to volunteer at the Food Center. Individuals who are 16 or older may volunteer by themselves at the Community Thrift Store. Individuals who are 14 or 15 may volunteer with their parental guardian at the Community Thrift Store.

If interested, fill out the volunteer request form here.
organization_description: SVdP CARES is a non-profit organization committed to ending homelessness: making it rare, brief, and one-time. SVdP CARES provides homeless services such as storage lockers, a shower program, emergency living facility, food center, and assistance in applying for jobs and benefits.
addresses: ["384 15th Street North, St. Petersburg, FL 33705, USA"]

headline: SciStarter
short_description: Citizen science projects you can do anytime, from anywhere!
content:
SciStarter is an online resource for citizen scientist volunteer opportunities worldwide.

Volunteers can select from projects in many fields, such as ecology, medicine, astronomy, botany, and more. Projects might involve taking and uploading photos from a smartphone, recording observations, or helping to organize or analyze research data on your computer. Volunteers do not need to be scientists or have a scientific background! They simply need the willingness to contribute to meaningful research and the ability to use a computer or smartphone to record or analyze data. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn something new, connect with other people who are passionate about similar scientific interests, and know that you are making a significant contribution to scientific research.

Hundreds of university, research and NGO affiliates partner with SciStarter to gain access to the assistance of citizen scientist volunteers.

To get started, click the Apply button and scroll through project listings, search for specific types of projects, or do an advanced search based on your interests, age, resources, and availability to find your project match. Once you've found a project that matches your interest, you can quickly sign up for a free account and get to work! Create an account to set up a SciStarter profile that allows you to stay abreast of recent developments on your project, be alerted to new projects, track your contributions, and earn badges.
organization_description: SciStarter is a vast online resource for citizen scientist volunteer opportunities worldwide.
addresses: [null]

headline: Center for Animal Health & Welfare
short_description: A nonprofit,  no-kill animal shelter and adoption center.
content:
The Center for Animal Health & Welfare cares for homeless dogs and cats with a mission to find them loving new homes.

The shelter welcomes volunteers who can write letters that support the Center's mission. This is a flexible activity that can be done at any time! Volunteers can write notes of encouragement to the staff at the center who provide love and care to homeless animals. Volunteers with more availability are encouraged to write letters to the editorial section of their local paper such as the Lehigh Valley News, and/or post on social media about the critical role the Center for Animal Health & Welfare plays in the lives of local animals. They can encourage others to foster a pet, volunteer or donate with the center, or suggest other ways to support animal shelters.
organization_description: A no-kill, nonprofit animal shelter and adoption center for homeless cats and dogs.
addresses: ["1165 Island Park Road, Williams Township, PA, USA"]

headline: Pleasant Valley Ecumenical Network Food Pantry
short_description: A food bank that distributes free food to those in need.
content:
The Pleasant Valley Ecumenical Network operates a Choice Food Pantry that provides free groceries to between 500 and 900 low-income community members each month.

A Choice Food pantry allows grocery recipients to choose their own food, helping them to maintain a sense of independence and dignity. PVEN also focuses on obtaining healthy, low-sodium, low-fat, and high-quality foods such as fresh, local fruits and vegetables. Volunteers can help the Food Pantry in many ways. Individuals or groups can distribute food on Tuesdays or Saturdays.

Volunteers are needed every day of the week to restock shelves, sort donations, and pick up food.

Donations of healthy canned and boxed foods, fresh fruits, and vegetables are also welcome!
organization_description: The Pleasant Valley Ecumenical Network (PVEN) is a non-profit organization that aims to assist low-income families in the Pleasant Valley area. They provide support through various programs and services such as emergency food and financial assistance, affordable housing, job training, and educational opportunities.
things_to_know_titles: ["Ability to lift or move objects", "Volunteers must complete a brief interview and two background checks."]

headline: Paul's House
short_description: A shelter and support center for homeless veterans.
content:
At the Major Paul Syverson Veterans Sanctuary (Paul’s House), homeless veterans receive shelter, hot meals, life skills classes, peer support mentoring, and other counseling to transition to civilian life successfully.

There are many ways volunteers can help veterans achieve stability and independence at the shelter. The sanctuary needs volunteers to cook fresh meals, provide administrative support and maintenance, receive and sort food, clothing, and furniture donations, and take homeless veterans to appointments. The veterans support nonprofit, VALOR, operates all of the programs at Paul's House.

For more information, contact Michelle at 570-664-6468 or mgoyette@valorclinic.org, or attend one of the regular monthly volunteer meetings at 7 pm on the first Monday of each month at 1130 Scenic Drive, Kunkeltown.
organization_description: VALOR assists military veterans by providing them with the resources and support they need to transition to civilian life successfully. This may include job training and placement, educational opportunities, mental health services, and other programs designed to help veterans overcome challenges after serving in the military. The ultimate goal of VALOR's programs is to help veterans achieve stability and independence and to empower them to lead fulfilling and productive lives.
addresses: ["1130 Scenic Drive, Kunkletown, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Paul's House relies completely on the generosity of volunteers, who donate up to 5,000 hours per month."]

headline: Big Brothers Big Sisters Lehigh Valley
short_description: Support and inspire students as a mentor
content:
Big Brothers Big Sisters LV makes a difference in up to 400  lives each year!

Volunteers who want to motivate, inspire, and support at-risk youth in their community have several different mentoring options. Each  
mentor ("Big") will be matched with a "Little" (aged 7-18) with whom they meet several times a month to do fun activities and build a friendship. There are even ways for high school students to mentor elementary-age children through the High School Bigs program. Mentors must be able to commit to spending 2-5 hours per month with their Little ones for at least one year.

For those with less time, there's the option to volunteer with Littles each month at the Mentoring Center in Allentown for a movie, game, or craft night.

Regardless of the option you choose, you can know that friendship, support, and the encouragement you provide will make a huge difference in each child's life!
organization_name: Big Brothers Big Sisters Lehigh Valley
organization_description:
Big Brothers Big Sisters LV is the local branch of the national nonprofit that connects
at-risk children and teenagers with mentors who provide support, encouragement, and resources
these students might not otherwise receive. Mentors act as supporters and 
positive role models to empower these students to achieve their goals and dreams in life.
addresses: ["41 South Carlisle Street, Allentown, PA, USA"]

headline: AWSOM Animal Shelter
short_description: Care for abandoned animals and assist at this local shelter!
content:
Support AWSOM's mission  by   caring  for  abandoned or abused animals as they wait for new homes.

As a volunteer, you can walk dogs, socialize and cuddle cats, clean the shelter, or assist with fundraising. All of these roles are essential in helping the Animal Welfare Society of Monroe County improve the lives of pets in the area. 

All ages are welcome to help at the shelter, although a parent or guardian must accompany children under 18. Dog walking volunteers will need to attend a training class before they begin.
organization_name: Animal Welfare Society of Monroe County
organization_description:
The Animal Welfare Society of Monroe County (AWSOM) is a non-profit organization dedicated to 
promoting animal welfare and providing care for homeless, abandoned, and abused animals in the 
local area. They work to provide temporary shelter and necessary medical attention to animals in 
need, and to find them permanent, loving homes through adoption. The society also
 engages in education and outreach programs to promote responsible pet ownership and 
reduce pet overpopulation.
addresses: ["3129 Godfrey Ridge Drive, Stroudsburg, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: New Bethany Ministries
short_description: A local nonprofit providing food and housing to the homeless
content:
There are many meaningful ways for volunteers to help improve the lives of the homeless in their community!

New Bethany Ministries runs several meal centers and food pantries. Volunteers are needed to prepare and serve meals, stock the food pantry, pick up and organize donations, and complete other jobs such as repairs and administrative tasks that help the meal centers operate.

Children 16 and younger must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.
organization_description:
"New Bethany Ministries provides a range of services to those who are homeless, including
emergency and long-term housing, food assistance, job training, and health and wellness 
programs, with a goal to empower those individuals to achieve self-sufficiency and improve their 
quality of life."
addresses: ["333 West 4th Street, Bethlehem, PA, USA"]

headline: Natural Lands
short_description: Conserve and restore the region's natural beauty!
content:
Natural Lands has many opportunities for volunteers passionate about restoring   and protecting the environment!

Suppose you only have a few hours to commit or want to volunteer as a group. In that case, workdays are wonderful opportunities to get outside, connect with fellow nature lovers, and take care of one of the many beautiful nature preserves managed by Natural Lands. Workdays occur throughout the year and involve the removal of invasive plants, trail maintenance, and habitat restoration. Corporate groups are welcome to get involved, and workdays can be customized to the company's needs!

Public workdays are limited in size to 12 people or less, so pre-registration is required. Children ages 12-18 are welcome at workdays but must be accompanied by an adult. To make the most of a workday, come prepared! Volunteers should wear long pants and long sleeves as protection from thorns, insects, and sunburn. In addition, volunteers need to bring their own water, snacks, sunscreen, insect repellent, and heavy-duty gloves.

Long-term volunteering options are also available! For those who want to commit more intensively to protecting and restoring the region's natural areas, the Force of Nature program provides in-depth land management and conservation training in return for 20 volunteer hours. You can also opt for training to become a docent at Stoneleigh Natural Gardens, where volunteers educate visitors about the ecology and biodiversity of the gardens.
organization_description: Natural Lands is an environmental nonprofit that conserves and restores land in eastern Pennsylvania and southern New Jersey. They own over 23,000 acres of nature preserves and gardens, with over 120 miles of trails that allow residents to explore and enjoy the region's natural beauty.
addresses: ["1031 Palmers Mill Road, Media, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Age Requirement", "Volunteers should bring their own water and snacks.", "Wear long-sleeved pants, shirts, and insect repellent."]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult", null]

headline: Friends of Northumberland County Animal Shelter
short_description: Support the shelter's operations and help care for animals!
content:
There are many ways volunteers can support the Northumberland County Animal Shelter, care for homeless cats and dogs, and help them find loving new homes!

For those who want to work directly with the animals, there are opportunities to walk dogs and puppies and socialize dogs, cats, puppies, and kittens who need love and cuddles.

There are many other ways to help, too. The shelter always needs support from volunteers who can clean the facility, help with clerical tasks, and assist at adoption events. The FNCAS Thrift Shop sells gently used furniture, clothing, and household items, and their proceeds directly support the shelter. Volunteers can help receive, sort, stage, and sell donated items to raise funds.

One must be at least 18 years old and love animals to get involved. Prospective volunteers should visit the shelter or Thrift Shop to see other volunteers in action, complete the volunteer application, and submit it to the shelter or email it to shelter@northumberlandsheriff.net.  A driver's license will need to be on file, and volunteers must clear a background check. A representative from FCNAS will contact you about the next steps to take once your application has been approved!
organization_name: Friends of Northumberland County Animal Shelter
organization_description: The Friends of Northumberland County Animal Shelter (NCAS) is a nonprofit run entirely by volunteers. With their support, the NCAS operates as a no-kill facility that houses and cares for homeless cats and dogs. The Friends of NCAS support the well-being and care of animals at the shelter and promote their adoption into loving homes.
addresses: ["11703 Northumberland Highway, Heathsville, VA 22473, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must be 18 or older to volunteer", "Required", null]

headline: Take Stock in Children Mentoring
short_description: Offer students the support to achieve their goals!
content:
The Take Stock in Children mentoring program pairs caring adults with students who need extra support. 

This initiative of the Hillsborough Education Foundation is a wonderful opportunity for anyone who would like to be a role model to a student who needs emotional support, confidence building, help with goal setting or preparing for college. Mentors guide students toward their full potential and help them overcome obstacles to graduating from high school or getting ready for the next steps in life. 

Mentors can change a student's life by offering their time and talents to guide and motivate their mentees. Mentors must be able to have 30-minute one-on-one meetings with their students several times a month, and commit to one school year in order to make the most impact. Meetings can be virtual to allow for maximum flexibility for volunteers! There are also in-person options for those who would like to meet face-to-face.

In order to become a mentor, one needs to be age 18 or older and possess a high school diploma, and be caring and compassionate towards students. After completing the application form and background check, applicants have a 90-minute orientation and then get paired with a student!
organization_description: The Hillsborough Education Foundation operates several initiatives aimed at helping public school students in Hillsborough overcome barriers to success and thrive in school. By mentoring students, obtaining vital tools and materials for teachers, and offering equitable training and enrichment opportunities, the Foundation helps all students graduate and prepare for college and beyond.
addresses: ["Hillsborough Education Foundation, North Howard Avenue, Tampa, FL, USA"]
things_to_know_sub_headlines: ["Must have received a High School Diploma", "Required", null]

headline: Healthy Harvest Food Bank
short_description: Fight hunger with one of the area's largest food banks!
content:
Join the over 1,7000 volunteers who help Healthy Harvest Food Bank collect and distribute nutritious food to people struggling with food insecurity.

You can make a huge difference in the lives of hungry children, families, and seniors. Healthy Harvest donates thousands of pounds of healthy food each month, and the food bank welcomes individuals, families, churches, and business groups who want to volunteer! 

From harvesting produce at partner farms to sorting food, assisting with warehouse operations, representing the food bank at community events, and helping with administrative tasks, volunteers have many opportunities to make a difference!

People of all ages are welcome, although children under 16 need to be accompanied by an adult. Healthy Harvest welcomes groups and can customize activities based on the interests and size of the group.
organization_description: Healthy Harvest Food Bank is a leading food distribution nonprofit serving over 7,600 people monthly in Virginia's Northern Neck and Upper Middle Peninsula. With a unique focus on providing fresh, healthy food to those in need, Healthy Harvest collects and distributes produce from local farms to the hungry throughout the region.
addresses: ["55 Commerce Parkway, Warsaw, VA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Volunteers under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian"]

headline: Beyond School Walls
short_description: Your company can mentor local students, virtually!
content:
Your business or organization can make a difference in the futures of local middle and high school students!

Beyond School Walls is a virtual college and workplace readiness program that connects local companies with at-risk youth. Individual mentors ("Bigs") are paired with students ("Littles") for virtual mentoring sessions facilitated by staff members from Big Brothers Big Sisters Lehigh Valley. Mentors guide and support their students in college preparation and career exploration. This is an excellent opportunity for your team members to make an impact in a flexible, online format!

Youth mentoring has increased career satisfaction, personal fulfillment, and community belonging in employees. The consistent, positive relationships that mentors build with their students will make a difference in these children's lives for years to come. 

All team members must pass a background check and complete pre-match training before connecting with students.
organization_name: Big Brothers Big Sisters Lehigh Valley
organization_description:
Big Brothers Big Sisters LV is the local branch of the national nonprofit that connects
at-risk children and teenagers with mentors who provide support, encouragement, and resources
these students might not otherwise receive. Mentors act as supporters and 
positive role models to empower these students to achieve their goals and dreams in life.
addresses: ["41 South Carlisle Street, Allentown, PA, USA"]

headline: Rappahannock Wildlife Refuge Friends
short_description: Protect and restore the beautiful local waterways
content:
If you are passionate about protecting plants, trees, wildlife, and the unique   ecosystem of the Rappahannock River for generations to  come, there  are many ways to help!

The Rappahannock Wildlife Refuge Friends has several volunteer opportunities for those who want to support the endangered species and wetlands of the refuge. Volunteers are needed to clean and maintain trails and riverbanks, build benches, fences, and educational kiosks, and plant native plant gardens. The trail and refuge cleanup and maintenance projects are ongoing and can be done at the volunteer's own time and pace. These projects would be perfect for family, corporate, or faith groups! The Friends will arrange the building and gardening projects at specified dates and times. 

People of all ages and experience levels are welcome, but those under 18 must have written parental consent to participate.

Anyone interested in volunteering should download and complete the Volunteer Service Agreement and the Volunteer Application Form. Or email volunteer@rwrfriends.org for more information!
organization_description: The Friends provide conservation, restoration, and public outreach initiatives that support the Rappahannock River Valley Wildlife Refuge. Their efforts help to protect and improve the valuable ecosystems along the Rappahannock River Valley that are home to numerous threatened species and habitats.
addresses: ["336 Wilna Rd, Warsaw, VA 22572, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["All ages welcome! Volunteers under 18 need written parental consent prior to participating.", "Forms Required"]

headline: Build a Kit for Convoy of Hope
short_description: Address global crises by  packing aid kits
content:
Building a kit for Convoy of Hope provides a hands-on and meaningful way for volunteers to help during times of crisis.

The Build a Kit program provides a well-organized list of all the materials and supplies necessary to assemble emergency kits.
