The emergency kits typically include essential items such as food, water, personal hygiene items, blankets, and other things that can provide comfort and support during a disaster or emergency. Your group can choose which type of kit you'd like to assemble. Volunteers are responsible for putting the kits together, packing them, and shipping them to a Convoy of Hope distribution center. The completed kits are distributed to those in need through Convoy of Hope's network of disaster response partners.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a group to marshal their resources and energy to help those in need worldwide! Kits can be assembled anywhere on a flexible schedule. Convoy of Hope's website provides easy-to-follow, detailed instructions to build kits so that you can offer precisely what is most needed to victims of hunger, poverty, or natural disasters.
organization_description: Convoy of Hope is an international humanitarian aid organization that aids people worldwide who are victims of hunger, poverty, and natural disasters. It operates a variety of initiatives to provide nutritious food, clean drinking water, basic medical and personal care supplies, and educational resources to underserved communities all over the world
addresses: [null]
things_to_know_titles: ["Can be done anytime, from anywhere!", "No age requirement"]

headline: Aid Kits for Lifting Hands International
short_description: Collect items for and create aid kits for refugees.
content:
Lifting Hands International needs donations of aid kits. This is a great opportunity for a group project.

You can help by collecting items and creating aid kits for refugees in the US and abroad. There are many different types of kits needed including women's kits, infant kits, school kits, winter kits, cooking kits, etc. A list of the kits and items needed can be found here.

You can then send items directly to the LHI warehouse through an organization called Give Back Box. Through them, you can download and print a prepaid shipping label for $20. Just fill up a large empty Amazon box or any shippable box (up to 70 lbs), apply the shipping label, and drop it off at any UPS location. You can purchase a label for a Give Back Box here.
universal_notes: Aid kits can be packed from anywhere and mailed in.
organization_description: Lifting Hands International is a humanitarian aid organization that provides aid to refugees both in the US and abroad. LHI's volunteer-powered humanitarian aid warehouse in Utah collects, sorts, packs, ships, and distributes aid supplies to refugee families living in countries including Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Jordan, Lebanon, Poland, Somalia, Syria, Tanzania, Turkey, Ukraine, and other destinations where refugees or displaced people are in need (including in the US).
addresses: [null]

headline: Clean the World Hygiene Kits
short_description: Build hygiene kits for local shelters or aid groups.
content:
Clean the World needs groups to build hygiene kits for distribution. This is a great hands-on group Give Back activity. Companies, clubs, and service organizations host hygiene kit-building events as a way to give back, improve teamwork and create a renewed focus on community.

Clean the World provides the items for the hygiene kits, and groups can assemble them and then provide the gift of good health to a local homeless shelter or aid group.

To inquire about setting up a hygiene kit build with your group, fill out the form here.
universal_notes: Hygiene kits can be made in any location.
organization_description: Clean the World distributes recycled soap and hygiene products from more than 8,100+ hotel and resort partners to children and families in countries with a high death rate due to acute respiratory infection (pneumonia) and diarrheal diseases (cholera) – which are two of the top killers of children under 5. Through the distribution of these and other donated hygiene products to impoverished people, Clean the World helps prevent millions of hygiene-related illnesses and deaths every year. Clean the World also distributes kits to local homeless shelters and aid groups.
addresses: [null]

headline: Prepare Dinner for Wanda Alston House
short_description: Provide dinner to homeless LGBTQ youth at Wanda Alston House
content:
The DC Center for the LGBT Community recruits a team of volunteers monthly to provide dinner to homeless LGBTQ youth at Wanda Alston House on the second Tuesday of every month.

This is a great group activity for your office or team. You and your teammates can cook and deliver a meal to the Wanda Alston House.  If you are interested in helping with this project, please e-mail the support desk at supportdesk@thedccenter.org, and CC: operations@thedccenter.org.
organization_name: The DC Center for the LGBT Community
organization_description: The DC Center for the LGBT Community educates, empowers, celebrates, and connects the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities. To fulfill their mission, they focus on four core areas: health and wellness, arts and culture, social and peer support, and advocacy and community building.
addresses: ["1701 Rhode Island Ave NW, Washington, DC, USA"]

headline: Last Chance Ranch
short_description: Care for animals and support a wonderful rescue organization
content:
Last Chance Ranch improves the lives of animals in need and promotes responsible animal care through rescue, rehabilitation, adoption, and education. Dedicated volunteers staff the organization; there  are many ways to join them in caring for animals and contributing to the organization's continued success! As a volunteer, you will be able to connect with others who love animals and make a difference in the lives of animals who need love and new homes. 

Volunteers on-site can help in the barn or kennel to clean the facilities and care for animals by feeding, exercising, or socializing. The office at Last Chance Ranch always needs volunteers to help with administrative tasks and website maintenance. You don't need to be on-site at the ranch to support its mission, either! Volunteers are needed to help with everything from community outreach and education to fundraisers. They can also offer their professional expertise to projects ranging from grant writing to legal advising to vehicle maintenance and servicing. Last Chance Ranch also operates a Thrift Store, and volunteers can help organize donations and display items for sale there.

Indiviuals and groups are welcome to volunteer, as are children ages 12-16, although children under 16 will need either parental supervision or a waiver depending on the exact age. 

To volunteer, you will need to complete a waiver, confidentiality agreement, and volunteer application. All volunteers need to attend an orientation. Orientations occur on the first Saturday of each month at 10 am.
organization_description: Last Chance Ranch is a nonprofit organization dedicated to rescuing, rehabilitating, and rehoming horses and other domestic animals. The organization's mission is to save animals from situations at risk of neglect, abuse, or euthanasia, and provide them with the care and support they need to lead healthy, happy lives.
addresses: ["9 Beck Rd, Quakertown, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Forms Required", "Orientation Required", "Volunteers under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian"]

headline: The Center for Animal Health & Welfare
short_description: Support this no-kill animal shelter from home or office!
content:
If you are an animal lover who wants to help homeless animals and needs to volunteer at home or the office on your own schedule, the Center for Animal Health & Welfare has many opportunities.

These are all flexible activities that can be done at any time!

The Center welcomes donations of homemade dog and cat treats, or homemade toys to keep the animals active and entertained. 
This is a fantastic activity for volunteers who want to do a creative activity to help animals, either independently or as a family or group activity. 

Volunteers can also write letters that support the center's mission. Volunteers are needed to write notes of encouragement to the staff 
at the center who provide love and care to homeless animals. Volunteers with more availability are encouraged to write letters to the editorial section of a local paper, such as the Lehigh Valley News and/or post on social media about the critical role the Center for Animal Health & Welfare plays in the lives of local animals. They can encourage others to foster a pet, volunteer or donate with the center, or suggest other ways to support animal shelters.
organization_name: The Center for Animal Health & Welfare
organization_description: The Center is a no-kill nonprofit animal shelter for local dogs and cats. Pets are given homes, food, veterinary care, and socialization by dedicated volunteers until they find new owners.
addresses: ["1165 Island Park Road, Williams Township, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Can be done anytime, from anywhere!", "No age requirement"]

headline: Allentown Area Ecumenical Food Bank
short_description: Help hungry community members receive food
content:
The Allentown Area Ecumenical   Food Bank relies on dedicated volunteers to feed local families who are struggling with food insecurity. 

By volunteering, you help over 1,800   families who rely  on the food bank. Volunteers are needed on weekday mornings to help families shop for food, load their grocery carts, and bring groceries to their cars. If you, your family, or your corporate or faith group would like to help those in the community who are hungry, assistance is always needed on weekdays between 8:45 and noon. Most volunteers commit to 1 - 2 regular mornings each month. Anyone 13 and older is welcome, but children ages 13 - 17 will need to volunteer with an adult. 

To learn more about volunteering, please contact Itza Castillo, Volunteer Coordinator, during business hours at 610.821.1332.
organization_description:
The Allentown Area Ecumenical Food Bank is a non-profit organization that strives to alleviate hunger 
and provide food assistance to individuals and families in need in the Allentown area. Their mission
 is to provide nutritious food to those struggling with food insecurity, regardless of their 
background or beliefs, and to empower and support them in achieving self-sufficiency. 
They achieve this through partnerships with local churches, community organizations, and businesses, 
as well as donations and volunteer support.
addresses: ["417 N 14th St, Allentown, PA, USA"]

headline: Sixth Street Shelter
short_description: Bring dignity and comfort to homeless families
content:
Volunteers at Sixth Street Shelter can help make temporary housing feel like a home. 

The shelter seeks volunteers who can make a long-term time commitment or are part of a group such as a business or faith-based organization. Volunteers are needed to sort donations of furniture, clothing, and other supplies, and beautify the shelter's outdoor spaces by weeding, cleaning, and planting flowers (weather permitting). Volunteers are also needed for administrative duties to support the shelter, such as managing the front desk, performing clerical duties, greeting visitors, and answering the phone. 

Those who would like to volunteer must be able to handle the physical exertion involved in those tasks and should dress appropriately (for example, garden volunteers should dress appropriately for the weather and bring their own gloves). Ages 16 and up are welcome, although those ages 16-18 must be accompanied by an adult. All volunteers must pass a background check and a child abuse check. 

For more information, contact Nikki at nvillar@caclv.org.
organization_description: Sixth Street Shelter combats homelessness by providing shelter, counseling, and other resources to families experiencing homelessness in Lehigh Valley.
addresses: ["219 N Sixth St, Allentown, PA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Background Check", "Volunteers ages 16 and up are welcome, but ages 16-18 need to be accompanied by an adult"]

headline: The Literacy Center
short_description: Change lives through teaching!
content:
The Literacy Center changes lives by helping students learn new skills, overcome barriers to work or  school, and take on new educational opportunities!


The nonprofit needs dedicated volunteers to help with events, tutor students in various subjects, and act as classroom assistants. The Center hosts several events throughout the year, and volunteers help to organize and execute the events. If you seek a longer-term, more involved way to support The Literacy Center's mission, you can volunteer as a tutor or a classroom assistant. 

Tutors work one-on-one with adults to help them master English as a second language, math skills, reading comprehension, and more. This is one of the most rewarding ways to make a difference in someone's life! Classroom assistants help the Literacy Center's teachers in group classes. Volunteers must be patient, flexible, and good at communicating with diverse people in either role. Volunteers need to be able to commit to 3 hours per week for at least six months. 

Literacy tutors must also possess a Bachelor's Degree and some teaching experience.
organization_description: The Literacy Center is a private nonprofit that provides adult education. With the help of trained volunteers, students gain new skills, overcome challenges, grow, and succeed in life and work.
addresses: ["1132 Hamilton St, Allentown, PA, USA"]

headline: Help from Home Kits
short_description: Pack kits of food or supplies for homeless women.
content:
Support the mission of the Downtown Women's  Center from your home or office by assembling  kits for homeless women.
 

Snack Packs and Clean Home Kits help homeless women who need nutritious food and basic supplies as they find new homes. The Center provides detailed instructions for how to put together the kits. You can choose the number of kits that you assemble. Include personalized notes to give the women extra encouragement!

Please get in touch with the Center beforehand to schedule a contactless drop-off of your kits! The Center asks that volunteers wear gloves and a mask while assembling them.
organization_description: The Downtown Women's Center is the only Los Angeles nonprofit serving homeless women. The center provides shelter, food, and other basic needs, as well as wellness services, training, and advocacy to help women find new homes.
addresses: ["442 South San Pedro Street, Los Angeles, CA, USA"]

headline: Help from Home Kits
short_description: Pack kits of food and supplies for homeless women
content:
Support the mission of the Downtown Women's  Center from your home or office by assembling kits for homeless  women.

Volunteering to assemble Snack Packs or Clean  Home Kits allows you to help homeless women who need nutritious food and basic supplies as they find new homes. The Center provides detailed instructions for how to put together the kits. You can choose the number of kits that you assemble. Include personalized notes to give the women extra encouragement!

Please get in touch with the Center ahead of time to schedule a contactless drop-off of your kits! The Center asks that volunteers wear gloves and a mask while assembling kits.
organization_description: The Downtown Women's Center is the only nonprofit in Los Angeles that serves homeless women. The center provides shelter, food, and other basic needs in addition to wellness services, training, and advocacy to help women find new homes.
addresses: ["442 San Pedro Street, Los Angeles, CA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Can be done anytime, from anywhere!", "No age requirement"]

headline: Hagar's Heart
short_description: Provide support to victims of  domestic violence
content:
Help those in domestic violence shelters feel seen and supported by assembling personal care kits or writing letters of encouragement.

Hagar's Heart allows volunteers to support victims of domestic violence from anywhere, on a flexible schedule, by assembling "I See You" boxes or writing personalized letters for the Hagar's Heart Letter Campaign. When you volunteer to pack "I See You" boxes, you fill plastic shoeboxes with necessities, toiletries, and personal care items. Hagar's Heart provides a list of items required to fill each box and detailed instructions for assembling and shipping them. Each box also contains a letter of encouragement, written by a volunteer.

When you volunteer to write for the HH Letter Campaign, you can work on your own time to pen an anonymous letter of support to victims of domestic violence. Hagar's Heart provides guidelines for what to include in the letters and how to send them to the nonprofit's distribution center in Texas.
organization_description: Hagar's Heart is a nonprofit that donates personalized letters of encouragement, boxes of personal care items, and childcare supplies to domestic violence shelters in the Arlington, Texas area.
addresses: [null]

headline: Cape Cod Challenger Club
short_description: Bring recreational opportunities to those with disabilities
content:
Volunteers with the Cape Cod Challenger Club play a vital role in providing support and encouragement to children and adults with impairments, helping them to participate in sports and social activities and fostering a sense of community and belonging.

Volunteers with the Cape Cod Challenger Club may be involved in a wide range of activities, depending on their interests, skills, and availability. Volunteers can help coach, referee, or assist athletes with disabilities during games and practices for basketball, baseball, bowling, or soccer during different seasons throughout the year. All sports participation is inclusive, not competitive, and it's essential for volunteers to respect and encourage every participant. 

Volunteers may also help organize and run social events, such as dances, trophy days, and outings to local attractions. Some programs may need help from volunteers to provide transportation to and from events for athletes who cannot travel independently.

There are many wonderful ways to get involved with the Cape Cod Challenger Club and provide opportunities for individuals with impairments to participate in sports and social activities! To get started read through the downloadable volunteer manual, and then complete the registration form online. A program manager will reach out soon with available opportunities!
organization_description: The mission of the Cape Cod Challenger Club is to promote physical fitness, social interaction, and self-esteem among people with disabilities, while fostering a sense of community and belonging.
addresses: ["418 Bumps River Road, Osterville, MA, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Volunteers must sign a code of conduct agreement"]

headline: YMCA Cape Cod
short_description: Build community and encourage healthy, positive activities!
content:
There are many  ways to volunteer with the YMCA Cape Cod and  promote  the well-being of individuals and families  while  building a sense of  community! 

The YMCA Cape Cod offers a variety of youth programs, including after-school programs, summer camps, and sports leagues. As a volunteer, you can assist with these programs by helping with activities, coaching teams, or simply spending time with the children.

If you are passionate about fitness, you can volunteer at the YMCA Cape Cod's fitness center. You can help members with their workouts, teach fitness classes, or assist with fitness events.

 The YMCA Cape Cod holds several special events throughout the year, such as fundraisers, holiday events, and community outreach programs. As a volunteer, you can help with setup and cleanup, assist with activities, or provide general support.

To become a volunteer with the YMCA Cape Cod, you can visit their website and fill out a volunteer application. You may also need to complete a background check and attend a volunteer orientation. The YMCA Cape Cod values diversity and encourages people of all backgrounds and abilities to volunteer.
organization_description: The YMCA Cape Cod is a non-profit organization dedicated to strengthening the community through youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility. Its mission is to improve the quality of life for individuals, families, and communities on Cape Cod by promoting physical fitness, healthy choices, and social engagement.
addresses: ["2245 Iyannough Road, West Barnstable, MA, USA"]

headline: Cape Cod Museum of Natural History
short_description: Inspire appreciation for Cape Cod's natural resources!
content:
The Cape Cod Museum of Natural History provides a variety of volunteer opportunities for individuals who are passionate about nature and conservation!

By volunteering, individuals can gain valuable experience, meet new people, and contribute to the museum's mission of educating the public about the natural environment of Cape Cod! 

Volunteer activities at the Cape Cod Museum of Natural History range from education to exhibit maintenance, landscaping to animal care, and special events or administrative assistance. Volunteers can assist with educational programs such as field trips, summer camps, and nature walks. They can help lead activities and engage with visitors to enhance their learning experience. Volunteers can also maintain exhibits by cleaning, repairing, and updating displays, or help with organizing and cataloging artifacts. 

The museum has extensive grounds and gardens that require regular maintenance. Volunteers can help with tasks such as planting, weeding, and pruning. The museum houses several live animals, including turtles, fish, and snakes. Volunteers can assist with feeding, cleaning, and caring for these animals.

The museum hosts several special events throughout the year, such as lectures, workshops, and festivals. Volunteers are always needed to help with organizing and promoting these events, as well as assisting with set-up and clean-up. Volunteers can also assist with administrative tasks throughout the year such as data entry, fundraising, and membership outreach.
organization_name: Cape Cod Museum of Natural History
organization_description: The mission of the Cape Cod Museum of Natural History is to inspire appreciation, understanding, and stewardship of the natural environment through educational programs, exhibits, and research. The museum is dedicated to promoting environmental awareness and conservation, as well as sharing the unique natural history of Cape Cod.
addresses: ["869 Main Street, Brewster, MA, USA"]

headline: Barnstable Land Trust
short_description: Preserve and protect the open spaces of Barnstable County!
content:
The Barnstable Land Trust provides a wide variety of  volunteer opportunities to protect and restore the area's natural beauty!

Volunteers can help care for the organization's conservation properties. This may involve trail maintenance, invasive species removal, and monitoring wildlife populations. 

The organization offers a variety of outreach and educational programs to help raise awareness about conservation issues. Volunteers can assist with organizing and promoting these events and lead educational programs for community groups and schools. 

The Barnstable Land Trust always needs help with fundraising events, grant writing, other development activities, and various administrative tasks such as data entry, filing, and answering phones. Volunteers can also help with environmental advocacy through outreach to elected officials, attending public meetings, and organizing advocacy campaigns.
organization_description: The mission of the Barnstable Land Trust is to conserve the natural resources and open spaces of Barnstable, Massachusetts for the benefit of current and future generations. The organization is committed to protecting the region's natural beauty and biodiversity while promoting responsible land use and sustainable development.
addresses: ["1540 Main Street, Barnstable, West Barnstable, MA, USA"]

headline: Anacostia Watershed Society
short_description: Restore a vital local waterway!
content:
Help the Anacostia Watershed Society  improve the health of one of the most  polluted waterways in the United States. 

Volunteers assist  with  river cleanups, native species plantings, seed  collecting, and habitat restoration projects that occur regularly throughout the year. The Earth Day Cleanup is the nonprofit's largest event, welcoming hundreds of volunteers to help clean up sites along the watershed on the Saturday after Earth Day. 

The AWS welcomes individuals as well as groups of volunteers from local organizations. The nonprofit will work with your group to match it to a project that fits its needs. 

All volunteering includes an educational component, so you will be able to learn about the importance of this vital waterway as you help to restore it!
organization_description: The mission of the Anacostia Watershed Society (AWS) is to protect and restore the Anacostia River and its watershed areas by cleaning up the river, preventing pollution, and promoting environmental education and stewardship.
addresses: ["4302 Baltimore Avenue, Bladensburg, MD, USA"]
things_to_know_titles: ["Advance registration required for all volunteer activities"]

headline: Invest in Our Planet
short_description: Create or join environmental events during Earth Month
content:
EarthDay.Org  has created an Action Toolkit to help individuals and companies positively impact  the  environment during Earth Month,  April 2023.

The theme for Earth Month 2023 is "Invest in Our Planet," and the toolkit provides a range of ideas about activities to address climate change, plastic pollution, deforestation, and other environmental issues. From tree planting initiatives to invasive species removal, park cleanups, and office and school sustainability education, the Action Toolkit inspires every schedule and interest.

An interactive map displays planned environmental events worldwide; your group or company can also register your event on the map.
organization_description: EarthDay.Org launched the modern environmental movement in 1970, celebrating the first Earth Day on April 22. Since then, the nonprofit has continued to promote annual Earth Day activities and expand advocacy, education, and partnerships aimed at protecting the natural environment and combatting climate change and pollution.
addresses: [null]

headline: San Diego Coastkeeper
short_description: Help to restore and beautify San Diego's waterways
content:
Join a scheduled community cleanup, partner with  Coastkeeper to customize your own, or do it yourself  with Coastkeeper's Beach  Cleanup in a Box program.
 

San Diego Coastkeeper hosts beach and river cleanups  twice a month from 9 - 11 am on Saturdays. By helping at coastal cleanups, volunteers improve the health of the surrounding ocean and its wildlife. Removing litter and other debris beautifies San Diego's coastline and helps Coastkeeper perform important environmental testing.

All ages are welcome! Volunteers should bring their own bags and gloves if they have them, but buckets will be provided. Please pre-register if you want to bring a group larger than 20 participants. 

Coastkeeper is happy to customize cleanups for larger groups, and also provides cleanup buckets to rent out for those who want to do cleanups on their own schedule.
organization_description: San Diego Coastkeeper utilizes education, advocacy, and community engagement to address the environmental issues affecting the rivers, streams, and beaches near San Diego. The nonprofit works to protect and restore local waterways and promote scientific methods for dealing with drought and water quality issues.
addresses: ["8305 Vickers Street, San Diego, CA, USA"]

headline: Pickup Parties
short_description: Have fun while beautifying your community!
content:
Volunteers at  Pickup  Parties  celebrate fun themes while cleaning up local parks!

All ages are welcome at these community  events, which occur one Thursday evening  a month from April  through November at parks throughout the city. Volunteers can dress up according to the theme and earn points for prizes! Themes in 2023 include Shark Week, Country vs. Rock N'Roll, and Halloween. 

The City of Winchester welcomes groups and businesses who want to do park cleanups on their own time. Supplies will be provided; just visit the website to complete a short form to get started!
organization_description: The town government of Winchester, West Virginia, provides essential services and amenities to its residents and maintains and enhances the quality of life within the town.
addresses: ["Rouss City Hall, North Cameron Street, Winchester, VA, USA"]

headline: Wildhorse Rescue
short_description: Help care for and love neglected animals.
content:
Wildhorse Rescue serves as a safe place for neglected animals to be cared for, heal and remain unharmed. 

Volunteers are able to help out around the ranch with a variety of activities that are animal and non-animal facing. Volunteers can feeding both horses and smaller animal residents, or help care for the herd at Wildhorse and help out with construction projects. 

All volunteers must submit a volunteer application and complete a new volunteer orientation before their first shift. Please dress accordingly, since most volunteer work is outdoors and around animals.
organization_description: Started in 1995, after founder and her sons stumbled upon a herd of homeless horses in Gilbert, AZ. There mission is to house, care for and ultimately match neglected animals with forever homes.
addresses: ["11811 South Lindsay Road, Gilbert, AZ 85296, USA"]

headline: One Small Step AZ
short_description: Volunteers needed in the Clothes Cabin!
content:
While the volunteer team at One Small Step gives over 900 hours per month, there is always a need for people and work teams to come by and give some time! 

Help out by processing donated clothes. For this activity, donated clothes must be looked over for quality, steamed, folded and propoerly stored. Volunteers are responsible for restocking racks and shelves. Help is welcomed on Mondays from 10AM - 2PM, Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 9AM - 12PM and 12PM - 3PM, and Thursdays from 10AM - 2PM.

Help out in the resale boutique. This is where clothes are sorted and put up for sale. Volunteers will be responsible for sorting and displaying clothes as well as organizing shelves and helping with check out. Help is welcomed on Tuesday through Saturday from 10 AM to 2 PM.

There is also always a need for computer support and data entry! Please submit a Volutneer Interest application at the bottom of the Volunteering page. A member of the One Small Step team will be in touch!
organization_description: Started in 2001 to offer socks to those in need across Gilbert, AZ, One Small Step AZ has grown to offer clothing and a Homeless Assistance Program to those in need.
addresses: ["710 N Cooper Rd, Gilbert, AZ 85233, USA"]

headline: Desert Rivers Audubon
short_description: Help with bird counts, educational programs and get outside!
content:
Volunteering at Desert Rivers Audubon is a highly fulfilling and educational experience for bird enthusiasts, conservationists or anyone who enjoys nature! By volunteering, you contribute to the organization's mission while also learning about bird behavior and conservation efforts.

One of the most popular volunteer opportunities with Desert Rivers Audubon is participating in bird counts. These events involve recording the number of bird species in a specific area over a certain period of time. Bird counts can provide valuable data on the health and behavior of bird populations in the region. Volunteers can also assist with habitat restoration projects, which involve removing invasive plant species and planting native vegetation to support bird habitats.

Another way to get involved with Desert Rivers Audubon is by participating in educational programs. The organization offers a variety of workshops, lectures, and classes on bird identification, behavior, and conservation. Volunteers can assist with these programs by helping with event planning, setup, and cleanup, or by leading bird walks and other educational activities.

To get started, email Volunteer Coordinator, Trish Julian, juliantrsh@att.net about your interests and group parameters.
organization_description: Desert Rivers Audubon is a chapter of the National Audubon Society located in the Arizona area. The organization is dedicated to the conservation and protection of bird species and their habitats.
addresses: ["Nina Mason Pulliam Rio Salado Audubon Center, South Central Avenue, South Mountain Village, Phoenix, AZ, USA"]

headline: Assemble Snack Bags for Hungry Kids
short_description: Send Kids Home on Fridays with Food for the Weekend.
content:
Ease food insecurity in DC-Area Public Schools by packing food and snacks for kids.

30 million children across the country depend on the USDA’s school meal program for a substantial portion of their daily nutrition. For some, it’s the only meal they can count on. The goal is to make an impact locally by assembling snack packs. Below, you will find a list of all the items you need to fill a zip-top bag to be dropped into the backpack of a child experiencing food insecurity.

STEP ONE:  

Identify a Title 1 School by performing an online search for the list of Title 1 schools in your county.

Happyly Pro Tip: Choose one near the location where you will be assembling the snack bags for easy delivery. If you would like support selecting a Title 1 School, just reach out to us at team@happyly.com.

STEP TWO:

Verify that the school will be interested in receiving the snack bags on the date you plan to deliver them.

Happyly Pro Tip: Avoid calling the school during the windows of student arrival or departure times.

STEP THREE:

Create an event on the Happyly app and invite colleagues to gather for this wonderful opportunity to help local kids in need.

Happyly Pro Tip: If this volunteer effort is not already sponsored by your company, create a Sign-Up Genius so individuals can select an item or items from the list to provide for the snack bags to spread out the cost. Once your management/executives see the connections and impact created by this event, they are likely to be eager to sponsor the next opportunity!

STEP FOUR:

Order/pickup the supplies. You can substitute items by preference, but the items listed below are proven to fit well in a gallon plastic freezer bag, and are of an acceptable weight for little ones to carry home easily.

Juice Box
Fruit Cup
GoGo Squeeze Apple Sauce
Kraft Easy Mac
Goldfish Crackers
Apple
Noodle Soup/Ramen
Granola Bar
Gallon Plastic Freezer Bags

Happyly Pro Tip: We find Costco is a great place to pickup supplies, but you will be unable to get the precise amount of items based on the numbers that each of these items come in bulk. So either a second stop at a grocery or big box store for a few extras, or plan to have extra of certain items based on the number of kits you plan to compile. For example: Honest Juice Boxes come in packs of 40 at Costco so if you are planning to put together 50 Snackbags, you can either get 80 and put two in many of the bags, or get 40 and buy an extra box of ten at the grocery store. Alternatively, order online where there is greater variety of bulk sizes in one shopping cart.

STEP FIVE:

Pickup notecards and colorful pens at an art supply or big box store. These will be used at a second giveback station where your team can write fun or encouraging notes to send with each snack bag. 

Happyly Pro Tip: Start with "Dear Friend" or "Dear Student." Everyone loves a good joke and/or positive message. Quotes are also always encouraged! Letters can be signed with either your initial or first name but please do not include any personal info, religious references or projections of feelings (i.e. "It's all going to be okay.")

STEP SIX: 

Create and Print Table Topics. Chat while you pack! Use these ideas, or ask a question of your own to get the conversation started.

Do you participate in giving back orvolunteering with any other organizations?
How does donating your time and talent make you feel?
Would you like to volunteer more frequently this year?
How do you spend your time outside of work, professionally or personally?

Happyly Pro Tip: Pick up a few plastic sign stands at an office supply or big box store so you can have the Table Topics displayed (as well as the activity instructions for both snackbag assembly and notecards).

STEP SEVEN:

Plan a mode of transport for the assembled snack bags to the school you have selected.

Happyly Pro Tip: Multiple large reusable fabric or tote bags work great depending on the size of the delivery.

STEP EIGHT:

Once at your event location, set up two stations for card writing and snack bag assembly with appropriate signs displayed at each.

Complete a notecard, then simply open a zip-top bag, insert your card and add one of each item to it, and seal. Repeat, if time permits. So easy!

Happyly Pro Tip: Set up the stations in a way that encourages people to fill out their card first so you can make sure a card makes it in most/all bags. Verbally encourage people as well, if you are comfortable doing so.

STEP NINE:

Deliver assembled snack bags to the Title 1 school you coordinated. Teachers or administrators can slip them into the bags of children who may be food compromised on Friday afternoons, so they will be guaranteed nourishment throughout the weekend.

Happyly Pro Tip: Please try to avoid dropping them during student arrival or dismissal as the staff will be preoccupied.

STEP TEN:

Any questions you might have before or after your event are welcome at team@happyly.com. We are happy to help and we would also be so thrilled to receive photos and/or testimonials following your event. 

Happyly Pro Tip: Please send pictures so we can celebrate your team!! Also, the "Apply to Giveback on your own" button below will take you to the Happyly website, where you can learn more about our Giveback programming.

Happy Volunteering and thank you for pitching in to support kids in your community!!
date_notes: Activity can be performed any day, but delivery must be on a weekday during the regular administrative workday.
universal_notes: No experience required and you can complete this activity anywhere!!
organization_description: Happyly empowers your employees to easily meet and build connections with colleagues, communities, and loved ones, through meaningful activities and experiences.
addresses: [null]
category_names: ["Childhood Hunger", "Food Insecurity", "Volunteer from Home or Office"]

headline: Delaware Nature Society
short_description: Promoting the health of the environment.
content:
The Delaware Nature Society provides many opportunities to volunteer so we can all make an impact!!

Also known as DelNature, this organization came about in 1964 as an affiliate of the National Wildlife Federation. The idea behind the mission is to provide tools to the community, so it can be convenient to help with land preservation, wildlife protection and healthy waters. They oversee four nature preserves, (DuPont Environmental Education Center, Coverdale Farm Preserve, Abbott's Mill Nature Center and Ashland Nature Center). There are many ways to volunteer to help maintain the health of this preservation land so future generations can continue to enjoy these beautiful over 2,000 acres of land.

Opportunities to volunteer:

*Group or Corporate Volunteer Activities

*Outreach Support

*Greeter/Interpreter

*Volunteer Guide

*Garden Caretaker

*Nest Watcher

*Habitat Helper

*Horseshoe Crab Spawning Surveyor

*Handyperson

*Clean Water Campaign Volunteer

*Event Photographer

*Ghost Writer and Blogger

*Backyard Wildlife Habitat Steward

*Train Maintenance and Restoration

And many other opportunities for clean-up and other events.
date_notes: Preserves are open dawn to dusk. Visitor's Centers vary by location.
organization_description: Delaware Nature Society’s (DelNature) mission is to connect people with the natural world to improve our environment through education, conservation, and advocacy. We envision a healthy and sustainable environment for all.

headline: The King Center's "Beloved" Community Service Project
short_description: Support the donation drive for the homeless in honor of MLK.
content:
Partner with The King Center by supporting their donation drive to help provide enough supplies for local volunteers to assemble care kits for Atlanta's homeless people on January 15th in honor of Martin Luther King Day.

In partnership with Atlanta Downtown Improvement District (ADID), The Elizabeth Foundation, Our House and other partner organizations, The King Center will host a Beloved Community Service Project on Monday, January 15th, 2024.

We will be hosting a donation drive until January 15th and volunteers will assemble care kits for the homeless and unsheltered. These care kits will provide essential items and basic necessities to help improve their well-being and provide some comfort during challenging times.

Anyone interested in supporting can purchase items from our Amazon Wish List (Amazon.com) or can purchase the items and drop them off at the King Center in person and even help assemble on January 15th between 11am-3pm. To sign up to volunteer on-site, email volunteer@thekingcenter.org.

The full URL for the Amazon wish list is available below: 

https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/3LGODILPRADY7?ref=cm_sw_em_r_un_un_IfynXrrPXNUgn
date_notes: Order supplies to arrive in time for the 15th.
universal_notes: Donate homeless drive supplies from anywhere to be delivered to The King Center.
organization_description:
Established in 1968 by Mrs. Coretta Scott King, The Martin Luther King, Jr. Center for Nonviolent Social Change (“The King Center”) has been a global destination, resource center and community institution for over a quarter century.The King Center is a 501(c)3. Nearly a million people each year make pilgrimage to the National Historic Site to learn, be inspired and pay their respects to Dr. King’s legacy.

"Our mission is to empower people to create a just, humane, equitable and peaceful world by applying Dr. King’s nonviolent philosophy and methodology (Nonviolence365)."

headline: Give Blood!!
short_description: A small gesture that can save a life!
content:
Plan a drive or grab a teammate and donate blood – this small gesture is a life-saving gift.

Honor and join this community of selfless individuals who ensure people can access safe blood in their time of need. Unite your team for good, by setting a blood donation goal!! If you are a remote team, everyone can sign up to donate in their communities by visiting a local blood drive – find one near you or start a campaign.

If you have a team available to connect in person, host a blood drive! It's easy, feels amazing and makes a massive impact!! Apply to host a drive here. 

In a selfless act for someone who you don't know, one person can save hundreds of lives.

Thank you for stepping up for the health of your community!!
date_notes: There are many ways to give blood! Or, consider coordinating a blood drive at a time and place of your choice!!!
universal_notes: Apply online to host a drive, or donate blood at an existing blood drive near you!!
organization_description: Red Cross volunteers and staff work to deliver vital services – from providing relief and support to those in crisis, to helping you be prepared to respond in emergencies.

headline: Gay for Good
short_description: Volunteer to promote diversity and foster inclusion.
content:
Make an impact and have fun in the process!!

Gay For Good mobilizes lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer (LGBTQ+) and ally volunteers to promote diversity, foster inclusion and strengthen ties to the broader community. 

There are now chapters in more than 20 locations (Arkansas, Chicago, Dallas-Fort Worth, LA, OC/Long Beach, Palm Spring, Phoenix, Raleigh-Durham, San Diego, Seattle, DC, Boston, Columbus, Denver, New York City, Oahu, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Rocky Mountains, San Francisco and the Twin Cities. Find an event near you, or join the mailing list to receive event updates in your chosen area. There are virtual events too!!

There are so many fun opportunities to volunteer to benefit many different causes and communities!!!
date_notes: Various events in more than 20 cities, and online opportunities too!
universal_notes: Chapters host events in 21 cities and you can join virtual volunteer opportunities too!

headline: Mental Health America
short_description: Get your workplace Bell Seal Certified.
content:
Prove Your Company is Invested in the Well-Being of the Team!

The Bell Seal for Workplace Mental Health national certification program recognizes employers committed to creating mentally healthy workplaces. Led by Mental Health America's rich history in research and advocacy, the Bell Seal's holistic evaluation of employer practices considers the entire employee experience.

As stated on the Mental Health America website, employers of all sizes and industries are welcome and encouraged to apply for the Bell Seal certification. Recipients represent over 28 industries - from health care and the public sector to financial services and manufacturing - and organizational sizes, from three to more than 1 million workers, in 35 states. Take a quick survey to see if your workplace qualifies. 

When the current year application process is complete (must apply by late March) take this opportunity to submit an employer information form to receive updates on the next application cycle. Start now to get educated on what qualifies your company for 2025 so you are ready to get your company's Bell Seal. 

Bell Seal recipients will receive a promotion toolkit to announce their certification to employees, clients, customers, and the communities they serve. In addition, recipients, at their discretion, will:

  • Have their name or logo included on MHA’s Bell Seal recipient website,
  • Be featured on MHA’s social media platform(s), newsletters, annual outcomes publication, and
  • Included in any earned and paid media efforts regarding the program (e.g., press releases, interviews, blogs, resources, and advertising). Recipients have the right to decline participation in promotional activities or publications.
date_notes: Annual applications due in late March.
organization_description: Founded in 1909, Mental Health America is the nation's leading national nonprofit dedicated to the promotion of mental health, well-being, and condition prevention.

headline: Support a Friend Experiencing Cancer
short_description: Cancer can be isolating, and you can help!!
content:
According to The American Cancer Society website, "Studies have found that cancer survivors with strong emotional support tend to adjust better to the changes cancer brings, have a more positive outlook, and often report a better quality of life. Research has shown that people with cancer need support from friends. You can make a big difference in the life of someone with cancer."

Notes and calls, visits and errands are all amazing ways to make an impact in the life of someone experiencing cancer. Lifting their spirit and showing them they are not alone are impactful ways to inspire elevated hope and endurance to face their challenges. Gifts and sharing projects you can accomplish together - this can be as simple as card games or puzzles, or as involved as coordinating a fundraiser for ACS together.

Many people are concerned about saying the "wrong thing" when talking with friends who have cancer. The American Cancer Society provides pointers on their website to take the uncertainty out of it, and make sure it doesn't deter friends from showing up for those they care about.

"Many people worry that they don’t know what to say to someone with cancer. Try to remember that the most important thing is not what you say – it’s that you’re there and willing to listen. Try to hear and understand how your friend feels. Let them know that you’re open to talking whenever they feel like it. Or, if the person doesn’t feel like talking, let them know that’s OK, too.

  • Listen without always feeling that you have to respond. Sometimes a caring listener is what the person needs most.
  • Gear the conversation to your friend’s attention span so they don’t feel overwhelmed or guilty about not being able to talk.
  • Help your friend focus on whatever brings out good feelings, such as sports, religion, travel, or pets.
  • Help your friend keep active in the friendship by asking advice, opinions, and questions – even if you don’t get the response you expect.
  • Ask your friend if they’re in any discomfort. Suggest new ways to be more comfortable, such as using more pillows or moving the furniture.
  • Give honest compliments, such as “You look rested today.”
  • Support your friend’s feelings. Let them be negative, withdrawn, or silent. Resist the urge to change the subject.
  • Don’t urge your friend to “fight” the disease.
  • Don’t tell them how strong they are; they may feel the need to act strong even when they’re sad or exhausted.
  • Be sure to include your friend when talking to others in the room.
  • Assume that your friend can hear you even if they seem to be asleep or dazed.
  • Don’t offer medical advice or your opinions on things like diet, vitamins, and herbal therapies.
  • Respect their decisions about how their cancer care will be treated, even if you disagree.
  • Don’t remind them of past behaviors that might be related to the illness, such as drinking or smoking. Some people feel guilty over those things."

For more information, visit the American Cancer Society information page for caregivers and friends of individuals with cancer at  https://www.cancer.org/cancer/caregivers/how-to-be-a-friend-to-someone-with-cancer.html
universal_notes: This can be online, in-person or with a simple phone call.
organization_description: The mission of the American Cancer Society is to improve the lives of people with cancer and their families through advocacy, research, and patient support, to ensure everyone has an opportunity to prevent, detect, treat, and survive cancer.
